original: rna bas ni ma yin no zhes zer te /
analyzed: rna bas ni ma yin no zhes zer te /
translated: but not by the ear.

original: bye brag tu bshad pa chen po bam po bcu gsum pa las bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: bye brag tu bshad pa chen po bam po bcu gsum pa las bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: This is explained in the thirteenth volume of the Great Exegesis.

original: mdo sde'i gzhung gis kyang /
analyzed: mdo sde'i gzhung gis kyang /
translated: The scriptural texts also say,

original: rnam par shes pas thos kyis rna bas ni ma yin no zhes zer te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pas thos kyis rna bas ni ma yin no zhes zer te /
translated: “Consciousness hears, but the ear does not.”

original: bstan bcos de kho na nyid grub pa las bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: bstan bcos de kho na nyid grub pa las bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: This is explained in the treatise Establishing Suchness.

original: slob dpon dpe can gyis 'dus pa las thos so zhes zer te /
analyzed: slob dpon dpe can gyis 'dus pa las thos so zhes zer te /
translated: The master Dāmodara says that it is heard in the Saṃgīti Sūtra,

original: bye brag tu bshad pa chen po bam po bcu gsum pa las bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: bye brag tu bshad pa chen po bam po bcu gsum pa las bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: as explained in the thirteenth volume of the Great Exegesis.

original: 'dir theg pa chen po dag gis bshad pa dang sbyar na byang chub sems dpa' klu sgrub kyis bshad pa yang rnam pa gnyis yod de /
analyzed: 'dir theg pa chen po dag gis bshad pa dang sbyar na byang chub sems dpa' klu sgrub kyis bshad pa yang rnam pa gnyis yod de /
translated: If we apply the explanation of the Mahāyāna here, the explanation of the bodhisattva Nāgārjuna also has two parts.

original: dang po ni rna bas thos kyis /
analyzed: dang po ni rna bas thos kyis /
translated: First, it is explained that it is heard by the ear,

original: rnam par shes pas ni ma yin no zhes bshad de /
analyzed: rnam par shes pas ni ma yin no zhes bshad de /
translated: but not by consciousness.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las ji skad du lha'i mig gis sangs rgyas mthong ngo //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las ji skad du lha'i mig gis sangs rgyas mthong ngo //
translated: As it says in the Commentary on the Perfection of Wisdom, “The buddhas are seen with the divine eye.

original: lha'i rna bas chos thos so zhes bstan pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: lha'i rna bas chos thos so zhes bstan pa lta bu'o //
translated: and with the divine ear, one hears the Dharma.”🔽

original: gnyis pa ni 'dus pa las thos so zhes bshad de /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni 'dus pa las thos so zhes bshad de /
translated: The second is explained as hearing it in an assembly.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel ba las ji skad du rnam pa gnyis su bshad pa yod kyang 'dus pa ni yang dag pa yin te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel ba las ji skad du rnam pa gnyis su bshad pa yod kyang 'dus pa ni yang dag pa yin te /
translated: Although it is explained in the commentary on the perfection of wisdom that there are two types, the assembly is correct.

original: thos pa yang dag pa'i don du rnam par bshad pa las 'dus pa las thos so zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: thos pa yang dag pa'i don du rnam par bshad pa las 'dus pa las thos so zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa lta bu'o //
translated: This is because it is explained in the explanation of the correct meaning of hearing that it is heard in an assembly.

original: 'phags pa byams pa'i gzhung dang sbyar na bshad pa gsum yod de /
analyzed: 'phags pa byams pa'i gzhung dang sbyar na bshad pa gsum yod de /
translated: If it is applied to the texts of Arya Maitreya, there are three explanations.

original: kha cig las ni rna bas thos kyis rnam par shes pas ni ma yin no zhes bshad de /
analyzed: kha cig las ni rna bas thos kyis rnam par shes pas ni ma yin no zhes bshad de /
translated: Some explain that it is heard by the ear but not by consciousness.

original: chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa las /
analyzed: chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa las /
translated: The compendium of different abhidharma texts explains:

original: rna ba'i khams kyi mtshan nyid ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: rna ba'i khams kyi mtshan nyid ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the definition of the ear element?

original: 'di lta ste sgra thos pa'o zhes 'byung ba dang / @43a * //
analyzed: 'di lta ste sgra thos pa'o zhes 'byung ba dang / @43a * //
translated: It is the hearing of sound.

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las 'di la grag pa rnams dmigs shing /
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las 'di la grag pa rnams dmigs shing /
translated: The Bodhisattvabhumi states:

original: 'di la grag pa rnams dmigs pas na rna ba'o zhes 'byung ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'di la grag pa rnams dmigs pas na rna ba'o zhes 'byung ba lta bu'o //
translated: It is called ear because it is the objective domain of what is heard.

original: kha cig las ni rnam par shes pas thos kyis rna bas ni ma yin no zhes bshad de /
analyzed: kha cig las ni rnam par shes pas thos kyis rna bas ni ma yin no zhes bshad de /
translated: Some say: Consciousness hears, not the ear.

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las ji skad du thos pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las ji skad du thos pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The Bodhisattvabhumi states:

original: mnyan nas thos pa'o zhes 'byung ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: mnyan nas thos pa'o zhes 'byung ba lta bu ste /
translated: Hearing is listening after hearing.

original: de ni rna ba'i dbang pos rna ba'i rnam par shes pa bskyed nas tshig gis bstan pa thos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rna ba'i dbang pos rna ba'i rnam par shes pa bskyed nas tshig gis bstan pa thos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the ear faculty generates ear consciousness and hears what is taught by words.

original: gzhan yang sangs rgyas kyi sa'i 'grel ba las thos pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang sangs rgyas kyi sa'i 'grel ba las thos pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Moreover, the Buddhabhumi states:

original: rna ba'i dbang pos rnam par shes pa bskyed nas nyan par byed pa'o zhes 'byung ngo //🔽bstan bcos rnam pa gnyis las rna bas thos kyis /
analyzed: rna ba'i dbang pos rnam par shes pa bskyed nas nyan par byed pa'o zhes 'byung ngo //🔽bstan bcos rnam pa gnyis las rna bas thos kyis /
translated: Hearing is listening after generating ear consciousness.🔽It is said that one hears with the ear, not with consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pas ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa yang rnam par shes pa bskyed pa'i rna ba'i dbang po thob pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pas ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa yang rnam par shes pa bskyed pa'i rna ba'i dbang po thob pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But it is not consciousness, because it is the nature of the ear faculty that has obtained the generation of consciousness.

original: kha cig las ni 'dus pa las nus par thos so zhes bshad do /
analyzed: kha cig las ni 'dus pa las nus par thos so zhes bshad do /
translated: In some sources, it is explained that the power of the collection is heard.

original: chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa las ji skad du mig gis gzugs mthong ngam /
analyzed: chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa las ji skad du mig gis gzugs mthong ngam /
translated: In the Compendium of Abhidharma, it is said: “Does the eye see forms,

original: 'on te rnam par shes pa la sogs pa yin na /
analyzed: 'on te rnam par shes pa la sogs pa yin na /
translated: or is it consciousness and so on?

original: mig gis gzugs mthong ba yang ma yin /
analyzed: mig gis gzugs mthong ba yang ma yin /
translated: The eye does not see forms,

original: rnam par shes pa la sogs pas kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa la sogs pas kyang ma yin te /
translated: nor does consciousness and so on.

original: 'di ltar chos thams cad la byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar chos thams cad la byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because in this way, all phenomena are devoid of activity.

original: 'dus pa yod pa'i dbang gis btags pa yod pa tsam du mthong ba zhes 'dogs par zad de /
analyzed: 'dus pa yod pa'i dbang gis btags pa yod pa tsam du mthong ba zhes 'dogs par zad de /
translated: It is merely designated as seeing because of the existence of the collection.

original: rna ba la sogs pa yang de bzhin no zhes 'byung ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: rna ba la sogs pa yang de bzhin no zhes 'byung ba lta bu ste /
translated: The same applies to the ear and so on.”

original: rgya cher ni de nyid las bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rgya cher ni de nyid las bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: The extensive explanation is like what is explained in that text.

original: de ltar bstan bcos rnams las tha dad par gyur pa yang sgra nyan pa dang rten khyad par can du gyur pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar bstan bcos rnams las tha dad par gyur pa yang sgra nyan pa dang rten khyad par can du gyur pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, they are different from the treatises because they are heard from the voice and they are special supports.🔽

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las rna bas thos so zhes bshad la /
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las rna bas thos so zhes bshad la /
translated: Thus, it is said in the Yogācārabhūmi that he hears with his ear, because he is different from the treatises and because his support is special.

original: don rnam par 'byed pa'i dbang du byas pa'i phyir ni sangs rgyas kyi sa'i 'grel pa la sogs pa las rnam par shes pas thos so zhes bshad do //
analyzed: don rnam par 'byed pa'i dbang du byas pa'i phyir ni sangs rgyas kyi sa'i 'grel pa la sogs pa las rnam par shes pas thos so zhes bshad do //
translated: But it is said in the Buddhabhūmi-vyākhyāna and so forth that he hears with consciousness, because he is the master of the discernment of objects.

original: chos rnams la yang dag par byed pa med pa'i phyir ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa dang / chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa las thos so zhes bshad de /
analyzed: chos rnams la yang dag par byed pa med pa'i phyir ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa dang / chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa las thos so zhes bshad de /
translated: It is said in the commentary to the Perfection of Wisdom and in the Abhidharma-samuccaya that he hears, because dharmas have no real activity.

original: so so nas don re re'i @43b dbang du byas pa'i phyir phan tshun 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: so so nas don re re'i @43b dbang du byas pa'i phyir phan tshun 'gal ba med do //
translated: Since each of these is from the point of view of a particular meaning, there is no contradiction among them.

original: rnam par rig pa tsam gyis rigs pas thos pa bya ba rnam par 'byed pa yang /
analyzed: rnam par rig pa tsam gyis rigs pas thos pa bya ba rnam par 'byed pa yang /
translated: The reasoning that hearing is mere representation is as follows.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sa'i 'grel ba las slob dpon gnyis kyis bshad pa'i don 'byung ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sa'i 'grel ba las slob dpon gnyis kyis bshad pa'i don 'byung ste /
translated: The commentary on the Buddha’s Levels sets forth the meaning explained by those two masters.

original: de la dang pos ni 'di skad du de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs rje dang / sngon gyi smon lam dang / rkyen gyi mthu can gyi dbang gis nyan pa po'i rnam par rig pa la yi ge dang don gyi rnam par skye ste /
analyzed: de la dang pos ni 'di skad du de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs rje dang / sngon gyi smon lam dang / rkyen gyi mthu can gyi dbang gis nyan pa po'i rnam par rig pa la yi ge dang don gyi rnam par skye ste /
translated: The first explains, “By the power of the compassion of the Tathāgata, his previous aspirations, and the power of conditions, the aspects of letters and meanings arise in the consciousness of the listener.

original: yi ge dang don gyi rnam pa de yang rang gi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i mthu las mngon du byung ba yin yang /
analyzed: yi ge dang don gyi rnam pa de yang rang gi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i mthu las mngon du byung ba yin yang /
translated: Although those aspects of letters and meanings arise by the power of his own roots of virtue,

original: rkyan mthu can gyi dbang du mdzad nas sangs rgyas kyis gsungs so zhes bshad la /
analyzed: rkyan mthu can gyi dbang du mdzad nas sangs rgyas kyis gsungs so zhes bshad la /
translated: from the perspective of the power of conditions, it is explained that the Buddha spoke.

original: rna ba'i dbang po dang rang gi sems gyur pa las snang ba'i phyir na bdag gis thos pa zhes bshad do zhe'o //
analyzed: rna ba'i dbang po dang rang gi sems gyur pa las snang ba'i phyir na bdag gis thos pa zhes bshad do zhe'o //
translated: Because they appear from the power of the ear faculty and one’s own mind, it is explained that ‘I hear it.’”

original: gnyis pa ni 'di skad du nyan pa po'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / smon lam chen po dang / rkyen mthu can gyi dbang gis de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par rig pa la /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni 'di skad du nyan pa po'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / smon lam chen po dang / rkyen mthu can gyi dbang gis de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par rig pa la /
translated: Due to the power of the roots of virtue and great aspirations of the listeners and powerful conditions,

original: yi ge dang don gyi rnam pa skye ste /
analyzed: yi ge dang don gyi rnam pa skye ste /
translated: aspects of words and meanings arise in the consciousness of the Tathāgata.

original: yi ge dang don gyi rnam pa de yang de bzhin gshegs pas gzhan la phan btags pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba las byung bas /
analyzed: yi ge dang don gyi rnam pa de yang de bzhin gshegs pas gzhan la phan btags pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba las byung bas /
translated: Those aspects of words and meanings arise from the roots of virtue of the Tathāgata’s altruistic intention to benefit others.

original: sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa zhes pa bstan la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa zhes pa bstan la /
translated: Therefore it is said that the Tathāgata teaches,

original: nyan pa po'i rnam par rig pa'i sems kyis blangs nas thob bam yin mod kyi /
analyzed: nyan pa po'i rnam par rig pa'i sems kyis blangs nas thob bam yin mod kyi /
translated: but the consciousness of the listener takes up and obtains those words and meanings.

original: rnam pa de dang 'dra bar gsal bar gnang ba'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: rnam pa de dang 'dra bar gsal bar gnang ba'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: However, from the perspective of the Tathāgata’s clear bestowal of those aspects,

original: bdag gis thos pa zhes gsungs so zhe'o //
analyzed: bdag gis thos pa zhes gsungs so zhe'o //
translated: it is said that “I hear.”

original: sangs rgyas kyi sa'i 'grel ba las slob dpon gnyis kyis bshad pa de yang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sa'i 'grel ba las slob dpon gnyis kyis bshad pa de yang /
translated: The two masters explain this in the Commentary on the Levels of the Buddha.

original: dang po ni slob dpon klu'i sde sangs rgyas kyi sa'i gnas skabs su gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa yod par mi 'dod do //
analyzed: dang po ni slob dpon klu'i sde sangs rgyas kyi sa'i gnas skabs su gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa yod par mi 'dod do //
translated: The first master, Nagamitra, does not accept that form, sound, etc. exist in the stage of a Buddha.

original: slob dpon gnyis pa ni don gyi sangs rgyas kyi sa'i gnas skabs su yang gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa dang ldan par 'dod do //
analyzed: slob dpon gnyis pa ni don gyi sangs rgyas kyi sa'i gnas skabs su yang gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa dang ldan par 'dod do //
translated: The second master, Shrigupta, accepts that form, sound, etc. exist in the stage of a Buddha.

original: slob dpon hyan tshang dang / chos skyong yang dag bstan pa'i phyi ma ltar bshad de /
analyzed: slob dpon hyan tshang dang / chos skyong yang dag bstan pa'i phyi ma ltar bshad de /
translated: The masters Hwashang and Dharmapala explain in accordance with the latter.

original: gong du ngo bo nyid dang gzugs brnyan yod med bstan pa'i skabs su bshad pa bzhin no //🔽'phags pa kun dga' bo ni de bzhin gshegs pa mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i nyin par bcas @44a * //
analyzed: gong du ngo bo nyid dang gzugs brnyan yod med bstan pa'i skabs su bshad pa bzhin no // 'phags pa kun dga' bo ni de bzhin gshegs pa mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i nyin par bcas @44a * //
translated: This is as explained above in the section on the existence and non-existence of the essence and the reflection.

original: pas lo nyi shu lon nas gdod zham ring ba byas te /
analyzed: pas lo nyi shu lon nas gdod zham ring ba byas te /
translated: The noble Ananda became the attendant of the Buddha twenty years after the Buddha had attained complete enlightenment.🔽Since he was not present at the time of the Buddha's enlightenment,

original: sngar gsungs pa'i mdo sde rnams mngon sum du thos pa med na ci'i phyir mdo sde thams cad las bdag gis thos pa zhes gsungs /
analyzed: sngar gsungs pa'i mdo sde rnams mngon sum du thos pa med na ci'i phyir mdo sde thams cad las bdag gis thos pa zhes gsungs /
translated: how is it that he says in all the sutras, I have heard?

original: 'phags pa drin lan gyi mdo'i 'grel pa las don rnam pa gsum du bshad de /
analyzed: 'phags pa drin lan gyi mdo'i 'grel pa las don rnam pa gsum du bshad de /
translated: The Commentary on the “Repayment of Kindness Sutra” explains three topics:

original: brgyud de thos pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'jig rten pa'i thugs bskyed pa shes pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis yang bzlas te bshad pa'o //
analyzed: brgyud de thos pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'jig rten pa'i thugs bskyed pa shes pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis yang bzlas te bshad pa'o //
translated: hearing indirectly, knowing the tathāgata’s mundane generation of mind, and the Bhagavān’s repetition of the explanation.

original: de'i phyir de nyid las bcom ldan 'das kyis lo bcu gnyis kyi bar du gsungs pa'i phyir chos rnams kun dga' bos ma thos na /
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid las bcom ldan 'das kyis lo bcu gnyis kyi bar du gsungs pa'i phyir chos rnams kun dga' bos ma thos na /
translated: Therefore, since the Bhagavān taught for twelve years, if Ānanda did not hear all the teachings,

original: ci'i phyir bdag gis thos zhes brjod /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bdag gis thos zhes brjod /
translated: why did he say, “I heard”?

original: smras ba / lha rnams kyis kun dga' bo la smras pas so //
analyzed: smras ba / lha rnams kyis kun dga' bo la smras pas so //
translated: It is said that the gods told Ānanda.

original: yang na dge slong rnams las thos pas so //
analyzed: yang na dge slong rnams las thos pas so //
translated: Or he heard it from the monks.

original: yang na bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten pa'i thugs bskyed pas kun dga' bos shes par gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten pa'i thugs bskyed pas kun dga' bos shes par gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Or because the Bhagavān generated a mundane mind, Ānanda came to know it.

original: yang na kun dga' bos bcom ldan 'das la lo bcu gnyis kyi bar du gsungs pa'i chos rnams ma lus par bdag la yang bshad par gsol ba btab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na kun dga' bos bcom ldan 'das la lo bcu gnyis kyi bar du gsungs pa'i chos rnams ma lus par bdag la yang bshad par gsol ba btab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Or else, Ananda requested the Bhagavan to explain to him all the Dharmas that he had taught for twelve years.

original: yang na bcom ldan 'das thabs legs par thugs su chud pas chos kyi tshig las chos tshad med pa gsungs pa dang / chos tshad med pa chos kyi tshig gcig tu gsungs par mdzad pas /
analyzed: yang na bcom ldan 'das thabs legs par thugs su chud pas chos kyi tshig las chos tshad med pa gsungs pa dang / chos tshad med pa chos kyi tshig gcig tu gsungs par mdzad pas /
translated: Or else, the Bhagavan, who is skilled in means, taught immeasurable Dharmas in a single word of Dharma and taught a single Dharma in immeasurable words of Dharma.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo tsam du smos pa kun dga' bos ma lus par khong du chud de /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo tsam du smos pa kun dga' bos ma lus par khong du chud de /
translated: Therefore, Ananda completely understood the brief statements of the Bhagavan

original: myur zhing rno ba dang / 'dzin pa'i mthu che ba'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
analyzed: myur zhing rno ba dang / 'dzin pa'i mthu che ba'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
translated: because he was swift and sharp and had great power of retention.

original: gzhan yang rdo rje gcod pa la sogs pa'i 'grel pa las /
analyzed: gzhan yang rdo rje gcod pa la sogs pa'i 'grel pa las /
translated: Moreover, the Vajracchedika and so on say:

original: dge slong kun dga' bo ni chos kyi ngo bo nyid blo dbang phyug gi rgyal po zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin thob pas /
analyzed: dge slong kun dga' bo ni chos kyi ngo bo nyid blo dbang phyug gi rgyal po zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin thob pas /
translated: The bhiksu Ananda obtained the concentration called the king of the powerful mind of the reality of phenomena.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi mthus sngar gsungs pa rnams ma lus par 'dzin par nus pas mngon sum du thos pa dang tha dad pa med de /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi mthus sngar gsungs pa rnams ma lus par 'dzin par nus pas mngon sum du thos pa dang tha dad pa med de /
translated: By the power of concentration, he is able to retain all that was previously taught, so that he is not different from one who hears it directly.

original: ji ltar mngon par shes pa dag gis 'das pa'i dngos po rnams gsal bar rtogs pa dang / k'a ty'a ya na'i bu chen po smos nas shes pa'i mthu thob pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i mdo sde rnams ma lus par 'dzin nus pa bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar mngon par shes pa dag gis 'das pa'i dngos po rnams gsal bar rtogs pa dang / k'a ty'a ya na'i bu chen po smos nas shes pa'i mthu thob pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i mdo sde rnams ma lus par 'dzin nus pa bzhin du /
translated: Just as those with supernormal knowledge clearly understand past things, and just as the great Kātyāyanīputra, having attained the power of knowledge, was able to retain all the sūtras taught by the Tathāgata,

original: kun dga' bo yang de bzhin no zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: kun dga' bo yang de bzhin no zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: so it is with Ānanda.

original: @44b 'phags pa kun dga' bo nyan thos yin na ji ltar theg pa chen po'i mdo sde rnams yongs su 'dzin par nus /
analyzed: @44b 'phags pa kun dga' bo nyan thos yin na ji ltar theg pa chen po'i mdo sde rnams yongs su 'dzin par nus /
translated: If Ārya Ānanda is a śrāvaka, how can he retain the Mahāyāna sūtras?

original: theg pa chen po'i chos bsdus pa la sogs pa mdo sde mang po las /
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i chos bsdus pa la sogs pa mdo sde mang po las /
translated: In many sūtras, such as the Mahāyāna Dharma Saṃgīti,

original: kun dga' bo ni rnam pa gsum yod de /
analyzed: kun dga' bo ni rnam pa gsum yod de /
translated: it is said that there are three kinds of Ānanda.

original: dang po ni kun dga' bo ste nyan thos kyi chos yongs su 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: dang po ni kun dga' bo ste nyan thos kyi chos yongs su 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The first is Ānanda, who retains the śrāvaka teachings.

original: gnyis pa ni dga' bo bzang po ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni dga' bo bzang po ste /
translated: The second Nanda is Bhadramukha,

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su 'dzin pa'o //
translated: who upholds the teachings of the Solitary Realizers.

original: gsum pa ni dga' bo rgya mtsho ste /
analyzed: gsum pa ni dga' bo rgya mtsho ste /
translated: The third Nanda is Sāgara,

original: theg pa chen po'i chos yongs su 'dzin pa'o zhes gsungs te /🔽'phags pa rdo rje gcod pa'i 'grel pa drang srong rdo rjes byas pa las kyang 'di dang mthun par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i chos yongs su 'dzin pa'o zhes gsungs te / 'phags pa rdo rje gcod pa'i 'grel pa drang srong rdo rjes byas pa las kyang 'di dang mthun par 'byung ngo //
translated: who upholds the teachings of the Great Vehicle.🔽This is also stated in the commentary on the Diamond Cutter composed by the sage Vajra.

original: slob dpon yang dag bden pas byas pa rdo rje gcod pa'i 'grel pa las /
analyzed: slob dpon yang dag bden pas byas pa rdo rje gcod pa'i 'grel pa las /
translated: In the commentary on the Diamond Cutter composed by the master Samyedenpa,

original: rgyal po ma skyes dgras sdig pa bshags pa'i mdo khungs bstan pa las gsungs pa dga' bo rnam pa gsum las /
analyzed: rgyal po ma skyes dgras sdig pa bshags pa'i mdo khungs bstan pa las gsungs pa dga' bo rnam pa gsum las /
translated: it is stated that the three kinds of Nanda mentioned in the sutra taught by King Ajatashatru to confess his misdeeds are:🔽the third Nanda upholds the sutras of the Great Vehicle.

original: dga' bo gsum pa ni theg pa chen po'i mdo sde yongs su 'dzin pa'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: dga' bo gsum pa ni theg pa chen po'i mdo sde yongs su 'dzin pa'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir 'gal ba med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no contradiction.

original: de la gsum pa de dag bshad pa'i dgongs pa bstan pa zhes bya ba yang /
analyzed: de la gsum pa de dag bshad pa'i dgongs pa bstan pa zhes bya ba yang /
translated: Here, the intention of explaining the three is called demonstrating.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sa'i 'grel pa las 'di skad bdag gis thos pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni yan lag gzhan gyis sgro 'dogs pa dang / skur pa 'debs pa'i nyes pa dang bral bar bstan te zhes 'byung yongs su spongs par rigs par bya ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sa'i 'grel pa las 'di skad bdag gis thos pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni yan lag gzhan gyis sgro 'dogs pa dang / skur pa 'debs pa'i nyes pa dang bral bar bstan te zhes 'byung yongs su spongs par rigs par bya ste /
translated: The Commentary on the Levels of the Buddhas says, “This ‘thus have I heard’ indicates freedom from the faults of exaggeration and deprecation by other branches.”

original: 'di ltar chos 'di ni bdag gis bcom ldan 'das las mngon sum du thos kyis gud nas gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar chos 'di ni bdag gis bcom ldan 'das las mngon sum du thos kyis gud nas gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa ma yin te /
translated: Thus, this teaching was directly heard by me from the Bhagavat, and it is not a case of one person telling it to another.

original: nyan pa po nus pa dang ldan pas thos pa rnams kyang yan lag gzhan gyis sgro 'dogs pa dang / skur pa 'debs pa'i nyes pa dang bral bar bstan to zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: nyan pa po nus pa dang ldan pas thos pa rnams kyang yan lag gzhan gyis sgro 'dogs pa dang / skur pa 'debs pa'i nyes pa dang bral bar bstan to zhes 'byung ste /
translated: The listener, who is endowed with the ability to hear, is also taught freedom from the faults of exaggeration and deprecation by other branches.

original: zhib tu de nyid las bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: zhib tu de nyid las bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: This is explained in detail in the Levels of the Buddhas.

original: dus gcig na zhes bya bas ni rnam pa lngar phye ba las gnyis pa 'byung ba'i dus kyi phyogs zhes bya ba ston te /
analyzed: dus gcig na zhes bya bas ni rnam pa lngar phye ba las gnyis pa 'byung ba'i dus kyi phyogs zhes bya ba ston te /
translated: At one time means that from among the five topics, it teaches the second, the time of the occurrence of the teaching.

original: dus gcig na zhes bya ba 'di yang yul 'di pa'i slob dpon rnams kyis rnam pa bzhir bstan te /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa ring gcig gis lo lnga bcu'i bar du bstan pa gsungs pa'i dus dang mdo sde gcig gsungs pa'i dus dang / 'khor lo yongs su smin @45a * //
analyzed: dus gcig na zhes bya ba 'di yang yul 'di pa'i slob dpon rnams kyis rnam pa bzhir bstan te / de bzhin gshegs pa ring gcig gis lo lnga bcu'i bar du bstan pa gsungs pa'i dus dang mdo sde gcig gsungs pa'i dus dang / 'khor lo yongs su smin @45a * //
translated: Also, the phrase at one time is explained in four ways by the masters of this land.

original: pa'i dus dang / 'chad pa dang / nyan pa phan tshun phrad par gyur pa'i dus so //
analyzed: pa'i dus dang / 'chad pa dang / nyan pa phan tshun phrad par gyur pa'i dus so //
translated: The masters of this land explain that the phrase at one time refers to the time when the Tathagata taught the doctrine for fifty years, the time when he taught a single sutra, the time when the retinue was fully ripened, and the time when the teacher and retinue met.

original: rgya gar yul pa'i slob dpon gyis bshad pa yang mi mthun pa rnam pa gsum yod de /🔽de la dang po ni slob dpon po de le'u cis 'di skad du dus gcig na zhes bya ba yang /
analyzed: rgya gar yul pa'i slob dpon gyis bshad pa yang mi mthun pa rnam pa gsum yod de / de la dang po ni slob dpon po de le'u cis 'di skad du dus gcig na zhes bya ba yang /
translated: The Indian masters also explain it in three different ways.🔽The first is the explanation of the master Bodhibhadra, who says:

original: rnam pa mang bas 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rnam pa mang bas 'di lta ste /
translated: The phrase at one time refers to many types of time.

original: skad cig ma'i dus kyang yod /
analyzed: skad cig ma'i dus kyang yod /
translated: There is the time of a moment,

original: nyin mtshan gyi dus kyang yod /
analyzed: nyin mtshan gyi dus kyang yod /
translated: the time of a day and night,

original: lo brgya'i dus kyang yod /
analyzed: lo brgya'i dus kyang yod /
translated: the time of a hundred years,

original: thams cad kyi dus kyang yod /
analyzed: thams cad kyi dus kyang yod /
translated: and the time of all.

original: dpyid dang ston dang / dgun dang / dbyar gyi dus kyang yod de /
analyzed: dpyid dang ston dang / dgun dang / dbyar gyi dus kyang yod de /
translated: There is also the time of spring, autumn, winter and summer.

original: 'dir dus gcig na zhes bya ba ni 'di lta bu la sogs pa'i dus ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dir dus gcig na zhes bya ba ni 'di lta bu la sogs pa'i dus ma yin gyi /
translated: Here, “at one time” does not refer to such a time,

original: de bzhin gshegs pas ldan par mdo 'di gsungs pa'i dus so zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas ldan par mdo 'di gsungs pa'i dus so zhes bshad do //
translated: but rather to the time when the Tathagata spoke this sutra.

original: gnyis pa ni slob dpon rna rings kyis 'di skad du dus gcig ces bya ba yang rnam pa gnyis yod de /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni slob dpon rna rings kyis 'di skad du dus gcig ces bya ba yang rnam pa gnyis yod de /
translated: The second is that of Master Karotapuni, who says: “At one time” is also twofold.

original: dang po ni yongs su ma rdzogs pa'i dus te /
analyzed: dang po ni yongs su ma rdzogs pa'i dus te /
translated: The first is the time of incompleteness,

original: dmigs pa ma khyab pa la ltos nas so //
analyzed: dmigs pa ma khyab pa la ltos nas so //
translated: in terms of the non-pervasion of the objective reference.

original: gnyis pa ni gsung yongs su rdzogs pa'i dus te /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni gsung yongs su rdzogs pa'i dus te /
translated: The second is the time of completeness of speech,

original: dmigs pa khyab pa la ltos nas so //
analyzed: dmigs pa khyab pa la ltos nas so //
translated: in terms of the pervasion of the objective reference.

original: dang po mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa nas /
analyzed: dang po mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa nas /
translated: From the first, the full enlightenment,

original: tha ma shing s'a la zung cig gi drung du mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar du gsung rnam pa gnyis su gsungs pas yongs su ma rdzogs pa dang yongs su rdzogs pa gnyis ka yang gsungs te /
analyzed: tha ma shing s'a la zung cig gi drung du mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar du gsung rnam pa gnyis su gsungs pas yongs su ma rdzogs pa dang yongs su rdzogs pa gnyis ka yang gsungs te /
translated: up to the last, the Nirvana between the twin sala trees, he spoke the two kinds of speech, both incomplete and complete.

original: chung ngu'i phyogs can gzigs pa la ni yongs su ma rdzogs pa'i gsung gi dus zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chung ngu'i phyogs can gzigs pa la ni yongs su ma rdzogs pa'i gsung gi dus zhes bya'o //
translated: The time of incomplete speech is when the vision is partial and incomplete.

original: yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyogs can gzigs pa la ni yongs su rdzogs pa'i gsung gi dus zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyogs can gzigs pa la ni yongs su rdzogs pa'i gsung gi dus zhes bya'o //
translated: The time of complete speech is when the vision is complete.

original: gzhan yang dus ni rnam pa gsum yod de /
analyzed: gzhan yang dus ni rnam pa gsum yod de /
translated: Moreover, there are three times:

original: dngos po can 'khor bar 'jug pa'i dus dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i rnam par gyur pa'i dus dang / btags pa tsam du gdags pa'i dus te /
analyzed: dngos po can 'khor bar 'jug pa'i dus dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i rnam par gyur pa'i dus dang / btags pa tsam du gdags pa'i dus te /
translated: the time of engagement in cyclic existence, the time of inconceivable transformation, and the time of mere designation.

original: snga ma gnyis ni skye shi rnam pa gnyis kyi dus so //
analyzed: snga ma gnyis ni skye shi rnam pa gnyis kyi dus so //
translated: The first two are the time of the two types of birth and death.

original: btags pa'i dus de yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: btags pa'i dus de yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The time of designation is also threefold:

original: snga ma gnyis ni shes par gyur pa'i dus dang / log bar lta ba 'jig pa'i dus dang / 'jig rten na gnas pa'i dus so //
analyzed: snga ma gnyis ni shes par gyur pa'i dus dang / log bar lta ba 'jig pa'i dus dang / 'jig rten na gnas pa'i dus so //
translated: the time of knowledge, the time of destroying wrong views, and the time of abiding in the world.

original: de la shes par gyur ba'i dus ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'dul ba rnams bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i tshe ni thos su gnang la /
analyzed: de la shes par gyur ba'i dus ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'dul ba rnams bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i tshe ni thos su gnang la /
translated: The time of knowledge is when the disciples of the Tathāgata are permitted to listen to the teachings when they are fully ordained.

original: bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa'i tshe thos su mi gnang ba dang / @45b rab tu byung ba'i tshe ni thos su gnang la /
analyzed: bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa'i tshe thos su mi gnang ba dang / @45b rab tu byung ba'i tshe ni thos su gnang la /
translated: It is not permitted to study when one has not taken full ordination, but it is permitted to study when one has taken full ordination.

original: khyim pa'i tshe thos su mi gnang ba dang / rgyal po ni thos su gnang la /
analyzed: khyim pa'i tshe thos su mi gnang ba dang / rgyal po ni thos su gnang la /
translated: It is not permitted to study when one is a layman, but it is permitted to study when one is a king.

original: gzhan rnams thos su mi gnang ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan rnams thos su mi gnang ba'o //
translated: It is not permitted to study when one is anyone other than a king.

original: log par lta ba 'jig pa'i dus ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: log par lta ba 'jig pa'i dus ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The time for destroying wrong views is as follows:

original: lung sde lnga dang / chos mngon pa yan lag dgu po dag nag po dang dkar po'i phyogs mi dbye bar thams cad thos su gnang ba'o //
analyzed: lung sde lnga dang / chos mngon pa yan lag dgu po dag nag po dang dkar po'i phyogs mi dbye bar thams cad thos su gnang ba'o //
translated: It is permitted to study all of the five piṭakas and the nine branches of the higher knowledge without distinguishing between the dark and light sides.

original: 'jig rten gnas pa'i dus ni ji skad du bcom ldan 'das dus gcig na chu bo gang g'a'i 'gram na bzhugs so //
analyzed: 'jig rten gnas pa'i dus ni ji skad du bcom ldan 'das dus gcig na chu bo gang g'a'i 'gram na bzhugs so //
translated: The time for the world to endure is as follows: The Bhagavān said, “At one time, I was staying on the banks of the Ganges River.”

original: dus gcig na tshal 'jigs su rung ba na bzhugs so zhes gsungs pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: dus gcig na tshal 'jigs su rung ba na bzhugs so zhes gsungs pa lta bu ste /
translated: At one time, he was staying in a terrifying forest.”

original: 'di dus gcig na zhes bya ba'i ri zhig phyi ma gnyis dang sbyar ro zhe'o //
analyzed: 'di dus gcig na zhes bya ba'i ri zhig phyi ma gnyis dang sbyar ro zhe'o //
translated: The phrase “at one time” in the first passage should be applied to the second and third passages.

original: gsum pa ni slob dpon yang dag bden pas 'di skad du dus zhes bya ba'i don ni rnam pa bcu yod do zhes bshad de //
analyzed: gsum pa ni slob dpon yang dag bden pas 'di skad du dus zhes bya ba'i don ni rnam pa bcu yod do zhes bshad de //
translated: The third is explained by Master Paramārthasatya as follows: The meaning of “time” has ten aspects.

original: zhib tu dngos po bdun gyi brjed byang byas pa las 'byung ste /
analyzed: zhib tu dngos po bdun gyi brjed byang byas pa las 'byung ste /
translated: It appears in detail in the notes on the seven topics,

original: mangs kyis dogs nas 'dir ma brjod do //
analyzed: mangs kyis dogs nas 'dir ma brjod do //
translated: but fearing too many words, I will not write about it here.

original: 'dir bstan bcos rnams dang sbyar na bshad pa rnam pa gsum yod de /
analyzed: 'dir bstan bcos rnams dang sbyar na bshad pa rnam pa gsum yod de /
translated: When applied to the treatises, there are three explanations.

original: de la dang po ni slob dpon yon tan byin gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rdo rje gcod pa'i 'grel pa byas pa las dus gcig na zhes bya ba ni mdo sde 'di gsungs pa'i dus gcig gi tshe ste /
analyzed: de la dang po ni slob dpon yon tan byin gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rdo rje gcod pa'i 'grel pa byas pa las dus gcig na zhes bya ba ni mdo sde 'di gsungs pa'i dus gcig gi tshe ste /
translated: The first is from Master Guṇadatta’s commentary on the Diamond Cutter Perfection of Wisdom Sūtra, which explains, “At one time” means at the time this sūtra was taught,

original: dus gzhan na ni mdo sde tshad med pa gzhan gsungs pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
analyzed: dus gzhan na ni mdo sde tshad med pa gzhan gsungs pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
translated: because at other times he taught countless other sūtras.

original: gnyis pa ni slob dpon klu sgrub kyis bshad pa dang sbyar na /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni slob dpon klu sgrub kyis bshad pa dang sbyar na /
translated: The second is when applied to the explanation of Master Nāgārjuna.

original: dus ni rnam pa gnyis yod de /
analyzed: dus ni rnam pa gnyis yod de /
translated: Time has two aspects.

original: dang po ni shes pa'i dus te /
analyzed: dang po ni shes pa'i dus te /
translated: The first is the time of cognition.

original: btags pa dang rdzas su yod pa'i phyi nang gnyis ka dang sbyar pa'o //
analyzed: btags pa dang rdzas su yod pa'i phyi nang gnyis ka dang sbyar pa'o //
translated: It is applied to both internal and external things that exist imputedly and substantially.

original: gnyis ba ni log par lta ba 'jig pa'i dus te /
analyzed: gnyis ba ni log par lta ba 'jig pa'i dus te /
translated: The second is the time of the destruction of wrong view.

original: btags pa kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: btags pa kho na yin gyi /
translated: It is only imputed,🔽but not substantially existent.

original: rdzas su ni ma yin no zhes chos 'di pa'i gzhung gis 'di la brten nas bshad pa yin no zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: rdzas su ni ma yin no zhes chos 'di pa'i gzhung gis 'di la brten nas bshad pa yin no zhes 'byung ste /
translated: This is explained in the treatises of this Dharma system.

original: de'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las dris pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las dris pa /
translated: Therefore the commentary on the perfection of wisdom says:

original: rgya gar yul pa rnams dus ni rnam pa gnyis yod de /
analyzed: rgya gar yul pa rnams dus ni rnam pa gnyis yod de /
translated: “The Indians say that time is of two types:

original: shes pa'i dus dang / log par lta ba 'jig pa'i dus so zhes bshad na /
analyzed: shes pa'i dus dang / log par lta ba 'jig pa'i dus so zhes bshad na /
translated: the time of consciousness and the time of the destruction of wrong view.”

original: bcom ldan 'das ci'i phyir shes pa'i dus kyi cha mi gsung bar /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ci'i phyir shes pa'i dus kyi cha mi gsung bar /
translated: “Why does the Bhagavat not teach the part of the time of consciousness,

original: log par lta ba 'jig pa'i dus 'ba' zhig gsung ba mdzad /
analyzed: log par lta ba 'jig pa'i dus 'ba' zhig gsung ba mdzad /
translated: but teach only the time of the destruction of wrong view?”

original: smras pa / gal te shes pa dang gnyi ga gsung na yang the tshom yod par @46a * //🔽'gyur ro // yang dris pa /
analyzed: smras pa / gal te shes pa dang gnyi ga gsung na yang the tshom yod par @46a * // 'gyur ro // yang dris pa /
translated: “If he taught both consciousness and time, doubt would arise.”

original: 'dir shes pa zhes gsungs pa'i rigs te /
analyzed: 'dir shes pa zhes gsungs pa'i rigs te /
translated: “Here it is appropriate to say that consciousness is taught.

original: 'di ltar yi ge gnyis po de yang zhing bshad sla ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ltar yi ge gnyis po de yang zhing bshad sla ba'i phyir /
translated: Because those two syllables are light and easy to explain.

original: log par lta ba 'jig ba'i dus zhes thad kar gsung ba'i mi rigs te /
analyzed: log par lta ba 'jig ba'i dus zhes thad kar gsung ba'i mi rigs te /
translated: It is illogical to directly state the time of destroying wrong view.

original: 'di ltar yi ge gsum po de lci zhing smra dka' ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ltar yi ge gsum po de lci zhing smra dka' ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because those three syllables are heavy and difficult to speak.

original: smras pa 'dir log par lta ba bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: smras pa 'dir log par lta ba bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: It is said that in order to eliminate wrong view,

original: log par lta ba 'jig par gsungs kyi shes pa ni ma gsungs so zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: log par lta ba 'jig par gsungs kyi shes pa ni ma gsungs so zhes 'byung ste /
translated: wrong view is said to be destroyed, but consciousness is not said to be.

original: zhib tu de nyid las 'byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: zhib tu de nyid las 'byung ba bzhin no //
translated: This is explained in detail in that text.

original: gsum pa ni slob dpon nye ba'i yid kyis dus ni rnam pa gsum yod de /
analyzed: gsum pa ni slob dpon nye ba'i yid kyis dus ni rnam pa gsum yod de /
translated: The third is explained by Master Upatiṣya: There are three types of time.

original: dang po ni bshad pa dang nyan pa mthar phyin pa la dus gcig ces bya'o zhes bshad de /
analyzed: dang po ni bshad pa dang nyan pa mthar phyin pa la dus gcig ces bya'o zhes bshad de /
translated: The first is called the same time as completing listening and explaining.

original: de'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi sa'i 'grel pa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi sa'i 'grel pa las /
translated: Therefore the commentary on the level of buddhahood says:

original: dus gcig ces bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dus gcig ces bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The so-called same time is as follows.

original: bshad pa dang nyan pa'i dus te /
analyzed: bshad pa dang nyan pa'i dus te /
translated: It is the time of listening and explaining.

original: 'di ni skad cig ma gcig la rgyun chags su bar chad med par bshad pa dang nyan pa mthar phyin pa'i dbang du mdzad nas spyir dus gcig ces bstan to //
analyzed: 'di ni skad cig ma gcig la rgyun chags su bar chad med par bshad pa dang nyan pa mthar phyin pa'i dbang du mdzad nas spyir dus gcig ces bstan to //
translated: This is taught in general as “at one time” from the perspective of completing the explanation and listening without interruption in a single moment.

original: de lta ma yin na yi ge dang ming dang tshig la sogs pa nyan pa dang / bshad pa'i dus dang tha dad pas ji ltar gcig tu 'gyur zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na yi ge dang ming dang tshig la sogs pa nyan pa dang / bshad pa'i dus dang tha dad pas ji ltar gcig tu 'gyur zhes bshad do //
translated: Otherwise, since the time of listening and explaining would be different from the time of the letters, words, and phrases, how could they be one?

original: gnyis pa ni skad cig ma gcig la 'dzin pa dang bshad pa dang go ba dang / yongs su bzung par nus pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni skad cig ma gcig la 'dzin pa dang bshad pa dang go ba dang / yongs su bzung par nus pa'i phyir /
translated: The second is explained as “at one time” because it is possible to apprehend, explain, understand, and fully grasp in a single moment.🔽Therefore, that very commentary says:🔽“Or, because the listener who has attained retention perfectly apprehends all Dharma topics in a single moment of a single letter,

original: dus gcig ces bya'o zhes bshad de /
analyzed: dus gcig ces bya'o zhes bshad de /
translated: it is called ‘at one time.’”

original: de'i phyir 'grel pa de nyid las /🔽yang na nyan pa po gzungs thob pas yi ge 'bru gcig la /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'grel pa de nyid las / yang na nyan pa po gzungs thob pas yi ge 'bru gcig la /
translated: Therefore, that very commentary says:🔽“Or, because the listener who has attained retention perfectly apprehends all Dharma topics in a single moment of a single letter,

original: skad cig ma gcig gis chos kyi rnam grangs thams cad yang dag par 'dzin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: skad cig ma gcig gis chos kyi rnam grangs thams cad yang dag par 'dzin pa'i phyir /
translated: it is called ‘at one time.’”

original: yang na nyan pa po'i rna ba'i dbang po rnam par dag pa thob pas skad cig ma gcig la yi ge 'bru gcig yongs su bcad pa na gzhan thams cad la thogs pa med par yang dag par 'dzin pa'i phyir dus gcig ces bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: yang na nyan pa po'i rna ba'i dbang po rnam par dag pa thob pas skad cig ma gcig la yi ge 'bru gcig yongs su bcad pa na gzhan thams cad la thogs pa med par yang dag par 'dzin pa'i phyir dus gcig ces bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Or, it is called “simultaneous” because the listener obtains the pure faculty of ear, and when one letter is completely apprehended in one moment, all others are correctly apprehended without impediment.

original: gsum pa ni phan tshun tshogs shing phrad par gyur pa la dus gcig ces bya'o zhes bshad de /
analyzed: gsum pa ni phan tshun tshogs shing phrad par gyur pa la dus gcig ces bya'o zhes bshad de /
translated: The third is explained as “simultaneous” because they mutually assemble and meet.

original: de'i phyir 'grel pa de nyid las /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'grel pa de nyid las /
translated: Therefore, the Subcommentary states:

original: yang na phan tshun tshogs shing phrad par gyur nas /
analyzed: yang na phan tshun tshogs shing phrad par gyur nas /
translated: Or, they mutually assemble and meet.

original: dus kyi cha tha dad pa med pa'i phyir dus gcig ces bya'o zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: dus kyi cha tha dad pa med pa'i phyir dus gcig ces bya'o zhes 'byung ste /
translated: Because there is no difference in the part of time, it is called “simultaneous.”

original: 'di ni 'chad pa dang nyan pa phan tshun tshogs shing dus mtshungs par gyur pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'di ni 'chad pa dang nyan pa phan tshun tshogs shing dus mtshungs par gyur pa'i don to //
translated: This means that the explanation and listening mutually assemble and become simultaneous.

original: dus dang gcig ces bya ba'i @46b ngo bo nyid ji lta bu yin /
analyzed: dus dang gcig ces bya ba'i @46b ngo bo nyid ji lta bu yin /
translated: What is the nature of simultaneous time?

original: de la dus ni dus kyi cha'o //
analyzed: de la dus ni dus kyi cha'o //
translated: Time is a part of time.

original: gcig ni grangs so //
analyzed: gcig ni grangs so //
translated: One is a number.

original: thams cad yod par smra ba dang / mdo sde pa dag ni gud na chos med kyi phung po lnga nyid kyi ngo bo nyid byed do //
analyzed: thams cad yod par smra ba dang / mdo sde pa dag ni gud na chos med kyi phung po lnga nyid kyi ngo bo nyid byed do //
translated: Sarvastivadins and Sautrantikas explain that the self is not a separate entity but the nature of the five aggregates.

original: khams dang skye mched kyi sgo nas ni 'dus byas kyi ngo bo nyid byed do zhes bshad do //
analyzed: khams dang skye mched kyi sgo nas ni 'dus byas kyi ngo bo nyid byed do zhes bshad do //
translated: They explain that the self is the nature of the conditioned from the perspective of the elements and sense bases.

original: 'dir theg pa chen po'i gzhung dang sbyar na bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
analyzed: 'dir theg pa chen po'i gzhung dang sbyar na bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
translated: Here, when applied to the Mahayana scriptures, there are two explanations.

original: dang po ni slob dpon klu sgrub kyi gzhung gis grangs dang dus la sogs pa la rang gi ngo bo nyid med pas phung po dang khams dang skye mched dag gis bsdus pa ma yin no zhes bshad de /
analyzed: dang po ni slob dpon klu sgrub kyi gzhung gis grangs dang dus la sogs pa la rang gi ngo bo nyid med pas phung po dang khams dang skye mched dag gis bsdus pa ma yin no zhes bshad de /
translated: The first is that because number, time and so on have no intrinsic reality, they are not included in the aggregates, elements and sense bases as explained in the scriptures of Nagarjuna.

original: de'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las /
translated: Therefore the commentary to the perfection of wisdom sutra states:

original: grangs dang dus la sogs pa'i chos ni yang dag par yod pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: grangs dang dus la sogs pa'i chos ni yang dag par yod pa ma yin pas /
translated: Since phenomena such as number and time do not exist in reality,

original: phung po dang skye mched dang / 'dzin pa dag gis ma bsdus pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: phung po dang skye mched dang / 'dzin pa dag gis ma bsdus pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: they are not included in the aggregates, sense bases and elements.

original: gzhan yang bstan bcos de nyid las 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang bstan bcos de nyid las 'di lta ste /
translated: Moreover, that treatise states:

original: dus dang phyogs la bral ba dang 'dus pa dang / gcig pa dang tha dad pa dang / ring po dang thung ngu'i ming dang yi ge yod pas so so'i skye bo rnams sems kyis mngon par zhen nas yang dag pa nyid du sems so zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: dus dang phyogs la bral ba dang 'dus pa dang / gcig pa dang tha dad pa dang / ring po dang thung ngu'i ming dang yi ge yod pas so so'i skye bo rnams sems kyis mngon par zhen nas yang dag pa nyid du sems so zhes 'byung ste /
translated: Because of the existence of names and letters such as time, direction, separation, conjunction, identity, difference, long and short, ordinary beings conceive them with their minds and think they are real.

original: rgya cher de nyid las bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rgya cher de nyid las bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: This is explained extensively in that treatise.

original: gnyis pa ni 'phags pa byams pa'i gzhung gis dus dang gcig ces bya ba ni 'dus byas yin te /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni 'phags pa byams pa'i gzhung gis dus dang gcig ces bya ba ni 'dus byas yin te /
translated: The second is the system of the noble Maitreya, which states: Time and identity are conditioned phenomena.

original: yid ches pa'i gnas skabs btags pa tsam du rnam par gzhag pa ste /
analyzed: yid ches pa'i gnas skabs btags pa tsam du rnam par gzhag pa ste /
translated: They are established as mere imputations, trustworthy sources.

original: 'di ni mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa nyi shu rtsa bzhi las grangs dang dus zhes bya ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa nyi shu rtsa bzhi las grangs dang dus zhes bya ba nyid yin no //
translated: This is number and time among the twenty-four non-concurrent formations.

original: phung po lnga las ni 'du byed kyi phung pos bsdus so //
analyzed: phung po lnga las ni 'du byed kyi phung pos bsdus so //
translated: It is included in the formation aggregate.

original: khams dang skye mched las ni chos kyi khams dang chos kyi skye mched kyis bsdus te /
analyzed: khams dang skye mched las ni chos kyi khams dang chos kyi skye mched kyis bsdus te /
translated: The elements and sense bases subsume it, because it is included in the element of mental objects and the sense base of mental objects.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
translated: It is the object of mental consciousness.🔽The commentary to the noble Sutra on Buddha Nature states:

original: 'phags pa sangs rgyas kyi sa'i 'grel pa las ni yang na sems kyi gnas skabs kyi gzugs brnyan yin te /
analyzed: 'phags pa sangs rgyas kyi sa'i 'grel pa las ni yang na sems kyi gnas skabs kyi gzugs brnyan yin te /
translated: Or else, it is a reflection of the state of mind.

original: 'di ni mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa'o zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'di ni mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa'o zhes 'byung ste /
translated: This is not associated.

original: 'di ni rnam par rig pa tsam gyi dbang du byas nas bshad pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rnam par rig pa tsam gyi dbang du byas nas bshad pa'o //
translated: This is explained from the perspective of mere representation.

original: ci'i phyir gzhung gnyis yod pa dang med ba mi mthun par gyur /🔽slob dpon klu sgrub ni chos stong pa nyid du bstan cing mu stegs can la sogs pa ni grangs @47a * //
analyzed: ci'i phyir gzhung gnyis yod pa dang med ba mi mthun par gyur / slob dpon klu sgrub ni chos stong pa nyid du bstan cing mu stegs can la sogs pa ni grangs @47a * //
translated: Why do these two texts have different positions regarding existence and nonexistence?🔽Master Nagarjuna explained that things are essenceless in order to teach that phenomena are empty and to refute the tirthikas and others who assert that number and time exist substantially.

original: dang dus rdzas su yod par 'dod pa gzhig pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid med par bshad la 'phags pa byams pa ni theg pa chen po'i chos kyi mtshan nyid kyi rigs pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dang dus rdzas su yod par 'dod pa gzhig pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid med par bshad la 'phags pa byams pa ni theg pa chen po'i chos kyi mtshan nyid kyi rigs pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The noble Maitreya explained that things have essence in order to teach the reasoning of the characteristics of Mahayana Dharma.

original: logs shig tu mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa rnams par gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: logs shig tu mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa rnams par gzhag pa yin no //
translated: They are posited separately as nonassociated compositional factors.

original: yang slob dpon klu sgrub kyis chos lnga'i nang du mtshungs par ldan pha ma yin pa bdun brgya bsdus te /
analyzed: yang slob dpon klu sgrub kyis chos lnga'i nang du mtshungs par ldan pha ma yin pa bdun brgya bsdus te /
translated: Also, Master Nagarjuna includes the seven nonassociated compositional factors in the five dharmas.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las /
translated: His commentary on the perfection of wisdom states:

original: sems la sogs pa'i chos lnga zhes bshad la /
analyzed: sems la sogs pa'i chos lnga zhes bshad la /
translated: The five dharmas are the mind and so on.🔽And his explanation of the ten grounds states:🔽The seven hundred nonassociated compositional factors are posited.🔽Why does he not explain that this sutra was taught at the time of the first sunrise and at midnight?

original: gnas pa bcu'i bshad pa las ni mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa bdun brgya rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ci'i phyir nyi ma dang po shar ba'i dus dang / de bzhin du nam gyi gung thun gyi dus la mdo sde 'di gsungs zhes ma bstan pa'i gnas pa la sogs pa ni logs shig tu gnas khyad par can dag tu bstan la /
analyzed: gnas pa bcu'i bshad pa las ni mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa bdun brgya rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ci'i phyir nyi ma dang po shar ba'i dus dang / de bzhin du nam gyi gung thun gyi dus la mdo sde 'di gsungs zhes ma bstan pa'i gnas pa la sogs pa ni logs shig tu gnas khyad par can dag tu bstan la /
translated: He teaches that the grounds and so on are separate and special times.

original: mdo sde 'di las ni dus gcig na zhes bya ba 'ba' zhig gsungs /
analyzed: mdo sde 'di las ni dus gcig na zhes bya ba 'ba' zhig gsungs /
translated: This sutra merely states, at one time.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sa'i 'grel pa las nyin mtshan dang dus tshod kyi yul so so nas nges pa med pas logs shig na bshad du mi rung ngo zhes 'byung ngo /🔽// / bam po lnga pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sa'i 'grel pa las nyin mtshan dang dus tshod kyi yul so so nas nges pa med pas logs shig na bshad du mi rung ngo zhes 'byung ngo / // / bam po lnga pa /
translated: The Commentary on the Levels of the Buddha states that since there is no certainty about the time and place of the day, it is not suitable to explain them separately.

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba 'dis ni rnam pa lnga las gsum pa bsten pa gsungs pa'i bdag po zhes bya ba bstan to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba 'dis ni rnam pa lnga las gsum pa bsten pa gsungs pa'i bdag po zhes bya ba bstan to //
translated: This “bhagavat” indicates the third of the five aspects, the master who teaches.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa dang sbyar na /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa dang sbyar na /
translated: When applied to the Commentary on the Perfection of Wisdom,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos 'chad pa'i gang zag ni rnam pa lnga yod do zhes bshad de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos 'chad pa'i gang zag ni rnam pa lnga yod do zhes bshad de /
translated: it explains that there are five types of persons who teach the Buddha’s teachings.

original: de'i phyir de nyid las bshad pa las chos bshad pa ni rnam pa lnga yod de /
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid las bshad pa las chos bshad pa ni rnam pa lnga yod de /
translated: Therefore, from among the explanations in that text, there are five types of Dharma teachings.

original: sangs rgyas nyid kyis gsungs pa dang / slob mas bshad pa dang / drang srong gis bshad pa dang / lha rnams kyis bshad pa dang / sprul pas bshad pa ste gzhan rnam pa bzhi bkod pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba gsungs so zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid kyis gsungs pa dang / slob mas bshad pa dang / drang srong gis bshad pa dang / lha rnams kyis bshad pa dang / sprul pas bshad pa ste gzhan rnam pa bzhi bkod pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba gsungs so zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: The Bhagavān is so called because he has set forth the four other kinds of teachings: those taught by the Buddha himself, those taught by his disciples, those taught by sages, and those taught by gods and emanations.

original: mdo sde 'di dang po kho nar byang chub sems dpa' don zab mo dgongs pa nges par 'grel pas kyang gnyis su med pa'i don bshad na /
analyzed: mdo sde 'di dang po kho nar byang chub sems dpa' don zab mo dgongs pa nges par 'grel pas kyang gnyis su med pa'i don bshad na /
translated: If the Bodhisattva, the Profound Meanings, the Definitive Explanation, first explained the meaning of nonduality,

original: ci'i phyir bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba 'ba' zhig gsungs /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba 'ba' zhig gsungs /
translated: why did he say only “the Bhagavān”?

original: don rnam pa gsum gyi phyir te /
analyzed: don rnam pa gsum gyi phyir te /
translated: For three reasons:

original: nyung ngu mang po'i rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir dang / mchog tu gyur pa'i dbang du mdzad nas bshad pa'i phyir dang / sangs rgyas @47b kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyung ngu mang po'i rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir dang / mchog tu gyur pa'i dbang du mdzad nas bshad pa'i phyir dang / sangs rgyas @47b kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he is following the few who are many, because he is explaining from the point of view of the supreme, and because he is blessed by the Buddha.

original: mdo sde rnams kyi mgor mtshan smos pa yang mi mthun pa rnam pa bzhi yod de /
analyzed: mdo sde rnams kyi mgor mtshan smos pa yang mi mthun pa rnam pa bzhi yod de /
translated: There are four different ways of mentioning the title at the beginning of the sūtras:

original: kha cig las ni sangs rgyas zhes bya ba 'ba' zhig smos te /
analyzed: kha cig las ni sangs rgyas zhes bya ba 'ba' zhig smos te /
translated: Some sūtras mention only the word “buddha,”

original: mya ngan las 'das pa chen po la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa chen po la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: such as the Mahāparinirvāṇa Sūtra.

original: kha cig las ni bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba nyi tshe smos te ;
analyzed: kha cig las ni bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba nyi tshe smos te ;
translated: Some sūtras mention only the word “bhagavat,”

original: le'u chen po la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: le'u chen po la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: such as the Mahāparivarta Sūtra.

original: kha cig las ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das zhes mtshan gnyi ga smos pa yang yod de /
analyzed: kha cig las ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das zhes mtshan gnyi ga smos pa yang yod de /
translated: Some sūtras mention both epithets, “buddha” and “bhagavat,”

original: bla na med pa'i gnas bstan pa'i mdo la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa'i gnas bstan pa'i mdo la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: such as the Anuttarāśrayasūtra.

original: kha cig las ni gnyi ga smos pa yang yod de /
analyzed: kha cig las ni gnyi ga smos pa yang yod de /
translated: Some sūtras mention neither epithet,

original: mtshams sbyor ba rnam par grol ba'i mdo dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i snying po la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: mtshams sbyor ba rnam par grol ba'i mdo dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i snying po la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: such as the Saṃyukta and the Prajñāpāramitāhṛdaya Sūtra.

original: de ltar mdo sde rnams kyi dpe mi mthun par gyur pa yang mtshams rnam par dgrol ba ni sde gcig gi nang na tha ma'i le'u gnyis yin pa'i phyir mtshan ma smos so //
analyzed: de ltar mdo sde rnams kyi dpe mi mthun par gyur pa yang mtshams rnam par dgrol ba ni sde gcig gi nang na tha ma'i le'u gnyis yin pa'i phyir mtshan ma smos so //
translated: Thus, although the sūtras are not consistent, the Saṃyukta is called the Saṃyukta because it has two final chapters in one collection.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i snying po ni dpe rgyas pa las sdud pa po dag gis bsdus pa'i phyir mtshan ma smos so //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i snying po ni dpe rgyas pa las sdud pa po dag gis bsdus pa'i phyir mtshan ma smos so //
translated: The Heart Sutra's title is mentioned because the compilers of the extensive sutra compiled the heart sutra.

original: tshig gzhan gsum pa dag ni rgya gar yul pa'i slob dpon rnams kyis bshad pa rnam pa gsum yod de /
analyzed: tshig gzhan gsum pa dag ni rgya gar yul pa'i slob dpon rnams kyis bshad pa rnam pa gsum yod de /
translated: The three other phrases are the three explanations by Indian masters.

original: de la dang po ni slob dpon yang dag bden pas dngos po bdun gyi brjed byang byas pa las rnam pa gnyis su bshad de /
analyzed: de la dang po ni slob dpon yang dag bden pas dngos po bdun gyi brjed byang byas pa las rnam pa gnyis su bshad de /
translated: The first is the two explanations from the seven point outline by master Bhavyarasi.

original: dang po ni bstan bcos de kho na nyid bstan pa las /
analyzed: dang po ni bstan bcos de kho na nyid bstan pa las /
translated: The first is from the treatise teaching thatness:

original: sangs rgyas ni don rnam pa bcu dang ldan pa'i phyir mdo sde rnams kyi mgor mtshan rnam pa bcu las sangs rgyas zhes bya ba nyi tshe rnam par gzhag pa yin no zhes bshad de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas ni don rnam pa bcu dang ldan pa'i phyir mdo sde rnams kyi mgor mtshan rnam pa bcu las sangs rgyas zhes bya ba nyi tshe rnam par gzhag pa yin no zhes bshad de /
translated: Because the Buddha has ten meanings, in the beginning of the sutras he is called the Buddha and is defined by ten titles.

original: de'i phyir dngos po bdun gyi brjed byang nyid las ston pa chen po la mtshan rnam pa bcu mnga' na mdo sde las ci'i phyir gzhan dgu po dag mi smos par sangs rgyas zhes bya ba 'ba' zhig brjod ce na /
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po bdun gyi brjed byang nyid las ston pa chen po la mtshan rnam pa bcu mnga' na mdo sde las ci'i phyir gzhan dgu po dag mi smos par sangs rgyas zhes bya ba 'ba' zhig brjod ce na /
translated: Therefore, if the great teacher has ten different names in the manual of seven things, why does the sutra mention only the name Buddha and not the other nine?

original: don rnam pa bcu las de sad par mdzad pa lha'i rnga las mchog tu gyur pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang gis rtogs pa ma yin pa dang / mi shes pa gnyis dang bral ba dang / gnyis las shin tu 'das pa dang / padma lta bur gyur pa dang /
analyzed: don rnam pa bcu las de sad par mdzad pa lha'i rnga las mchog tu gyur pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang gis rtogs pa ma yin pa dang / mi shes pa gnyis dang bral ba dang / gnyis las shin tu 'das pa dang / padma lta bur gyur pa dang /
translated: The Buddha is called Buddha because he awakens to the ten topics, he is supreme among those who awaken, he is not realized through the power of another, he is free from the two ignorances, he is beyond the two, he is like a lotus,

original: rang bzhin gyi mngon par zhen pa mi mnga' ba dang / don rnam pa gsum phun sum tshogs pa dang / yon tan gsum dang ldan pa dang / dkon mchog gsum gyi ngo bo nyid dang ldan pa @48a * //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi mngon par zhen pa mi mnga' ba dang / don rnam pa gsum phun sum tshogs pa dang / yon tan gsum dang ldan pa dang / dkon mchog gsum gyi ngo bo nyid dang ldan pa @48a * //
translated: he is not attached to intrinsic reality, he is endowed with the three perfections, he is endowed with the three qualities, and he is endowed with the nature of the three jewels.

original: dang / bdag nyid thugs su chud cing gzhan dag kyang khong du chud par mdzad pa'o zhes 'byung ste rgya cher de nyid las bshad pa gnyis pa ni slob dpon yang dag bden pa nyid kyis dbu ma'i rig pa mu rnam pa bzhir phye nas /
analyzed: dang / bdag nyid thugs su chud cing gzhan dag kyang khong du chud par mdzad pa'o zhes 'byung ste rgya cher de nyid las bshad pa gnyis pa ni slob dpon yang dag bden pa nyid kyis dbu ma'i rig pa mu rnam pa bzhir phye nas /
translated: and he himself understands and causes others to understand.

original: mdo sde thams cad kyi mgor mtshan rnam pa gnyis cig car smos pa yin no zhes bshad de /
analyzed: mdo sde thams cad kyi mgor mtshan rnam pa gnyis cig car smos pa yin no zhes bshad de /
translated: The second explanation is that master paramārtha divides the middle way into four alternatives and explains that the two names are mentioned simultaneously at the beginning of all sūtras.

original: de'i phyir dngos po bdun gyi brjed byang las /
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po bdun gyi brjed byang las /
translated: Therefore the notes on the seven topics states:

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la mu rnam pa bzhi yod de /🔽sangs rgyas yin la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la mu rnam pa bzhi yod de / sangs rgyas yin la /
translated: The term Bhagavan Buddha has four alternatives.

original: bcom ldan 'das ma yin pa yod de /🔽de ni theg pa 'og ma pa gnyis po dag bden pa bzhi bsgoms pas /🔽lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa mngon sum du byas nas rang gi gnas pa la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma yin pa yod de / de ni theg pa 'og ma pa gnyis po dag bden pa bzhi bsgoms pas / lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa mngon sum du byas nas rang gi gnas pa la /
translated: There are buddhas who are not bhagavats.

original: bdag kyang sangs rgyas zhes bya ba'i ming thob ste /
analyzed: bdag kyang sangs rgyas zhes bya ba'i ming thob ste /
translated: Those of the two lower vehicles who directly perceive nirvāṇa without remainder through meditating on the four truths attain the name buddha for themselves in their own abodes.

original: spyad pa mi spyod pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das ni ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: spyad pa mi spyod pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das ni ma yin pa'o //
translated: The Blessed One is not so called because he does not practice the perfections.

original: bcom ldan 'das yin la sangs rgyas ma yin pa yang yod de /🔽de ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams yon tan gyi spyod pa spyad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das yin la sangs rgyas ma yin pa yang yod de / de ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams yon tan gyi spyod pa spyad pa'i phyir /
translated: There are those who are Blessed Ones but not Buddhas.

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya la /
translated: They are the Bodhisattvas, who are called Blessed Ones because they practice the perfections,🔽but are not called Buddhas

original: rgyu'i gnas skabs gnas shing shes rab yongs su ma rdzogs pas sangs rgyas zhes bya ba'i ming mi thob pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu'i gnas skabs gnas shing shes rab yongs su ma rdzogs pas sangs rgyas zhes bya ba'i ming mi thob pa'o //
translated: because they are in the causal stage, and their wisdom is not fully developed.

original: sangs rgyas kyang ma yin la bcom ldan 'das kyang ma yin pa yang yod de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyang ma yin la bcom ldan 'das kyang ma yin pa yang yod de /
translated: There are those who are neither Buddhas nor Blessed Ones.

original: de ni so so'i skye bo rnams yon tan mi 'grub pa'i phyir ni bcom ldan 'das ma yin la /
analyzed: de ni so so'i skye bo rnams yon tan mi 'grub pa'i phyir ni bcom ldan 'das ma yin la /
translated: They are the ordinary persons, who are not called Blessed Ones because they do not accomplish the perfections,

original: shes rab mi bsgom pa'i phyir ni sangs rgyas zhes mi brjod pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab mi bsgom pa'i phyir ni sangs rgyas zhes mi brjod pa'o //
translated: and are not called Buddhas because they do not cultivate wisdom.

original: sangs rgyas kyang yin la bcom ldan 'das kyang yin pa yang yod de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyang yin la bcom ldan 'das kyang yin pa yang yod de /
translated: There are those who are both Buddhas and Blessed Ones.

original: de ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams mkhyen pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ni sangs rgyas zhes brjod la /
analyzed: de ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams mkhyen pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ni sangs rgyas zhes brjod la /
translated: Because the Bhagavan Buddhas have fully completed omniscience, they are called Buddhas.

original: yon tan phun sum tshogs pa'i phyir ni bcom ldan 'das kyang yin zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: yon tan phun sum tshogs pa'i phyir ni bcom ldan 'das kyang yin zhes 'byung ste /
translated: Because they are endowed with perfect qualities, they are also called Bhagavans.

original: de bzhin du de nyid las gal te sangs rgyas zhes bya ba nyi tshe smos na ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du de nyid las gal te sangs rgyas zhes bya ba nyi tshe smos na ni /
translated: In the same text it says: If only the term “Buddha” were mentioned,

original: theg pa 'og ma pa gnyis kyang der bsdu bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: theg pa 'og ma pa gnyis kyang der bsdu bar 'gyur la /
translated: the two lower vehicles would be included.

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba 'ba' zhig smos na yang /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba 'ba' zhig smos na yang /
translated: If only the term “Bhagavan” were mentioned,

original: byang chub sems dpa' dang 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po dag kyang bsdu bar 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dang 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po dag kyang bsdu bar 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: bodhisattvas and universal emperors would be included.

original: gcig tu bsdus pa la de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gcig tu bsdus pa la de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Therefore, the term “Tathagata” is used to include all of them.

original: de'i phyir bla na med pa'i gnas bstan pa dang / tshig nges par 'grel pa'i mdo la sogs pa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir bla na med pa'i gnas bstan pa dang / tshig nges par 'grel pa'i mdo la sogs pa las /
translated: Thus, in the Sutra Teaching the Unsurpassed Support and the Sutra Definitely Elucidating the Noble Intention and so on,

original: sangs @48b rgyas bcom ldan 'das zhes smos pa yin no zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sangs @48b rgyas bcom ldan 'das zhes smos pa yin no zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: the term “Buddha Bhagavan” is used.

original: sde pa rnams kyi lta ba bshad pa'i brjed byang las kyang dngos po bdun gyi brjed byang las 'byung ba dang mthun par bshad do //
analyzed: sde pa rnams kyi lta ba bshad pa'i brjed byang las kyang dngos po bdun gyi brjed byang las 'byung ba dang mthun par bshad do //
translated: The Summary of the Views of the Buddhist Schools also explains in accordance with the Summary of the Seven Categories.

original: gnyis pa ni slob dpon po de le'u ci dang drang srong rdo rjes byas pa'i bstan bcos las /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni slob dpon po de le'u ci dang drang srong rdo rjes byas pa'i bstan bcos las /
translated: Second, the treatise composed by the master Bodhisattva and the sage Vajra states:

original: rgya gar yul pa'i dpe ma nor ba dang gtugs nas mdo thams cad kyi mgor bcom ldan 'das 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rgya gar yul pa'i dpe ma nor ba dang gtugs nas mdo thams cad kyi mgor bcom ldan 'das 'byung ngo //
translated: “Having consulted unmistaken Indian texts, the Blessed One appears at the beginning of all sūtras.

original: yul 'di pa'i mdo sde rnams kha cig las sangs rgyas zhes smos /
analyzed: yul 'di pa'i mdo sde rnams kha cig las sangs rgyas zhes smos /
translated: In the sūtras of this land, some refer to him as the Buddha,

original: kha cig las bcom ldan 'das smos /
analyzed: kha cig las bcom ldan 'das smos /
translated: some refer to him as the Blessed One,

original: kha cig las sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das zhes smos pa ni lo ts'a dag gis de ltar byas so zhes bshad do //
analyzed: kha cig las sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das zhes smos pa ni lo ts'a dag gis de ltar byas so zhes bshad do //
translated: and some refer to him as the Buddha, the Blessed One. This is because the translators did it that way.”

original: gsum pa ni slob dpon nye ba'i 'od kyis sangs rgyas kyi sa'i 'grel pa byas pa las /
analyzed: gsum pa ni slob dpon nye ba'i 'od kyis sangs rgyas kyi sa'i 'grel pa byas pa las /
translated: Third, the master Uddyota explains in his commentary on the Buddha Land Sūtra:

original: sangs rgyas ni yon tan rnam pa bcu dang ldan pa'i mtshan mnga' na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas ni yon tan rnam pa bcu dang ldan pa'i mtshan mnga' na /
translated: “The Buddha possesses the name of one endowed with ten kinds of qualities.

original: ci'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa brgyud pa dag gis mdo sde thams cad kyi mgor 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba smos /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa brgyud pa dag gis mdo sde thams cad kyi mgor 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba smos /
translated: Why do the lineages of the teachings of the Tathāgatas begin all sūtras with the words “Thus have I heard”?

original: 'di ltar mtshan nyid 'di 'jig rten kun gyis bkur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar mtshan nyid 'di 'jig rten kun gyis bkur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because this name is honored by the whole world.

original: mu stegs can rnams kyang so so nas rang gi ston pa la bcom ldan 'das zhes brjod pas so //
analyzed: mu stegs can rnams kyang so so nas rang gi ston pa la bcom ldan 'das zhes brjod pas so //
translated: Because the tīrthikas also call their own teachers “Bhagavān.”

original: gzhan yang mtshan 'di gcig gis yon tan thams cad bsdus pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gzhan yang mtshan 'di gcig gis yon tan thams cad bsdus pa yin gyi /
translated: Moreover, this name includes all the qualities of a Buddha.

original: mtshan gzhan dag na de lta ma yin pas /
analyzed: mtshan gzhan dag na de lta ma yin pas /
translated: The other names do not do this.

original: de'i phyir mdo sde thams cad kyi mgor mtshan 'di smos pa yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir mdo sde thams cad kyi mgor mtshan 'di smos pa yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: Therefore, this name is mentioned at the beginning of all sūtras.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las kyang /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las kyang /
translated: The commentary on the Perfection of Wisdom says:

original: sangs rgyas kyi sa'i 'grel pa dang don mthun par 'byung ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sa'i 'grel pa dang don mthun par 'byung ste /
translated: This agrees with the commentary on the stage of a buddha.

original: de'i phyir bam po gnyis pa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir bam po gnyis pa las /
translated: Therefore, the second chapter says:

original: bcom ldan 'das la mtshan 'di gcig mnga' bar zad dam /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la mtshan 'di gcig mnga' bar zad dam /
translated: Does the Bhagavān have only this name?

original: mtshan gzhan yang mnga'/
analyzed: mtshan gzhan yang mnga'/
translated: He also has other names.

original: smras pa / sangs rgyas kyi yon tan tshad med pas mtshan yang tshad med do //
analyzed: smras pa / sangs rgyas kyi yon tan tshad med pas mtshan yang tshad med do //
translated: Since the qualities of the Buddha are immeasurable, his marks are also immeasurable.

original: mtshan 'di phal cher smos pa ni mang po kun gyis shes pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: mtshan 'di phal cher smos pa ni mang po kun gyis shes pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: The reason why the majority of these marks are mentioned is because they are well known to many.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo dang sbyar na /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo dang sbyar na /
translated: When applied to the Mahāparinirvāṇa Sūtra,

original: bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
analyzed: bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
translated: there are two types of explanations:

original: sdig pa 'joms pa dang / yon tan drug dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: sdig pa 'joms pa dang / yon tan drug dang ldan pa'o //
translated: overcoming evil and possessing six qualities.

original: de dag gcig tu bsdus nas don rnam pa bdun du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag gcig tu bsdus nas don rnam pa bdun du 'gyur te /
translated: When those are combined into one, there are seven topics.

original: de'i phyir mdo sde de nyid las bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de'i phyir mdo sde de nyid las bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la /
translated: Therefore, in that sūtra itself, regarding the term Bhagavān,

original: bcom pa ni 'jig pa'o //
analyzed: bcom pa ni 'jig pa'o //
translated: bhag means “to destroy,”

original: ldan pa ni nyon mongs pa ste /
analyzed: ldan pa ni nyon mongs pa ste /
translated: and vāṃ means “afflictions.”

original: @49a * // nyon mongs pa ni 'jig pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das zhes bya'o //
analyzed: @49a * // nyon mongs pa ni 'jig pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das zhes bya'o //
translated: Because he destroys afflictions, he is called Bhagavān.
