original: gzhan yang dge ba'i chos mngon par grub par mdzad pa'i phyir dang / chos rnams kyi don legs par thugs su chud pa'i phyir dang / yon tan chen po mnga' bas dpe zla med pa'i phyir dang / grags pa chen po dang ldan pas phyogs bcu kun du khyab pa'i phyir dang /
analyzed: gzhan yang dge ba'i chos mngon par grub par mdzad pa'i phyir dang / chos rnams kyi don legs par thugs su chud pa'i phyir dang / yon tan chen po mnga' bas dpe zla med pa'i phyir dang / grags pa chen po dang ldan pas phyogs bcu kun du khyab pa'i phyir dang /
translated: Moreover, it is the bhaga of the Tathagata because he has accomplished the virtuous qualities, because he has understood the meaning of the dharmas, because he is incomparable due to possessing great qualities, because he is endowed with great fame that pervades the ten directions,

original: gtong ba chen pos rnam pa sna tshogs yongs su btang ba'i phyir dang / bskal pa tshad dang grangs med pa nas bud med kyi dbang po bor ba bsgrubs pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gtong ba chen pos rnam pa sna tshogs yongs su btang ba'i phyir dang / bskal pa tshad dang grangs med pa nas bud med kyi dbang po bor ba bsgrubs pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: because he has given up various things through great generosity, and because he has accomplished the abandonment of the female organ for countless eons.

original: yon tan drug po 'di dag kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa dang sbyar na don rnam pa bzhi dang ldan te /
analyzed: yon tan drug po 'di dag kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa dang sbyar na don rnam pa bzhi dang ldan te /
translated: These six qualities, when applied to the commentary on the perfection of wisdom, have four meanings.

original: de'i phyir de nyid las bha ga ni yon tan zhes bya ba na ni yod pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid las bha ga ni yon tan zhes bya ba na ni yod pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Therefore, in that very [text], bhaga is called quality and na is called existing.

original: 'di ni yon tan mnga' ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni yon tan mnga' ba zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called possessing qualities.

original: gzhan yang bha ga ni rnam par 'byed pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang bha ga ni rnam par 'byed pa'o //
translated: Moreover, bhaga means “to divide.🔽”

original: ban ni legs par spyod pa ste /
analyzed: ban ni legs par spyod pa ste /
translated: Ban means “to act well,”

original: spyi'i mtshan nyid dang / bye brag gi mtshan nyid legs par rnam par 'byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyi'i mtshan nyid dang / bye brag gi mtshan nyid legs par rnam par 'byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the general characteristic and the specific characteristic that are well divided.

original: gzhan yang bha ga ni sgra la bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang bha ga ni sgra la bya'o //
translated: Moreover, bhaga is to be taken as sound.

original: ban ni yod pa la bya ste /
analyzed: ban ni yod pa la bya ste /
translated: Ban is to be taken as existence.

original: 'di ni sgra dang grags pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sgra dang grags pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: This is endowed with sound and fame.

original: gzhan yang bha ga ni bcom pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang bha ga ni bcom pa'o //
translated: Moreover, bhaga is to be taken as “to conquer.🔽”

original: ban ni nus pa ste /
analyzed: ban ni nus pa ste /
translated: Ban is to be taken as “to be able.🔽”

original: dus gsum bcom par spyod pas na /
analyzed: dus gsum bcom par spyod pas na /
translated: Because it is the conqueror that acts to conquer the three times,

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya'o //
translated: it is called the Bhagavat.

original: theg pa 'og ma dag spangs pa yin par bag chags dang bcas pas /
analyzed: theg pa 'og ma dag spangs pa yin par bag chags dang bcas pas /
translated: It is the one that abandons the lower vehicles, together with their habitual tendencies.

original: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das zhes mi bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das zhes mi bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Therefore, it is not called the Bhagavat.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sa'i 'grel pa las bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba'i mtshan nyid 'di ni don rnam pa gnyis dang ldan te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sa'i 'grel pa las bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba'i mtshan nyid 'di ni don rnam pa gnyis dang ldan te /
translated: The commentary to the Buddha Land Sutra says that this name Bhagavat has two meanings:

original: yon tan drug dang ldan pa dang bdud bzhi bcom pa'o //
analyzed: yon tan drug dang ldan pa dang bdud bzhi bcom pa'o //
translated: it is endowed with six qualities and it has conquered the four demons.

original: de la yon tan drug dang ldan pa ni de nyid las bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba'i sgra ni don rnam pa drug gi rjes su 'jug ste /
analyzed: de la yon tan drug dang ldan pa ni de nyid las bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba'i sgra ni don rnam pa drug gi rjes su 'jug ste /
translated: The word “Bhagavat” is used in the sense of six meanings.

original: dang po ni rang dbang dang ldan pa'i don te /
analyzed: dang po ni rang dbang dang ldan pa'i don te /
translated: The first is the sense of independence,

original: nyon mongs pa rnams kyi dbang du ma gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams kyi dbang du ma gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he is not subject to the afflictions.

original: gnyis pa ni rab tu sbyangs pa'i don te /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni rab tu sbyangs pa'i don te /
translated: The second is the sense of being well purified,

original: ye shes me'i gdung bas yongs su sbyangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ye shes me'i gdung bas yongs su sbyangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he is purified by the fire of transcendent wisdom.

original: gsum pa ni shin tu mdzes pa'i don te /
analyzed: gsum pa ni shin tu mdzes pa'i don te /
translated: The third is the sense of being very beautiful,

original: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan mchog sum cu rtsa gnyis la sogs pas rab tu brgyan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan mchog sum cu rtsa gnyis la sogs pas rab tu brgyan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he is adorned with the thirty-two marks of a great being.

original: bzhi pa ni grags pa'i don te /
analyzed: bzhi pa ni grags pa'i don te /
translated: The fourth is the sense of being famous,

original: yon tan gyi khyad par thams @49b cad phun sum tshogs pas kun gyis shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yon tan gyi khyad par thams @49b cad phun sum tshogs pas kun gyis shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he is known by all because of his perfection of all the special qualities.

original: lnga pa ni dpal gyi don te /
analyzed: lnga pa ni dpal gyi don te /
translated: The fifth is the sense of glory,

original: 'jig rten thams cad kyis bsnyen bkur byed cing bsngags pa brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten thams cad kyis bsnyen bkur byed cing bsngags pa brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he is honored and praised by all the world.🔽The sixth is the sense of strength,🔽because he is not overcome by any of the hosts of demons and adversaries.

original: drug pa ni bdag nyid chen po'i don te /
analyzed: drug pa ni bdag nyid chen po'i don te /
translated: The sixth is the meaning of “great being.”

original: yon tan thams cad dang ldan pas sems can thams cad la rnam pa thams cad du phan pa dang / bde ba mdzad pa'i sbyor ba nyams pa mi mnga' ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: yon tan thams cad dang ldan pas sems can thams cad la rnam pa thams cad du phan pa dang / bde ba mdzad pa'i sbyor ba nyams pa mi mnga' ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because he possesses all good qualities, he is engaged in every way in the welfare and happiness of all sentient beings, and he is never deficient.

original: tshigs su bcad pa las ji skad du /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa las ji skad du /
translated: As it is said in a verse:🔽Self-mastery, sweet voice, beauty,

original: rang dbang rab dbyangs mdzes pa dang // grags dang dpal dang bdag nyid che //
analyzed: rang dbang rab dbyangs mdzes pa dang // grags dang dpal dang bdag nyid che //
translated: fame, glory, greatness,

original: 'di ltar don drug khyad par la //
analyzed: 'di ltar don drug khyad par la //
translated: In these six meanings,

original: bcom ldan zhes ni rig par bya ;🔽/ zhes gang bshad pa'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: bcom ldan zhes ni rig par bya ; / zhes gang bshad pa'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: the Bhagavān is to be understood.

original: de la bdud bzhi bcom pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de la bdud bzhi bcom pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here, the four māras are the māra of the afflictions,🔽the māra of the aggregates,🔽the māra of death, and the māra of the sons of the gods.

original: nyon mongs pa'i bdud ni rtsa ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa brgya nyi shu rtsa brgyad la /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i bdud ni rtsa ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa brgya nyi shu rtsa brgyad la /
translated: The māra of the afflictions is the one hundred and eight root and secondary afflictions.

original: nyon mongs pa'i bdud ces bya'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i bdud ces bya'o //
translated: This is called the māra of the afflictions.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i phung po lnga ni phung po'i bdud ces bya'o ;
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i phung po lnga ni phung po'i bdud ces bya'o ;
translated: The five contaminated aggregates are called the māra of the aggregates.🔽The māra of death is the one who has the power to destroy the life faculty of sentient beings.

original: / zag pa dang bcas pa'i phung po lnga mi rtag pa'i mtshan nyid rnams ni 'chi bdag gi bdud ces bya'o //
analyzed: / zag pa dang bcas pa'i phung po lnga mi rtag pa'i mtshan nyid rnams ni 'chi bdag gi bdud ces bya'o //
translated: The five aggregates with outflows, which have the characteristic of impermanence, are called the demon of the Lord of Death.

original: gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi gnas na lha'i bu dbang phyug la dbang thob pa dag ni lha'i bu'i bdud ces bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi gnas na lha'i bu dbang phyug la dbang thob pa dag ni lha'i bu'i bdud ces bya'o //
translated: The sons of gods who have attained mastery over the gods in the Heaven of Controlling Others' Emanations are called the demon of the sons of gods.

original: 'di ltar bzhi po de dag dge ba'i chos nyams par byed pa'i phyir bdud ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar bzhi po de dag dge ba'i chos nyams par byed pa'i phyir bdud ces bya'o //
translated: In this way, these four are called demons because they cause the degeneration of virtuous qualities.

original: bdud bzhi dang bral ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bdud bzhi dang bral ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ste /
translated: Because he is free from the four demons, he is called the Blessed One.

original: bdud bzhi bcom pa'i don phyis rnam par 'byed do //
analyzed: bdud bzhi bcom pa'i don phyis rnam par 'byed do //
translated: The meaning of having conquered the four demons will be analyzed later.

original: 'dir rgya gar yul pa'i sde snod gsum pa rnams kyi dgongs pa brtags na /
analyzed: 'dir rgya gar yul pa'i sde snod gsum pa rnams kyi dgongs pa brtags na /
translated: Here, if one examines the intention of the Tripiṭaka masters of India,

original: slob dpon tham bu chim la sogs pa ni bstan bcos de kho na nyid bstan pa la brten nas /
analyzed: slob dpon tham bu chim la sogs pa ni bstan bcos de kho na nyid bstan pa la brten nas /
translated: masters such as Thambuchaim, based on the treatise Teaching the Principles,

original: sangs rgyas zhes bya ba'i mtshan nyi tshe smos so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas zhes bya ba'i mtshan nyi tshe smos so //
translated: merely mention the name Buddha.

original: sde snod gsum pa yang dag bden pa ni bstan bcos de kho na nyid bstan pa dang / mu bzhi pa'i don la brten nas mtshan rnam pa gnyis smos so //
analyzed: sde snod gsum pa yang dag bden pa ni bstan bcos de kho na nyid bstan pa dang / mu bzhi pa'i don la brten nas mtshan rnam pa gnyis smos so //
translated: The Tripiṭaka master, the true truth, is mentioned by two names based on the meaning of the four alternatives.

original: sde snod gsum pa hyan tshang dang po de le'u ci gnyis ni so so nas bstan bcos re re la brten nas /
analyzed: sde snod gsum pa hyan tshang dang po de le'u ci gnyis ni so so nas bstan bcos re re la brten nas /
translated: The Tripiṭaka master, the first of the two chapters, is based on each treatise.

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba smos pa yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba smos pa yin no //
translated: The Blessed One is mentioned.

original: de ltar so so nas bshad pa yod kyang 'dir re zhig bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba las brtsams nas /
analyzed: de ltar so so nas bshad pa yod kyang 'dir re zhig bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba las brtsams nas /
translated: Although there are individual explanations like this, here for the time being, starting with the Blessed One,

original: brjod pa yod par gyur pa yin no //🔽rin po che sna bdun mchog tu @50a * //
analyzed: brjod pa yod par gyur pa yin no // rin po che sna bdun mchog tu @50a * //
translated: the expression has come to be.

original: 'bar ba bkod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rnam pa lnga las bzhi pa mdo sde gsungs pa'i gnas brtan pa zhes bya ba ston to //
analyzed: 'bar ba bkod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rnam pa lnga las bzhi pa mdo sde gsungs pa'i gnas brtan pa zhes bya ba ston to //
translated: The supreme blazing array of the seven precious substances and so on shows the fourth of the five aspects, the place where the sūtra is spoken.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: This also has two aspects.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa bzhugs pa'i gnas kyi bkod pa bstan pa dang bcom ldan 'das kyi yon tan gyi spyi dang khyad par rab tu bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa bzhugs pa'i gnas kyi bkod pa bstan pa dang bcom ldan 'das kyi yon tan gyi spyi dang khyad par rab tu bstan pa'o //
translated: The setting of the Tathagata's abode is shown, and the general and specific qualities of the Lord are revealed.

original: gnas pa bstan pa la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: gnas pa bstan pa la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The setting is shown in two ways:

original: bzhugs pa'i gnas gcig pa dang / tha dad pa'i bshad pa dang / mdo sde'i tshig gi don yang dag par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: bzhugs pa'i gnas gcig pa dang / tha dad pa'i bshad pa dang / mdo sde'i tshig gi don yang dag par bshad pa'o //
translated: the explanation of the single abode and the different abodes, and the correct explanation of the meaning of the words of the sutra.

original: de la bzhugs pa'i gnas gcig pa dang / tha dad pa'i bshad pa zhes bya ba dang / tshig nges par 'grel pa'i mdo dang sbyar na sprul pa'i sku'i de bzhin gshegs pas zhing yongs sum dag par 'di gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: de la bzhugs pa'i gnas gcig pa dang / tha dad pa'i bshad pa zhes bya ba dang / tshig nges par 'grel pa'i mdo dang sbyar na sprul pa'i sku'i de bzhin gshegs pas zhing yongs sum dag par 'di gsungs pa yin te /
translated: In this regard, the explanation of the single abode and the different abodes is connected with the sutra of the definitive commentary on the words, and is spoken by the Tathagata's emanation body in a completely pure realm.

original: de'i phyir tshig nges par 'grel pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: de'i phyir tshig nges par 'grel pa'i mdo las /
translated: Therefore, in the sutra of the definitive commentary on the words,🔽it says:

original: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa dus gcig na /
analyzed: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa dus gcig na /
translated: Thus have I heard at one time

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rgyal po'i khab bya rgod phung po'i ri la bzhugs te zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rgyal po'i khab bya rgod phung po'i ri la bzhugs te zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: the Lord Buddha was dwelling on Vulture Peak at Rajagriha.

original: zab mo rnam par grol ba'i mdo dang sbyar na zhing yongs su dag par bzhugs par 'byung bas dgongs pa zab mo nges par 'grel pa'i mdo las mthun no //
analyzed: zab mo rnam par grol ba'i mdo dang sbyar na zhing yongs su dag par bzhugs par 'byung bas dgongs pa zab mo nges par 'grel pa'i mdo las mthun no //
translated: If it is applied to the profound Vimukti-sutra, it is said that he resides in a pure land. Therefore, it is in accord with the Samdhinirmocana-sutra.

original: li yul gyi sde gsum pa'i dpe las ni sangs rgyas kyi spyod yul zhes 'byung gi / yongs su dag pa dang yongs su ma dag pa rnam par phye ba med pas gsung rab 'di dang sbyar na /
analyzed: li yul gyi sde gsum pa'i dpe las ni sangs rgyas kyi spyod yul zhes 'byung gi / yongs su dag pa dang yongs su ma dag pa rnam par phye ba med pas gsung rab 'di dang sbyar na /
translated: In the three-part text of Khotan, it says “the domain of the Buddha,” but since it does not distinguish between the pure and the impure, if it is applied to this scripture,

original: gcig tu nges par dpyad du yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gcig tu nges par dpyad du yang mi rung ngo //
translated: it is not suitable to be analyzed as being one-sidedly certain.

original: tshig nges par 'grel pa'i mdo dang / slob dpon yang dag bden pas byas pa'i 'grel pa'i dpe gnyis phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir tshad mar mi rung ste /
analyzed: tshig nges par 'grel pa'i mdo dang / slob dpon yang dag bden pas byas pa'i 'grel pa'i dpe gnyis phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir tshad mar mi rung ste /
translated: The two texts of the Nirvacana-sutra and the commentary composed by Master Samyedenpa are not valid because they contradict each other.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: tshig nges par 'grel pa'i mdo las ni /
analyzed: tshig nges par 'grel pa'i mdo las ni /
translated: In the Nirvacana-sutra,

original: rgyal po'i khab bya rgod kyi phung po'i ri la bzhugs te zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: rgyal po'i khab bya rgod kyi phung po'i ri la bzhugs te zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
translated: it says, “He resides in Rājagṛha on the Vulture Peak.”

original: 'grel pa de las ni yangs pa can gyi grong khyer ri dvags kyi rgyal po'i pho brang na bzhugs te /
analyzed: 'grel pa de las ni yangs pa can gyi grong khyer ri dvags kyi rgyal po'i pho brang na bzhugs te /
translated: The Commentary states that the Buddha was dwelling in the palace of the king of beasts in the city of Vaiśālī,

original: byang chub sems dpa' yang dag 'phags la bshad pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' yang dag 'phags la bshad pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: and that he was teaching the bodhisattva Samantabhadra.

original: gzhan yang tshig nges par 'grel pa'i mdo las ni gleng gzhi dang yang dag pa'i gzhung nyid dang / bstan pa gnas pa'i phyogs rdzogs par 'byung la /
analyzed: gzhan yang tshig nges par 'grel pa'i mdo las ni gleng gzhi dang yang dag pa'i gzhung nyid dang / bstan pa gnas pa'i phyogs rdzogs par 'byung la /
translated: Moreover, the Discourse Resolving the Meaning of the Tantra presents the setting, the actual text, and the section on the duration of the teachings in their entirety,

original: 'grel pa de nyid las @50b ni bar gyi le'u bzhi nyi tshe rnam par bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'grel pa de nyid las @50b ni bar gyi le'u bzhi nyi tshe rnam par bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: while the Commentary explains only the four intermediate chapters.

original: slob dpon yang dag bden pas mdo sde rnams kyi mtshan gyi brjed byang byas pa yang /
analyzed: slob dpon yang dag bden pas mdo sde rnams kyi mtshan gyi brjed byang byas pa yang /
translated: The master Sukeśa composed a list of the sūtras,

original: mdo sde'i 'grel ba dang mthun pa'i dang po dang tha ma'i phyogs gnyis rgya gar gyi dpe yang dag pa ni yin no //
analyzed: mdo sde'i 'grel ba dang mthun pa'i dang po dang tha ma'i phyogs gnyis rgya gar gyi dpe yang dag pa ni yin no //
translated: and the first and last sections of the list are in accord with the Commentary on the Sūtra and are based on authentic Indian texts.

original: sangs rgyas sa'i 'grel pa las ni rnam pa gsum yod de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas sa'i 'grel pa las ni rnam pa gsum yod de /
translated: The Commentary on the Buddha Ground presents three versions of the setting.

original: de'i phyir bam po dang po las bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar gzhal med khang chen po na bzhugs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bam po dang po las bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar gzhal med khang chen po na bzhugs te /
translated: Therefore, in the first chapter, it is said that the Bhagavat, dwelling in the great palace,

original: mdo sde 'di gsungs na longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / sprul pa'i sangs rgyas gnyis kyi zhing las zhing yongs su dag pa ni 'di gang gis yongs su bsdus /
analyzed: mdo sde 'di gsungs na longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / sprul pa'i sangs rgyas gnyis kyi zhing las zhing yongs su dag pa ni 'di gang gis yongs su bsdus /
translated: preaches this sutra. If the two buddha lands of the enjoyment body and the emanation body are pure lands, by what is this land purified?

original: mdo sde 'di gsungs pa'i sangs rgyas ni sku gang dag gis bsdus she na /
analyzed: mdo sde 'di gsungs pa'i sangs rgyas ni sku gang dag gis bsdus she na /
translated: By what bodies is the buddha who preaches this sutra subsumed?

original: kha cig las zhing 'di ni sprul pa'i zhing gis bsdus so //
analyzed: kha cig las zhing 'di ni sprul pa'i zhing gis bsdus so //
translated: Some say that this land is subsumed by the emanation land.

original: mdo sde 'di gsungs pa'i sangs rgyas kyang sprul ba'i sku yin te /
analyzed: mdo sde 'di gsungs pa'i sangs rgyas kyang sprul ba'i sku yin te /
translated: The buddha who preaches this sutra is also an emanation body.

original: nyan thos la sogs pa'i 'khor rnams zhing 'dir gnas nas /
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa'i 'khor rnams zhing 'dir gnas nas /
translated: The retinue of disciples and so on, dwelling in this land,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa las mngon sum du mdo sde 'di thos pas rab tu dga' zhing mngon par yid ches nas gus pas nyams su blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa las mngon sum du mdo sde 'di thos pas rab tu dga' zhing mngon par yid ches nas gus pas nyams su blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: directly hear this sutra from the Tathāgata, and because they are delighted and have perfect faith, they practice it with respect.

original: sangs rgyas kyi thugs las snang pa'i phyir khams gsum las 'das pa shin tu rnam par dag pa'i rnam par rig pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi thugs las snang pa'i phyir khams gsum las 'das pa shin tu rnam par dag pa'i rnam par rig pa'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: Because it appears from the mind of the Buddha, it is characterized by a very pure cognition that transcends the three realms.

original: chos khyad par can gsungs pa dag gis sa'i mdun rol gyi sems can gyi rnam pa rnams btul nas mos pa bskyed de /
analyzed: chos khyad par can gsungs pa dag gis sa'i mdun rol gyi sems can gyi rnam pa rnams btul nas mos pa bskyed de /
translated: Having subdued the forms of sentient beings in front of the stage by means of the special teachings, he causes them to generate interest

original: de'i rgyu sgrub tu gzhug par mdzad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i rgyu sgrub tu gzhug par mdzad pa'i phyir /
translated: and he causes them to accomplish the causes of that.

original: re zhig sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa dang / sprul pa'i sku'i khyad par can sprul nas byin gyi rlabs kyis de dag re zhig mthong ba nyid du mdzad do //
analyzed: re zhig sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa dang / sprul pa'i sku'i khyad par can sprul nas byin gyi rlabs kyis de dag re zhig mthong ba nyid du mdzad do //
translated: Therefore, having emanated the special enjoyment body and the completely pure buddha field, he causes them to see that by his blessing.

original: de lta ma yin na nyan thos la sogs pa'i 'khor thams cad kyis mthong bar gyur pa mi rigs so zhe'o //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na nyan thos la sogs pa'i 'khor thams cad kyis mthong bar gyur pa mi rigs so zhe'o //
translated: Otherwise, it would be illogical for the entire retinue of śrāvakas and so on to see it.

original: kha cig las zhing 'di ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i zhing gis bsdus so //
analyzed: kha cig las zhing 'di ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i zhing gis bsdus so //
translated: Some say that this field is subsumed by the enjoyment field.

original: mdo sde 'di gsungs pa'i sangs rgyas kyang longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku yin te /
analyzed: mdo sde 'di gsungs pa'i sangs rgyas kyang longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku yin te /
translated: The Buddha who taught this sūtra is also the enjoyment body.

original: zhing yongs su dag pa'i de'i tshad dang mtha' med pa'i phyir dang lam dang bzhon pa dang / sgo la sogs pa yang dag pa'i yon tan yin pa'i phyir dang sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa 'di lta bu la /
analyzed: zhing yongs su dag pa'i de'i tshad dang mtha' med pa'i phyir dang lam dang bzhon pa dang / sgo la sogs pa yang dag pa'i yon tan yin pa'i phyir dang sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa 'di lta bu la /
translated: Because the measure and limit of that pure realm is limitless, and because the path, vehicle, door, and so on are perfect qualities, this is the pure buddha realm.

original: yongs su longs spyod pa ni gcig tu gya nom pa dang / gcig tu bde ba dang / @51a * //
analyzed: yongs su longs spyod pa ni gcig tu gya nom pa dang / gcig tu bde ba dang / @51a * //
translated: Because the measure and limit of that pure field is limitless, because the path, vehicle, door and so on are perfect qualities and because the enjoyment of such a pure buddha field is exclusively sublime, exclusively blissful,🔽exclusively free of misdeeds, exclusively obtained through power and exclusively explained in other sūtras and because the Sūtra Unravelling the Intended Meaning states:

original: gcig tu kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / gcig tu dbang thob pa dang / gzhan las bshad pa'i phyir dang / dgongs pa zab mo nges par 'grel pa'i mdo las sa gsum pa yan chad kyis der skye bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa'i phyir dang /
analyzed: gcig tu kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / gcig tu dbang thob pa dang / gzhan las bshad pa'i phyir dang / dgongs pa zab mo nges par 'grel pa'i mdo las sa gsum pa yan chad kyis der skye bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa'i phyir dang /
translated: Those on the third ground and above are born there.

original: mdo sde 'di gsungs pa'i sangs rgyas 'og nas bshad pa'i yon tan yang dag pa nyi shu rtsa gcig dang ldan pa'i phyir dang / mdo sde gzhan gsungs pa'i tshe sangs rgyas kyi yon tan 'di lta bu ma bkod pa'i phyir ro //🔽gal te re zhig 'di lta bu'i zhing yongs su dag pa dang / 'di lta bu'i sku gya nom pa sprul nas 'khor rnams byin gyis brlabs te /
analyzed: mdo sde 'di gsungs pa'i sangs rgyas 'og nas bshad pa'i yon tan yang dag pa nyi shu rtsa gcig dang ldan pa'i phyir dang / mdo sde gzhan gsungs pa'i tshe sangs rgyas kyi yon tan 'di lta bu ma bkod pa'i phyir ro // gal te re zhig 'di lta bu'i zhing yongs su dag pa dang / 'di lta bu'i sku gya nom pa sprul nas 'khor rnams byin gyis brlabs te /
translated: because the Buddha who taught this sutra possesses twenty one true qualities that will be explained below, and because when he taught other sutras, he did not set forth such qualities of the Buddha.

original: mthong bar mdzad pa yin na /
analyzed: mthong bar mdzad pa yin na /
translated: If he emanated such a pure land and such a sublime body and empowered the retinue to see it,

original: mdo sde gzhan dag bzhin du gsal bar rab tu dbye bar rigs na /
analyzed: mdo sde gzhan dag bzhin du gsal bar rab tu dbye bar rigs na /
translated: then it is reasonable that he would clearly distinguish it, as in other sutras.

original: bshad pa de lta bu yang med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bshad pa de lta bu yang med pa'i phyir /
translated: But he did not explain it in that way.

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i zhing dang longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku yin par mngon no //
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i zhing dang longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku yin par mngon no //
translated: Therefore it is evident that it is the land of the body of perfect enjoyment and the body of perfect enjoyment.

original: nyan thos la sogs pa'i 'khor ni sangs rgyas kyi sprul pa yin no //
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa'i 'khor ni sangs rgyas kyi sprul pa yin no //
translated: The retinue of sravakas and so on is the emanation of the Buddha.

original: yang na byang chub sems dpa' rnams lus de lta bur bsgyur nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing dang chos bshad pa'i 'khor mdzes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na byang chub sems dpa' rnams lus de lta bur bsgyur nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing dang chos bshad pa'i 'khor mdzes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Or else, the bodhisattvas transform their bodies in that way in order to beautify the buddha-field and the assembly of the Dharma-expounding retinue.

original: gal te de ltar na 'di ni sa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis mthong zhing thos par 'gyur ba yin na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar na 'di ni sa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis mthong zhing thos par 'gyur ba yin na /
translated: If that is so, then this buddha-field would be seen and heard by the bodhisattvas dwelling on the stages.

original: ci'i phyir sprul pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'dir bsdus shing gnas par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sprul pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'dir bsdus shing gnas par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Why then would they gather in this emanated buddha-field?

original: chos brgyud pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis thams cad mkhyen ba dang / de bzhugs nas 'jig rten pa'i chos thams cad las 'das par rab tu bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos brgyud pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis thams cad mkhyen ba dang / de bzhugs nas 'jig rten pa'i chos thams cad las 'das par rab tu bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the bodhisattvas of the lineage of the Dharma would see the omniscience of the Buddha and, dwelling there, would be taught the transcendence of all worldly dharmas.

original: de ltar bstan pa yang gdul bar bya ba rnams la mos pa bskyed pa'i phyir dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa de lta bur skyes nas /
analyzed: de ltar bstan pa yang gdul bar bya ba rnams la mos pa bskyed pa'i phyir dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa de lta bur skyes nas /
translated: And that teaching would generate devotion in those to be trained, and having been born in that pure buddha-field,

original: sangs rgyas de lta bur mthong ba dang / chos de lta bu thos par smon lam 'debs shing /
analyzed: sangs rgyas de lta bur mthong ba dang / chos de lta bu thos par smon lam 'debs shing /
translated: They pray to see such a Buddha and to hear such a Dharma.

original: de'i rgyu bsgrub tu gzhug pa'i phyir dang / rgya chen po la mos pa'i sems can dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams mgu ba khyad par can rab tu bskyed pa'i phyir dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa la mos pa rnams lhag pa'i bsam pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rgyu bsgrub tu gzhug pa'i phyir dang / rgya chen po la mos pa'i sems can dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams mgu ba khyad par can rab tu bskyed pa'i phyir dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa la mos pa rnams lhag pa'i bsam pa'o //
translated: In order to make them practice its cause, in order to generate a special joy in beings and bodhisattvas who aspire to the vast, and in order to generate a special resolve in those who aspire to the superior intention,

original: khams bstan par bya ba'i phyir 'dir bsdus shing gnas par @51b gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: khams bstan par bya ba'i phyir 'dir bsdus shing gnas par @51b gyur pa yin no //
translated: they gather here and remain here in order to teach the elements.

original: gzhan yang chos khyad par can yin pas 'dir thos par 'os te /
analyzed: gzhan yang chos khyad par can yin pas 'dir thos par 'os te /
translated: Moreover, since it is a special Dharma, it is worthy to be heard here.

original: 'on kyang gnas mchog tu gyur pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang gnas mchog tu gyur pa ni ma yin no //
translated: However, it is not the supreme abode.

original: sprul pa'i sku'i mtshan nyid ni rags pas der gsung par mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sprul pa'i sku'i mtshan nyid ni rags pas der gsung par mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The characteristic of the emanation body is that it is coarse, so it is not suitable to speak there.

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku longs spyod rdzogs pa'i zhing du bzhugs nas /
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku longs spyod rdzogs pa'i zhing du bzhugs nas /
translated: The enjoyment body abides in the enjoyment realm.

original: sa dang po yan chad kyi byang chub sems dpa' rnams la gsungs pas 'dir chos brgyud pa dag gis bsdus shing gnas par gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: sa dang po yan chad kyi byang chub sems dpa' rnams la gsungs pas 'dir chos brgyud pa dag gis bsdus shing gnas par gyur pa yin no //
translated: Since it was taught to the bodhisattvas on the first ground and above, here it was compiled and preserved by the lineage of the Dharma.

original: gal te de lta na ci'i phyir der gsungs pa'i chos zhes ma bstan /
analyzed: gal te de lta na ci'i phyir der gsungs pa'i chos zhes ma bstan /
translated: If that is so, why was it not taught as the Dharma that was taught there?

original: gal te gnas dang 'chad pa po ma bstan na /
analyzed: gal te gnas dang 'chad pa po ma bstan na /
translated: If the place and the teacher are not taught,

original: chos 'di gang du gang gis bshad pa mi shes pas thams cad the tshom skye ba'i phyir zhib tu bshad dgos she na /
analyzed: chos 'di gang du gang gis bshad pa mi shes pas thams cad the tshom skye ba'i phyir zhib tu bshad dgos she na /
translated: since it is not known where and by whom this Dharma was explained, it is necessary to explain it in detail because everyone will have doubts.

original: yang dag pa'i don du de bzhin gshegs pa sh'akya thub pas mdo sde 'di gsungs pa'i tshe /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i don du de bzhin gshegs pa sh'akya thub pas mdo sde 'di gsungs pa'i tshe /
translated: In reality, when the Tathāgata Śākyamuni taught this sūtra,

original: sa'i mdun rol gyi 'khor rnams kyis sprul pa'i sku zhing yangs su ma dag pa 'dir bzhugs nas /
analyzed: sa'i mdun rol gyi 'khor rnams kyis sprul pa'i sku zhing yangs su ma dag pa 'dir bzhugs nas /
translated: the retinue in front of the earth saw the nirmāṇakāya residing in this impure vast realm

original: de dag la chos bshad par mthong la /
analyzed: de dag la chos bshad par mthong la /
translated: and teaching the Dharma to them.

original: sa la gnas pa'i 'khor rnams kyis ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bzhugs nas de dag la chos bshad par mthong ste /
analyzed: sa la gnas pa'i 'khor rnams kyis ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bzhugs nas de dag la chos bshad par mthong ste /
translated: The retinue abiding on the stages see the enjoyment body residing in a completely pure buddhafield and teaching the dharma to them.

original: thos par mtshungs kyang lta ba tha dad do //
analyzed: thos par mtshungs kyang lta ba tha dad do //
translated: Although they hear the same dharma, their views are different.

original: thams cad dga' ba dang / mngon par yid ches pa dang / len cing spyod par 'dra yang shes pa zab mi zab dang / spyod pa ni tha dad do //
analyzed: thams cad dga' ba dang / mngon par yid ches pa dang / len cing spyod par 'dra yang shes pa zab mi zab dang / spyod pa ni tha dad do //
translated: Although they are all delighted, have complete confidence, accept and practice the dharma, their understanding is profound or shallow and their practice is different.

original: chos brgyud pa dag gis sems can mchog thos pas brtson 'grus kyis de'i rgyu spyad nas /
analyzed: chos brgyud pa dag gis sems can mchog thos pas brtson 'grus kyis de'i rgyu spyad nas /
translated: Through the lineage of the dharma, supreme beings hear it, practice its causes with diligence,🔽and make aspirations to be born in a completely pure buddhafield and to manifest many of the qualities of a buddha.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par skye bar smon lam 'debs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi yon tan du ma mngon du bya ba'i phyir khyad par can dag gis mthong ba'i dbang du mdzad nas bsdus bas na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par skye bar smon lam 'debs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi yon tan du ma mngon du bya ba'i phyir khyad par can dag gis mthong ba'i dbang du mdzad nas bsdus bas na /
translated: For the sake of those with special aspirations, the Buddha taught the sutra in a condensed form.

original: bcom ldan 'das gzhal med khang chen po na bzhugs te zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gzhal med khang chen po na bzhugs te zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The Bhagavat resided in a great immeasurable mansion...

original: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan rgya cher bstan pa'i bar du gsungs so zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan rgya cher bstan pa'i bar du gsungs so zhes 'byung ste /
translated: In the same way, it is said that the qualities of the Tathagata are taught in detail.

original: 'dir mdo sde 'di yang dag pa'i don dang sbyar te bshad na yang 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: 'dir mdo sde 'di yang dag pa'i don dang sbyar te bshad na yang 'gal ba med do //
translated: Here, if this sutra is explained in accordance with the true meaning, there is no contradiction.

original: mdo sde 'di'i dpe rnams mthun mi mthun pa'i bshad pa ni gong du bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: mdo sde 'di'i dpe rnams mthun mi mthun pa'i bshad pa ni gong du bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: The explanations of the similes in this sutra being consistent or not are as explained above.

original: da ni gnas kyi don yang dag par bshad pa ston te /
analyzed: da ni gnas kyi don yang dag par bshad pa ston te /
translated: Now, the correct explanation of the meaning of the abode is taught.

original: gnas kyi don bstan pa de yang /🔽dam pa'i @52a * //
analyzed: gnas kyi don bstan pa de yang / dam pa'i @52a * //
translated: That teaching of the meaning of the abode

original: chos padma dkar po'i mdo las /
analyzed: chos padma dkar po'i mdo las /
translated: is in the Sutra of the White Lotus of the True Dharma.

original: chos khyad par can du bstan pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das gnas khyad par can na bzhugs so zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: chos khyad par can du bstan pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das gnas khyad par can na bzhugs so zhes gsungs so //
translated: In order to teach the special Dharma, it is said that the Blessed One abides in a special abode.

original: dkon mchog brtsegs pa'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: dkon mchog brtsegs pa'i mdo las kyang /
translated: And in the Sutra of the Heaped Jewels,

original: sems can bsod nams can dag 'dir smos par bya ba'i phyir dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba 'phel bar bya ba'i phyir sngar bzhugs pa'i gnas bstan pa yin no zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: sems can bsod nams can dag 'dir smos par bya ba'i phyir dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba 'phel bar bya ba'i phyir sngar bzhugs pa'i gnas bstan pa yin no zhes gsungs te /
translated: it is said that in order to mention those with merit here and to increase their roots of virtue, the previously-abiding abode is taught.

original: yon tan byin gyis rdo rje gcod pa'i 'grel pa byas pa las kyang 'di dang mthun par bshad do //
analyzed: yon tan byin gyis rdo rje gcod pa'i 'grel pa byas pa las kyang 'di dang mthun par bshad do //
translated: And the commentary on the Diamond Cutter composed by Gunaprabha explains in agreement with this.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las dus dang phyogs dang gang zag smos pa ni sems can rab tu dang ba bskyed pa'i phyir zhes 'byung bas gnas bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las dus dang phyogs dang gang zag smos pa ni sems can rab tu dang ba bskyed pa'i phyir zhes 'byung bas gnas bstan pa yin no //
translated: The explanation of the perfection of wisdom sutra states that the mention of time, direction, and person is for the purpose of generating faith in sentient beings.

original: de la dus ni mdo sde gsungs pa'i dus so //🔽phyogs ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la dus ni mdo sde gsungs pa'i dus so // phyogs ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Thus, time is the time when the sutra was spoken.

original: mdo sde gsungs pa'i gnas so //
analyzed: mdo sde gsungs pa'i gnas so //
translated: Direction is the place where the sutra was spoken.

original: gang zag ni chos nyan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gang zag ni chos nyan pa'i phyir te /
translated: Person is for listening to the dharma.

original: nyan thos la sogs pa'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: It is said that it is for sravakas and so on.

original: gzhan yang de nyid las rnam pa gsum gyis bzhugs pa'i don bstan te /
analyzed: gzhan yang de nyid las rnam pa gsum gyis bzhugs pa'i don bstan te /
translated: Moreover, that same text explains the meaning of abiding in three ways:

original: spyod lam gyis bzhugs pa dang / 'phags pa'i gnas pas bzhugs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi gnas pas bzhugs pa ste /
analyzed: spyod lam gyis bzhugs pa dang / 'phags pa'i gnas pas bzhugs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi gnas pas bzhugs pa ste /
translated: abiding by conduct, abiding by the noble abodes and abiding by the buddha abodes.

original: de'i phyir de nyid las bzhugs pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid las bzhugs pa ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: Therefore, that same text asks, What is abiding?

original: sku'i lam rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: sku'i lam rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: There are four aspects of the body:

original: bzhugs pa dang gzims pa dang / gshegs pa dang / bzhengs pa'i phyir yang bzhugs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bzhugs pa dang gzims pa dang / gshegs pa dang / bzhengs pa'i phyir yang bzhugs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: He is called “abiding” because he is seated, lying down, walking, or standing.

original: gzhan yang gnas pa rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: gzhan yang gnas pa rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: Moreover, there are three kinds of abiding:

original: dang po ni lha'i gnas pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dang po ni lha'i gnas pa 'di lta ste /
translated: The first is the abiding of the gods, which is to say,

original: 'dod pa'i khams kyi lha drug po dag ni gnas pa'i chos so //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams kyi lha drug po dag ni gnas pa'i chos so //
translated: the six gods of the desire realm are abiding in the Dharma.

original: gnyis pa ni tshangs pa'i gnas pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni tshangs pa'i gnas pa 'di lta ste /
translated: The second is the abiding of Brahmā, which is to say,

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i lha rnams kyi gnas pa'i chos so //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i lha rnams kyi gnas pa'i chos so //
translated: the gods of the form and formless realms are abiding in the Dharma.

original: gsum pa ni 'phags pa'i gnas pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gsum pa ni 'phags pa'i gnas pa 'di lta ste /
translated: The third is the abiding of the noble ones, which is to say,

original: sangs rgyas dang rang sangs rgyas dang / dgra bcom pa rnams kyi gnas pa'i chos te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang rang sangs rgyas dang / dgra bcom pa rnams kyi gnas pa'i chos te /
translated: the buddhas, the pratyekabuddhas, and the arhats are abiding in the Dharma.

original: gnas pa rnam pa gsum las de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni 'phags pa'i gnas pa la bzhugs so //
analyzed: gnas pa rnam pa gsum las de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni 'phags pa'i gnas pa la bzhugs so //
translated: Among these three kinds of abiding, the tathāgatas abide in the abiding of the noble ones.

original: gzhan yang sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang dge ba'i sems kyi dngos po gsum ni lha'i gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang dge ba'i sems kyi dngos po gsum ni lha'i gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Moreover, the three things of generosity, morality, and virtuous mind are called the abiding of the gods.

original: tshad med pa'i sems bzhi ni tshangs pa'i gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tshad med pa'i sems bzhi ni tshangs pa'i gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The four boundless states are called the “abodes of the Brahmä gods.”

original: stong pa dang mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni 'phags pa'i gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: stong pa dang mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni 'phags pa'i gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The concentrations on emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness are called the “abodes of the noble ones.”

original: gnas pa las sangs @52b rgyas kyi gnas pa rnam pa bzhir 'gyur te /
analyzed: gnas pa las sangs @52b rgyas kyi gnas pa rnam pa bzhir 'gyur te /
translated: From the abodes, there are four kinds of abodes of the buddhas.

original: lha dang tshangs pa dang / 'phags pa dang sangs rgyas kyi gnas pa ste /
analyzed: lha dang tshangs pa dang / 'phags pa dang sangs rgyas kyi gnas pa ste /
translated: They are the abodes of the gods, the Brahmä gods, the noble ones, and the buddhas.

original: gnas pa gsum ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: gnas pa gsum ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The first three abodes are as above.

original: de la sangs rgyas kyi gnas pa ni dpa' bar 'gro ba la sogs pa sangs rgyas rnams kyi ting nge 'dzin tshad med pa dang / stobs bcu dang mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / ma 'dres pa'i chos bco brgyad dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la sogs pa shes rab sna tshogs pa dang chos kyi sde snod brgyad khri bzhi stong sems can sgrol ba'i sgo rnams dang 'di la sogs pa yon tan rnam pa sna tshogs ni sangs rgyas gnas par bya ba yin pas /
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas kyi gnas pa ni dpa' bar 'gro ba la sogs pa sangs rgyas rnams kyi ting nge 'dzin tshad med pa dang / stobs bcu dang mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / ma 'dres pa'i chos bco brgyad dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la sogs pa shes rab sna tshogs pa dang chos kyi sde snod brgyad khri bzhi stong sems can sgrol ba'i sgo rnams dang 'di la sogs pa yon tan rnam pa sna tshogs ni sangs rgyas gnas par bya ba yin pas /
translated: Buddha's abiding is the immeasurable concentrations of the buddhas such as the heroic stride, the ten powers, the four fearlessnesses, the eighteen distinctive qualities, the knowledge of all aspects, and so on, the various wisdoms, the eighty-four thousand collections of dharma, the doors for liberating sentient beings, and so on.

original: sangs rgyas der bzhugs pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi gnas pa zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas der bzhugs pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi gnas pa zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ba'o //
translated: Since these various qualities are the abiding of the Buddha, they are called the abiding of the Buddha because the Buddha abides in them.

original: slob dpon yang dag bden pas dngos po bdun gyi brjed byang byas pa la ni don rnam pa brgyad kyis bzhugs par bshad de /
analyzed: slob dpon yang dag bden pas dngos po bdun gyi brjed byang byas pa la ni don rnam pa brgyad kyis bzhugs par bshad de /
translated: Master Paramartha's notes on the seven topics explain abiding in eight topics.

original: de la spyod yul la bzhugs pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la spyod yul la bzhugs pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Abiding in the domain is as follows.

original: yul chen po bcu drug pa thams cad kyis yo byad rnam pa bzhis mchod pa byas pa'i gnas rnams ni de bzhin gshegs pas bgrod pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir spyod yul zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yul chen po bcu drug pa thams cad kyis yo byad rnam pa bzhis mchod pa byas pa'i gnas rnams ni de bzhin gshegs pas bgrod pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir spyod yul zhes bya'o //
translated: The places where the sixteen great countries make offerings with the four kinds of offerings are called “fields of activity” because they are the places where the Tathagata goes.

original: rten gyi gnas su bzhugs pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rten gyi gnas su bzhugs pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The Buddha’s dwelling in the place of support is as follows.

original: dge 'dun gyi kun dga' ra ba thams cad dang / bya rgod phung po'i ri dang ; ka lan dka'i tshal la sogs pa'i gnas na bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi kun dga' ra ba thams cad dang / bya rgod phung po'i ri dang ; ka lan dka'i tshal la sogs pa'i gnas na bzhugs pa'o //
translated: He dwells in all the monasteries of the Sangha, on Vulture Peak, in the Kalanda Grove, and so forth.

original: spyod lam gyis bzhugs pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: spyod lam gyis bzhugs pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The Buddha’s dwelling in his conduct is as follows.

original: gshegs pa dang / bzhengs pa dang / bzhugs pa dang / gzims pa'i spyod lam gyis bzhugs so //
analyzed: gshegs pa dang / bzhengs pa dang / bzhugs pa dang / gzims pa'i spyod lam gyis bzhugs so //
translated: He dwells in the conduct of going, standing, sitting, and lying down.

original: sku tshe ma spangs pa'i bzhugs ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: sku tshe ma spangs pa'i bzhugs ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The Buddha’s dwelling in not abandoning his life is as follows.

original: mngon sum du bzhugs shing mya ngan las ma 'das pa dang / tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin pa la sogs pa cha rnam pa lnga'i chos kyi sku la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: mngon sum du bzhugs shing mya ngan las ma 'das pa dang / tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin pa la sogs pa cha rnam pa lnga'i chos kyi sku la gnas pa'o //
translated: He dwells in the Dharma body, which is the five aspects of morality, samadhi, and so forth, and he does not pass into nirvana.

original: tshangs pa'i bzhugs pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: tshangs pa'i bzhugs pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The abode of Brahma is as follows:

original: tshad med pa rnam pa bzhi'i sems te /
analyzed: tshad med pa rnam pa bzhi'i sems te /
translated: It is the mind of the four immeasurables.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni thugs rje chen po'i sems la gnas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni thugs rje chen po'i sems la gnas pa'i phyir /
translated: The Tathagata abides in the mind of great compassion.

original: tshangs pa'i gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the abode of Brahma.

original: lha'i bzhugs pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: lha'i bzhugs pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The abode of the gods is as follows:

original: bsam gtan bzhi po rnams te /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi po rnams te /
translated: It is the four dhyanas.

original: bsam gtan bzhi po mchog tu gyur pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa ni de la gnas so //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi po mchog tu gyur pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa ni de la gnas so //
translated: The Tathagata, who is supreme among the four dhyanas, abides in them.

original: 'phags pa'i bzhugs pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bzhugs pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The abode of the noble ones is as follows:

original: rnam par thar pa'o //🔽rnam par thar pa yang @53a * //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'o // rnam par thar pa yang @53a * //
translated: It is the liberations.

original: rnam pa bzhi yod do /
analyzed: rnam pa bzhi yod do /
translated: There are four types of liberation.

original: dang po ni sems med pa'i ting nge 'dzin du bzhugs pa ste /
analyzed: dang po ni sems med pa'i ting nge 'dzin du bzhugs pa ste /
translated: The first is abiding in the samadhi of no-mind,

original: re zhig sdug bsngal bkag pa'o //
analyzed: re zhig sdug bsngal bkag pa'o //
translated: which is the cessation of suffering.

original: gnyis pa ni stong pa nyid ting nge 'dzin du bzhugs pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni stong pa nyid ting nge 'dzin du bzhugs pa ste /
translated: The second is abiding in the samadhi of emptiness,

original: lta ba rnams bkag pa'o //
analyzed: lta ba rnams bkag pa'o //
translated: which is the cessation of views.

original: gsum pa smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin du bzhugs pa ste ;
analyzed: gsum pa smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin du bzhugs pa ste ;
translated: The third is abiding in the samadhi of wishlessness,

original: 'dod chags bkag pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags bkag pa'o //
translated: which is the cessation of attachment.

original: bzhi pa ni mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin du bzhugs pa ste /
analyzed: bzhi pa ni mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin du bzhugs pa ste /
translated: The fourth is the abiding in the samadhi of signlessness.

original: skur pa rnam pa bzhi bkag pa'o //
analyzed: skur pa rnam pa bzhi bkag pa'o //
translated: These are the four kinds of denigration.

original: bcom ldan 'das ni mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa /
translated: The Lord abides in the samadhi of signlessness.

original: sems kyi nyon mongs pa gtan nas zad pa'o //
analyzed: sems kyi nyon mongs pa gtan nas zad pa'o //
translated: He has completely exhausted the afflictions of the mind.

original: sangs rgyas kyi bzhugs pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi bzhugs pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The abiding of the Buddha is as follows:

original: sangs rgyas ni skye ba med pa 'gag pa med pa gnas pa med pa'i chos la gnas pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas ni skye ba med pa 'gag pa med pa gnas pa med pa'i chos la gnas pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because the Buddha abides in the Dharma of non-arising, non-ceasing, and non-abiding, it is called the abiding of the Buddha.

original: sku gsum dang sbyar te rnam par dbye na /🔽gnas pa snga ma gsum ni sprul pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: sku gsum dang sbyar te rnam par dbye na / gnas pa snga ma gsum ni sprul pa'i sku'o //
translated: When classified in terms of the three bodies,🔽the first three abidings are the emanation body.

original: bar ma gsum ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: bar ma gsum ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'o //
translated: The three in the middle are the enjoyment body.

original: tha ma gnyis ni chos kyi sku'o //
analyzed: tha ma gnyis ni chos kyi sku'o //
translated: The last two are the Dharma body.

original: de la sku snga ma gnyis ni gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de la sku snga ma gnyis ni gnas pa'o //
translated: Among them, the first two bodies are the abidings.

original: phyi ma chos kyi sku ni gnas par bya ba ste /
analyzed: phyi ma chos kyi sku ni gnas par bya ba ste /
translated: The last Dharma body is what is to be abided in.

original: mdo sde thams cad phal cher gnas pa brgyad po de dag las snga ma gnyis po spyod yul la bzhugs pas ni khyim pa rnams 'dul bar mdzad do //
analyzed: mdo sde thams cad phal cher gnas pa brgyad po de dag las snga ma gnyis po spyod yul la bzhugs pas ni khyim pa rnams 'dul bar mdzad do //
translated: Most of the sutras are contained in these eight topics. The first two topics, the subject matter and the purpose, are for the sake of disciplining householders.

original: rten gyi gnas su bzhugs pas ni rab tu byung ba rnams 'dul bar mdzad do zhes gsungs te /🔽spyi dang bye brag gi gnas gnyis smos pa yin no zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rten gyi gnas su bzhugs pas ni rab tu byung ba rnams 'dul bar mdzad do zhes gsungs te / spyi dang bye brag gi gnas gnyis smos pa yin no zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: The remaining six topics are for the sake of disciplining those who have gone forth from the home life.🔽Thus, the subject matter and the purpose are mentioned in general, and the remaining six topics are mentioned in particular.🔽The word “place” is explained in the Commentary as follows:

original: de la gnas kyi tshig ni don rnam par bshad pa yang tshig bcu dgur zhing yongs su dag pa de'i phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa bco brgyad ston par mdzad de ;
analyzed: de la gnas kyi tshig ni don rnam par bshad pa yang tshig bcu dgur zhing yongs su dag pa de'i phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa bco brgyad ston par mdzad de ;
translated: “The place is the place of the eighteen kinds of excellence of the purity of the ten topics.

original: phun sum tshogs pa bco brgyad po de dag nyid kyis rnam pa bco brgyad du dbye'o //
analyzed: phun sum tshogs pa bco brgyad po de dag nyid kyis rnam pa bco brgyad du dbye'o //
translated: The eighteen kinds of excellence are divided into eighteen topics by means of those very eighteen kinds of excellence.🔽The eighteen topics are explained in the commentary to the Buddha Level as follows:

original: rnam pa bco brgyad ni sangs rgyas sa'i 'grel pa las ji skad du 'dis ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas phun sum tshogs pa bstan te /
analyzed: rnam pa bco brgyad ni sangs rgyas sa'i 'grel pa las ji skad du 'dis ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas phun sum tshogs pa bstan te /
translated: “This shows the excellence of the Tathagata’s place.

original: 'di lta ste sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: It is the complete purification of the Buddha-field.

original: 'di ltar zhing yongs su dag pa 'di yang phun sum tshogs pa'i dngos po bco brgyad kyi dbang gis na phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhing yongs su dag pa 'di yang phun sum tshogs pa'i dngos po bco brgyad kyi dbang gis na phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This complete purification of the field is called complete because of the perfection of eighteen aspects.

original: 'di lta ste kha dog phun sum tshogs pa dang / dbyibs phun sum tshogs pa dang / tshad phun sum tshogs pa dang / yul phun sum tshogs pa dang / rgyu @53b phun sum tshogs pa dang / 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa dang / bdag po phun sum tshogs pa dang /
analyzed: 'di lta ste kha dog phun sum tshogs pa dang / dbyibs phun sum tshogs pa dang / tshad phun sum tshogs pa dang / yul phun sum tshogs pa dang / rgyu @53b phun sum tshogs pa dang / 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa dang / bdag po phun sum tshogs pa dang /
translated: They are: perfection of color, perfection of shape, perfection of size, perfection of place, perfection of cause, perfection of effect, perfection of master,

original: phyogs phun sum tshogs pa dang / zhabs 'bring ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / ston pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / phrin las phun sum tshogs pa dang / phan 'dogs pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / mi 'jigs pa phun sum tshogs pa dang /
analyzed: phyogs phun sum tshogs pa dang / zhabs 'bring ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / ston pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / phrin las phun sum tshogs pa dang / phan 'dogs pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / mi 'jigs pa phun sum tshogs pa dang /
translated: perfection of direction, perfection of retinue, perfection of teacher, perfection of action, perfection of benefit, perfection of fearlessness,

original: gnas phun sum tshogs pa dang / lam phun sum tshogs pa dang / bzhon pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / sgo phun sum tshogs pa dang / gzhi phun sum tshogs pa dang / de yang tshig bcu dgu go rims bzhin du phun sum tshogs pa bco brgyad yongs su ston to /
analyzed: gnas phun sum tshogs pa dang / lam phun sum tshogs pa dang / bzhon pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / sgo phun sum tshogs pa dang / gzhi phun sum tshogs pa dang / de yang tshig bcu dgu go rims bzhin du phun sum tshogs pa bco brgyad yongs su ston to /
translated: The perfect place, the perfect path, the perfect vehicle, the perfect gate, the perfect basis, the perfect assembly, the perfect time, the perfect teacher, the perfect teaching, the perfect practice, the perfect result, the perfect function, the perfect entrance, the perfect evocation, the perfect explanation, and the perfect reply.

original: 'di ni yul phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni yul phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: This is the perfect place.

original: rab tu brgyan pa ni gzhal med khang gang yin pa de ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rab tu brgyan pa ni gzhal med khang gang yin pa de ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The fully adorned palace is called the pure buddha field.

original: bcom ldan 'das de lta bu'i gzhal med khang chen po na bzhugs nas mdo sde 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de lta bu'i gzhal med khang chen po na bzhugs nas mdo sde 'di gsungs so //
translated: The Blessed One, dwelling in such a great palace, taught this sutra.

original: bstan bcos rnams las kyang slob dpon dbyig gnyen dang / ngo bo nyid med kyis theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa mdzad pa las /
analyzed: bstan bcos rnams las kyang slob dpon dbyig gnyen dang / ngo bo nyid med kyis theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa mdzad pa las /
translated: In the treatises, Master Vasubandhu and Asvabhāva, in their commentaries on the Compendium of the Great Vehicle,

original: mdo sde las 'byung ba'i phun sum tshogs pa bco brgyad rnam par bshad de /
analyzed: mdo sde las 'byung ba'i phun sum tshogs pa bco brgyad rnam par bshad de /
translated: explain the eighteen perfections that appear in the sutras.

original: yi ge thad kar bab pa'i tshe bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: yi ge thad kar bab pa'i tshe bshad par bya'o //
translated: When the letters are arranged in order, they should be explained.

original: de la phun sum tshogs pa dang po yang mdo tshig gnyis kyis bstan te /
analyzed: de la phun sum tshogs pa dang po yang mdo tshig gnyis kyis bstan te /
translated: The first perfection is indicated by two sūtra passages.

original: dang po kha dog gi gzugs bstan pa ni /
analyzed: dang po kha dog gi gzugs bstan pa ni /
translated: First, the form of color is indicated by

original: rin po che sna bdun bkod pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: rin po che sna bdun bkod pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: the statement “arrayed with the seven precious substances.”

original: gnyis pa 'od zer 'byung ba ni 'jig rten gyi khams rgyas par 'gengs pa'o zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa 'od zer 'byung ba ni 'jig rten gyi khams rgyas par 'gengs pa'o zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: Second, the arising of light rays is indicated by the statement “it fills the world systems in the ten directions.”

original: de la tshig ces bya ba ni don yongs su rdzogs par bstan pa la tshig bya'i yi ge'i grangs la tshig ces bya ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de la tshig ces bya ba ni don yongs su rdzogs par bstan pa la tshig bya'i yi ge'i grangs la tshig ces bya ba ni ma yin te /
translated: Here, “passage” means a passage that teaches the complete meaning, not a passage that is a certain number of letters.

original: tshig gzhan bco brgyad po dag la yang de bzhin du sbyar bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: tshig gzhan bco brgyad po dag la yang de bzhin du sbyar bar rig par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood as applying to the other eighteen passages as well.

original: mdo'i tshig dang po de yang slob dpon nye ba'i 'od kyis rnam pa gnyis su bshad de /
analyzed: mdo'i tshig dang po de yang slob dpon nye ba'i 'od kyis rnam pa gnyis su bshad de /
translated: The first sūtra passage is explained in two ways by Master Upālo.

original: de'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi sa'i 'grel pa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi sa'i 'grel pa las /
translated: Therefore, in the commentary on the Buddha Level it says:

original: 'di ltar gzhal med khang chen po de mchog tu 'bar ba'i rin po che sna bdun dag gis bkad pa brgyan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar gzhal med khang chen po de mchog tu 'bar ba'i rin po che sna bdun dag gis bkad pa brgyan pa'o //
translated: Thus, that great palace is adorned with the seven supreme precious substances.

original: yang na gzhal med khang chen po'i khyad par rin po che sna bdun po de dag mchog tu 'bar ba'o zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: yang na gzhal med khang chen po'i khyad par rin po che sna bdun po de dag mchog tu 'bar ba'o zhes 'byung ste /
translated: Or, the great palace is the seven precious substances, which are supreme.

original: ngo bo nyid med kyis byas pa'i 'grel pa las kyang 'di dang mthun par bshad do //🔽slob dpon dbyig @54a * //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med kyis byas pa'i 'grel pa las kyang 'di dang mthun par bshad do // slob dpon dbyig @54a * //
translated: The commentary composed by Asvabhāva explains in agreement with this.

original: gnyen rnam par ma bshad pa ni go sla ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyen rnam par ma bshad pa ni go sla ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Master Vasubandhu does not explain it because it is easy to understand.

original: de la rin po che sna bdun ni sangs rgyas kyis yongs su dag pa'i bsngags pa brjod pa'i mdo las ji skad du /
analyzed: de la rin po che sna bdun ni sangs rgyas kyis yongs su dag pa'i bsngags pa brjod pa'i mdo las ji skad du /
translated: Regarding that, the seven precious substances are as stated in the Sutra of the Buddha's Praise of Pure Giving:

original: gser dang / dngul dang / bee d'urya dang / spug dang / mu tig dmar po dang / rdo'i snying po dang / ke ke ru zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: gser dang / dngul dang / bee d'urya dang / spug dang / mu tig dmar po dang / rdo'i snying po dang / ke ke ru zhes gsungs te /
translated: gold, silver, beryl, coral, red pearls, emerald, and kesara.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las kyang mdo 'di dang mthun par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las kyang mdo 'di dang mthun par 'byung ngo //
translated: The commentary on the perfection of wisdom also explains in agreement with this sutra.

original: slob dpon yang dag bden pa'i bshad pa las gser ni rin po che kha dog ser pa'o //
analyzed: slob dpon yang dag bden pa'i bshad pa las gser ni rin po che kha dog ser pa'o //
translated: Gold is a precious substance that is yellow in color.

original: dngul ni rin po che kha dog dkar po'o //
analyzed: dngul ni rin po che kha dog dkar po'o //
translated: Silver is a precious substance that is white in color.

original: bee d'urya ni rin po che kha dog sngon po'o //
analyzed: bee d'urya ni rin po che kha dog sngon po'o //
translated: Beryl is a precious substance that is blue in color.

original: bsregs na yang mi 'jig ste /
analyzed: bsregs na yang mi 'jig ste /
translated: It does not disintegrate when burned.

original: lha ma srin mthu dang ldan pa dag gis gdod bzhu nas snod spyad dag tu byed par nus so //
analyzed: lha ma srin mthu dang ldan pa dag gis gdod bzhu nas snod spyad dag tu byed par nus so //
translated: Powerful gods and demons can melt it and make it into vessels.

original: yang na bya gser 'dab can gyi sgong bzhi yin no //
analyzed: yang na bya gser 'dab can gyi sgong bzhi yin no //
translated: Or it is the egg of the golden-winged bird.

original: spug ni rin po che kha dog ljang ser can no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: spug ni rin po che kha dog ljang ser can no zhes bshad do //
translated: Coral is a precious substance that is yellow-green in color.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las kyang lo stong 'das pa'i chab rom ni spug tu 'gyur ro zhes bshad do //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las kyang lo stong 'das pa'i chab rom ni spug tu 'gyur ro zhes bshad do //
translated: Also, the commentary on the perfection of wisdom says that after a thousand years, ice becomes coral.

original: mu tig dmar po ni sangs rgyas kyi sa'i 'grel ba las srog chags dmar po las byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mu tig dmar po ni sangs rgyas kyi sa'i 'grel ba las srog chags dmar po las byung ba'i phyir /
translated: The commentary on the Buddha ground says that red pearls come from red creatures.

original: mu tig dmar po zhes bya ste /
analyzed: mu tig dmar po zhes bya ste /
translated: Therefore, they are called red pearls.

original: ngo bo nyid dmar ba'i phyir mu tig dmar po zhes bshad do /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid dmar ba'i phyir mu tig dmar po zhes bshad do /
translated: Because they are red in essence, they are called red pearls.

original: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis bshad pa las kyang 'di dang mthun par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis bshad pa las kyang 'di dang mthun par 'byung ngo //
translated: This is also in agreement with the explanation of Master Svābhāvika.

original: slob dpon yang dag bden pas bshad pa las ni nor bu rin po che rin thang med pa zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: slob dpon yang dag bden pas bshad pa las ni nor bu rin po che rin thang med pa zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Master Samghabhadra explains that it is a priceless jewel.

original: rdo'i snying po ni slob dpon yang dag bden pas rin po che kha dog dmar zhes bshad do //
analyzed: rdo'i snying po ni slob dpon yang dag bden pas rin po che kha dog dmar zhes bshad do //
translated: Master Svābhāvika explains that cat’s eye is a red jewel.

original: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa byas pa las /
analyzed: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa byas pa las /
translated: In his commentary on the Compendium of the Mahāyāna, Master Svābhāvika explains:

original: rdo'i snying po ni aanda rnyil dang / mthon ka chen po la sogs pa'o zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: rdo'i snying po ni aanda rnyil dang / mthon ka chen po la sogs pa'o zhes 'byung ste /
translated: “Cat’s eye is lapis lazuli, great sapphire, and so on.”

original: de la aanda rnyil ni lha'i dbang po'i rin po che kha dog sngon po'o //
analyzed: de la aanda rnyil ni lha'i dbang po'i rin po che kha dog sngon po'o //
translated: Lapis lazuli is the blue jewel of the lord of the gods.

original: mthon ka chen po ni lha'i dbang po'i rin po che kha dog sngon po mchog tu gyur pa'o //
analyzed: mthon ka chen po ni lha'i dbang po'i rin po che kha dog sngon po mchog tu gyur pa'o //
translated: Great sapphire is the supreme blue jewel of the lord of the gods.

original: ke ke ru ni slob dpon yang dag bden pas rin po che ljang sngon no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: ke ke ru ni slob dpon yang dag bden pas rin po che ljang sngon no zhes bshad do //
translated: Master Samghabhadra explains that cat’s eye is an emerald.

original: gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las /🔽rin po che rnam pa gsum yod de /
analyzed: gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las / rin po che rnam pa gsum yod de /
translated: Moreover, the commentary to the Perfection of Wisdom says:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: There are three kinds of jewels:🔽human jewels,🔽divine jewels, and

original: mi'i rin po che dang / lha'i rin po che dang / byang chub sems dpa'i rin po che'o //
analyzed: mi'i rin po che dang / lha'i rin po che dang / byang chub sems dpa'i rin po che'o //
translated: bodhisattva jewels.

original: de la mi'i rin po che ni mthu chung ste /
analyzed: de la mi'i rin po che ni mthu chung ste /
translated: Human jewels have little power.

original: yongs su dag pa'i kha dog dang ldan pas /
analyzed: yongs su dag pa'i kha dog dang ldan pas /
translated: They have a pure color

original: dug dang gdon dang @54b mun pa dang bkres pa dang / skom pa dang grang ba dang tsha ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal sel bar byed do //🔽lha'i rin po che ni chen po yang yin /
analyzed: dug dang gdon dang @54b mun pa dang bkres pa dang / skom pa dang grang ba dang tsha ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal sel bar byed do // lha'i rin po che ni chen po yang yin /
translated: and they remove the sufferings of poison, spirits, darkness, hunger, thirst, cold, heat, and so forth.

original: mchog kyang yin pas rtag par lha'i lus kyi rjes su 'brang ba dang / mngags pa dang / smrar rung ba dang / yang zhing mi lci ba'o //
analyzed: mchog kyang yin pas rtag par lha'i lus kyi rjes su 'brang ba dang / mngags pa dang / smrar rung ba dang / yang zhing mi lci ba'o //
translated: Divine jewels are great and supreme. They always follow the divine body, can be sent on errands, can speak, and are light and not heavy.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i rin po che mi'i rin po che las mchog tu gyur pa dang / gzhan yang lha'i rin po che las mchog tu gyur pa dang / gzhan yang lha'i dang mi'i rin po che ni gnyis kyis nus pa dang ldan pa dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i rin po che mi'i rin po che las mchog tu gyur pa dang / gzhan yang lha'i rin po che las mchog tu gyur pa dang / gzhan yang lha'i dang mi'i rin po che ni gnyis kyis nus pa dang ldan pa dang /
translated: The jewel of the bodhisattva is superior to the human jewel, and also superior to the divine jewel.🔽Moreover, the human and divine jewels are both capable of knowing the causes and conditions of the arising of the world and of the end of the world.

original: gzhan yang sems can dag 'chi bar 'gyur ba rtogs shing 'di de'i rgyu dang rkyen gyi thog ma dang tha ma'o zhes shes par byed pa dang / gzhan yang chos kyi sgra skad rnam pa sna tshogs 'byung ngo zhes bya ba nas rgya cher bshad pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang sems can dag 'chi bar 'gyur ba rtogs shing 'di de'i rgyu dang rkyen gyi thog ma dang tha ma'o zhes shes par byed pa dang / gzhan yang chos kyi sgra skad rnam pa sna tshogs 'byung ngo zhes bya ba nas rgya cher bshad pa'i bar du'o //
translated: Moreover, various sounds of the Dharma arise from that jewel.

original: gzhan yang de nyid las rin po che de dag gang nas byung zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan yang de nyid las rin po che de dag gang nas byung zhe na /
translated: Moreover, from that same text: “Where do those jewels come from?”

original: smras pa gser ni ri dang rdo dang bye ma dang zangs dmar po las 'byung ngo //
analyzed: smras pa gser ni ri dang rdo dang bye ma dang zangs dmar po las 'byung ngo //
translated: It says: “Gold comes from mountains, rocks, sand, and red copper.

original: mu tig ni nya'i khog pa dang / rgyu ma dang sprul gyi glad pa'i nang nas 'byung ngo //
analyzed: mu tig ni nya'i khog pa dang / rgyu ma dang sprul gyi glad pa'i nang nas 'byung ngo //
translated: Pearls come from the bellies of fish, intestines, and the heads of snakes.”

original: klu'i nor bu ni klu'i glad pa'i nang nas 'byung ngo //
analyzed: klu'i nor bu ni klu'i glad pa'i nang nas 'byung ngo //
translated: The nāga jewel comes from the head of a nāga.

original: byi ru ni rgya mtsho'i nang nas 'byung ngo //
analyzed: byi ru ni rgya mtsho'i nang nas 'byung ngo //
translated: Coral comes from the ocean.

original: dngul ni rdo bsregs pa las 'byung ngo //🔽bee d'urya dang spug la sogs pa gzhan dag ni /
analyzed: dngul ni rdo bsregs pa las 'byung ngo // bee d'urya dang spug la sogs pa gzhan dag ni /
translated: Silver comes from burned rock.

original: ri'i phug nas 'byung ngo //
analyzed: ri'i phug nas 'byung ngo //
translated: Other jewels such as lapis lazuli and cat’s eye come from mountain caves.

original: yid bzhin gyi nor bu ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i ring bsrel las 'byung ste /
analyzed: yid bzhin gyi nor bu ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i ring bsrel las 'byung ste /
translated: The wish-fulfilling jewel comes from the relics of the Tathāgata.

original: nam chos nub par gyur pa'i tshe /
analyzed: nam chos nub par gyur pa'i tshe /
translated: When the Dharma has disappeared,

original: ring bsrel rnams yid bzhin gyi nor bur 'gyur te /
analyzed: ring bsrel rnams yid bzhin gyi nor bur 'gyur te /
translated: the relics become wish-fulfilling jewels.

original: ji ltar lo stong 'das pa'i chab rom spug tu 'gyur ba bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar lo stong 'das pa'i chab rom spug tu 'gyur ba bzhin no //
translated: Just as ice becomes cat’s eye after a thousand years.

original: 'di lta bu la sogs pa'i rin po che rnams ni mi'i rin po che phal che ba'o //
analyzed: 'di lta bu la sogs pa'i rin po che rnams ni mi'i rin po che phal che ba'o //
translated: Such jewels are mostly human jewels.

original: 'dir yongs su brgyan pa dag ni shin tu khyad par can du gyur pa dag yin pas /
analyzed: 'dir yongs su brgyan pa dag ni shin tu khyad par can du gyur pa dag yin pas /
translated: Here, the ornaments are extremely special,

original: lha rnams kyis thob par mi nus so //
analyzed: lha rnams kyis thob par mi nus so //
translated: and cannot be obtained by the gods.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: yon tan chen po las rab tu byung ba'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: yon tan chen po las rab tu byung ba'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: because it is the source of great qualities.

original: theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel ba'i dpe mi mthun pa kha cig las rin po che sna bdun po thams cad ni rdo'i rigs su gtogs pa yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel ba'i dpe mi mthun pa kha cig las rin po che sna bdun po thams cad ni rdo'i rigs su gtogs pa yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: In some variant recensions of the commentary on the Compendium of the Great Vehicle, it is explained that all seven precious substances are a type of stone.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams dpag tu med pa rgyas par 'gengs pa'i 'od zer chen po rab tu 'byung ba zhes bya bas ni tshig gnyis po 'od zer rgyas par 'gengs pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams dpag tu med pa rgyas par 'gengs pa'i 'od zer chen po rab tu 'byung ba zhes bya bas ni tshig gnyis po 'od zer rgyas par 'gengs pa bstan to //
translated: The second line, “the great light rays that fill the immeasurable world systems,” indicates the light rays that fill the world systems.

original: slob dpon nye ba'i 'od kyis 'grel pa @55a * //
analyzed: slob dpon nye ba'i 'od kyis 'grel pa @55a * //
translated: In the commentary by Master Upāśānta,

original: las / gzhan yang longs spyod pa'i zhing ni rang gi ngo bo nyid kun du khyab pa ma yin yang /
analyzed: las / gzhan yang longs spyod pa'i zhing ni rang gi ngo bo nyid kun du khyab pa ma yin yang /
translated: it says, “Moreover, the field of enjoyment is not pervaded by its own essence,

original: 'dir 'od zer gyis kun du 'gengs par byed la /
analyzed: 'dir 'od zer gyis kun du 'gengs par byed la /
translated: but here it is pervaded by light rays.

original: nyid kyis longs spyod pa'i zhing ni rang gi ngo bo kun du khyab pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nyid kyis longs spyod pa'i zhing ni rang gi ngo bo kun du khyab pa'i phyir /
translated: The field of enjoyment of the Buddha himself is pervaded by its own essence,

original: 'od zer gyis kun du gsal bar byed do zhes 'byung ngo ;
analyzed: 'od zer gyis kun du gsal bar byed do zhes 'byung ngo ;
translated: so it is illuminated by light rays.”

original: ; slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis 'grel pa las ni 'di ltar sngar bstan pa'i rin po che sna bdun las 'od zer 'byung bas kun du gsal bar gyur pa yin no zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: ; slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis 'grel pa las ni 'di ltar sngar bstan pa'i rin po che sna bdun las 'od zer 'byung bas kun du gsal bar gyur pa yin no zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Thus, light rays emerge from the seven precious substances taught above, illuminating everywhere.

original: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las kyang gong ma'i rnam par bshad pa gsum char dang ldan no ;
analyzed: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las kyang gong ma'i rnam par bshad pa gsum char dang ldan no ;
translated: Master Niḥsvabhāva's commentary also has all three explanations above.

original: ; gnas tha dad pa shin tu rnam par phye ba mtha' yas par rnam par gnas pa zhes bya bas ni gnyis pa dbyibs phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: ; gnas tha dad pa shin tu rnam par phye ba mtha' yas par rnam par gnas pa zhes bya bas ni gnyis pa dbyibs phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
translated: Abiding in infinite, well-differentiated, distinct places teaches the second perfection, shape.

original: de la gnas tha dad pa zhes bya ba ni zab dar gyi gur la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de la gnas tha dad pa zhes bya ba ni zab dar gyi gur la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: Here, distinct places refers to things like a tent of fine silk, and so on.

original: shin tu rnam par phye ba zhes bya ba ni me tog gi ri mo'i rnam pa la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par phye ba zhes bya ba ni me tog gi ri mo'i rnam pa la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: Well-differentiated refers to things like a pattern of flowers, and so on.

original: slob dpon nye ba'i 'od kyis 'grel pa las /
