analyzed: slob dpon nye ba'i 'od kyis 'grel pa las /
translated: Master Upālo's commentary states:

original: 'di ltar gzhal med khang chen po'i shin tu rnam par phye ba dag gis gnas tha dad pa tshad med par phye ba'am /🔽yang na gzhal med khang chen po shin tu rnam par phye ba tshad med pa dag gnas tha dad pa rab tu dbye pa'o //🔽tshad med pa zhes bya ba ni grangs tshad med pa mnga'/🔽yang na gnas tshad med pa'o zhes bshad de /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzhal med khang chen po'i shin tu rnam par phye ba dag gis gnas tha dad pa tshad med par phye ba'am / yang na gzhal med khang chen po shin tu rnam par phye ba tshad med pa dag gnas tha dad pa rab tu dbye pa'o // tshad med pa zhes bya ba ni grangs tshad med pa mnga'/ yang na gnas tshad med pa'o zhes bshad de /
translated: Thus, the great palaces are differentiated by the immeasurable different abodes, or the great palaces are differentiated by the immeasurable different abodes.🔽The term immeasurable means that they possess immeasurable numbers, or that they are immeasurable abodes.🔽🔽

original: 'dir grangs tshad med pa zhes bya bas ni snga ma bzhin du rnam par phye ba tshad med pa bzlas te bshad pa'o //🔽gnas tshad med pa zhes bya bas ni snga ma'i gnas tshad med pa tha dad pa bzlas te bshad pa'o //🔽slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis kyang nye ba'i 'od dang mthun par bshad do //🔽de yan chad du kha dog dang dbyibs rnam pa sna gnyis bshad zin te /
analyzed: 'dir grangs tshad med pa zhes bya bas ni snga ma bzhin du rnam par phye ba tshad med pa bzlas te bshad pa'o //🔽gnas tshad med pa zhes bya bas ni snga ma'i gnas tshad med pa tha dad pa bzlas te bshad pa'o //🔽slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis kyang nye ba'i 'od dang mthun par bshad do //🔽de yan chad du kha dog dang dbyibs rnam pa sna gnyis bshad zin te /

original: gzugs 'di gnyis la bye brag yod pa yang mdzod kyi bstan bcos la sogs pa las sgo rnam pa gnyis kyis rnam par 'byed de /🔽gzugs rnam pa nyi shu rtsa gcig dang sbyar nas /
analyzed: gzugs 'di gnyis la bye brag yod pa yang mdzod kyi bstan bcos la sogs pa las sgo rnam pa gnyis kyis rnam par 'byed de / gzugs rnam pa nyi shu rtsa gcig dang sbyar nas /
translated: The treatise entitled Abhidharmakośa and so on, distinguishes the two types of form by means of two methods.

original: kha dog dang dbyibs phan tshun ltos pa'i mu bzhis rnam par dbye ba'o //
analyzed: kha dog dang dbyibs phan tshun ltos pa'i mu bzhis rnam par dbye ba'o //
translated: It distinguishes the twenty one types of form by means of the four possibilities of mutual dependence between color and shape.

original: de la gzugs rnam pa nyi shu kha dog dang dbyibs bstan pa ni mdzod kyi bstan bcos tshig le'ur byas pa las ji skad du /
analyzed: de la gzugs rnam pa nyi shu kha dog dang dbyibs bstan pa ni mdzod kyi bstan bcos tshig le'ur byas pa las ji skad du /
translated: The twenty one types of form and the teaching on color and shape are stated in the Abhidharmakośa in the following lines:

original: gzugs rnam @55b gnyis dang rnam pa nyi shu zhes 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: gzugs rnam @55b gnyis dang rnam pa nyi shu zhes 'byung ba ste /
translated: Form is twofold and twenty types.

original: de nyid kyi 'grel pa las /
analyzed: de nyid kyi 'grel pa las /
translated: The Autocommentary states:

original: de la gzugs rnam pa gnyis zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la gzugs rnam pa gnyis zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The two types of form are as follows.

original: kha dig dang dbyibs rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: kha dig dang dbyibs rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: Color and shape are the two types.

original: kha dog dang gzugs kyang rnam pa bzhi yod de /
analyzed: kha dog dang gzugs kyang rnam pa bzhi yod de /
translated: Color and shape are also of four types.

original: sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po'o //
analyzed: sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po'o //
translated: Blue, yellow, red and white.

original: kha dog bzhi ni gzugs 'di bzhi'i dbye ba las so //
analyzed: kha dog bzhi ni gzugs 'di bzhi'i dbye ba las so //
translated: The four colors are the divisions of these four forms.

original: dbyibs ni rnam pa brgyad de /
analyzed: dbyibs ni rnam pa brgyad de /
translated: Shape has eight types.🔽

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: Shape is of eight types:

original: ring po dang / thung ngu dang / lham pa dang / zlum po dang / mtho ba dang / dma' ba dang / phya le ba dang / phya le ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: ring po dang / thung ngu dang / lham pa dang / zlum po dang / mtho ba dang / dma' ba dang / phya le ba dang / phya le ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: long, short, square, round, high, low, even, uneven.

original: gzhan yang rnam pa nyi shu 'di lta ste /🔽sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po dang / 'od dang / grib ma dang / snang ba dang / mun pa dang / sprin dang / du ba dang / rdul dang / khug rna dang / ring po dang thung du dang /
analyzed: gzhan yang rnam pa nyi shu 'di lta ste / sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po dang / 'od dang / grib ma dang / snang ba dang / mun pa dang / sprin dang / du ba dang / rdul dang / khug rna dang / ring po dang thung du dang /
translated: It is also of twenty types:

original: lham pa dang / zlum po dang / mtho ba dang / dma' ba dang / phya le ba dang / phya le ba ma yin pa'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: lham pa dang / zlum po dang / mtho ba dang / dma' ba dang / phya le ba dang / phya le ba ma yin pa'o zhes bshad do //
translated: blue, yellow, red, white, shiny, shaded, bright, dark, cloudy, smoky, dusty, misty, long, short, square, round, high, low, even, uneven.

original: slob dpon kha cig ni nam mkha' kha dog gcig pa'i gzugs so zhes kyang bshad do //
analyzed: slob dpon kha cig ni nam mkha' kha dog gcig pa'i gzugs so zhes kyang bshad do //
translated: Some masters say that space is a color, a single color.

original: bam po nyi shu rtsa gcig pa las gzugs rnams kyi mtshan nyid rgya cher rnam par bshad de /
analyzed: bam po nyi shu rtsa gcig pa las gzugs rnams kyi mtshan nyid rgya cher rnam par bshad de /
translated: The characteristics of the form aggregate have been extensively explained.

original: de nyid las 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //🔽de la mu bzhis bstan pa ni bstan bcos de nyid las ji skad du gzugs kyi skye mched kha cig ni kha dog yod la /
analyzed: de nyid las 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o // de la mu bzhis bstan pa ni bstan bcos de nyid las ji skad du gzugs kyi skye mched kha cig ni kha dog yod la /
translated: This should be understood as it is explained in that treatise.🔽The four possibilities are explained in that treatise as follows:

original: dbyibs med pa yang yod de /
analyzed: dbyibs med pa yang yod de /
translated: “There is a form base that has color but not shape.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po dang / grib ma dang / 'od dang / snang ba dang mun pa rnams so //
analyzed: sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po dang / grib ma dang / 'od dang / snang ba dang mun pa rnams so //
translated: blue, yellow, red, white, shadow, sunlight, light, and darkness.

original: gzugs kyi skye mched kha cig ni dbyibs yod la kha dog med pa yang yod de /
analyzed: gzugs kyi skye mched kha cig ni dbyibs yod la kha dog med pa yang yod de /
translated: There is a form base that has shape but not color.

original: 'di lta ste ring ba la sogs pa dang / lus kyi rnam par rig byed kyi las kyi ngo bo nyid kyi phyogs gcig go //
analyzed: 'di lta ste ring ba la sogs pa dang / lus kyi rnam par rig byed kyi las kyi ngo bo nyid kyi phyogs gcig go //
translated: It is like this: long, etc., and one part of the bodily manifest karma.

original: gzugs kyi skye mched kha cig ni kha dog dang dbyibs gnyi ga yod pa yang yod de /
analyzed: gzugs kyi skye mched kha cig ni kha dog dang dbyibs gnyi ga yod pa yang yod de /
translated: There is a form base that has both color and shape.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: de las gzhan pa'i gzugs rnams so ;
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i gzugs rnams so ;
translated: the other forms.

original: / mu bzhi po 'di yang so so nas bshad pa mi mthun te /
analyzed: / mu bzhi po 'di yang so so nas bshad pa mi mthun te /
translated: These four possibilities are explained separately and are not in agreement.

original: de la dang po ni slob dpon yang dag bden pas 'di skad du kha dog yin la dbyibs ma yin pa ni ri rab kyi ngos bzhi'i nam mkha' kha dog sngon po la sogs pa'i kha dog gi gzugs rnams so //
analyzed: de la dang po ni slob dpon yang dag bden pas 'di skad du kha dog yin la dbyibs ma yin pa ni ri rab kyi ngos bzhi'i nam mkha' kha dog sngon po la sogs pa'i kha dog gi gzugs rnams so //
translated: Color but not shape is the color of forms such as the blue sky on the four sides of Meru.

original: dbyibs yin la kha dog ma yin @56a * //🔽pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dbyibs yin la kha dog ma yin @56a * // pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Shape but not color is

original: lus kyi rnam par rig byed kyi gzugs so //
analyzed: lus kyi rnam par rig byed kyi gzugs so //
translated: the form of physical manifest karma.

original: kha dog kyang yin la dbyibs kyang yin pa ni rtsig pa la sogs pa'i sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa'i gzugs rnams so //
analyzed: kha dog kyang yin la dbyibs kyang yin pa ni rtsig pa la sogs pa'i sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa'i gzugs rnams so //
translated: Both color and shape is the form of blue, yellow, and so on of walls and so forth.

original: kha dog kyang ma yin dbyibs kyang ma yin pa ni rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs so zhes bshad do //
analyzed: kha dog kyang ma yin dbyibs kyang ma yin pa ni rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs so zhes bshad do //
translated: Neither color nor shape is nonindicative form.🔽The second is the four possibilities from the perspective of generating consciousness, as explained by the master Hīnayasaṅghabhadra.

original: gnyis pa ni slob dpon hyan tsang gis shes pa skye ba'i dbang du byas nas mu bzhir rnam par 'byed de ji ltar ras dkar po yug gcig sngon por 'jer ba'i tshe /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni slob dpon hyan tsang gis shes pa skye ba'i dbang du byas nas mu bzhir rnam par 'byed de ji ltar ras dkar po yug gcig sngon por 'jer ba'i tshe /
translated: When a single white cloth is dyed blue,

original: dbyibs las gyur ba med pas /
analyzed: dbyibs las gyur ba med pas /
translated: its shape does not change.

original: kha dog gi shes pa bskyed mod kyi dbyibs kyi shes pa yang skye ste /
analyzed: kha dog gi shes pa bskyed mod kyi dbyibs kyi shes pa yang skye ste /
translated: Although the cognition of color arises, the cognition of shape also arises.

original: 'di lta bu ni kha dog yin la dbyibs ma yin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di lta bu ni kha dog yin la dbyibs ma yin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is like this: “This is color, not shape.”

original: gal te drangs nas 'tsher bar mi byed na ni dbyibs kho na'i shes pa skye'i /
analyzed: gal te drangs nas 'tsher bar mi byed na ni dbyibs kho na'i shes pa skye'i /
translated: If one does not draw out the shape, then only the cognition of shape arises.

original: kha dog gi shes pa ni mi skye ste /
analyzed: kha dog gi shes pa ni mi skye ste /
translated: The cognition of color does not arise.

original: 'di lta bu'i dbyibs yin la kha dog ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di lta bu'i dbyibs yin la kha dog ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is like this: “This is shape, not color.”

original: gal te kha dog bsgyur te 'dra bar yang byed na ni dbyibs dang kha dog gnyi ga'i shes pa skyes te /
analyzed: gal te kha dog bsgyur te 'dra bar yang byed na ni dbyibs dang kha dog gnyi ga'i shes pa skyes te /
translated: If one draws out the shape and makes it similar to the color, then the cognition of both shape and color arises.

original: bstan bcos yang dag pa'i rigs pa las ji skad du /🔽rgyang nas rtsig pa nag po mthong nas 'di snyam du 'di ni bya rog yin gyi /
analyzed: bstan bcos yang dag pa'i rigs pa las ji skad du / rgyang nas rtsig pa nag po mthong nas 'di snyam du 'di ni bya rog yin gyi /
translated: As it is said in the treatise Correct Logical Reasoning:

original: rtsig pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rtsig pa ni ma yin te /
translated: “From afar, seeing a black wall, one thinks, ‘This is a crow, not a wall.🔽A wall is not a crow, etc.’

original: rtsig pa ni bya rog la sogs pa ma yin no snyam du sems so zhes bshad pa 'di lta bu ni kha dog kyang yin dbyibs kyang yin pa'o zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rtsig pa ni bya rog la sogs pa ma yin no snyam du sems so zhes bshad pa 'di lta bu ni kha dog kyang yin dbyibs kyang yin pa'o zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called ‘both color and shape.’”

original: kha dog kyang ma yin dbyibs kyang ma yin pa ni nam mkha'i khams kyi gzugs la sogs pa'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: kha dog kyang ma yin dbyibs kyang ma yin pa ni nam mkha'i khams kyi gzugs la sogs pa'o zhes bshad do //
translated: Form that is neither color nor shape is the form of the space element.

original: mu bzhi po de dag kyang so so nas bshad pa mi mthun pas bstan bcos bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod de //
analyzed: mu bzhi po de dag kyang so so nas bshad pa mi mthun pas bstan bcos bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod de //
translated: These four possibilities are explained differently in the great treatise on differentiation.

original: kha cig ni 'di skad du nam mkha'i khams kyi gzugs ni mu bzhi pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kha cig ni 'di skad du nam mkha'i khams kyi gzugs ni mu bzhi pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say: The form of the space element is the fourth possibility.

original: kha cig ni kha dog kyang ma yin pa dbyibs kyang ma yin pa ni med do zhes bshad do //
analyzed: kha cig ni kha dog kyang ma yin pa dbyibs kyang ma yin pa ni med do zhes bshad do //
translated: Some say: There is no form that is neither color nor shape.

original: bstan bcos yang dag pa'i rigs pa dang sbyar na /
analyzed: bstan bcos yang dag pa'i rigs pa dang sbyar na /
translated: The treatise that is applied to correct reasoning explains:

original: sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg bya dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs ni mu bzhi pa yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg bya dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs ni mu bzhi pa yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: Sound, smell, taste, tactility and imperceptible form are the fourth possibility.

original: bstan bcos rnam par shes pa'i chos kyi gnas zhes bya ba las /
analyzed: bstan bcos rnam par shes pa'i chos kyi gnas zhes bya ba las /
translated: The treatise called the Abhidharma on phenomena and consciousness explains:

original: dbang po lnga dang yul rnam pa bzhi dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs ni mu bzhi pa yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: dbang po lnga dang yul rnam pa bzhi dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs ni mu bzhi pa yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: The five sense faculties, the four types of object fields and nonindicative form are the fourth possibility.

original: @56b gzhan yang mdzod kyi bstan bcos las slob dpon kha cig 'di skad du /🔽'od dang snang pa'i gzugs kho na 'ba' zhig la kha dog yod kyi dbyibs ni med de /
analyzed: @56b gzhan yang mdzod kyi bstan bcos las slob dpon kha cig 'di skad du / 'od dang snang pa'i gzugs kho na 'ba' zhig la kha dog yod kyi dbyibs ni med de /
translated: Moreover, the treatise on the Abhidharmakośa explains:

original: 'di ltar 'jig rten na sngon po la sogs pa'i gzugs la ring po la sogs pa'i mngon sum du dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jig rten na sngon po la sogs pa'i gzugs la ring po la sogs pa'i mngon sum du dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
translated: Some masters say that only the forms of light and illumination have color but not shape because shape is not directly perceived in the form of blue and so on.🔽But the Vaibhasikas say that shape is also directly perceived because shape is directly perceived in the form of blue and so on.

original: thams cad yod par smra ba dbyibs dang kha dog gi ngo bo nyid rnam pa bshad pa las kha dog kyang yin dbyibs kyang yin zhes bya ba des ji ltar bshad /
analyzed: thams cad yod par smra ba dbyibs dang kha dog gi ngo bo nyid rnam pa bshad pa las kha dog kyang yin dbyibs kyang yin zhes bya ba des ji ltar bshad /
translated: How do the Sarvastivadins explain this in the Abhidharmakosa when it says, “That which is color is also shape”?

original: mdzod kyi bstan bcos las 'di'i dris pa dang ldan pa yod de /
analyzed: mdzod kyi bstan bcos las 'di'i dris pa dang ldan pa yod de /
translated: The treatise on the Abhidharmakośa asks:

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos de las ji ltar dngos po gcig pa kha dog dang dbyibs gnyi ga dang ldan pa yod /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos de las ji ltar dngos po gcig pa kha dog dang dbyibs gnyi ga dang ldan pa yod /
translated: How can one entity have both color and shape?

original: 'di gnyi ga dmigs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'di gnyi ga dmigs pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because both are observed.

original: de la yod ces bya ba yang shes pa yod pa'i don gyis yin gyi /
analyzed: de la yod ces bya ba yang shes pa yod pa'i don gyis yin gyi /
translated: The statement “It exists there” means that consciousness exists there,

original: yul yod pa'i don gyis ni ma yin no zhes 'byung ste /🔽thams cad yod par smra ba las lan du gnas gcig tu shes par 'dren mar skye ba'i phyir /🔽kha dog dang dbyibs zhes bya'i /
analyzed: yul yod pa'i don gyis ni ma yin no zhes 'byung ste / thams cad yod par smra ba las lan du gnas gcig tu shes par 'dren mar skye ba'i phyir / kha dog dang dbyibs zhes bya'i /
translated: but it does not mean that the object exists there.

original: dngos po gcig la yul gnyis yod pa'i don gyis ni ma yin no zhes bshad de /
analyzed: dngos po gcig la yul gnyis yod pa'i don gyis ni ma yin no zhes bshad de /
translated: The Vaibhasikas respond: The meaning of the statement “It exists there” is that consciousness arises in a way that is similar to the object, but it does not mean that two objects exist in one place.

original: slob dpon hyan tsang gis kyang 'di la brten nas 'di skad du bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: slob dpon hyan tsang gis kyang 'di la brten nas 'di skad du bshad pa yin no //
translated: The master Hlyan-tsan also explains this on the basis of that passage.

original: mu bzhi zhib tu bshad pa ni bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las 'byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: mu bzhi zhib tu bshad pa ni bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las 'byung ba bzhin no //
translated: The detailed explanation of the four possibilities is like that found in the great treatise on differentiation.

original: 'dir theg pa chen po'i gzhung dang sbyar na grangs mang nyung gis bstan pa yang bstan bcos rnams las mi mthun te /
analyzed: 'dir theg pa chen po'i gzhung dang sbyar na grangs mang nyung gis bstan pa yang bstan bcos rnams las mi mthun te /
translated: Here, if we apply the Mahayana scriptures, the treatises do not agree on the number of forms.

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las ni gzugs rnam pa nyi shu rtsa bzhi yod do zhes bshad de /
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las ni gzugs rnam pa nyi shu rtsa bzhi yod do zhes bshad de /
translated: The Levels of Yogic Deeds explains that there are twenty-four types of form.

original: de'i phyir de nyid las de yang rnam pa du mar yod de /
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid las de yang rnam pa du mar yod de /
translated: Therefore, it is of many types.

original: mdor na kha dog dang dbyibs dang rnam par rig byed do //
analyzed: mdor na kha dog dang dbyibs dang rnam par rig byed do //
translated: In brief, it is color, shape, and informative form.

original: kha dog ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: kha dog ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Color is as follows:

original: sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po dang / grib ma dang / nyi ma dang / snang ba dang / mun pa dang / sprin dang / du ba dang / rdul dang / khug rna dang / nam mkha' kha dog gcig pa'o //
analyzed: sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po dang / grib ma dang / nyi ma dang / snang ba dang / mun pa dang / sprin dang / du ba dang / rdul dang / khug rna dang / nam mkha' kha dog gcig pa'o //
translated: blue, yellow, red, white, shadow, sunlight, light, darkness, cloud, smoke, dust, and mist.

original: dbyibs ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dbyibs ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Shape is as follows:

original: ring po dang / thung du dang / lham pa dang / zlum po dang / rdul phra mo dang / rags pa dang / phya le ba dang / phya le ba ma yin pa dang / mthon po dang / dma' ba'o //
analyzed: ring po dang / thung du dang / lham pa dang / zlum po dang / rdul phra mo dang / rags pa dang / phya le ba dang / phya le ba ma yin pa dang / mthon po dang / dma' ba'o //
translated: long, short, square, round, fine, coarse, high, and low.

original: rnam par rig byed ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rnam par rig byed ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Informative form is as follows:

original: len pa dang / 'jog pa dang / bskum pa dang / @57a * //
analyzed: len pa dang / 'jog pa dang / bskum pa dang / @57a * //
translated: taking up, putting down, bending,

original: brkyang ba dang / 'greng ba dang / 'dug pa dang / nyal ba dang / 'gro ba dang / ldog pa dang / de la sogs pa'o zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: brkyang ba dang / 'greng ba dang / 'dug pa dang / nyal ba dang / 'gro ba dang / ldog pa dang / de la sogs pa'o zhes 'byung ste /
translated: and so on.

original: de ltar nyi shu rtsa bzhi yod mod kyi mu rnam pa bzhir rnam par dbye na /
analyzed: de ltar nyi shu rtsa bzhi yod mod kyi mu rnam pa bzhir rnam par dbye na /
translated: Although there are twenty-four, they are classified into four alternatives.

original: mu rnam pa gsum kho nar 'gyur te /🔽kha dog la dbyibs ma yin pa yang bcu gsum po dag go //
analyzed: mu rnam pa gsum kho nar 'gyur te / kha dog la dbyibs ma yin pa yang bcu gsum po dag go //
translated: There are only three alternatives.🔽There are thirteen that are color but not shape.

original: dbyibs yin la kha dog ma yin pa ni bcu po dag go //🔽kha dog kyang ma yin la dbyibs kyang ma yin pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dbyibs yin la kha dog ma yin pa ni bcu po dag go // kha dog kyang ma yin la dbyibs kyang ma yin pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: There are ten that are shape but not color.

original: rnam par rig byed do //
analyzed: rnam par rig byed do //
translated: There is one that is neither color nor shape, namely, informative form.

original: bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las kyang rnam pa nyi shu rtsa bzhi'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las kyang rnam pa nyi shu rtsa bzhi'o zhes bshad do //
translated: The Exposition of the Compendium of Abhidharma explains that there are twenty-four.

original: de'i phyir de nyid las kha dog gam /
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid las kha dog gam /
translated: Therefore it says:

original: dbyibs sam rnam par rig byed do //
analyzed: dbyibs sam rnam par rig byed do //
translated: Color, shape, and informative form.

original: de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is this:

original: sngon po dang ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po'o //
analyzed: sngon po dang ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po'o //
translated: blue, yellow, red, white, long, short, square, round, high, low, soft, rough, light, heavy, and the primary signs of the primary elements.

original: de lta bu la sogs pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de lta bu la sogs pa 'di lta ste /
translated: Such things as these are long and short,

original: ring po dang thung ngu dang / lham pa dang / zlum po dang / rags pa dang / phra ba dang / mtho ba dang / dma' ba dang / phya le ba dang / phya le ba ma yin pa dang / du ba dang sprin dang /
analyzed: ring po dang thung ngu dang / lham pa dang / zlum po dang / rags pa dang / phra ba dang / mtho ba dang / dma' ba dang / phya le ba dang / phya le ba ma yin pa dang / du ba dang sprin dang /
translated: square and round, gross and subtle, high and low, beautiful and ugly, smoke,

original: rdul dang / khug rna dang / 'od dang / grib ma dang / snang ba dang / mun pa dang / nam mkha' kha dog gcig pa 'am /
analyzed: rdul dang / khug rna dang / 'od dang / grib ma dang / snang ba dang / mun pa dang / nam mkha' kha dog gcig pa 'am /
translated: clouds, dust, and mist, light, shade, radiance, darkness, and the color of the🔽sky.

original: gzugs brnyan gyi gzugs so zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: gzugs brnyan gyi gzugs so zhes 'byung ste /
translated: Or it is the form of a reflection.

original: rnam par bshad pa las tshig tha dad pa 'dra yang don rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa dang mthun te /
analyzed: rnam par bshad pa las tshig tha dad pa 'dra yang don rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa dang mthun te /
translated: The explanation is similar to the Yogācārabhūmi, although the words🔽are different.

original: de'i phyir de las 'di lta bu la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i tshig smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de las 'di lta bu la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i tshig smos te /
translated: Therefore, the text says, “such things as these.”

original: stsogs pa zhes bya bas ni phyi ma du pa dang sprin la sogs pa'i tshig bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: stsogs pa zhes bya bas ni phyi ma du pa dang sprin la sogs pa'i tshig bsdus pa'o //
translated: The word “such” includes the later words “fog,” “clouds,” and so on.

original: gzugs brnyan gyi gzugs ni rnam par rig byed kyi gzugs so ;
analyzed: gzugs brnyan gyi gzugs ni rnam par rig byed kyi gzugs so ;
translated: The form of a reflection is the form of informative action.

original: / bstan bcos chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa las /
analyzed: / bstan bcos chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa las /
translated: The Abhidharma treatise called the Compendium of Various Dharmas explains:

original: gzugs ni nyi shu rtsa lnga yod do zhes bshad de /
analyzed: gzugs ni nyi shu rtsa lnga yod do zhes bshad de /
translated: “There are twenty-five kinds of form.”

original: mngon par skabs yod pas bsnan na'o //
analyzed: mngon par skabs yod pas bsnan na'o //
translated: This is said by adding the form that is not obstructed.

original: gzhan ni rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa dang mthun te /
analyzed: gzhan ni rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa dang mthun te /
translated: The other [explanation] is in agreement with the Yogācārabhūmi.

original: mu rnam pa bzhir dbye ba med pa yang /
analyzed: mu rnam pa bzhir dbye ba med pa yang /
translated: The four alternatives are not differentiated,

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa dang mthun pas don la 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa dang mthun pas don la 'gal ba med do //
translated: but since it is in agreement with the Yogācārabhūmi, there is no contradiction in the meaning.

original: rgya yongs su ma chad pas de'i tshad shin tu dpag bar dka' ba zhes bya ba 'dis ni gsum pa tshad phun sum tshogs pa yongs su bstan to //
analyzed: rgya yongs su ma chad pas de'i tshad shin tu dpag bar dka' ba zhes bya ba 'dis ni gsum pa tshad phun sum tshogs pa yongs su bstan to //
translated: “Because it is not limited, its extent is very difficult to fathom” explains the third, the perfection of extent.

original: slob dpon nye ba'i 'od kyis sngar don rnam pa gsum gyis de'i tshad shin tu dpag par dka' bar bshad la /
analyzed: slob dpon nye ba'i 'od kyis sngar don rnam pa gsum gyis de'i tshad shin tu dpag par dka' bar bshad la /
translated: The master Upālo previously explained that its extent is very difficult to fathom in terms of three topics.

original: phyis ni @57b zhing rnam pa gnyis kyi dbang du byas nas dpag par dka' ba rnam par 'byed de /
analyzed: phyis ni @57b zhing rnam pa gnyis kyi dbang du byas nas dpag par dka' ba rnam par 'byed de /
translated: Later, he differentiates the difficulty of fathoming it in terms of two kinds of fields.

original: de la don rnam pa gsum zhes bya ba yang kha cig ni de'i tshad kyi rgya mtha' med pa'i phyir dpag par dka'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de la don rnam pa gsum zhes bya ba yang kha cig ni de'i tshad kyi rgya mtha' med pa'i phyir dpag par dka'o zhes zer ro //
translated: As for the three meanings of “incalculable,” some say that it is difficult to measure because the extent of its size is limitless.

original: kha cig ni de'i tshad kyi mtha' med pas rgya yang shin tu dpag par dka'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kha cig ni de'i tshad kyi mtha' med pas rgya yang shin tu dpag par dka'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say that it is difficult to measure because the extent of its size is limitless.

original: don gsum pa ni phyogs bcu la brten nas dpag par dka' bar bshad de /
analyzed: don gsum pa ni phyogs bcu la brten nas dpag par dka' bar bshad de /
translated: The third meaning is explained as being difficult to measure in terms of the ten directions.

original: de'i phyir sangs rgyas sa'i 'grel ba las 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir sangs rgyas sa'i 'grel ba las 'di lta ste /
translated: Thus, the commentary on the stage of a buddha says:

original: gzhal med khang de'i tshad kyi rgya mtha' med pas dpag par dka' ba 'am /
analyzed: gzhal med khang de'i tshad kyi rgya mtha' med pas dpag par dka' ba 'am /
translated: It is difficult to measure because the extent of the size of that immeasurable mansion is limitless.

original: yang na gzhal med khang chen po de'i tshad kyi mtha' med pas /
analyzed: yang na gzhal med khang chen po de'i tshad kyi mtha' med pas /
translated: Or, because the extent of the size of that great immeasurable mansion is limitless,

original: rgya yang shin tu dpag par dka'o //
analyzed: rgya yang shin tu dpag par dka'o //
translated: its size is extremely difficult to measure.

original: gzhan yang shar phyogs la sogs pa'i phyogs cha med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan yang shar phyogs la sogs pa'i phyogs cha med pa'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, because it has no parts, such as an eastern direction,

original: ring po dang thung du la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyang dpag par dka'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: ring po dang thung du la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyang dpag par dka'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: it is difficult to measure in terms of such characteristics as long and short.

original: de la zhing rnam pa gnyis kyi dbang du byas nas dpag par dka' bar bstan pa yang /
analyzed: de la zhing rnam pa gnyis kyi dbang du byas nas dpag par dka' bar bstan pa yang /
translated: It is taught that it is difficult to measure in terms of two kinds of fields.

original: slob dpon gsum gyis bshad pa yang yod de /🔽de'i phyir sangs rgyas sa'i 'grel pa las kha cig ni 'di skad du /
analyzed: slob dpon gsum gyis bshad pa yang yod de / de'i phyir sangs rgyas sa'i 'grel pa las kha cig ni 'di skad du /
translated: There are three masters who explain this.🔽Therefore, the Buddha Land Treatise says, “Some say that the field of the Tathāgata’s enjoyment body is not of definite size.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i zhing ni gdul ba'i sems can gyi mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i zhing ni gdul ba'i sems can gyi mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du /
translated: In accordance with the aspirations of sentient beings to be trained,

original: res 'ga' rgya chen po res 'ga' rgya chung du ston par mdzad pas de'i tshad nges pa yang med do //
analyzed: res 'ga' rgya chen po res 'ga' rgya chung du ston par mdzad pas de'i tshad nges pa yang med do //
translated: sometimes it is shown to be vast and sometimes it is shown to be small.

original: yangs shing rgya chen po ston par mdzad kyang /
analyzed: yangs shing rgya chen po ston par mdzad kyang /
translated: Even though it is shown to be vast and extensive,

original: mtha' med pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: mtha' med pa ma yin gyi /
translated: it is not without limits.

original: 'on kyang sa'i mdun rol gyi byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi shes pa la sogs pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: 'on kyang sa'i mdun rol gyi byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi shes pa la sogs pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: However, in terms of the cognition and so on of bodhisattvas on the stages,

original: mtha' med pa dang / de'i tshad dpag par dka'o zhes gsungs pa yin no zhe'o //
analyzed: mtha' med pa dang / de'i tshad dpag par dka'o zhes gsungs pa yin no zhe'o //
translated: it is said to be limitless and its size is difficult to measure.”

original: yang kha cig na re de bzhin gshegs pa longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i zhing ni bskal ba grangs med pa gsum du dge ba'i rtsa ba mtha' med pa bsgrub pa las mngon par bsgrubs pas na /
analyzed: yang kha cig na re de bzhin gshegs pa longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i zhing ni bskal ba grangs med pa gsum du dge ba'i rtsa ba mtha' med pa bsgrub pa las mngon par bsgrubs pas na /
translated: Again, some say that the field of the Tathāgata’s enjoyment body is accomplished through the cultivation of limitless roots of virtue for three incalculable eons.

original: chos kyi dbyings dang mnyam ste /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings dang mnyam ste /
translated: It is equal to the dharma realm.

original: sa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis kyang de'i tshad dpag par mi spyod do //
analyzed: sa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis kyang de'i tshad dpag par mi spyod do //
translated: Even bodhisattvas abiding on the grounds and the tathāgatas cannot fathom its extent.

original: 'di ltar mtha' med pa'i phyir thog ma med pa'i dus ji lta ba bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar mtha' med pa'i phyir thog ma med pa'i dus ji lta ba bzhin no //
translated: Because it is limitless, it is like beginningless time.

original: yang dag pa'i don du na longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i zhing yang mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis yod de //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i don du na longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i zhing yang mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis yod de //
translated: In reality, the field of the enjoyment body is, in brief, of two kinds.

original: dang po ni nyid kyi longs spyod rdzogs pa'i zhing 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dang po ni nyid kyi longs spyod rdzogs pa'i zhing 'di lta ste /
translated: The first is one’s own enjoyment field, which is as follows.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams @58a * //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams @58a * //
translated: The tathāgatas

original: bskal ba grangs med pa gsum du dge ba'i rtsa ba mtha' med pa yongs su bsgoms pa las mngon par grub pas na /
analyzed: bskal ba grangs med pa gsum du dge ba'i rtsa ba mtha' med pa yongs su bsgoms pa las mngon par grub pas na /
translated: accomplish it through the cultivation of limitless roots of virtue for three incalculable eons.

original: chos kyi dbyings kun tu khyab ste /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kun tu khyab ste /
translated: The dharmadhatu is all-pervading.

original: nyid kyi chos kyi dgyes pa chen po bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nyid kyi chos kyi dgyes pa chen po bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate his own great delight in the Dharma,

original: dang por mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa nas phyi ma'i mtha' ji srid par rgyun mi 'chad cing 'gyur ba med de /
analyzed: dang por mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa nas phyi ma'i mtha' ji srid par rgyun mi 'chad cing 'gyur ba med de /
translated: he is not interrupted and does not change from the time of his initial perfect enlightenment until the end of time.

original: yon tan rnams ji lta ba bzhin no //
analyzed: yon tan rnams ji lta ba bzhin no //
translated: His qualities are just as they are.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyis kyang mthong bar mi nus kyi /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyis kyang mthong bar mi nus kyi /
translated: Even the bodhisattva-mahasattvas cannot see it,

original: thos pa tsam du zad do //
analyzed: thos pa tsam du zad do //
translated: they can only hear about it.

original: 'di ltar zhing yongs su dag pa de tshad med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhing yongs su dag pa de tshad med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that pure realm is immeasurable.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis gzigs mod kyi /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis gzigs mod kyi /
translated: The tathagatas do see it,

original: de'i tshad mtha' ni dpag par mi spyod do //
analyzed: de'i tshad mtha' ni dpag par mi spyod do //
translated: but its extent cannot be fathomed.

original: gnyis pa ni gzhan longs spyod rdzogs pa'i zhing ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni gzhan longs spyod rdzogs pa'i zhing ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The second is the pure realm of others' enjoyment.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor rnams kyis chos kyi dga' ba chen po la longs spyod cing spyod pa khyad par can sgrub tu gzhug pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor rnams kyis chos kyi dga' ba chen po la longs spyod cing spyod pa khyad par can sgrub tu gzhug pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to cause the bodhisattvas who are the retinue of the Tathagatas to enjoy the great delight of the Dharma and to practice the special conduct,

original: mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du res 'ga' khyad par can dang / res 'ga' dman pa dang res 'ga' rgya chen po dang / res 'ga' rgya chung du ston par mdzad de /
analyzed: mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du res 'ga' khyad par can dang / res 'ga' dman pa dang res 'ga' rgya chen po dang / res 'ga' rgya chung du ston par mdzad de /
translated: the Tathagatas sometimes teach the special, sometimes the inferior, sometimes the extensive, and sometimes the concise, in accordance with their aspirations.

original: 'gyur zhing nges pa med pas sprul pa'i zhing ji lta ba bzhin no //
analyzed: 'gyur zhing nges pa med pas sprul pa'i zhing ji lta ba bzhin no //
translated: Since they are changeable and uncertain, they are like emanated fields.

original: 'di ltar zhing yongs su dag pa de mtha' med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ltar zhing yongs su dag pa de mtha' med pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, because that pure field is limitless,

original: sa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis kyang de'i tshad dpag bar mi spyod do //
analyzed: sa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis kyang de'i tshad dpag bar mi spyod do //
translated: even the bodhisattvas abiding on the stages and the Tathagatas cannot fathom its extent.

original: sa'i mdun rol pa rnam pa gnyis kyi dbang du mdzad nas ni dpag par mi nus so zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sa'i mdun rol pa rnam pa gnyis kyi dbang du mdzad nas ni dpag par mi nus so zhes gsungs so //
translated: With regard to the two aspects of the stage, it is said to be unfathomable.

original: de ltar rnam pa gnyis kyi bye brag gi phyir rgya yongs su ma chad pas de'i tshad shin tu dpag par dka'o zhes gsungs pa yin no zhes 'byung ngo //🔽slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis kyang /
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa gnyis kyi bye brag gi phyir rgya yongs su ma chad pas de'i tshad shin tu dpag par dka'o zhes gsungs pa yin no zhes 'byung ngo // slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis kyang /
translated: Thus, because of the distinction of these two aspects, the measure of the Buddha's knowledge is very difficult to fathom, because it is not limited.

original: sangs rgyas sa'i 'grel pa las 'byung ba'i rnam pa gsum las rnam grangs dang po'i gnyis dang mthun par bshad do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas sa'i 'grel pa las 'byung ba'i rnam pa gsum las rnam grangs dang po'i gnyis dang mthun par bshad do //
translated: Master Niḥsvabhāva­vairocana explains this in accordance with the first two of the three aspects mentioned in the commentary on the Buddha level.

original: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis ni bshad pa ma mdzad de /
analyzed: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis ni bshad pa ma mdzad de /
translated: Master Vasubandhu does not explain it,

original: don go sla ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don go sla ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the meaning is easy to understand.

original: khams gsum pa las yang dag par 'das pa'i spyod yul zhes bya ba 'dis ni bzhi pa yul phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: khams gsum pa las yang dag par 'das pa'i spyod yul zhes bya ba 'dis ni bzhi pa yul phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
translated: The phrase the domain that transcends the three realms indicates the fourth perfection, the perfection of domain.

original: slob dpon nye ba'i 'od kyis byas pa'i 'grel pa las 'di ltar gzhal med khang chen po de'i gnas dang / phyogs dang @58b yul khams gsum po'i spyod yul las shin tu 'das pas ji ltar khams gsum pa dag pa ltar rang gi sa'i srid pa dag gir byas pa dang /
analyzed: slob dpon nye ba'i 'od kyis byas pa'i 'grel pa las 'di ltar gzhal med khang chen po de'i gnas dang / phyogs dang @58b yul khams gsum po'i spyod yul las shin tu 'das pas ji ltar khams gsum pa dag pa ltar rang gi sa'i srid pa dag gir byas pa dang /
translated: Since that great celestial mansion is beyond the domain of the three realms, it is not like the three realms, the three existences of one's own level,

original: dmigs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pas 'ching ba gnyis brtas par byed pa dang / de'i rnam par smin par byed pa dang / dbang gi 'bras bu gyur pa lta bu ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dmigs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pas 'ching ba gnyis brtas par byed pa dang / de'i rnam par smin par byed pa dang / dbang gi 'bras bu gyur pa lta bu ni ma yin te /
translated: or the two bonds that increase through focal objects and concomitance, or its fully ripened result, or its dominant result.

original: 'di ltar yongs su dag pa de khams gsum pa'i srid pa'i dbang gis yongs su bzung ba ma yin pa'i phyir dang / 'ching ba gnyis dang bral ba'i phyir dang / de'i rnam par smin pa dang / dbang gi 'bras bu ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ltar yongs su dag pa de khams gsum pa'i srid pa'i dbang gis yongs su bzung ba ma yin pa'i phyir dang / 'ching ba gnyis dang bral ba'i phyir dang / de'i rnam par smin pa dang / dbang gi 'bras bu ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, since that completely pure realm is not governed by the existence of the three realms, since it is free from the two bonds, and since it is not the fully ripened result or the dominant result of that,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa la sogs pa bzhin du ;
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa la sogs pa bzhin du ;
translated: it is like nirvana and so on.

original: khams gsum pa'i rnam par smin pa'i sa las shin tu 'das pa yin no zhes bshad de /
analyzed: khams gsum pa'i rnam par smin pa'i sa las shin tu 'das pa yin no zhes bshad de /
translated: It is explained that it is utterly beyond the stage of karmic maturation in the three realms.

original: khams bco brgyad dang sbyar nas phan tshun 'dri zhing rnam par dbye ba dang / ldan mi ldan pa la sogs pa ni sangs rgyas kyi sa'i 'grel pa dang / zhing yongs su dag pa bstan pa las rgya cher bshad pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: khams bco brgyad dang sbyar nas phan tshun 'dri zhing rnam par dbye ba dang / ldan mi ldan pa la sogs pa ni sangs rgyas kyi sa'i 'grel pa dang / zhing yongs su dag pa bstan pa las rgya cher bshad pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The mutual questions and distinctions in connection with the eighteen elements, as well as the possession and non-possession, should be understood in detail according to the commentary on the Buddha Land Sutra and the teaching on the pure land.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa bla ma'i dge ba'i rtsa ba las byung ba zhes bya ba 'dis ni lnga pa rgyu phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa bla ma'i dge ba'i rtsa ba las byung ba zhes bya ba 'dis ni lnga pa rgyu phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
translated: This line arising from the supramundane roots of virtue of the guru shows the fifth, the perfection of cause.

original: slob dpon nye ba'i 'od kyis byas pa'i 'grel pa las /
analyzed: slob dpon nye ba'i 'od kyis byas pa'i 'grel pa las /
translated: In the commentary written by Master Upadhana:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this.

original: gzhal med khang chen po de 'jig rten las 'das pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi rjes la thob pa'i ye shes kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba las rgyu byas pa las mngon par byung bas rgyu med pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: gzhal med khang chen po de 'jig rten las 'das pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi rjes la thob pa'i ye shes kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba las rgyu byas pa las mngon par byung bas rgyu med pa yang ma yin /
translated: Since that great celestial palace arises from the roots of virtue of supramundane non-conceptual wisdom and the wisdom attained after that, it is not causeless.

original: dbang phyug chen po la sogs pa'i rgyu las kyang ma yin no //🔽ji ltar na zhing yongs su dag pa khams gsum pa las shin tu dag pa /
analyzed: dbang phyug chen po la sogs pa'i rgyu las kyang ma yin no // ji ltar na zhing yongs su dag pa khams gsum pa las shin tu dag pa /
translated: Nor is it from a cause such as the great lord, etc.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi rjes la thob pa dag pa 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi rnam par smin pa'i rgyu byed ce na /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi rjes la thob pa dag pa 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi rnam par smin pa'i rgyu byed ce na /
translated: How does the pure field act as the cause of the pure dharmas of the world transcending, non-discriminating knowledge and the subsequently attained pure worldly knowledge, which are completely purified from the three realms?

original: de'i rnam par smin pa'i rgyu byed do zhes ni mi brjod do //
analyzed: de'i rnam par smin pa'i rgyu byed do zhes ni mi brjod do //
translated: It is not said that it acts as the cause of their maturation.

original: rgyu gzhan las de 'byung bar bstan te /
analyzed: rgyu gzhan las de 'byung bar bstan te /
translated: It is taught that they arise from other causes.

original: ji ltar sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i phyogs 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog gi rgyu byed pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i phyogs 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog gi rgyu byed pa bzhin no //
translated: Just as the mundane supreme factors of virtue, which are the side of perseverance for the knowledge of the dharma with regard to suffering, act as the cause of the knowledge of the dharma with regard to suffering.

original: 'di ni rang bzhin gyis rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi rjes la thob pa zag pa med pa'i dge ba'i chos kyi sa bon bskal ba grangs med pa gsum du mngon par bsgrubs nas 'phel zhing rgya chen por gyur pas zhing yongs su dag pa 'di
analyzed: 'di ni rang bzhin gyis rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi rjes la thob pa zag pa med pa'i dge ba'i chos kyi sa bon bskal ba grangs med pa gsum du mngon par bsgrubs nas 'phel zhing rgya chen por gyur pas zhing yongs su dag pa 'di
translated: This is the attainment subsequent to the naturally nonconceptual wisdom. It is the seed of the uncontaminated virtuous dharmas that has been accomplished for three incalculable eons and has increased and become vast.🔽

original: mngon du snang bar @59a * //🔽'gyur ba'i rgyu byed do //
analyzed: mngon du snang bar @59a * // 'gyur ba'i rgyu byed do //
translated: This is the cause for the manifestation of the pure land, because it is the seed of the uncontaminated wholesome qualities that are attained subsequently to the nonconceptual wisdom that is naturally pure, which has been cultivated for three incalculable eons and has increased and become vast.

original: de la rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes ni 'jig rten las 'das pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes ni 'jig rten las 'das pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The nonconceptual wisdom is called supramundane.

original: rjes las thob pa'i snga ma las 'das pa'i phyir bla ma zhes brjod de /
analyzed: rjes las thob pa'i snga ma las 'das pa'i phyir bla ma zhes brjod de /
translated: The subsequent attainment is called higher because it is higher than the former.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bla ma'i gang zag pa med pa'i dge ba'i rtsa bas 'dir 'byung ba'i rgyu byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bla ma'i gang zag pa med pa'i dge ba'i rtsa bas 'dir 'byung ba'i rgyu byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The cause for the manifestation of the pure land is the uncontaminated roots of virtue of the supramundane higher person.

original: yang rnam pa gcig tu na nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis 'phags pa'i lam ni 'jig rten las 'das pa zhes bya la /
analyzed: yang rnam pa gcig tu na nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis 'phags pa'i lam ni 'jig rten las 'das pa zhes bya la /
translated: Alternatively, the ārya path of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas is called supramundane.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba ni de dag las 'das pa'i phyir bla ma zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba ni de dag las 'das pa'i phyir bla ma zhes bya ste /
translated: The roots of virtue of the Tathagata are superior to those, and so he is called the guru.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi zhing yongs su dag pa 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par rig pa la mnga' ba'i zag pa med pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i rgyu byas nas rab tu skye'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi zhing yongs su dag pa 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par rig pa la mnga' ba'i zag pa med pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i rgyu byas nas rab tu skye'o //
translated: The roots of virtue of the Tathagatas are superior to those because they are the cause of the purification of the Buddha-fields.

original: kha cig ni bdag po'i rkyen las 'byung ste /
analyzed: kha cig ni bdag po'i rkyen las 'byung ste /
translated: Some say that the Buddha-fields arise from the dominant condition,

original: 'di ltar phyi rol gyi chos can gyi phyir ro zhe'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar phyi rol gyi chos can gyi phyir ro zhe'o //
translated: because they are external entities.

original: kha cig ni rgyu'i rkyen gyis 'byung ste /
analyzed: kha cig ni rgyu'i rkyen gyis 'byung ste /
translated: Some say that they arise from the causal condition,

original: nye bar bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nye bar bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are generated.

original: gal te de lta ma yin na rgyu dang rkyen med pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te de lta ma yin na rgyu dang rkyen med pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: If that were not so, they would be without cause and condition.

original: phyi rol gyi chos ma yin pa rnams phan tshun ltos na /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi chos ma yin pa rnams phan tshun ltos na /
translated: Because external entities are mutually dependent,

original: rgyu dang rkyen ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: they are not the cause and condition of each other.

original: phyi rol gyi chos thams cad ni nang gi chos yongs su bsgos pas rgyu byed de /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi chos thams cad ni nang gi chos yongs su bsgos pas rgyu byed de /
translated: All external entities are the cause of the purification of the Buddha-fields because they are imbued with the internal dharmas.

original: gal te de ltar phyi rol gyi chos rnams thun mong du yod pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar phyi rol gyi chos rnams thun mong du yod pa yin na /
translated: If external phenomena exist in common like this,

original: ji ltar sems can so so'i sa bon gyis lhan cig tu rgyu dang rkyen byas nas thun mong du 'bras bu gcig skyed par byed ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar sems can so so'i sa bon gyis lhan cig tu rgyu dang rkyen byas nas thun mong du 'bras bu gcig skyed par byed ce na /
translated: how is it that the seeds of individual sentient beings simultaneously act as causes and conditions to produce a single common effect?

original: 'di ltar sems can rgyu chung dus chos rgya chen po dpag par mi nus te /
analyzed: 'di ltar sems can rgyu chung dus chos rgya chen po dpag par mi nus te /
translated: In this way, when the causes of sentient beings are small, the phenomena that are their effects are vast and cannot be measured.

original: ci'i phyir phyi rol gyi dngos po rnams rdul phra rab la sogs pa las mngon par grub cing yang dag pa'i ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir phyi rol gyi dngos po rnams rdul phra rab la sogs pa las mngon par grub cing yang dag pa'i ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin na /
translated: Why is it that external things are not established from subtle particles and so on and do not have a real essence?

original: de ni rgyu mang po las thun mong du mngon par 'grub pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni rgyu mang po las thun mong du mngon par 'grub pa yin te /
translated: They are commonly established from many causes.

original: sems can gyi rnam par rig pa tha dad pa so so nas gnas gcig pa lta bur gyur nas gcig la gcig sgrib par mi byed de /
analyzed: sems can gyi rnam par rig pa tha dad pa so so nas gnas gcig pa lta bur gyur nas gcig la gcig sgrib par mi byed de /
translated: The different consciousnesses of sentient beings do not obscure each other, as if they were in the same place.

original: ji ltar mar me mang po'i 'od dang / skye bo mang po'i rmi lam lta bur rgyu'i rnam pa mtshungs pas 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid dang 'dra yang gnas ni tha dad de /
analyzed: ji ltar mar me mang po'i 'od dang / skye bo mang po'i rmi lam lta bur rgyu'i rnam pa mtshungs pas 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid dang 'dra yang gnas ni tha dad de /
translated: Just as the light of many lamps and the dreams of many people are similar in the aspect of the cause, and are similar in the characteristics of the result, but the locations are different,

original: btags pa tsam du thun mong ngo zhes brjod kyang yang dag par so so tha dad do //
analyzed: btags pa tsam du thun mong ngo zhes brjod kyang yang dag par so so tha dad do //
translated: although it is said that the commonality is merely nominal, in reality they are distinct.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi zhing yongs su dag pa yang de bzhin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi zhing yongs su dag pa yang de bzhin te /
translated: The same is true of the completely purified fields of the Tathagatas.

original: so so'i rnam par rig pa gyur nas chos kyi dbyings kun tu khyab cing gnas gcig 'dra bar snang @59b bas thun mong zhes brjod pa yin no zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: so so'i rnam par rig pa gyur nas chos kyi dbyings kun tu khyab cing gnas gcig 'dra bar snang @59b bas thun mong zhes brjod pa yin no zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: When the individual representations are transformed, they pervade the entire Dharma realm and appear as the same in one location, so it is said to be common.

original: shin tu rnam par dag cing dbang bsgyur ba'i rnam par rig pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba 'dis ni drug pa 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa bstan te /
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag cing dbang bsgyur ba'i rnam par rig pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba 'dis ni drug pa 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa bstan te /
translated: This is called the characteristic of the extremely pure and controlled representation. This shows the sixth, the perfection of the result.

original: slob dpon nye ba'i 'od kyis byas pa'i 'grel pa las 'di ltar gzhal med khang chen po de ni shin tu rnam par dag cing dbang bsgyur ba /
analyzed: slob dpon nye ba'i 'od kyis byas pa'i 'grel pa las 'di ltar gzhal med khang chen po de ni shin tu rnam par dag cing dbang bsgyur ba /
translated: That great immeasurable mansion is extremely pure and controlled,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i zag pa med pa'i thugs kyi ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid byed de /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i zag pa med pa'i thugs kyi ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid byed de /
translated: characterized by the essence of the Tathagata's undefiled mind.

original: rnam par rig pa tsam du zad pa'i phyir rnam par rig pa las ma gtogs par rin po che la sogs pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par rig pa tsam du zad pa'i phyir rnam par rig pa las ma gtogs par rin po che la sogs pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Because it is merely consciousness, apart from consciousness there are no jewels and so forth.

original: de ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi thugs yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: de ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi thugs yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: That is the complete purity of the Tathagatas' minds.

original: de ltar rin po che la sogs pa lta bur snang ba yang /
analyzed: de ltar rin po che la sogs pa lta bur snang ba yang /
translated: Thus, the appearance as jewels and so forth

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i me long lta bu'i ye shes dang / mtshungs par ldan pa'i rnam par rig pa yongs su dag pa sngon bdag la phan 'dogs pa'i zag pa med pa'i zhing yongs su dag pa'i sa bon mngon par bsgrub pa'i rgyu dang rkyen gyi mthu'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i me long lta bu'i ye shes dang / mtshungs par ldan pa'i rnam par rig pa yongs su dag pa sngon bdag la phan 'dogs pa'i zag pa med pa'i zhing yongs su dag pa'i sa bon mngon par bsgrub pa'i rgyu dang rkyen gyi mthu'i phyir /
translated: is the complete purity of consciousness associated with the Tathagata's mirror-like wisdom, due to the power of the cause and conditions of establishing the seed of the completely pure undefiled field that previously benefited oneself.

original: dus thams cad dang / gnas thams cad du mngon par 'du mdzad pa la mi ltos par rang gi ngang gis rin po che sna tshogs kyi bkod pa /
analyzed: dus thams cad dang / gnas thams cad du mngon par 'du mdzad pa la mi ltos par rang gi ngang gis rin po che sna tshogs kyi bkod pa /
translated: At all times and in all places, without any need for deliberate effort, the natural radiance of the ground of being manifests as the array of various precious things.

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing dang nyid kyi longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i gnas byed pa lta bur gyur par snang ngo ;
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing dang nyid kyi longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i gnas byed pa lta bur gyur par snang ngo ;
translated: In all times and in all places, without regard to manifest activity, it appears as if it were the natural abode of the perfect enjoyment body of the Buddha and of the array of various jewels.

original: / gzhan la phan btags pa'i zag pa med pa'i zhing yongs su dag pa'i sa bon gyi rgyu dang rkyen gyi stobs kyi phyir ni sa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ched du ji ltar 'os pa bzhin du zhing yongs su dag pa rgya chen
analyzed: / gzhan la phan btags pa'i zag pa med pa'i zhing yongs su dag pa'i sa bon gyi rgyu dang rkyen gyi stobs kyi phyir ni sa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ched du ji ltar 'os pa bzhin du zhing yongs su dag pa rgya chen
translated: For the sake of the bodhisattvas on the stages, it is the cause and condition of the seed of the pure land of the uncontaminated benefit of others.🔽It is the great abode of the perfect enjoyment body of the Buddha, because it manifests as the pure land, whether vast or small,

original: po 'am / rgya chung ngu'am /🔽khyad par can nam khyad par can ma yin pa dag ston par mdzad pas kyang gzhan longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i gnas byed pa lta bur snang ngo //
analyzed: po 'am / rgya chung ngu'am /🔽khyad par can nam khyad par can ma yin pa dag ston par mdzad pas kyang gzhan longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i gnas byed pa lta bur snang ngo //
translated: special or not special, in whatever way is appropriate.

original: 'di ltar sa dang po'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ched du ni ji ltar 'os pa bzhin du rgya chung ngu dang / dman pa dag ston par mdzad la /
analyzed: 'di ltar sa dang po'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ched du ni ji ltar 'os pa bzhin du rgya chung ngu dang / dman pa dag ston par mdzad la /
translated: Thus, for the sake of the bodhisattvas on the first stage, he teaches the Dharma in a small way, in a lowly way, as is appropriate.

original: de bzhin du gong sa gong du sa bcu pa dag la ni rgya chen po dang khyad par can dag ston te /
analyzed: de bzhin du gong sa gong du sa bcu pa dag la ni rgya chen po dang khyad par can dag ston te /
translated: Similarly, on the higher stages, he teaches the Dharma in a great way, in a special way, for the bodhisattvas on the tenth stage.

original: sa de'i dang po dang bar ma dang / tha ma la sogs pa yang de bzhin du zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sa de'i dang po dang bar ma dang / tha ma la sogs pa yang de bzhin du zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: The same is true of the first, middle, and last of those stages.

original: slob dpon dbyig gnyen dang ngo bo nyid med kyis kyang /
analyzed: slob dpon dbyig gnyen dang ngo bo nyid med kyis kyang /
translated: The masters Vasubandhu and Asvabhāva also explain it in this way.

original: de las rnam pa gzhan du bshad pa med do //🔽de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas zhes bya ba 'dis ni bdun pa @60a * //
analyzed: de las rnam pa gzhan du bshad pa med do // de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas zhes bya ba 'dis ni bdun pa @60a * //
translated: There is no other explanation.

original: bdag po phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: bdag po phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
translated: The phrase “the abode of the Tathāgatas” indicates the perfection of the master.

original: slob dpon nye ba'i 'od kyis byas pa'i 'grel pa las 'di ltar gzhal med khang chen po de sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnga' bdag yin gyis gzhan ni ma yin te /
analyzed: slob dpon nye ba'i 'od kyis byas pa'i 'grel pa las 'di ltar gzhal med khang chen po de sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnga' bdag yin gyis gzhan ni ma yin te /
translated: The commentary composed by the master Upasena states that the great palace belongs to the Lord Buddha and not to anyone else.

original: khyad par du gyur pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das nyag gcig mnga' ba yin no //
analyzed: khyad par du gyur pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das nyag gcig mnga' ba yin no //
translated: The Blessed One alone possesses it, because it is distinctive.

original: yang na bcom ldan 'das nyag gcig gis byin gyis brlabs nas bzhes pa yin gyis gzhan gyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yang na bcom ldan 'das nyag gcig gis byin gyis brlabs nas bzhes pa yin gyis gzhan gyis ni ma yin no //
translated: Or else, the Blessed One alone accepts it, having blessed it, but not others.

original: nyid kyis longs spyod pa'i zhing chos kyi dbyings kun du khyab pa yin mod kyi /
analyzed: nyid kyis longs spyod pa'i zhing chos kyi dbyings kun du khyab pa yin mod kyi /
translated: The field of enjoyment is the universal realm of Dharma, which is enjoyed by the Buddha himself.

original: rang rang gis sprul pa yin pas so so nas mnga' bdag mdzad de /
analyzed: rang rang gis sprul pa yin pas so so nas mnga' bdag mdzad de /
translated: But since it is emanated by each of the Buddhas, each of them is the master of it.

original: gcig la gcig sgrib pa yang med do //
analyzed: gcig la gcig sgrib pa yang med do //
translated: And there is no mutual obstruction.

original: gzhan longs spyod pa'i zhing de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi sprul pa yin yang /
analyzed: gzhan longs spyod pa'i zhing de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi sprul pa yin yang /
translated: The field of enjoyment of others is the emanation of the Tathāgatas.

original: mtshan nyid gcig tu gyur pas mtshan nyid kyi sku gcig gis yongs su bzhengs nas mnga' bdag mdzad de /
analyzed: mtshan nyid gcig tu gyur pas mtshan nyid kyi sku gcig gis yongs su bzhengs nas mnga' bdag mdzad de /
translated: But since it is of the same nature, it is erected by the body of nature, and they are the masters of it.

original: phan tshun sgrib pa yang med do zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: phan tshun sgrib pa yang med do zhes 'byung ste /
translated: And there is no mutual obstruction.

original: slob dpon dbyig gnyen dang ngo bo nyid med kyis rnam pa gzhan du bshad pa ni med do //
analyzed: slob dpon dbyig gnyen dang ngo bo nyid med kyis rnam pa gzhan du bshad pa ni med do //
translated: There is no other explanation of this by Master Vasubandhu and by Asvabhāva.

original: byang chub sems dpa' chen po'i dge 'dun yongs su 'dus pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni brgyad pa phyogs phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' chen po'i dge 'dun yongs su 'dus pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni brgyad pa phyogs phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
translated: This phrase, “the assembly of great bodhisattvas gathered together,” indicates the eighth perfection, direction.

original: slob dpon nye ba'i 'od kyis byas pa'i 'grel pa las 'di ltar gzhal med khang chen po de na rtag par rgyun du byang chub sems dpa' chen po'i dge 'dun tshad med pa dag lhan cig tu 'dus nas 'gro bar 'os pa gang yin pa de dag ni
analyzed: slob dpon nye ba'i 'od kyis byas pa'i 'grel pa las 'di ltar gzhal med khang chen po de na rtag par rgyun du byang chub sems dpa' chen po'i dge 'dun tshad med pa dag lhan cig tu 'dus nas 'gro bar 'os pa gang yin pa de dag ni
translated: As the master Udbhatasiddhasvamin’s commentary explains, “In that great palace, the assembly of great bodhisattvas is always gathered together, and they are the ones who are worthy to go there.

original: phyogs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phyogs zhes bya'o //
translated: That is called the direction.

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' chen po'i dge 'dun grangs med pa rtag par 'ong zhing phyogs byed pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' chen po'i dge 'dun grangs med pa rtag par 'ong zhing phyogs byed pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Because the assembly of great bodhisattvas, countless in number, always comes and acts as the direction,

original: dgra bo rnams kyis gnod par byed pa'ang mi mnga' ste /
analyzed: dgra bo rnams kyis gnod par byed pa'ang mi mnga' ste /
translated: they are not harmed by enemies.

original: nyan thos la sogs pa la ni de lta bu med do //
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa la ni de lta bu med do //
translated: But the disciples and so on do not have that.

original: 'di ltar sa dang po'i byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor rnams de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis bdag la phan 'dogs pa'i longs spyod pa'i zhing yongs su dag par mi nus mod kyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar sa dang po'i byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor rnams de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis bdag la phan 'dogs pa'i longs spyod pa'i zhing yongs su dag par mi nus mod kyi /
translated: Thus, the retinue of bodhisattvas on the first level are not able to purify the fields that are enjoyed by the tathāgatas for the benefit of themselves.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi thugs rje'i dbang gis rang gi rnam par rig pa las byang chub sems dpa' de dag la ji lta ba bzhin du /🔽zhing rags pa gya nom pa byang chub sems dpa' rang gi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / smon lam gyi stobs ji lta ba bzhin du rang gi rnam par rig pa la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi thugs rje'i dbang gis rang gi rnam par rig pa las byang chub sems dpa' de dag la ji lta ba bzhin du / zhing rags pa gya nom pa byang chub sems dpa' rang gi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / smon lam gyi stobs ji lta ba bzhin du rang gi rnam par rig pa la /
translated: However, by the power of the compassion of the tathāgatas, those bodhisattvas perceive in their own consciousnesses the signs of the pure fields that are generated by the tathāgatas,🔽which are like the pure fields that are generated by the power of the roots of virtue and prayers of the bodhisattvas themselves.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis bskyed pa @60b 'dra ba'i zhing yongs su dag pa'i rgyu mtshan rab tu snang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis bskyed pa @60b 'dra ba'i zhing yongs su dag pa'i rgyu mtshan rab tu snang ngo //
translated: These pure fields are like the pure fields that are generated by the power of the roots of virtue and prayers of the bodhisattvas themselves.

original: so so nas rang gi sems de ltar snang yang gnas gcig tu dbyibs kyi mtshan nyid mtshungs pa dang zhing gcig tu lhan cig tu 'dus par gyur to snyam du sems so zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: so so nas rang gi sems de ltar snang yang gnas gcig tu dbyibs kyi mtshan nyid mtshungs pa dang zhing gcig tu lhan cig tu 'dus par gyur to snyam du sems so zhes 'byung ste /
translated: Each one thinks, “My mind appears in that way, but it has the same shape as one place and it is assembled together in one place.”

original: 'di ltar sa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi zhing yongs su dag pa de zag pa dang bcas pa dang / 'on te zag pa med pa zhig yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don ni zhib tu de nyid las bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar sa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi zhing yongs su dag pa de zag pa dang bcas pa dang / 'on te zag pa med pa zhig yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don ni zhib tu de nyid las bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: Thus, the meaning of the question, “Is the complete purification of the realm of those bodhisattvas who abide on the stages with or without outflows?” and so on, is explained in detail in that text.

original: slob dpon dbyig gnyen dang ngo bo nyid med kyis de las rnam pa gzhan du bshad pa ni med do /🔽// / bam po drug pa /
analyzed: slob dpon dbyig gnyen dang ngo bo nyid med kyis de las rnam pa gzhan du bshad pa ni med do /🔽// / bam po drug pa /
translated: There is no other explanation of this in the texts of Master Vasubandhu and Asvabhāva.

original: lha dang klu dang gnod sbyin dang dri za dang lha ma yin dang nam mkha' lding dang / mi 'am ci dang lto 'phye chen po dang mi dang mi ma yin pa la sogs pa tshad med pa rtag par rnam par rgyu ba zhes pa 'dis ni dgu pa zhabs 'bring ba phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa dang sbyar na /
analyzed: lha dang klu dang gnod sbyin dang dri za dang lha ma yin dang nam mkha' lding dang / mi 'am ci dang lto 'phye chen po dang mi dang mi ma yin pa la sogs pa tshad med pa rtag par rnam par rgyu ba zhes pa 'dis ni dgu pa zhabs 'bring ba phun sum tshogs pa bstan to // shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa dang sbyar na /
translated: The phrase incomparable, and so on, indicates the ninth perfection, that is, the perfection of attendants.

original: lha ni rnam pa gsum yod do zhes bshad de /🔽de la ming gi lha ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: lha ni rnam pa gsum yod do zhes bshad de / de la ming gi lha ni 'di lta ste /
translated: When this is applied to the commentary on the perfection of wisdom, it is said, There are three kinds of gods.

original: 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po la sogs pa'o //🔽skye ba'i lha ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po la sogs pa'o // skye ba'i lha ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Among them, the nominal gods are such as the universal monarch, and so on.

original: rgyal chen rigs bzhi'i lha nas srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar gyi lha rnams so //
analyzed: rgyal chen rigs bzhi'i lha nas srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar gyi lha rnams so //
translated: The gods of birth are the gods from the Caturmaharajakayika gods up to the Bhavagra gods.

original: rnam par dag pa'i lha ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i lha ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The pure gods are the noble ones.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi sku dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / dgra bcom pa rnams so zhes bshad do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi sku dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / dgra bcom pa rnams so zhes bshad do //
translated: the Dharma body of the Buddha, the bodhisattvas, the pratyekabuddhas, and the arhats.🔽Moreover, the same text says:

original: gzhan yang de nyid las lha ni rnam pa bzhi yod de /
analyzed: gzhan yang de nyid las lha ni rnam pa bzhi yod de /
translated: There are four kinds of gods:

original: ming gi lha ni ji ltar da ltar gyi mi'i rgyal po la lha'i bu zhes brjod pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ming gi lha ni ji ltar da ltar gyi mi'i rgyal po la lha'i bu zhes brjod pa lta bu'o //
translated: name gods, like the present king of humans who is called the son of a god;

original: skye ba'i lha ni rgyal chen ris bzhi'i lha nas 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi bar gyi lha rnams so //
analyzed: skye ba'i lha ni rgyal chen ris bzhi'i lha nas 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi bar gyi lha rnams so //
translated: birth gods, from the gods of the Four Great Kings up to the gods of Neither Perception nor Non-perception;

original: rnam par dag pa'i lha ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i lha ni 'di lta ste /
translated: pure gods, namely

original: mi'i gnas 'dir 'phags pa rnams 'byung ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: mi'i gnas 'dir 'phags pa rnams 'byung ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: those who appear in this human realm as noble ones;

original: skye ba yongs su dag pa'i lha ni khams gsum pa'i lha'i nang nas 'phags pa rnams 'byung ba gang yin pa'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: skye ba yongs su dag pa'i lha ni khams gsum pa'i lha'i nang nas 'phags pa rnams 'byung ba gang yin pa'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: and gods of pure birth, namely those who appear as noble ones among the gods of the three realms.

original: lha rnam pa gsum dang rnam pa bzhi las mi dang skye ba'i lha rnams ni lha zhes bya ste /
analyzed: lha rnam pa gsum dang rnam pa bzhi las mi dang skye ba'i lha rnams ni lha zhes bya ste /
translated: Among the three and four kinds of gods, humans and birth gods are called gods.

original: de'i phyir dam pa'i chos padma dkar po'i mdo las /
analyzed: de'i phyir dam pa'i chos padma dkar po'i mdo las /
translated: Therefore, the Sutra of the White Lotus of the Excellent Teaching states:

original: nga yi zhing 'di shin tu bde //
analyzed: nga yi zhing 'di shin tu bde //
translated: This realm of mine is very happy,

original: lha rnams kyis ni rtag tu gang //
analyzed: lha rnams kyis ni rtag tu gang //
translated: Always filled with gods.

original: zhes gsungs pa dang / gzhan yang sngon gyi las bstan pa'i @61a * //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa dang / gzhan yang sngon gyi las bstan pa'i @61a * //
translated: Moreover, the Sutra Teaching Past Deeds states:🔽The gods of the formless realm are also called gods because they gather in the retinue of the gods.🔽Moreover, the Sutra Requested by Shariputra states:

original: mdo las / gzugs med pa'i lha rnams 'khor 'dus par song ba'i phyir yang lha'i 'khor zhes bya'o zhes gsungs pa dang / gzhan yang sh'a ri'i bus zhus pa'i mdo las lha rnams bsrung ba'i lha la yang lha zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: mdo las / gzugs med pa'i lha rnams 'khor 'dus par song ba'i phyir yang lha'i 'khor zhes bya'o zhes gsungs pa dang / gzhan yang sh'a ri'i bus zhus pa'i mdo las lha rnams bsrung ba'i lha la yang lha zhes gsungs so //
translated: Even the gods who protect the gods are called gods.

original: klu ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: klu ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: There are four types of nagas:

original: lha'i klu ni lha'i gzhal med rnams 'dzin cing lhung bar mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: lha'i klu ni lha'i gzhal med rnams 'dzin cing lhung bar mi byed pa'o //
translated: divine nagas who hold the divine palaces and prevent them from falling;

original: mi'i klu ni sprin 'byin cing char 'bebs pa'o //
analyzed: mi'i klu ni sprin 'byin cing char 'bebs pa'o //
translated: human nagas who produce clouds and cause rain;

original: sprul gyi klu ni sa dang rgya mtsho yongs su 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: sprul gyi klu ni sa dang rgya mtsho yongs su 'dzin pa'o //
translated: snake nagas who hold the earth and oceans;

original: rgyal po'i klu ni rgyal po'i rin po che'i bar mdzod bsrung ba'o //
analyzed: rgyal po'i klu ni rgyal po'i rin po che'i bar mdzod bsrung ba'o //
translated: and king nagas who guard the king's treasury of jewels.

original: gnod sbyin zhes bya ba ni khro gtum che pa 'am /🔽dpa' ba 'am /
analyzed: gnod sbyin zhes bya ba ni khro gtum che pa 'am / dpa' ba 'am /
translated: Yakṣa means one who is very wrathful,🔽or one who is heroic,

original: 'jigs su rung ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'jigs su rung ba zhes bya'o //
translated: or one who is terrifying.

original: de yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: They are of three types:

original: sa la gnas pa dang / nam mkha' la gnas pa dang / lha'i nang na gnas shing lha'i g-yog byed pa'o //
analyzed: sa la gnas pa dang / nam mkha' la gnas pa dang / lha'i nang na gnas shing lha'i g-yog byed pa'o //
translated: those who live on the earth, those who live in the sky, and those who live among the gods and serve the gods.

original: dri za zhes bya ba ni rol mo byed pa ste /
analyzed: dri za zhes bya ba ni rol mo byed pa ste /
translated: Gandharva means one who makes music.

original: dris 'tsho ba'i phyir dri za zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dris 'tsho ba'i phyir dri za zhes bya ste /
translated: They are called gandharva because they live on smell,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las 'di ni lha'i rol mo mkhan rnams kyi rjes su 'brang ba /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las 'di ni lha'i rol mo mkhan rnams kyi rjes su 'brang ba /
translated: because they are followers of the gods who make music in the heavens.

original: sems mnyen des shing bsod nams lha rnam pas chung ba ste /
analyzed: sems mnyen des shing bsod nams lha rnam pas chung ba ste /
translated: They have soft, gentle minds and are less meritorious than the gods.

original: rin po che sna bdun gyi ri'i bar na gnas pa'o //
analyzed: rin po che sna bdun gyi ri'i bar na gnas pa'o //
translated: They live between the mountains of the seven precious substances.

original: lha ma yin ni sgyu che zhing lha'i yang dag pa'i spyod pa med pa'i phyir lha ma yin zhes bya ste /
analyzed: lha ma yin ni sgyu che zhing lha'i yang dag pa'i spyod pa med pa'i phyir lha ma yin zhes bya ste /
translated: Asura means one who is very deceptive and does not have the correct practice of the gods.

original: ji ltar mi 'ga' zhig nyes par spyod pa la mi ma yin pa zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar mi 'ga' zhig nyes par spyod pa la mi ma yin pa zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: It is like when some people who engage in bad conduct are called non-humans.

original: de'i phyir rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las lha ma yin rnams kyang lha'i 'gro bas bsdus par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las lha ma yin rnams kyang lha'i 'gro bas bsdus par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the Levels of Yogic Deeds says, “You should understand that the demigods are included in the class of gods.”

original: 'on kyang de dag ni sgyu can 'drid pa'i bsam pa dang ldan pa sgyu dang g-yo'i spyod pa shas che ba yin te /🔽de bas na 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang de dag ni sgyu can 'drid pa'i bsam pa dang ldan pa sgyu dang g-yo'i spyod pa shas che ba yin te / de bas na 'di lta ste /
translated: However, they are deceitful and deceptive, and their behavior is mostly fraudulent and dishonest.🔽Therefore, they are not vessels for the virtuous teachings,

original: lha rnams bzhin du dkar po'i chos rnams kyi snod du gyur pa ma yin te /
analyzed: lha rnams bzhin du dkar po'i chos rnams kyi snod du gyur pa ma yin te /
translated: as are the gods.

original: de'i phyir ched 'ga' zhig mdo gzhan ngag las 'gro ba tha dad pa'i bstan pas bstan to //🔽de dag lha nyid yin na lha'i chos yang dag par blangs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir ched 'ga' zhig mdo gzhan ngag las 'gro ba tha dad pa'i bstan pas bstan to // de dag lha nyid yin na lha'i chos yang dag par blangs te /
translated: Therefore, in some sutras they are taught as a separate realm,🔽but since they are not gods, they do not take up the practices of gods.

original: gnas pa ma yin pas de'i phyir lha ma yin rnams zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gnas pa ma yin pas de'i phyir lha ma yin rnams zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Therefore, they are called demigods.”

original: yang na the tshom skye ba'i lha zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yang na the tshom skye ba'i lha zhes bya ste /
translated: Or, they are called gods of doubt.

original: de'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las lha ma yin ni lha'i bde ba nyams su myong ba mi nyams pa lha rnams kyis byin gyis brlabs pas sprul pa rnams dga' mgur byed pas /
