analyzed: de'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las lha ma yin ni lha'i bde ba nyams su myong ba mi nyams pa lha rnams kyis byin gyis brlabs pas sprul pa rnams dga' mgur byed pas /
translated: The asuras experience the bliss of the gods without decline. Since they are emanations blessed by the gods, they enjoy themselves as they wish.

original: de'i phyir mi rnams the tshom za ba'i tshig tu 'di lha yin nam ma @61b yin zhes zer ba'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir mi rnams the tshom za ba'i tshig tu 'di lha yin nam ma @61b yin zhes zer ba'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
translated: Therefore humans say, “Are they gods or not?”

original: yang na lus po che zhes kyang bya ste /
analyzed: yang na lus po che zhes kyang bya ste /
translated: Or they are called mahoragas.

original: de'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las lha ma yin rgya mtsho'i nang du 'greng ba'i tshe /
analyzed: de'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las lha ma yin rgya mtsho'i nang du 'greng ba'i tshe /
translated: Therefore the commentary to the perfection of wisdom states:

original: pus mo mi nub par sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams la blta'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: pus mo mi nub par sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams la blta'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: When the asuras stand in the ocean, their knees do not touch the water and they look at the gods of Trayastrimsa.

original: gzhan yang de nyid las mi sdug pa zhes kyang bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang de nyid las mi sdug pa zhes kyang bya ste /
translated: Also they are called asuras.

original: bu mo sha tsi 'ba' zhig byad bzhin bzang gi pha ming dang nye bshes bzhin mi sdug go //
analyzed: bu mo sha tsi 'ba' zhig byad bzhin bzang gi pha ming dang nye bshes bzhin mi sdug go //
translated: The daughter of the asura king, Shachi, has a beautiful face, but her father and relatives have ugly faces.

original: yang na skyes pa mi sdug la bud med byad bzhin bzang ba'i phyir yang mi sdug pa zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: yang na skyes pa mi sdug la bud med byad bzhin bzang ba'i phyir yang mi sdug pa zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Or else, they are called “ugly” because the males are ugly and the females are beautiful.

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa dang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa dang sbyar na lha ma yin ni lha'i 'gro bas bsdus par bshad do //
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa dang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa dang sbyar na lha ma yin ni lha'i 'gro bas bsdus par bshad do //
translated: According to the Yogācārabhūmi and the commentary on the Perfection of Wisdom, the demigods are explained as included in the realm of gods.

original: bstan bcos chos mngon pa'i ma mo las ni yi dags kyis bsdus par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: bstan bcos chos mngon pa'i ma mo las ni yi dags kyis bsdus par 'byung ngo //
translated: In the Abhidharma treatise, they are said to be included in the hungry ghosts.

original: chos yang dag par dran pa'i mdo las ni yi dags dang dud 'gro'i 'gro bas bsdus par gsungs so //
analyzed: chos yang dag par dran pa'i mdo las ni yi dags dang dud 'gro'i 'gro bas bsdus par gsungs so //
translated: In the Sūtra on the Correctly Remembering the Dharma, they are said to be included in the realms of hungry ghosts and animals.

original: g-ya'i mdo las ni lha dang yi dags dang dud 'gro rnam pa gsum gyis bsdus par bshad do //
analyzed: g-ya'i mdo las ni lha dang yi dags dang dud 'gro rnam pa gsum gyis bsdus par bshad do //
translated: In the Sūtra on the Owl, they are explained as included in the three types of gods, hungry ghosts, and animals.

original: lha ma yin de yang gnas kyi bye brag gis rnam pa lnga yod de /
analyzed: lha ma yin de yang gnas kyi bye brag gis rnam pa lnga yod de /
translated: Those demigods also exist in five different places.

original: gnas bstan pa'i mdo las ji skad du /
analyzed: gnas bstan pa'i mdo las ji skad du /
translated: As the Sūtra on the Teaching of the Abodes says:

original: de la dang po'i sa'i steng du gnas pa ste /
analyzed: de la dang po'i sa'i steng du gnas pa ste /
translated: “The first live on the surface of the earth.

original: mtshan ma sna tshogs kyi ri la lag na mtshon thogs nang gi 'og na gnas so //
analyzed: mtshan ma sna tshogs kyi ri la lag na mtshon thogs nang gi 'og na gnas so //
translated: They live in the interior of the mountain, holding weapons in their hands, on a mountain of various signs.

original: gnyis pa ni ri rab kyi byang phyogs rgya mtsho'i 'og dpag tshad stong 'das pa na /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni ri rab kyi byang phyogs rgya mtsho'i 'og dpag tshad stong 'das pa na /
translated: The second is 1,000 yojanas below the ocean north of Meru.

original: lha ma yin gyi rgyal po sgra gcan zin gnas so //
analyzed: lha ma yin gyi rgyal po sgra gcan zin gnas so //
translated: This is the abode of Rāhu, king of the asuras.

original: gsum pa ni sgra gcan gyi 'og dpag tshad nyi khri tshig stong 'das pa na lha ma yin gyi rgyal po rab brtan zhes bya ba gnas so zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: gsum pa ni sgra gcan gyi 'og dpag tshad nyi khri tshig stong 'das pa na lha ma yin gyi rgyal po rab brtan zhes bya ba gnas so zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: The third is 20,000 yojanas below Rāhu. This is the abode of the asura king Vemacitrin.

original: rab brtan gyi ma ni dang po lha las byung ba yin pa'i phyir lha dman pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rab brtan gyi ma ni dang po lha las byung ba yin pa'i phyir lha dman pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Since the mother of Vemacitrin first arose from the gods, she is called a lesser god.

original: bskal pa dang po chags pa'i tshe lha'i bu mo rnams rgya mtsho'i nang du lus bkrus pa las /
analyzed: bskal pa dang po chags pa'i tshe lha'i bu mo rnams rgya mtsho'i nang du lus bkrus pa las /
translated: When the first eon formed, the daughters of the gods bathed in the ocean.

original: chus de dag gi lus la reg pa dang / khu chu shor nas chu'i nang du lhung ba sha'i sgo nga gcig tu gyur to //
analyzed: chus de dag gi lus la reg pa dang / khu chu shor nas chu'i nang du lhung ba sha'i sgo nga gcig tu gyur to //
translated: When the water touched their bodies, their semen was emitted and fell into the water, becoming a single egg of flesh.

original: de lo brgya stong lon pa dang de las bu mo zhig byung ste /
analyzed: de lo brgya stong lon pa dang de las bu mo zhig byung ste /
translated: After a hundred thousand years, a daughter was born to her.

original: mgo dgu brgya dgu bcu rtsa dgu yod do //
analyzed: mgo dgu brgya dgu bcu rtsa dgu yod do //
translated: She had nine hundred and ninety-nine heads.

original: mgo la mig stong dang / kha dgu brgya dgu bcu rtsa dgu yod do //
analyzed: mgo la mig stong dang / kha dgu brgya dgu bcu rtsa dgu yod do //
translated: On each head were a thousand eyes and nine hundred and ninety-nine mouths.

original: khal ni so bzhi yod so'i steng du me byung ba ni lce 'bab pa 'dra'o //
analyzed: khal ni so bzhi yod so'i steng du me byung ba ni lce 'bab pa 'dra'o //
translated: Her load was four teeth, and on top of the teeth there was fire, like a falling tongue.

original: lag pa ni nyi shu rtsa bzhi'o //
analyzed: lag pa ni nyi shu rtsa bzhi'o //
translated: She had twenty-four hands.

original: rkang pa ni dgu brgya dgu bcu rtsa dgu yod do //
analyzed: rkang pa ni dgu brgya dgu bcu rtsa dgu yod do //
translated: She had nine hundred and ninety-nine feet.

original: bu mo de dus gzhan zhig na @62a * //🔽rgya mtsho'i nang du zhugs te /
analyzed: bu mo de dus gzhan zhig na @62a * // rgya mtsho'i nang du zhugs te /
translated: At another time,🔽that girl entered the ocean

original: rtsed mo byas pa las chu dangs ma de khung du zhugs pas /
analyzed: rtsed mo byas pa las chu dangs ma de khung du zhugs pas /
translated: and played. From the pure water entering her vagina,

original: sha'i sgo nga gcig btsas so //
analyzed: sha'i sgo nga gcig btsas so //
translated: a flesh egg was born.

original: lo brgya stong lon pa dang / rab brtan zhes bya ba byung ste /
analyzed: lo brgya stong lon pa dang / rab brtan zhes bya ba byung ste /
translated: After a hundred thousand years, a son named Sthira was born.

original: mgo ni dgu yod do //
analyzed: mgo ni dgu yod do //
translated: He had nine heads.

original: mgo la mig ni dgu stong yod do //
analyzed: mgo la mig ni dgu stong yod do //
translated: On each head were nine thousand eyes.

original: kha nas ni me 'bar ro //
analyzed: kha nas ni me 'bar ro //
translated: Fire blazed from his mouth.

original: lag pa ni dgu brgya dgu bcu'o //
analyzed: lag pa ni dgu brgya dgu bcu'o //
translated: He had nine hundred and ninety hands.

original: rkang pa ni brgyad yod do //
analyzed: rkang pa ni brgyad yod do //
translated: He had eight feet.

original: lus kyi tshad ni ri rab pas phyed kyis ring ste /
analyzed: lus kyi tshad ni ri rab pas phyed kyis ring ste /
translated: The size of their bodies is half the size of Mount Meru.

original: zas su sa zhag dang padma'i rtsa ba za'o //
analyzed: zas su sa zhag dang padma'i rtsa ba za'o //
translated: They eat mud and lotus roots.

original: phal cher ni lha rnams rtsod do zhes bshad de /
analyzed: phal cher ni lha rnams rtsod do zhes bshad de /
translated: They mostly fight with the gods.

original: zhib tu ni chos yang dag par dran pa'i mdo las gsungs pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: zhib tu ni chos yang dag par dran pa'i mdo las gsungs pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood in detail according to the Dharma-smṛty-upasthāna-sūtra.

original: de la nam mkha' lding ni bya gser 'dab ces kyang bya /
analyzed: de la nam mkha' lding ni bya gser 'dab ces kyang bya /
translated: Among them, garuḍa is also called Suvarṇapatra,

original: bya 'dab bzangs zhes kyang bya ste /
analyzed: bya 'dab bzangs zhes kyang bya ste /
translated: and also Suparṇa.

original: bya de'i 'dab ma rin po che sna tshogs kyi bkod pa dang ldan pas gcig tu gser yin par nges pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bya de'i 'dab ma rin po che sna tshogs kyi bkod pa dang ldan pas gcig tu gser yin par nges pa ma yin no //
translated: Because the wings of that bird have various precious patterns, they are not definitely all gold.

original: sangs rgyas phal po che'i mdo las chos kyi sku gser 'dab can ni dan pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi'i rkang pa dang / byams pa dang / snying rje dang / rig pa yongs su dag pa'i mig dang ldan te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas phal po che'i mdo las chos kyi sku gser 'dab can ni dan pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi'i rkang pa dang / byams pa dang / snying rje dang / rig pa yongs su dag pa'i mig dang ldan te /
translated: In the Buddhâvataṃsaka-sūtra, the Dharma-body with golden wings has the feet of the four right abidings, and has the eyes of loving-kindness, compassion, and pure wisdom.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi shing la gnas so //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi shing la gnas so //
translated: It dwells in the tree of omniscient wisdom.

original: byang chub sems dpa' gser 'dab can ni 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho chen po'i nang du lha dang mi'i klu rnams spar mos blangs nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gser 'dab can ni 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho chen po'i nang du lha dang mi'i klu rnams spar mos blangs nas /
translated: The bodhisattva Suvarṇapatra, with his wings, lifts up the gods and humans of the great ocean of cyclic existence

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'gram du 'jog par byed pa /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'gram du 'jog par byed pa /
translated: and places them on the bank of nirvana.

original: 'di ni phyir mi ldog pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi gser 'dab can gyi chos kyi sgo mo zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di ni phyir mi ldog pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi gser 'dab can gyi chos kyi sgo mo zhes gsungs so //
translated: This is the Dharma door of the golden-winged garuḍa of the concentration of nonreturn.

original: yang mdo gzhan dag las 'dab ma gnyis kyi bar du dpag tshad khri phrag sum brgya sum cu rtsa drug yod de /
analyzed: yang mdo gzhan dag las 'dab ma gnyis kyi bar du dpag tshad khri phrag sum brgya sum cu rtsa drug yod de /
translated: Again, in other sūtras it is said that between the two wings there are 3,360,000 yojanas.

original: 'dzam bu'i gling du de'i rkang pa gcig las mi shong ngo //
analyzed: 'dzam bu'i gling du de'i rkang pa gcig las mi shong ngo //
translated: It does not fit on the foot of Jambudvīpa.

original: de'i 'gram pa na yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che yod pas de'i phyir yid bzhin zhes kyang bya'o zhes kyang bshad do //
analyzed: de'i 'gram pa na yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che yod pas de'i phyir yid bzhin zhes kyang bya'o zhes kyang bshad do //
translated: Since a wish-fulfilling jewel exists on its side, it is also called wish-fulfilling.

original: yang kha cig las de ni bya'i rgyal po yin pas /
analyzed: yang kha cig las de ni bya'i rgyal po yin pas /
translated: Again, some say that since it is the king of birds,

original: bya'i nang na gser 'dab can zhes bya ba klu 'ba' zhig zas su zab yod de /
analyzed: bya'i nang na gser 'dab can zhes bya ba klu 'ba' zhig zas su zab yod de /
translated: it is called golden-winged among birds and it only eats nāgas.

original: de yang skye ba rnam pa bzhi'i bye brag gis tha dad do //
analyzed: de yang skye ba rnam pa bzhi'i bye brag gis tha dad do //
translated: Moreover, they are differentiated by the four types of birth.

original: de la rdzus te skye ba ni rnam pa bzhi'i klu dag za bar byed do //
analyzed: de la rdzus te skye ba ni rnam pa bzhi'i klu dag za bar byed do //
translated: The garuḍa born from an egg eats the four types of nāgas.

original: mngal nas skye ba ni skye ba rnam pa gsum gyi klu dag za bar byed de /
analyzed: mngal nas skye ba ni skye ba rnam pa gsum gyi klu dag za bar byed de /
translated: The garuḍa born from a womb eats three types of nāgas,

original: rdzus te skyes pa ma gtogs so //
analyzed: rdzus te skyes pa ma gtogs so //
translated: except for those born from eggs.

original: sgong las skye ba ni skye ba rnam pa gnyis kyi klu dag za bar byed de /
analyzed: sgong las skye ba ni skye ba rnam pa gnyis kyi klu dag za bar byed de /
translated: The garuḍa born from heat and moisture eats two types of nāgas,

original: rdzus te skye ba dang mngal nas @62b skye ba ma gtogs so //
analyzed: rdzus te skye ba dang mngal nas @62b skye ba ma gtogs so //
translated: except for those born from eggs and from a womb.

original: drod gsher las skye ba ni drod gsher las skye ba 'ba' zhig za bar byed do //
analyzed: drod gsher las skye ba ni drod gsher las skye ba 'ba' zhig za bar byed do //
translated: The garuḍa born from miraculous birth eats only those born from miraculous birth.

original: gling bzhi po 'dir rdzus te skye ba'i nam mkha' lding gi rgyal po yang dag dbyangs zhes bya ba tshe lo brgyad stong thub pa nyin re zhing klu'i rgyal po chen po gcig dang klu phra mo lnga brgya za bar nus pa cig yod de /
analyzed: gling bzhi po 'dir rdzus te skye ba'i nam mkha' lding gi rgyal po yang dag dbyangs zhes bya ba tshe lo brgyad stong thub pa nyin re zhing klu'i rgyal po chen po gcig dang klu phra mo lnga brgya za bar nus pa cig yod de /
translated: In the four continents, there is a garuḍa king born from miraculous birth called Samantaprabhāsa. He lives eight thousand years and is able to eat one great nāga king and five hundred small nāgas each day.

original: gling bzhi po rnams su rim gyis mthar chags su za bar byed do //
analyzed: gling bzhi po rnams su rim gyis mthar chags su za bar byed do //
translated: They eat the crops of the four continents in sequence and in order.

original: 'chi ka'i dus kyi tshe klu rnams bzung zhing bzang mi btub ste /
analyzed: 'chi ka'i dus kyi tshe klu rnams bzung zhing bzang mi btub ste /
translated: At the time of death, the nāgas cannot be caught or subdued.

original: bkres pa'i gdung bas bsregs pas 'dab ma'i shugs kyis rlung gi dkyil 'khor la thug pa'i bar du babs pa las rlung gis bus pas slar yang gyen du thug go //
analyzed: bkres pa'i gdung bas bsregs pas 'dab ma'i shugs kyis rlung gi dkyil 'khor la thug pa'i bar du babs pa las rlung gis bus pas slar yang gyen du thug go //
translated: Because they are tormented by the suffering of hunger, they descend by the power of their wings until they reach the wind maṇḍala. The wind blows them up again.

original: de ltar lan bdun yan man 'das pas rkang pa bzhag pa'i gnas kyang mi rnyed de /
analyzed: de ltar lan bdun yan man 'das pas rkang pa bzhag pa'i gnas kyang mi rnyed de /
translated: In this way, they go up and down seven times, and then they do not find a place to put their feet down.

original: de nas rdo rje'i 'khor lo'i ri'i rtse mor phyin nas der tshe 'da'o //
analyzed: de nas rdo rje'i 'khor lo'i ri'i rtse mor phyin nas der tshe 'da'o //
translated: Then they reach the peak of the vajra wheel mountain and die there.

original: klu mang po'i sha zos pa'i dug gdug pa'i dbang gis lus la me rab tu 'bar ba 'byung ngo //
analyzed: klu mang po'i sha zos pa'i dug gdug pa'i dbang gis lus la me rab tu 'bar ba 'byung ngo //
translated: Because of the poison of eating the flesh of many nāgas, their bodies are consumed by a raging fire.

original: klu'i rgyal po dga' bo dang / nye dga' bo gnyis rin po che'i ri rab rnams tshig tu dogs nas /
analyzed: klu'i rgyal po dga' bo dang / nye dga' bo gnyis rin po che'i ri rab rnams tshig tu dogs nas /
translated: The nāga kings Nanda and Upananda, fearing that the precious Sumeru will be burned,

original: char chen po'i rgyun thigs pa shing rta'i 'phang lo tsam phab nas me gsod par byed do //
analyzed: char chen po'i rgyun thigs pa shing rta'i 'phang lo tsam phab nas me gsod par byed do //
translated: cause a great rain with drops the size of chariot wheels to fall and extinguish the fire.

original: de'i lus kyi sha gzhan zhig zhu nas snying 'ba' zhig lus pa tshad mi'i bral tsam bee d'urya sngon po nyid du 'gyur te ;
analyzed: de'i lus kyi sha gzhan zhig zhu nas snying 'ba' zhig lus pa tshad mi'i bral tsam bee d'urya sngon po nyid du 'gyur te ;
translated: The flesh of its body is digested except for the heart, which becomes the size of a human thumb and turns into a blue beryl.

original: 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po thob na ni nor bu rin po cher byed do //
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po thob na ni nor bu rin po cher byed do //
translated: If one becomes a universal monarch, it becomes the precious jewel.

original: brgya byin lha'i dbang po thob na ni gtsug gi nor bu byed do zhes bshad do //
analyzed: brgya byin lha'i dbang po thob na ni gtsug gi nor bu byed do zhes bshad do //
translated: If one becomes Śakra, lord of the gods, it becomes the crest jewel.

original: de la mi 'am ci zhes bya ba ni lha glu mkhan zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de la mi 'am ci zhes bya ba ni lha glu mkhan zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The kinnara is a god called a singer.

original: glu la mkhas zhing dri za rnams dang lhan cig tu lha rnams kyi g-yog byed do //
analyzed: glu la mkhas zhing dri za rnams dang lhan cig tu lha rnams kyi g-yog byed do //
translated: They are skilled in singing and serve the gods together with gandharvas.

original: lha rnams nam dgos pa na res kyis 'gro bar byed do //
analyzed: lha rnams nam dgos pa na res kyis 'gro bar byed do //
translated: When the gods need them, they go there.

original: yang the tshom skye ba'i lha zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yang the tshom skye ba'i lha zhes bya ste /
translated: They are also called gods who have doubts.

original: lus dud 'gro yin la dbyibs mi 'dra zhing byad bzhin bzang ba dang / mgo po la rva gcig yod pas mis mthong ba'i tshe /
analyzed: lus dud 'gro yin la dbyibs mi 'dra zhing byad bzhin bzang ba dang / mgo po la rva gcig yod pas mis mthong ba'i tshe /
translated: Their bodies are like animals, but their shapes are different and their faces are beautiful. Since they have one horn on their heads, when humans see them,

original: the tshom skyes nas ci 'di mi yin nam 'on te yi dags dang dud 'gro gang yin pa mi shes so zhes zer ba'i phyir /
analyzed: the tshom skyes nas ci 'di mi yin nam 'on te yi dags dang dud 'gro gang yin pa mi shes so zhes zer ba'i phyir /
translated: Because they doubt whether these are humans or hungry ghosts or animals, they say, “I don’t know what these are.”

original: the tshom skye ba'i lha zhes bya'o //
analyzed: the tshom skye ba'i lha zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, they are called gods who give rise to doubt.

original: lto 'phye chen po ni sprul chen po'o //
analyzed: lto 'phye chen po ni sprul chen po'o //
translated: The great nāgas are great snakes.

original: rkang pa med de ltos 'phye zhing 'gro ba'i phyir lto 'phye zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rkang pa med de ltos 'phye zhing 'gro ba'i phyir lto 'phye zhes bya'o //
translated: They are called nāgas because they move and go without feet.

original: yang gcig tu na sprul klu zhes kyang bya ste /
analyzed: yang gcig tu na sprul klu zhes kyang bya ste /
translated: Or, they are called nāgas because they are snakes.

original: 'di ni 'jig rten pa'i chab khung sa'i lha mi rnams kyis sha chang @63a * //
analyzed: 'di ni 'jig rten pa'i chab khung sa'i lha mi rnams kyis sha chang @63a * //
translated: These are the worldly nāgas who are gods of the earth. Humans take their flesh and blood

original: len cing za ba'o //
analyzed: len cing za ba'o //
translated: and eat them.

original: lto'i nang na klu dang sprul yod de ngo shes par dka' zhing cung zad klu 'dra ba'i phyir logs shig tu smos pa yin no //
analyzed: lto'i nang na klu dang sprul yod de ngo shes par dka' zhing cung zad klu 'dra ba'i phyir logs shig tu smos pa yin no //
translated: Because they have nāgas and snakes in their bellies, they are difficult to recognize and are slightly snake-like. Therefore, they are mentioned separately.

original: mi 'am ci zhes bya ba ni mi'i gzugs su bsgyur nas chos nyan du 'ongs pa'i phyir mi 'am ci zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi 'am ci zhes bya ba ni mi'i gzugs su bsgyur nas chos nyan du 'ongs pa'i phyir mi 'am ci zhes bya'o //
translated: The kinnaras are called kinnaras because they come to listen to the Dharma in the form of humans.

original: sh'a ri'i bus zhus pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bus zhus pa'i mdo las /
translated: In the Śāriputrāṣṭa,

original: lha 'dre sde brgyad ni thams cad kyang mi 'am ci zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: lha 'dre sde brgyad ni thams cad kyang mi 'am ci zhes gsungs so //
translated: The eight classes of gods and demons are all called kinnaras.

original: de la mi zhes bya ba ni ma thams cad bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: de la mi zhes bya ba ni ma thams cad bsdu ba'o //
translated: Here, “human” includes all humans.

original: mi ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni mi ma yin pa thams cad bsdu ba'o //🔽yang na mi dang mi ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni the tshom za ba'i tshig tu ci 'di mi yin nam /
analyzed: mi ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni mi ma yin pa thams cad bsdu ba'o // yang na mi dang mi ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni the tshom za ba'i tshig tu ci 'di mi yin nam /
translated: “Non-human” includes all non-humans.🔽Alternatively, “human and non-human” is a term of doubt, asking whether they are humans or

original: 'on te mi ma yin zhes smra ba'i phyir ro zhe'o //
analyzed: 'on te mi ma yin zhes smra ba'i phyir ro zhe'o //
translated: not.

original: sh'a ri'i bus zhus pa'i mdo las sde brgyad kyi rgyu zhus pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bus zhus pa'i mdo las sde brgyad kyi rgyu zhus pa 'byung ste /
translated: In the Sūtra Requested by Śāriputra, the causes of the eight classes are asked about.

original: de'i phyir de la sh'a ri'i bus bcom ldan 'das la gsol ba bcom ldan 'das lha 'dre sde brgyad rnams rkyen gang gis las ngan par skyes kyang rtag par chos yang dag par thos par gyur lags /
analyzed: de'i phyir de la sh'a ri'i bus bcom ldan 'das la gsol ba bcom ldan 'das lha 'dre sde brgyad rnams rkyen gang gis las ngan par skyes kyang rtag par chos yang dag par thos par gyur lags /
translated: Therefore, Śāriputra requests the Bhagavān, “Bhagavān, by what conditions are the eight classes of gods and demons born in bad migrations, yet always hear the true Dharma?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān replies,

original: las rnam pa gnyis kyis te 'di ltar las ngan par skyes so //
analyzed: las rnam pa gnyis kyis te 'di ltar las ngan par skyes so //
translated: “By two kinds of karma: thus they are born in bad migrations.

original: 'di ltar las dge bas ni bde ba cher myong bar 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar las dge bas ni bde ba cher myong bar 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: Thus, through virtuous karma, one experiences great happiness.

original: sde brgyad po 'di dag thams cad kyang mi dang mi ma yin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sde brgyad po 'di dag thams cad kyang mi dang mi ma yin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: All of these eight classes are called “humans and non-humans.”

original: de la lha ni tshe rabs snga ma la shing rta dang khyogs la sogs pas dkon mchog gsum dang pha ma dang / skyes bu dam pa rnams mchod pa byas mod kyi /
analyzed: de la lha ni tshe rabs snga ma la shing rta dang khyogs la sogs pas dkon mchog gsum dang pha ma dang / skyes bu dam pa rnams mchod pa byas mod kyi /
translated: Gods. In a previous life, they made offerings to the Three Jewels, parents, and holy beings with chariots, palanquins, and so forth,

original: 'on kyang ser sna dang sgyu dang phrag dog dang bcas pa'i phyir lus 'di blangs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang ser sna dang sgyu dang phrag dog dang bcas pa'i phyir lus 'di blangs pa yin te /
translated: but because they were stingy, deceitful, and jealous, they took up this body.

original: lha'i bu kun tu 'od dang gtsang mchog la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: lha'i bu kun tu 'od dang gtsang mchog la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: They are like the gods Pervasive Light, Supreme Purity, and so forth.

original: klu ni tshe snga ma la yon tan rnams kyi rgyu bsags pa dang / sbyin pa rgya cher btang yang yang dag pa'i dran pa la mi gnas shing spro thung ba dang khro ba la dga' ba'i phyir lus 'di blangs pa yin te /
analyzed: klu ni tshe snga ma la yon tan rnams kyi rgyu bsags pa dang / sbyin pa rgya cher btang yang yang dag pa'i dran pa la mi gnas shing spro thung ba dang khro ba la dga' ba'i phyir lus 'di blangs pa yin te /
translated: Nāgas. In a previous life, they accumulated the causes of good qualities and gave vast gifts, but because they did not abide in correct mindfulness and were irritable and fond of anger, they took up this body.

original: klu'i rgyal po yid zhing gyi nor bu la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: klu'i rgyal po yid zhing gyi nor bu la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: They are like the nāga kings Jewel of the Mind, and so forth.

original: gnod sbyin ni tshe snga ma la sbyin pa chen po legs par btang ba 'am /
analyzed: gnod sbyin ni tshe snga ma la sbyin pa chen po legs par btang ba 'am /
translated: Yakshas are those who in a previous life gave great gifts,

original: yang na sngar gnod pa byas la de'i 'og tu phan btags pa las mtho dman gyi dbang gis lus blangs pa yin no //
analyzed: yang na sngar gnod pa byas la de'i 'og tu phan btags pa las mtho dman gyi dbang gis lus blangs pa yin no //
translated: or who first did harm and then helped, and so took birth in a high or low position.

original: dri za ni tshe rabs snga ma la zhe sdang cung zad dang bcas la rtag par sbyin pa'i legs par bstab pa dang / padma sngon pos bdag nyid brgyan te /
analyzed: dri za ni tshe rabs snga ma la zhe sdang cung zad dang bcas la rtag par sbyin pa'i legs par bstab pa dang / padma sngon pos bdag nyid brgyan te /
translated: Gandharvas are those who in a previous life had a little hatred but always gave gifts, and who adorned themselves with blue lotuses

original: @63b rol mo rnam pa sna tshogs mang po byas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: @63b rol mo rnam pa sna tshogs mang po byas pa'i phyir /
translated: and made much of various kinds of music.

original: lus 'di blangs pa yin no //
analyzed: lus 'di blangs pa yin no //
translated: Because of this, they took birth in this body.

original: lha ma yin ni sems khengs shing dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi rjes su yongs su dag pa'i bsod nams byed du mi btub la /
analyzed: lha ma yin ni sems khengs shing dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi rjes su yongs su dag pa'i bsod nams byed du mi btub la /
translated: Asuras are those whose minds are inflated and who cannot be made to do meritorious actions by a spiritual teacher.

original: gang zag g-yo sgyu can gyi rjes su 'brang zhing bsod nams yang dag pa ma yin pa la dga' ba dang / log par ston pa'i mkhan po la brten cing sbyin pa yang legs par btang ba dang / gzhan yang gzhan dag 'thab mo byed pa la lta bar mos pa'i phyir lus 'di blangs pa yin no //
analyzed: gang zag g-yo sgyu can gyi rjes su 'brang zhing bsod nams yang dag pa ma yin pa la dga' ba dang / log par ston pa'i mkhan po la brten cing sbyin pa yang legs par btang ba dang / gzhan yang gzhan dag 'thab mo byed pa la lta bar mos pa'i phyir lus 'di blangs pa yin no //
translated: He took on this body because he followed deceitful people and took pleasure in false merit, and because he relied on a teacher who taught falsely and gave good gifts, and because he was interested in watching others fight.

original: nam mkha' lding ni tshe rabs snga ma la sbyin pa chen po btang ba dang / sems mtho zhing gzhan dag la brnyas pa'i phyir lus 'di blangs pa yin no //🔽mi 'am ci ni tshe rabs snga ma la gzhan dag legs par byang chub tu sems bskyed du bcug pa las /
analyzed: nam mkha' lding ni tshe rabs snga ma la sbyin pa chen po btang ba dang / sems mtho zhing gzhan dag la brnyas pa'i phyir lus 'di blangs pa yin no // mi 'am ci ni tshe rabs snga ma la gzhan dag legs par byang chub tu sems bskyed du bcug pa las /
translated: Garuḍa took on this body because in his previous lives he gave great gifts and had a lofty mind and looked down on others.🔽The kinnara took on this body because in his previous lives he caused others to give rise to the mind of enlightenment,

original: de sems yang dag pa nyid du ma gyur par log par ston pa rnams kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir lus 'di blangs pa yin no //
analyzed: de sems yang dag pa nyid du ma gyur par log par ston pa rnams kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir lus 'di blangs pa yin no //
translated: but because his mind was not right, he followed those who taught falsely.

original: lto 'phye chen po ni sbyin pa yang btang /
analyzed: lto 'phye chen po ni sbyin pa yang btang /
translated: The mahoraga took on this body because he gave gifts

original: dam pa'i chos kyang bsdus mod kyi /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos kyang bsdus mod kyi /
translated: He also collected the true Dharma.

original: khong khro ba la dga' ba'i phyir lus 'di blangs pa yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: khong khro ba la dga' ba'i phyir lus 'di blangs pa yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: But he took up this body because he delighted in anger.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sa'i 'grel ba las zhing yongs su dag pa 'di khams gsum pa las yang dag par 'das pa'i spyod yul yin na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sa'i 'grel ba las zhing yongs su dag pa 'di khams gsum pa las yang dag par 'das pa'i spyod yul yin na /
translated: If the field of the Buddha stage is the domain that transcends the three realms,

original: lha la sogs pa'i zham ring ba ji ltar srid de lha la sogs pa de dag thams cad ni khams gsum pas bsdus pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: lha la sogs pa'i zham ring ba ji ltar srid de lha la sogs pa de dag thams cad ni khams gsum pas bsdus pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: how is it possible that gods and so on are his attendants, since all those gods and so on are included in the three realms?

original: yongs su dag pa'i rnam par rig pas bzung nas zhing yongs su dag pa brgyan pa'i phyir snang bas 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: yongs su dag pa'i rnam par rig pas bzung nas zhing yongs su dag pa brgyan pa'i phyir snang bas 'gal ba med do //
translated: There is no contradiction, because they appear in the pure field of the Buddha stage, being held by the Buddha’s pure cognition.

original: yang na 'dul bar bya ba'i sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: yang na 'dul bar bya ba'i sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Or else, in order to ripen those sentient beings who are to be trained,

original: sprul pa'i rnam pa'i rnam pa de lta bu ston te /
analyzed: sprul pa'i rnam pa'i rnam pa de lta bu ston te /
translated: he manifests in such and such a form.

original: ji ltar rgyal po bka' byin na 'dul ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ji ltar rgyal po bka' byin na 'dul ba'i phyir /
translated: Just as a king, in order to punish the wicked and protect the good,

original: 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po 'khor stong dang byas pa sprul nas bstan pa bzhin no zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po 'khor stong dang byas pa sprul nas bstan pa bzhin no zhes 'byung ste /
translated: The wheel-turning kings emanate a thousand retinues and then teach.

original: 'di ni gleng gzhi zhib tu ni sangs rgyas kyi sa'i brjed byang las bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di ni gleng gzhi zhib tu ni sangs rgyas kyi sa'i brjed byang las bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: This is the extensive nidana, which is explained in the Bodhisattvabhumi and the commentary to the Abhisamayalamkara.

original: gzhan yang sangs rgyas kyi sa'i 'grel pa las /
analyzed: gzhan yang sangs rgyas kyi sa'i 'grel pa las /
translated: Moreover, the Vrtti on the Bodhisattvabhumi states:

original: yang na byang chub sems dpa' rnams lha dang klu la sogs pa'i lung tshad med pa dag tu sprul nas /
analyzed: yang na byang chub sems dpa' rnams lha dang klu la sogs pa'i lung tshad med pa dag tu sprul nas /
translated: Or, bodhisattvas emanate as gods, nagas and so on,

original: zhing yongs su dag pa der gnas shing sangs rgyas rnams la mchod pa byed pa 'am /
analyzed: zhing yongs su dag pa der gnas shing sangs rgyas rnams la mchod pa byed pa 'am /
translated: and having received immeasurable scriptures, they make offerings to the buddhas while dwelling in that pure land.🔽Or, they emanate their own bodies as the bodies of gods, nagas and so on and they serve the tathagatas.

original: @64a * // yang na bdag nyid kyi lus lha dang klu la sogs pa'i lus su sprul nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i zham ring byed pa yin pa'i phyir 'gal ba med do zhes bshad do //
analyzed: @64a * // yang na bdag nyid kyi lus lha dang klu la sogs pa'i lus su sprul nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i zham ring byed pa yin pa'i phyir 'gal ba med do zhes bshad do //
translated: Therefore there is no contradiction.

original: theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa mi mthun pa'i rnam pa gcig las zhing yongs su dag pa der yang dag par lha dang klu la sogs pa 'di lta bu med mod kyi /
analyzed: theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa mi mthun pa'i rnam pa gcig las zhing yongs su dag pa der yang dag par lha dang klu la sogs pa 'di lta bu med mod kyi /
translated: The Commentary on the Compendium of the Mahāyāna says, “In that pure realm, there are no such things as gods and nāgas.”🔽

original: stong pa nyid du mi 'dzin pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyis 'di lta bu'i rnam pa 'dren pa sna tshogs sprul pa yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: stong pa nyid du mi 'dzin pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyis 'di lta bu'i rnam pa 'dren pa sna tshogs sprul pa yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: The Commentary on the Compendium of the Mahāyāna explains that in that pure land there are no such things as gods, nāgas, and so on, but because of not apprehending emptiness, the Tathāgata himself emanates various kinds of guides.

original: chos rgya chen po ro'i dga' ba dang bde ba bsten pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni bcu pa rtogs pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: chos rgya chen po ro'i dga' ba dang bde ba bsten pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni bcu pa rtogs pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
translated: This verse called “The Enjoyment of the Taste of the Great Dharma” teaches the perfection of realization.

original: slob dpon nye ba'i 'od kyis byas pa'i 'grel pa las 'di ltar de na theg pa chen po'i chos kyi dga' ba dang bde ba'i zas kyis bsten nas gnas par byed pa ni ston pa'i don yin no //
analyzed: slob dpon nye ba'i 'od kyis byas pa'i 'grel pa las 'di ltar de na theg pa chen po'i chos kyi dga' ba dang bde ba'i zas kyis bsten nas gnas par byed pa ni ston pa'i don yin no //
translated: The commentary composed by Master Upālo says that the meaning of the verse is that they live there by relying on the food of the joy and bliss of the Mahāyāna Dharma.

original: khams gsum pa las yang dag par 'das pa'i spyod yul zhes bshad na /
analyzed: khams gsum pa las yang dag par 'das pa'i spyod yul zhes bshad na /
translated: If it is said that the domain of the buddhas transcends the three realms,

original: ji ltar zas yod par 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar zas yod par 'gyur /
translated: how can there be food?

original: zag pa med pa'i chos ni zas zhes brjod par mi rigs te /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i chos ni zas zhes brjod par mi rigs te /
translated: It is not reasonable to call the uncontaminated a nutriment.

original: zas ni srid pa gsum gyi sems can gso par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: zas ni srid pa gsum gyi sems can gso par byed pa yin la /
translated: Nutriment nourishes the sentient beings of the three realms.

original: 'di ni srid pa gcod pa yin pa'i phyir zas brjod pa ni mi rigs so zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ni srid pa gcod pa yin pa'i phyir zas brjod pa ni mi rigs so zhe na /
translated: But since this is the severence of existence, it is not reasonable to call it nutriment.

original: zag pa med pa yin yang ston pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir yang zas zhes brjod de /
analyzed: zag pa med pa yin yang ston pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir yang zas zhes brjod de /
translated: Even though it is uncontaminated, it is called nutriment because it is the cause of teaching.

original: ji ltar khyed kyi gzhung las gzugs med pa la sogs par skyes pa rnams zag pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa la yang zas zhes brjod pa dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: ji ltar khyed kyi gzhung las gzugs med pa la sogs par skyes pa rnams zag pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa la yang zas zhes brjod pa dang 'dra'o //
translated: It is like the nutriment of those born in the formless realm and so on who enter uncontaminated meditative attainment.

original: 'das pa'i zas la zas zhes brjod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'das pa'i zas la zas zhes brjod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it past nutriment,

original: 'das pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'das pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the past does not exist.

original: 'di yang don bzhin te ston pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir zas zhes brjod do //
analyzed: 'di yang don bzhin te ston pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir zas zhes brjod do //
translated: This is also reasonable because it is called nutriment since it is the cause of teaching.

original: ji ltar zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos zag pa med pa la sgrib pa yin mod kyi 'on kyang zag pa dang bcas pa yongs su 'dzin pas zas zhes bya'o zhes brjod pa de bzhin du zag pa med pa yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos zag pa med pa la sgrib pa yin mod kyi 'on kyang zag pa dang bcas pa yongs su 'dzin pas zas zhes bya'o zhes brjod pa de bzhin du zag pa med pa yang de bzhin no //
translated: Just as it is said that though contaminated dharmas are not obscurations to uncontaminated dharmas, they are called food because they sustain contaminated states, so too they are uncontaminated.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa spangs mod kyi /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa spangs mod kyi /
translated: Though contaminated states are abandoned,🔽why are uncontaminated states not food?

original: 'on kyang zag pa med pa yong su 'dzin pas ci'i phyir zas ma yin te zhing yongs su dag pa der /
analyzed: 'on kyang zag pa med pa yong su 'dzin pas ci'i phyir zas ma yin te zhing yongs su dag pa der /
translated: In that field of pure karma,

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams rjes la brnyes pa'i zag pa med pa'i theg pa chen pa'i chos kyi ro'i dga' @64b ba 'chad pa yang spyod /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams rjes la brnyes pa'i zag pa med pa'i theg pa chen pa'i chos kyi ro'i dga' @64b ba 'chad pa yang spyod /
translated: buddhas and bodhisattvas enjoy the taste of the uncontaminated Mahayana Dharma that they have attained and

original: bstar ba yang spyod pas dgyes pa chen po skyel /
analyzed: bstar ba yang spyod pas dgyes pa chen po skyel /
translated: they experience great delight.

original: gzhan yang yang dag pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi ye shes kyis de bzhin nyid kyi ro bstar zhing dgyes pa chen po skye ba dang / sku yongs su 'dzin cing 'jig par mi 'gyur ba dang / dge ba'i chos rnams gso ba'i phyir zas zhes brjod de zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gzhan yang yang dag pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi ye shes kyis de bzhin nyid kyi ro bstar zhing dgyes pa chen po skye ba dang / sku yongs su 'dzin cing 'jig par mi 'gyur ba dang / dge ba'i chos rnams gso ba'i phyir zas zhes brjod de zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Moreover, the wisdom of the authentic nature of things is called food because it tastes the flavor of suchness and generates great delight, it holds the body and does not allow it to perish, and it nourishes virtuous qualities.

original: slob dpon dbyig gnyen dang ngo bo nyid med kyis rnam pa gzhan du bshad pa ni med do //
analyzed: slob dpon dbyig gnyen dang ngo bo nyid med kyis rnam pa gzhan du bshad pa ni med do //
translated: There is no other explanation by Master Vasubandhu or Asvabhāva.

original: gzhan yang dam pa'i chos padma dkar po'i mdo las /
analyzed: gzhan yang dam pa'i chos padma dkar po'i mdo las /
translated: Moreover, the Sūtra of the White Lotus of the Sacred Teachings states:

original: zhing de'i sems can ni rtag par zas rnam pa gnyis kyis gnas par byed de /
analyzed: zhing de'i sems can ni rtag par zas rnam pa gnyis kyis gnas par byed de /
translated: The sentient beings of that realm always abide by means of two types of food.

original: chos kyi dga' ba'i zas dang / bsam gtan gyi dga' ba'i zas so zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: chos kyi dga' ba'i zas dang / bsam gtan gyi dga' ba'i zas so zhes gsungs te /
translated: The food of delight in the Dharma and the food of delight in meditative concentration.

original: de nyid kyi 'grel pa las //
analyzed: de nyid kyi 'grel pa las //
translated: The commentary to that states:

original: chos dang bsam gtan dga' ba'i zas //
analyzed: chos dang bsam gtan dga' ba'i zas //
translated: The food of delight in the Dharma and meditative concentration

original: zas gzhan 'du shes ci yang med //🔽ces gsungs so //
analyzed: zas gzhan 'du shes ci yang med //🔽ces gsungs so //
translated: has no notion of any other type of food.

original: sems can gyi don dang phan pa thams cad byed par gnas pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni bcu gcig pa phrin las phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: sems can gyi don dang phan pa thams cad byed par gnas pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni bcu gcig pa phrin las phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the perfection of activity of the tenth stage.

original: slob dpon nye ba'i 'od kyis byas pa'i 'grel pa las /🔽'di ltar de na de nyid kyis mngon sum du sems can thams cad kyi don dang phan pa thams cad mdzad pa 'am /
analyzed: slob dpon nye ba'i 'od kyis byas pa'i 'grel pa las / 'di ltar de na de nyid kyis mngon sum du sems can thams cad kyi don dang phan pa thams cad mdzad pa 'am /
translated: The commentary composed by Master Upāyavajra explains:

original: yang na sems can thams cad rang nyid kyi don dang phan pa thams cad byed par 'gyur ba'o /
analyzed: yang na sems can thams cad rang nyid kyi don dang phan pa thams cad byed par 'gyur ba'o /
translated: Thus, he accomplishes the benefit and welfare of all sentient beings by himself, or all sentient beings will accomplish their own benefit and welfare.

original: de la tshe 'di la phan 'dogs pa'i don to //
analyzed: de la tshe 'di la phan 'dogs pa'i don to //
translated: Here, benefit is the benefit of this life.

original: tshe phyi ma la phan 'dogs par 'gyur ba ni phan pa'o //
analyzed: tshe phyi ma la phan 'dogs par 'gyur ba ni phan pa'o //
translated: Welfare is that which will benefit future lives.

original: gzhan yang 'jig rten pa ni don zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang 'jig rten pa ni don zhes bya'o //
translated: Moreover, benefit is called mundane.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa ni phan pa zhes bya'o /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa ni phan pa zhes bya'o /
translated: Welfare is called supramundane.

original: gzhan yang sdig pa dang bral ba ni ngon zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang sdig pa dang bral ba ni ngon zhes bya'o //
translated: Moreover, benefit is called freedom from sin.

original: dge ba sdud pa ni phan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dge ba sdud pa ni phan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Welfare is called gathering virtue.

original: gzhan yang bsod nams dang yon tan ni don zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang bsod nams dang yon tan ni don zhes bya'o //
translated: Moreover, merit and virtue are called benefit,

original: ye shes dang shes rab ni phan pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: ye shes dang shes rab ni phan pa zhes bya ste /
translated: and knowledge and wisdom are called benefit.

original: 'di lta bu la sogs pa tha dad do //
analyzed: 'di lta bu la sogs pa tha dad do //
translated: Such are the differences.

original: ting nge 'dzin rab tu zhi ba la bzhugs kyang sngon sbyor ba mngon par bsgrubs pa dang / smon lam gyi mthu'i dbang gis sems can thams cad kyi phan par mdzad par spyod do zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin rab tu zhi ba la bzhugs kyang sngon sbyor ba mngon par bsgrubs pa dang / smon lam gyi mthu'i dbang gis sems can thams cad kyi phan par mdzad par spyod do zhes 'byung ste /
translated: Although he dwells in the peace of concentration, he acts for the benefit of all sentient beings through the power of his former practices and his vows.

original: slob dpon dbyig gnyen dang ngo bo snyid med kyis rnam pa gzhan du bshad pa ni med do //🔽nyon mongs pa 'ching ba dang dri ma thams cad rab tu bsal pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni bcu gnyis pa phan 'dogs pa @65a * //
analyzed: slob dpon dbyig gnyen dang ngo bo snyid med kyis rnam pa gzhan du bshad pa ni med do // nyon mongs pa 'ching ba dang dri ma thams cad rab tu bsal pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni bcu gnyis pa phan 'dogs pa @65a * //
translated: There is no other explanation by Master Vasubandhu and Master Asvabhāva.

original: phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
translated: By completely eliminating all the bonds, defilements, and stains, the perfection of benefit is taught.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sa'i 'grel pa las /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sa'i 'grel pa las /
translated: In the commentary on the Buddha ground,

original: nyon mongs pa'i 'ching ba'i dri ma yang rnam pa gnyis kyis tha dad do zhes rnam grangs gsum gyis bshad de /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i 'ching ba'i dri ma yang rnam pa gnyis kyis tha dad do zhes rnam grangs gsum gyis bshad de /
translated: the stains of the bonds of affliction are explained by three categories.

original: de'i phyir de nyid 'grel pa de nyid las nyon mongs pa de dag nyid la 'ching ba dang dri ma zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid 'grel pa de nyid las nyon mongs pa de dag nyid la 'ching ba dang dri ma zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the same commentary says that those afflictions are called “bondage” and “stain.”

original: yang na nyon mongs pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: yang na nyon mongs pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Or, the afflictions are as follows:

original: rtsa ba'i nyon mongs pa brgya nyi shu rtsa brgyad do //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i nyon mongs pa brgya nyi shu rtsa brgyad do //
translated: The root afflictions are one hundred and twenty-eight.

original: 'ching ba ni ngo tsha med pa dang khrel med pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'ching ba ni ngo tsha med pa dang khrel med pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Bondage is shamelessness, lack of abashment, and so on.

original: dri ma ni g-yo dang sgyu la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dri ma ni g-yo dang sgyu la sogs pa'o //
translated: Stain is deceit, pretense, and so on.

original: gzhan yang shes bya'i sgrib pa dang bag la nyal rnams ni nyon mongs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang shes bya'i sgrib pa dang bag la nyal rnams ni nyon mongs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Moreover, the obscurations to be known and the latent afflictions are called “afflictions.”

original: de nyid mngon sum du byung ba ni 'ching ba dang dri ma zhes brjod de /
analyzed: de nyid mngon sum du byung ba ni 'ching ba dang dri ma zhes brjod de /
translated: The actualization of those is called “bondage” and “stain.”

original: de la rtsa ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams ni 'ching ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la rtsa ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams ni 'ching ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The root afflictions are called “bondage.”

original: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams ni dri ma zhes bya ste /
analyzed: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams ni dri ma zhes bya ste /
translated: The secondary afflictions are called “stain.”

original: de ltar nyon mongs pa'i 'ching ba dang dri ma yongs su spangs pa ni phan 'dogs pa zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de ltar nyon mongs pa'i 'ching ba dang dri ma yongs su spangs pa ni phan 'dogs pa zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Thus, the abandonment of the bondage and stain of the afflictions is called “beneficial.”

original: mdo'i tshig 'di yang mi mthun pa rnam pa gsum yod de /
analyzed: mdo'i tshig 'di yang mi mthun pa rnam pa gsum yod de /
translated: There are three different versions of this sutra passage.

original: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa las mdo sde'i tshig khungs su bstan pa las gnod pa zhes 'byung gis /
analyzed: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa las mdo sde'i tshig khungs su bstan pa las gnod pa zhes 'byung gis /
translated: The Mahayana-samgraha-shastra quotes the sutra as saying harm,

original: 'ching ba dang dri ma zhes mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'ching ba dang dri ma zhes mi 'byung ste /
translated: but not bondage or stain.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos de nyid las nyon mongs pa'i gnod pa thams cad rab tu bsal ba zhes 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos de nyid las nyon mongs pa'i gnod pa thams cad rab tu bsal ba zhes 'byung ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, that treatise says completely eliminating all the harm of afflictions.

original: mdo sde 'di las ni 'ching ba dang dri ma zhes 'byung gi / gnod pa zhes bya'i tshig ni ma gsungs so //
analyzed: mdo sde 'di las ni 'ching ba dang dri ma zhes 'byung gi / gnod pa zhes bya'i tshig ni ma gsungs so //
translated: This sutra says bondage and stain, but not the word harm.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sa'i mdo las ni gnyi ga smos te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sa'i mdo las ni gnyi ga smos te /
translated: The Buddha-bhumi-sutra mentions both.

original: de'i phyir mdo de nyid las nyon mongs pa'i gnod pa dang 'ching ba dang dri ma thams cad dang bral ba zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir mdo de nyid las nyon mongs pa'i gnod pa dang 'ching ba dang dri ma thams cad dang bral ba zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, that sutra says free from all the harm, bondage, and stains of afflictions.

original: gnod pa'i don ni 'og nas byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan brjod pa'i skabs nas bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gnod pa'i don ni 'og nas byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan brjod pa'i skabs nas bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: The meaning of harm is as explained below in the section on the qualities of the bodhisattvas.

original: bdud thams cad yongs su spangs pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni bcu gsum pa mi 'jigs pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: bdud thams cad yongs su spangs pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni bcu gsum pa mi 'jigs pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the thirteenth perfection, fearlessness.

original: de la bdud thams cad ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la bdud thams cad ces bya ba ni /
translated: Here, all demons refers to

original: sngar gong du nyon mongs pa dang phung po dang 'chi bdag dang lha'i bu'i bdud do zhes bstan pa nyid do //
analyzed: sngar gong du nyon mongs pa dang phung po dang 'chi bdag dang lha'i bu'i bdud do zhes bstan pa nyid do //
translated: the previously mentioned afflictive, aggregate, Lord of Death, and divine son demons.

original: slob dpon nye ba'i 'od kyis 'grel pa las ji skad du 'di ltar rnam pa bzhi po 'di dag dge ba'i chos rnams la gnod pa byed pa'i phyir bdud ces bya'o zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: slob dpon nye ba'i 'od kyis 'grel pa las ji skad du 'di ltar rnam pa bzhi po 'di dag dge ba'i chos rnams la gnod pa byed pa'i phyir bdud ces bya'o zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: As Master Upasena’s Commentary explains, “In this way, these four are called demons because they harm virtuous qualities.”

original: bdud bzhi @65b spangs pa'i bye brag kyang thams cad yod par smra ba dang / theg pa chen po'i gzhung dang sbyar na byang chub kyi shing drung mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i tshe /
analyzed: bdud bzhi @65b spangs pa'i bye brag kyang thams cad yod par smra ba dang / theg pa chen po'i gzhung dang sbyar na byang chub kyi shing drung mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i tshe /
translated: The Vaibhāṣika tradition explains that the four demons are abandoned by the path of seeing, while the Mahāyāna tradition explains that they are abandoned by the uninterrupted path at the time of full awakening beneath the Bodhi tree.

original: bar chad med pa'i lam gyis ni nyon mongs pa'i bdud bcom mo //
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i lam gyis ni nyon mongs pa'i bdud bcom mo //
translated: The afflictive demon is conquered by the uninterrupted path.

original: lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das par zhugs nas mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su zhugs pa'i tshe ni phung po'i bdud bcom mo //
analyzed: lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das par zhugs nas mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su zhugs pa'i tshe ni phung po'i bdud bcom mo //
translated: When he entered nirvana in the realm of nirvana without remainder, he conquered the demon of the aggregates.

original: zla ba gsum du sku tshe slar bsring ba ni 'chi bdag gi bdud bcom pa yin no //
analyzed: zla ba gsum du sku tshe slar bsring ba ni 'chi bdag gi bdud bcom pa yin no //
translated: When he extended his life for three months, he conquered the demon of death.

original: byams pa'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa'i tshe ni lha'i bu'i bdud bcom pa yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: byams pa'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa'i tshe ni lha'i bu'i bdud bcom pa yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: When he remained in the concentration of loving-kindness, he conquered the demon of the devas.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las ni bshad pa 'di dang cung zad tha dad de /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las ni bshad pa 'di dang cung zad tha dad de /
translated: The commentary to the Perfection of Wisdom explains this passage slightly differently.

original: de'i phyir de nyid las bdud thams cad spangs pa zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid las bdud thams cad spangs pa zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: It says, “The abandonment of all demons is as follows.

original: nyon mongs pa dang phung po dang / 'chi bdag dang lha'i bu'i bdud dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang phung po dang / 'chi bdag dang lha'i bu'i bdud dang bral ba'o //
translated: It is freedom from the demons of the afflictions, the aggregates, death, and the devas.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam thob pa'i phyir ni nyon mongs pa'i bdud bcom mo //
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam thob pa'i phyir ni nyon mongs pa'i bdud bcom mo //
translated: The bodhisattvas conquer the demon of the afflictions because they have attained the path of nirvana.

original: chos kyi ngo bo nyid kyi sku thob pa'i phyir ni phung po'i bdud bcom mo //
analyzed: chos kyi ngo bo nyid kyi sku thob pa'i phyir ni phung po'i bdud bcom mo //
translated: He conquered the demon of the aggregates because he attained the body of Dharma nature.

original: lam dang chos kyi ngo bo nyid kyi sku thob pa'i phyir ni 'chi bdag gi bdud bcom mo //🔽sems rtse gcig pa'i phyir thams cad du sems mngon par zhen pa med pa'i phyir dang mi g-yo ba'i ting nge 'dzin las rab tu zhugs pa'i phyir ni gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha'i bu'i bdud bcom pa'o //
analyzed: lam dang chos kyi ngo bo nyid kyi sku thob pa'i phyir ni 'chi bdag gi bdud bcom mo // sems rtse gcig pa'i phyir thams cad du sems mngon par zhen pa med pa'i phyir dang mi g-yo ba'i ting nge 'dzin las rab tu zhugs pa'i phyir ni gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha'i bu'i bdud bcom pa'o //
translated: He conquered the demon of the Lord of Death because he attained the path and the body of Dharma nature.

original: shes rab kyi srog 'phrog pa dang / lam gyi chos dang yon tan dang dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams 'jig par byed pa'i phyir bdud ces bya ba'o zhes bshad de /🔽rgya cher de nyid las 'byung ba bzhin no //🔽theg pa chen po yang dag pa'i don dang sbyar na /
