original: sangs rgyas kyi sa'i 'grel pa las ji skad du sa dang po yan chad ni bdud rags pa rnam pa bzhi spangs pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sa'i 'grel pa las ji skad du sa dang po yan chad ni bdud rags pa rnam pa bzhi spangs pa'o //
translated: As the commentary to the Buddha Land Sutra says, “From the first stage on, the four coarse māras are abandoned.

original: sangs rgyas sa'i tshe ni gtan du spangs pa'o zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas sa'i tshe ni gtan du spangs pa'o zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: At the time of the Buddha stage, they are abandoned forever.”

original: don gyi rjes su rnam par dbye na dad pa bcu la gnas pa yan chad kyang sa rnams su rim gyis yongs su spong bar byed de ci rigs su sbyar ro //
analyzed: don gyi rjes su rnam par dbye na dad pa bcu la gnas pa yan chad kyang sa rnams su rim gyis yongs su spong bar byed de ci rigs su sbyar ro //
translated: If one analyzes the meaning, from the stage of the ten abiding in faith on, one gradually abandons them, as is appropriate.

original: thams cad kyi bkod pa las lhag pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i bkod pa'i gnas zhes bya ba 'dis ni bcu bzhi pa gnas @66a * //🔽phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: thams cad kyi bkod pa las lhag pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i bkod pa'i gnas zhes bya ba 'dis ni bcu bzhi pa gnas @66a * //🔽phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
translated: The phrase “the place of the array of the Tathāgata, which surpasses all arrays” shows the perfection of the place of the fourteenth stage.🔽The phrase “the place of the array of the Tathāgata, which surpasses all arrays” shows the perfection of the place of the fourteenth stage.

original: slob dpon nye ba'i 'od kyis byas pa'i 'grel pa las 'di ltar de ni sangs rgyas bzhugs pa'i gnas yin pas byang chub sems dpa' thams cad dang / gzhan dag gis bkod pa'i gnas gang yin pa de dag pas lhag cing de bzhin gshegs pa 'ba' zhig gis bkod pa khyad par can gyis brgyan pa'i gnas su gyur pa des na thams cad kyis bkod pa'i gnas las mchog tu gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: slob dpon nye ba'i 'od kyis byas pa'i 'grel pa las 'di ltar de ni sangs rgyas bzhugs pa'i gnas yin pas byang chub sems dpa' thams cad dang / gzhan dag gis bkod pa'i gnas gang yin pa de dag pas lhag cing de bzhin gshegs pa 'ba' zhig gis bkod pa khyad par can gyis brgyan pa'i gnas su gyur pa des na thams cad kyis bkod pa'i gnas las mchog tu gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: Since it is the abode of the buddhas, it is superior to the abodes created by all bodhisattvas and others. Since it is an abode adorned with the special creation of the Tathagata alone, it is the best of all created abodes.

original: gnas phun sum tshogs pa zhes bshad do zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gnas phun sum tshogs pa zhes bshad do zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Thus it is called the perfect abode.

original: dran pa dang blo gros dang spyod pa chen po rnam par rgyu ba'i lam du gyur pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni bco lnga pa lam phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: dran pa dang blo gros dang spyod pa chen po rnam par rgyu ba'i lam du gyur pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni bco lnga pa lam phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
translated: The path of the great memory, understanding and practice is the fifteenth, the perfect path.

original: slob dpon nye ba'i 'od kyis 'grel pa las 'di ltar de ni dran pa chen po dang blo gros chen po dang spyod pa chen po rnams rnam par rgyu ba'i lam du gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: slob dpon nye ba'i 'od kyis 'grel pa las 'di ltar de ni dran pa chen po dang blo gros chen po dang spyod pa chen po rnams rnam par rgyu ba'i lam du gyur pa yin te /
translated: This is the path for the movement of great mindfulness, great intelligence, and great practice.

original: bgrod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir rnam par rgyu ba'i lam zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bgrod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir rnam par rgyu ba'i lam zhes bya ste /
translated: It is called the path of movement because it is what is to be traversed.

original: lam gyi rnam grangs so //
analyzed: lam gyi rnam grangs so //
translated: This is a synonym for path.

original: thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyi dran pa chen po zhes bya ste /
analyzed: thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyi dran pa chen po zhes bya ste /
translated: The mindfulness that is the wisdom arisen from listening is called great mindfulness.

original: 'di ltar thos nas mi brjed par 'dzin par byed do //
analyzed: 'di ltar thos nas mi brjed par 'dzin par byed do //
translated: Having listened, it holds without forgetting.

original: don phyin ci ma log par 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don phyin ci ma log par 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It holds the meaning without error.

original: bsams pa las byung ba'i shes rab ni blo gros chen po zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bsams pa las byung ba'i shes rab ni blo gros chen po zhes bya ste /
translated: The wisdom arisen from contemplation is called great intelligence.

original: don ji lta ba bzhin du legs par bsams nas nges par thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don ji lta ba bzhin du legs par bsams nas nges par thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Having contemplated the meaning well, it is ascertained just as it is.

original: bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab ni spyod pa chen po zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab ni spyod pa chen po zhes bya ste /
translated: The wisdom arisen from meditation is called great practice.

original: bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis de kho na nyid rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis de kho na nyid rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Through the power of meditation, it realizes suchness.

original: de la chen po ni dran pa la sogs pa theg pa chen po'i chos la dmigs pa las byung ba'i phyir dang / de'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir dang de bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la chen po ni dran pa la sogs pa theg pa chen po'i chos la dmigs pa las byung ba'i phyir dang / de'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir dang de bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The great is so called because it arises from the observation of the Mahāyāna dharmas such as mindfulness, because it is the result of that, and because it includes that.

original: shes rab gya nom pa rnam pa gsum gyis zhing yongs su dag par phan tshun du bgrod pa'i phyir rnam par rgyu ba'i lam zhes bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab gya nom pa rnam pa gsum gyis zhing yongs su dag par phan tshun du bgrod pa'i phyir rnam par rgyu ba'i lam zhes bya'o //
translated: The path of movement is so called because the field is purified by the three kinds of excellent wisdom, and because one moves from one to the other.

original: 'dis ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams shes rab gya nom pa gsum gyi rgyus zhing yongs su dag par 'jug pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dis ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams shes rab gya nom pa gsum gyi rgyus zhing yongs su dag par 'jug pa'i phyir /
translated: This shows that the bodhisattvas, by the cause of the three kinds of excellent wisdom, enter into the purification of the field.

original: rnam par rgyu ba'i lam zhes bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: rnam par rgyu ba'i lam zhes bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: Therefore it is called the path of movement.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi dran pa chen po ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi dran pa chen po ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes yin te /
translated: The great mindfulness of the tathāgatas is nonconceptual wisdom,

original: dran pa'i dbang gis de kho na nyid kyi don la rab tu gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dran pa'i dbang gis de kho na nyid kyi don la rab tu gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because by the power of mindfulness one abides in the meaning of thatness.

original: blo gros chen po ni rjes las @66b thob pa'i ye shes yin te /
analyzed: blo gros chen po ni rjes las @66b thob pa'i ye shes yin te /
translated: Great intelligence is subsequent attainment wisdom,🔽because it is the cause of the purification of the field.

original: chos rnams kyi don dam pa dang kun rdzob kyi mtshan nyid rnam par 'byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi don dam pa dang kun rdzob kyi mtshan nyid rnam par 'byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they distinguish the ultimate and conventional characteristics of phenomena.

original: 'di gnyi ga yang zhing yongs su dag pa'i mngon par 'du byed pa'i las khyad par can dang ldan pa'i phyir gnyi ga yang spyod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di gnyi ga yang zhing yongs su dag pa'i mngon par 'du byed pa'i las khyad par can dang ldan pa'i phyir gnyi ga yang spyod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Both of these are called “practice” because they are endowed with the special activity of purifying the field.

original: shes pa 'di gnyis kyi dbang gis zhing yongs su dag par skye bar 'gyur ba'i phyir rnam par rgyu ba'i lam zhes bya'o //
analyzed: shes pa 'di gnyis kyi dbang gis zhing yongs su dag par skye bar 'gyur ba'i phyir rnam par rgyu ba'i lam zhes bya'o //
translated: Because of the power of these two knowledges, one is born in a pure field. Therefore, they are called “paths of movement.”

original: yang ni dran pa chen po'i spyod pa ni bdag la phan 'dogs pa'i spyod pa yin te /
analyzed: yang ni dran pa chen po'i spyod pa ni bdag la phan 'dogs pa'i spyod pa yin te /
translated: Moreover, the practice of great mindfulness is the practice of benefiting oneself,

original: nang du bsdus nas mngon par rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nang du bsdus nas mngon par rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is inwardly collected and perfected.

original: blo gros chen po'i spyod pa ni gzhan la phan 'dogs pa'i spyod pa yin te /
analyzed: blo gros chen po'i spyod pa ni gzhan la phan 'dogs pa'i spyod pa yin te /
translated: The practice of great intelligence is the practice of benefiting others,

original: phyi rol du rnam par 'byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi rol du rnam par 'byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is outwardly discriminating.

original: go rims bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhing yongs su dag pa rnam pa gnyis su skye bar 'gyur ba'i phyir rnam par rgyu ba'i lam zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: go rims bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhing yongs su dag pa rnam pa gnyis su skye bar 'gyur ba'i phyir rnam par rgyu ba'i lam zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Because one is born in the two kinds of pure fields of the Tathagata, in order, it is called the path of movement.

original: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel ba las ni thos pa dang bsams pa dang / bsgoms pa'i shes rab ni go rims bzhin du dran pa dang blo gros dang spyod pa chen pos bgrod pa'i lam byed do zhes bshad do //
analyzed: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel ba las ni thos pa dang bsams pa dang / bsgoms pa'i shes rab ni go rims bzhin du dran pa dang blo gros dang spyod pa chen pos bgrod pa'i lam byed do zhes bshad do //
translated: In the commentary composed by Master Vasubandhu, it is explained that the wisdoms of hearing, reflection, and meditation respectively function as the path of travel by great mindfulness, great intelligence, and great practice.

original: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis byas pa'i 'grel pa las bsams pa las byung ba'i shes rab ni dran pa chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis byas pa'i 'grel pa las bsams pa las byung ba'i shes rab ni dran pa chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: In the commentary composed by Master Nāgārjuna, it is said that the wisdom arisen from reflection is called great mindfulness.

original: thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab ni blo gros chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab ni blo gros chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: The wisdom arisen from hearing is called great intelligence.

original: bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab ni spyod pa chen po zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab ni spyod pa chen po zhes bya ste /
translated: The wisdom arisen from meditation is called great practice.

original: bgrod par bya ba'i lam du gyur ba ni lam gyi grangs so zhes bshad do //
analyzed: bgrod par bya ba'i lam du gyur ba ni lam gyi grangs so zhes bshad do //
translated: The path to be traversed is the enumeration of paths.

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong chen po'i bzhon pa yin pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni bcu drug pa bzhon pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong chen po'i bzhon pa yin pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni bcu drug pa bzhon pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the perfection of vehicle, the sixteenth perfection.

original: slob dpon nye ba'i 'od kyis byas pa'i 'grel pa las zhi gnas ni ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: slob dpon nye ba'i 'od kyis byas pa'i 'grel pa las zhi gnas ni ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: In the commentary composed by Master Upasena, it says, “Tranquility is concentration.

original: lhag mthong ni shes rab bo //
analyzed: lhag mthong ni shes rab bo //
translated: Insight is wisdom.

original: chen po'i don ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: chen po'i don ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The meaning of ‘great’ is as before.

original: de nyid rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa ni bzhon pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa ni bzhon pa ste /
translated: That itself is the vehicle, which proceeds by its own nature.

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong la zhon nas /
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong la zhon nas /
translated: Having mounted tranquility and insight,

original: ci rigs par mdun gyi lam du 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: ci rigs par mdun gyi lam du 'gro ba'o //
translated: one goes along the path ahead, as is appropriate.

original: de la lam ni spyi'i gnas yin la gnas las zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bye brag tu bzhon pa zhes bstan pa yin no zhes 'byung ngo //🔽slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa las na zhi gnas dang lhag @67a * //
analyzed: de la lam ni spyi'i gnas yin la gnas las zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bye brag tu bzhon pa zhes bstan pa yin no zhes 'byung ngo // slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa las na zhi gnas dang lhag @67a * //
translated: In that, the path is the general basis, and the basis is taught as the vehicle of tranquility and insight in particular.”

original: mthong la zhon nas rnam par rgyu zhing 'gro ba'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
analyzed: mthong la zhon nas rnam par rgyu zhing 'gro ba'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
translated: In the commentary composed by Master Vasubandhu, it says, “Because one proceeds and goes, having mounted tranquility and insight.”

original: ngo bo nyid med kyis byas pa'i 'grel ba las ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong la zhon nas shes rab rnam gsum gyis lam du rgyu zhing bgrod par bya ba'i lam du 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med kyis byas pa'i 'grel ba las ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong la zhon nas shes rab rnam gsum gyis lam du rgyu zhing bgrod par bya ba'i lam du 'gro ba'o //
translated: The commentary composed by Asvabhāva explains: “It is the path that is to be traversed by one who has mounted the vehicle of śamatha and vipaśyanā, and by one who proceeds on the path by means of the three wisdoms.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bzhon pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong las mchog tu gyur ba'i phyir chen po zhes bya'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bzhon pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong las mchog tu gyur ba'i phyir chen po zhes bya'o zhes bshad do //
translated: It is called great because it is superior to the vehicle of śamatha and vipaśyanā of the śrāvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and bodhisattvas.”

original: rnam par thar pa chen po'i stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang smon pa med par 'jug pa'i sgor gyur ba zhes bya ba 'dis ni bcu bdun pa sgo phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa chen po'i stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang smon pa med par 'jug pa'i sgor gyur ba zhes bya ba 'dis ni bcu bdun pa sgo phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
translated: This line “the gateway to engaging the great liberation, emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness” teaches the perfection of the gateway.

original: slob dpon nye ba'i 'od kyis byas pa'i 'grel pa las 'di ltar gzhal med khang chen po rnam par thar ba'i sgo gsum gyis 'jug pa'i gnas byed de /
analyzed: slob dpon nye ba'i 'od kyis byas pa'i 'grel pa las 'di ltar gzhal med khang chen po rnam par thar ba'i sgo gsum gyis 'jug pa'i gnas byed de /
translated: The commentary composed by Master Upālo explains: “It is the abode that is entered by the three gateways of liberation in the great celestial mansion.

original: de la rnam par thar ba ni nges par 'byung ba mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: de la rnam par thar ba ni nges par 'byung ba mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: Liberation is nirvana, which is the going forth of the mind.

original: stong pa la sogs pa ni rnam par thar ba'i sgo yin te /
analyzed: stong pa la sogs pa ni rnam par thar ba'i sgo yin te /
translated: Emptiness, etc. are the doors of liberation.

original: sgo mo de la brten nas zhing yongs su dag par 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: sgo mo de la brten nas zhing yongs su dag par 'jug pa'o //
translated: By means of these doors, one enters into the purification of the field.

original: kun brtags pa'i sems can dang chos bdag med pa ni stong pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i sems can dang chos bdag med pa ni stong pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The emptiness of the self of persons and things, which are imagined, is called emptiness.

original: de la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni rnam par thar ba'i sgo stong pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni rnam par thar ba'i sgo stong pa nyid yin no //
translated: The concentration which has that as its object is the emptiness door of liberation.

original: mtshan ma ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: mtshan ma ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Signlessness is as follows:

original: mtshan ma bcu po rnams te /
analyzed: mtshan ma bcu po rnams te /
translated: There are ten signs:

original: gzugs dang sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg bya dang / skyes pa dang bud med dang skye ba dang rga ba dang 'chi ba ste /
analyzed: gzugs dang sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg bya dang / skyes pa dang bud med dang skye ba dang rga ba dang 'chi ba ste /
translated: form, sound, smell, taste, and tactility, male and female, birth and death.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa 'di la mtshan ma ni bdag med pa'i phyir mtshan ma med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa 'di la mtshan ma ni bdag med pa'i phyir mtshan ma med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: In nirvana, the sign is called signlessness because of the non-existence of the self.

original: de la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo mtshan ma med pa yin no //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo mtshan ma med pa yin no //
translated: The concentration which has that as its object is the signlessness door of liberation.🔽Wishlessness is as follows:

original: smon pa ni smon cing rtsol ba ste /
analyzed: smon pa ni smon cing rtsol ba ste /
translated: Aspiration is the aspiration and striving for the realm of suffering.

original: khams sdug bsngal nyid du ltan smon cing rtsol bar bya ba med pa'i phyir smon pa med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: khams sdug bsngal nyid du ltan smon cing rtsol bar bya ba med pa'i phyir smon pa med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called “without aspiration” because there is no aspiration and striving for the realm of suffering.

original: de la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni rnam par thar ba'i sgo smon pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni rnam par thar ba'i sgo smon pa med pa yin no //
translated: The samadhi that has that as its object is the door of liberation that is without aspiration.

original: stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i rnam par thar ba'i sgo'i dbang gis zhing yongs su dag par 'jug pa thob pa'i phyir sgo zhes bya'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i rnam par thar ba'i sgo'i dbang gis zhing yongs su dag par 'jug pa thob pa'i phyir sgo zhes bya'o //
translated: The door is so called because, by the power of the doors of liberation such as emptiness, one attains the entry to the purification of the field.

original: chen po ni snga ma bzhin du bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: chen po ni snga ma bzhin du bshad par bya'o //
translated: The great is to be explained as before.

original: zhing yongs su dag pa der don gnyer ba yod pas lam dang bzhon pa dang sgo la sogs pa bstan pa ni sems can rnams @67b yang dag pa'i yon tan la rab tu dang ba bskyed pa'i phyir spyod pa'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa yin no zhes
analyzed: zhing yongs su dag pa der don gnyer ba yod pas lam dang bzhon pa dang sgo la sogs pa bstan pa ni sems can rnams @67b yang dag pa'i yon tan la rab tu dang ba bskyed pa'i phyir spyod pa'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa yin no zhes
translated: In that purified field, the teaching of the path, vehicle, door, and so on, is for the sake of those who aspire, and is taught in terms of conduct in order to generate faith in sentient beings in the correct qualities.

original: 'byung ngo // yon tan gyi tshogs mtha' yas par rab tu brgyan pa rin po che padma'i rgyal po chen po rnams kyis rnam par gzhag pa'i gzhal med khang chen po na bzhugs te zhes bya ba 'dis ni bco brgyad pa gzhi phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'byung ngo // yon tan gyi tshogs mtha' yas par rab tu brgyan pa rin po che padma'i rgyal po chen po rnams kyis rnam par gzhag pa'i gzhal med khang chen po na bzhugs te zhes bya ba 'dis ni bco brgyad pa gzhi phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
translated: It is adorned with an infinite array of qualities, and it is arranged with great kings of lotuses made of precious jewels.

original: slob dpon nye ba'i 'od kyis 'grel ba las 'di lta ste /
analyzed: slob dpon nye ba'i 'od kyis 'grel ba las 'di lta ste /
translated: In this passage, Master Upasena explains:

original: ji ltar sa la sogs pa rlung gi dkyil 'khor la sogs pa la brten pa bzhin du'am /
analyzed: ji ltar sa la sogs pa rlung gi dkyil 'khor la sogs pa la brten pa bzhin du'am /
translated: Just as the earth and so on are supported by the wind-disk and so on,

original: yang na 'jig rten pa'i gzhal med khang sa la brten pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: yang na 'jig rten pa'i gzhal med khang sa la brten pa de bzhin du /
translated: or just as the worldly celestial palaces are supported by the earth,

original: zhing yongs su dag pa de yang yon tan gyi tshogs tshad med pas rab tu brgyan pa rin po che le brgan gyi padma'i rgyal po chen po rnams kyis rnam par gzhag pa yin no zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: zhing yongs su dag pa de yang yon tan gyi tshogs tshad med pas rab tu brgyan pa rin po che le brgan gyi padma'i rgyal po chen po rnams kyis rnam par gzhag pa yin no zhes 'byung ste /
translated: in the same way, that pure land is supported by great kings of lotuses made of precious jewels, adorned with an infinite array of qualities.

original: de la don rnam pa gsum gyis chen po dang rgyal po zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de la don rnam pa gsum gyis chen po dang rgyal po zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Here, the meaning of great and king is threefold.

original: dang po ni 'di ltar padma le brgan de rin po che chen po las mngon par grub pa yin la /
analyzed: dang po ni 'di ltar padma le brgan de rin po che chen po las mngon par grub pa yin la /
translated: The first is as follows: thus, that red lotus is fully established from a great jewel.

original: rin po che chen po de yang yon tan dang dge ba'i tshogs tshad med pa las byung bas /
analyzed: rin po che chen po de yang yon tan dang dge ba'i tshogs tshad med pa las byung bas /
translated: That great jewel arises from immeasurable collections of good qualities and virtues.

original: rin po che rnams kyi nang na mchog tu gyur ba'i phyir chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rin po che rnams kyi nang na mchog tu gyur ba'i phyir chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: Because it is supreme among jewels, it is called “great.”

original: rin po che'i padma le brgan de padma rnams kyi nang na mchog dang khyad par du gyur ba'i phyir padma'i rgyal po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rin po che'i padma le brgan de padma rnams kyi nang na mchog dang khyad par du gyur ba'i phyir padma'i rgyal po zhes bya'o //
translated: That red jewel lotus is the king of lotuses because it is supreme and special among lotuses.

original: gnyis pa ni yang na rin po che'i padma de byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba las byung ba las ltos na padma le brgan de dag mchog tu gyur ba'i phyir chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni yang na rin po che'i padma de byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba las byung ba las ltos na padma le brgan de dag mchog tu gyur ba'i phyir chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: The second is as follows: Alternatively, that jewel lotus is called “great” because that red lotus is supreme in comparison to the lotuses that arise from the roots of virtue of bodhisattvas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni chos kyi rgyal po yin la de bzhin gshegs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba mchog las byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni chos kyi rgyal po yin la de bzhin gshegs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba mchog las byung ba'i phyir /
translated: The Tathāgata is the king of the Dharma, and because he arises from the supreme roots of virtue of the Tathāgata,

original: padma'i rgyal po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: padma'i rgyal po zhes bya'o //
translated: he is called the “king of lotuses.”

original: gsum pa ni rin po che'i padma de shin tu rnyed par dka' ba'i phyir na rin po che chen po zhes bya la /🔽padma'i nang na mchog tu gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gsum pa ni rin po che'i padma de shin tu rnyed par dka' ba'i phyir na rin po che chen po zhes bya la / padma'i nang na mchog tu gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: The third is called a great jewel because that jewel lotus is very difficult to obtain.

original: padma'i rgyal po zhes bya'o //🔽padma de gcig kho na ma yin pa 'am /
analyzed: padma'i rgyal po zhes bya'o // padma de gcig kho na ma yin pa 'am /
translated: It is called the king of lotuses because it is supreme among lotuses.

original: yang na padma'i 'dab ma mnga' ba'i phyir rnam shes gsungs so zhes bshad do //
analyzed: yang na padma'i 'dab ma mnga' ba'i phyir rnam shes gsungs so zhes bshad do //
translated: That lotus is not just one, or else it is said to have lotus petals.

original: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel ba las tshig 'di gcig gis gzhi phun sum tshogs pa bstan te /🔽ji ltar sa chen po la sogs rlung gi dkyil @68a * //
analyzed: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel ba las tshig 'di gcig gis gzhi phun sum tshogs pa bstan te / ji ltar sa chen po la sogs rlung gi dkyil @68a * //
translated: In the commentary composed by Master Vasubandhu, this one verse teaches the perfection of the basis.

original: 'khor la sogs pa la brten cing gnas pa bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa 'dir yang ci zhig gzhi byed ce na /
analyzed: 'khor la sogs pa la brten cing gnas pa bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa 'dir yang ci zhig gzhi byed ce na /
translated: Just as the great earth and so on are based and situated on the wind maṇḍala and so on, what is the basis here in this pure buddhafield?

original: yon tan gyi tshogs tshad med pas rab tu brgyan pa padma le brgan gyi rgyal po chen pos rnam par gzhag pa zhes gsungs pa yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: yon tan gyi tshogs tshad med pas rab tu brgyan pa padma le brgan gyi rgyal po chen pos rnam par gzhag pa zhes gsungs pa yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: It is adorned with immeasurable collections of good qualities, and is arranged with great red lotuses.

original: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las ni padma le brgan 'di padma rnams kyi nang na 'di mchog dang khyad par can du gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las ni padma le brgan 'di padma rnams kyi nang na 'di mchog dang khyad par can du gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: Master Bhāviveka’s commentary says, “Because this red lotus is the best and most special of all lotuses,

original: rin po che'i padma'i rgyal po zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rin po che'i padma'i rgyal po zhes gsungs so //
translated: it is called the king of precious lotuses.

original: yang na de bzhin gshegs pa ni rgyal po chen po zhes brjod la /
analyzed: yang na de bzhin gshegs pa ni rgyal po chen po zhes brjod la /
translated: Or, the Tathāgata is called the great king,

original: padma le brgan 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rten pa'i gnas yin /
analyzed: padma le brgan 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rten pa'i gnas yin /
translated: and this red lotus is the abode of the Tathāgata.

original: bdag po'i dbang du mdzad nas ming 'di skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: bdag po'i dbang du mdzad nas ming 'di skad ces bya'o //
translated: From the perspective of ownership, it is called by this name.

original: rnam par gzhag ces bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rnam par gzhag ces bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: ‘Arranged’ means that,

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa de padma'i rgyal po 'di la brten nas rtag par rgyun du bar chad med pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa de padma'i rgyal po 'di la brten nas rtag par rgyun du bar chad med pa ste /
translated: in that pure buddha realm, it is always, continuously, and uninterruptedly

original: tshig 'dis ni gzhi phun sum tshogs pa bsten to zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: tshig 'dis ni gzhi phun sum tshogs pa bsten to zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: This passage shows that the basis is perfect.

original: gzhan yang theg pa chen po bsdus pa las yang sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa'i longs spyod ni shin tu dag pa dang / shin tu kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / shin tu dbang bsgyur ba can no zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang theg pa chen po bsdus pa las yang sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa'i longs spyod ni shin tu dag pa dang / shin tu kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / shin tu dbang bsgyur ba can no zhes 'byung ste /
translated: Moreover, the Compendium of the Great Vehicle says, “The enjoyment of a completely pure buddhafield is extremely pure, extremely irreproachable, and extremely sovereign.”

original: 'di nyid kyi 'grel pa las /
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi 'grel pa las /
translated: And its commentary says,

original: de la shin tu dag pa zhes bya ba ni ma dag pa med pa'i phyir dang / gcin rkyag dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la shin tu dag pa zhes bya ba ni ma dag pa med pa'i phyir dang / gcin rkyag dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: “Extremely pure” means that it is not impure and is free of urine and excrement.

original: shin tu bde ba ni sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba dang / tshor ba bar med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shin tu bde ba ni sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba dang / tshor ba bar med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Extremely blissful” means that it is free of the sensation of suffering and of neutral sensations.

original: shin tu kha na ma tho ba med pa ni mi dge ba dang lung ma bstan pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shin tu kha na ma tho ba med pa ni mi dge ba dang lung ma bstan pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Extremely irreproachable” means that it is free of nonvirtue and neutral states.

original: shin tu dbang bsgyur ba can ni phyi rol gyi rkyen la mi ltos pa'i phyir dang / sems bskyed pa tsam gyis bya ba rnams 'byor ba'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: shin tu dbang bsgyur ba can ni phyi rol gyi rkyen la mi ltos pa'i phyir dang / sems bskyed pa tsam gyis bya ba rnams 'byor ba'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: The very well-controlled are so called because they do not depend on external conditions and because they have mastery over all activities by merely generating the mind.

original: bcom ldan 'das shin tu rnam par dag pa'i blo dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni de yan chad du gnas kyi bkod pa rnam par bshad nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das shin tu rnam par dag pa'i blo dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni de yan chad du gnas kyi bkod pa rnam par bshad nas /
translated: The Blessed One, endowed with a very pure mind, and so on, having explained the arrangement of the stages up to here,

original: 'di man chad gnyis pa yon tan gyi spyi dang khyad par rab tu bstan pa zhes bya ba bstan to //
analyzed: 'di man chad gnyis pa yon tan gyi spyi dang khyad par rab tu bstan pa zhes bya ba bstan to //
translated: from here on, the second chapter is taught called The Teaching of the General and Specific Qualities.

original: 'dir ci'i phyir gnas sngar bstan la /
analyzed: 'dir ci'i phyir gnas sngar bstan la /
translated: Here, why are the stages taught first,

original: yon tan phyis bstan zhe na /
analyzed: yon tan phyis bstan zhe na /

original: slob dpon nye ba'i 'od kyis 'grel pa las /
analyzed: slob dpon nye ba'i 'od kyis 'grel pa las /
translated: Master Upasena explains in the commentary:

original: bcom ldan 'das @68b sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa na bzhugs shing yon tan 'di lta bu dang ldan pas mdo sde 'di gsungs so zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das @68b sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa na bzhugs shing yon tan 'di lta bu dang ldan pas mdo sde 'di gsungs so zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
translated: In order to show that the Blessed One, dwelling in the completely pure buddha-field, endowed with such qualities, taught this sutra.

original: de la yon tan rnam par bshad pa la yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
analyzed: de la yon tan rnam par bshad pa la yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
translated: The explanation of the qualities is also divided into two:

original: yon tan gyi spyi'i rnam par bshad pa dang / yon tan gyi khyad par rnam par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: yon tan gyi spyi'i rnam par bshad pa dang / yon tan gyi khyad par rnam par bshad pa'o //
translated: the general explanation of the qualities and the specific explanation of the qualities.🔽What is the point of teaching these two qualities?

original: yon tan 'di gnyis bstan pa la don ci yod ce na sangs rgyas kyi sa'i 'grel pa las don rnam pa gnyis kyi phyir zhes bshad de /
analyzed: yon tan 'di gnyis bstan pa la don ci yod ce na sangs rgyas kyi sa'i 'grel pa las don rnam pa gnyis kyi phyir zhes bshad de /
translated: The commentary on the Buddha Level states that it is for two reasons:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ston pa gzhan las khyad par du 'phags par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ston pa gzhan las khyad par du 'phags par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the Tathagatas are superior to other teachers,

translated: the special qualities of the Lord are taught, and in order to generate faith in others, the perfect qualities of the Tathagata are taught.

original: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las /
analyzed: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las /
translated: The master Asvabhava comments:

original: bcom ldan 'das nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi blo las mchog tu gyur par bstan pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das zhes bya bas gang zag yon tan can yin par bstan la /
