analyzed: yon tan mchog tu gyur ba de yang sangs rgyas kyi sa'i 'grel ba dang sbyar na don rnam pa gsum du bshad de /
translated: The Bhagavan is said to be the best of beings with a mind, in order to show that he is superior to the sravakas, pratyekabuddhas and bodhisattvas.🔽The Bhagavan is said to be the best of beings with a mind, in order to show that he is superior to the sravakas, pratyekabuddhas and bodhisattvas.🔽The Bhagavan is said to be the best of beings with a mind, in order to show that he is superior to the sravakas, pratyekabuddhas and bodhisattvas.🔽The Bhagavan is said to be the best of beings with a mind, in order to show that he is superior to the sravakas, pratyekabuddhas and bodhisattvas.🔽The Bhagavan is said to be the best of beings with a mind, in order to show that he is superior to the sravakas, pratyekabuddhas and bodhisattvas.🔽The Bhagavan is said to be the best of beings with a mind, in order to show that he is superior to the sravakas, pratyekabuddhas and bodhisattvas.

original: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas thugs su chud par bya ba ji snyed pa yod pa thams cad yang dag par thugs su chud pa'i blo mnga' ba'i phyir dang / thugs su chud par bya ba thams cad legs par rdzogs par yang dag par thugs su chud pa'i blo mnga' ba'i phyir dang /
analyzed: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas thugs su chud par bya ba ji snyed pa yod pa thams cad yang dag par thugs su chud pa'i blo mnga' ba'i phyir dang / thugs su chud par bya ba thams cad legs par rdzogs par yang dag par thugs su chud pa'i blo mnga' ba'i phyir dang /
translated: The Bhagavan is said to be the best of beings with a mind, in order to show that he is superior to the sravakas, pratyekabuddhas and bodhisattvas

original: ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa dang ji snyed yod pa thams cad yang dag par thugs su chud pa'i blo mnga' ba'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa dang ji snyed yod pa thams cad yang dag par thugs su chud pa'i blo mnga' ba'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: because he has the knowledge that comprehends all that exists in terms of the way things really are and the diversity of phenomena.

original: rnam pa gsum du bshad pa la bye brag yod par bstan pa yang so so nas bshad pa mi mthun te /
analyzed: rnam pa gsum du bshad pa la bye brag yod par bstan pa yang so so nas bshad pa mi mthun te /
translated: The explanation of the three aspects of the Buddha's knowledge is not consistent with the individual explanations of the differences.

original: kha cig na re dang po ni chos kyi rnam grangs kyi dbang du byas nas shin tu rnam par dag pa'i blo bstan te /
analyzed: kha cig na re dang po ni chos kyi rnam grangs kyi dbang du byas nas shin tu rnam par dag pa'i blo bstan te /
translated: Some say that the first is taught from the perspective of the categories of phenomena, as the knowledge that is completely pure;

original: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi shes bya mtha' dag ma lus par bsdus pa'i phyir ro //🔽gnyis pa ni legs par rdzogs pa'i dbang du byas @69a * //
analyzed: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi shes bya mtha' dag ma lus par bsdus pa'i phyir ro // gnyis pa ni legs par rdzogs pa'i dbang du byas @69a * //
translated: because it includes all knowable objects, both conditioned and unconditioned, without exception.

original: nas shin tu rnam par dag pa'i blo bstan te /
analyzed: nas shin tu rnam par dag pa'i blo bstan te /
translated: The second is taught from the perspective of perfection, as the knowledge that is completely pure;

original: sgrib pa spangs pa shin tu gya nom pa yang yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgrib pa spangs pa shin tu gya nom pa yang yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the perfect completion of the elimination of obscurations.

original: gsum pa ni rang gi ngo bo nyid dang bye brag gi dbang du byas nas shin tu rnam par dag pa'i blo bstan te /
analyzed: gsum pa ni rang gi ngo bo nyid dang bye brag gi dbang du byas nas shin tu rnam par dag pa'i blo bstan te /
translated: The third is taught from the perspective of the essence and the distinctions, as the knowledge that is completely pure;

original: rang gi ngo bo nyid thugs su chud pa ni ji snyed yod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo nyid thugs su chud pa ni ji snyed yod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The understanding of its own-nature is called the knowledge of all that exists.

original: bye brag tu thugs su chud pa ni ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bye brag tu thugs su chud pa ni ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The understanding of its differentiation is called the knowledge of the mode of being of all that exists.

original: kha cig na re dang po ni chos kyi rnam grangs kyi dbang du byas nas shin tu rnam par dag pa'i blo bstan pa yin no zhes bshad de snga ma dang mthun no //
analyzed: kha cig na re dang po ni chos kyi rnam grangs kyi dbang du byas nas shin tu rnam par dag pa'i blo bstan pa yin no zhes bshad de snga ma dang mthun no //
translated: Some say that the first is taught from the point of view of the categories of phenomena, and that the second is taught from the point of view of the two knowledges.

original: gnyis pa ni mkhyen pa gnyis kyi dbang du byas nas shin tu rnam par dag pa'i blo bstan te /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni mkhyen pa gnyis kyi dbang du byas nas shin tu rnam par dag pa'i blo bstan te /
translated: The second is taught from the point of view of the two knowledges.

original: 'di ltar sems can stong pa nyid du mkhyen pa ni yongs su dag pa gya nom pa'i blo zhes bya ba la chos stong pa nyid mkhyen pa ni yongs su rdzogs pa'i blo zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar sems can stong pa nyid du mkhyen pa ni yongs su dag pa gya nom pa'i blo zhes bya ba la chos stong pa nyid mkhyen pa ni yongs su rdzogs pa'i blo zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, the knowledge of the emptiness of sentient beings is called the knowledge of the pure, excellent thought, and the knowledge of the emptiness of phenomena is called the knowledge of the complete thought.

original: gsum pa ni don dam pa dang kun rdzob kyi shes bya'i dbang du byas nas shin tu rnam par dag pa'i blo bstan te /
analyzed: gsum pa ni don dam pa dang kun rdzob kyi shes bya'i dbang du byas nas shin tu rnam par dag pa'i blo bstan te /
translated: The third is taught from the point of view of the ultimate and conventional objects of knowledge.

original: kun rdzob kyi yul la dmigs pa ni ji snyed yod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi yul la dmigs pa ni ji snyed yod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The object of the conventional is called “the diversity of phenomena.”

original: don dam pa'i yul la dmigs pa ni ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: don dam pa'i yul la dmigs pa ni ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The object of the ultimate is called “the real nature of phenomena.”

original: de'i phyir 'og nas mdo las ji snyed yod pa nyid ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'og nas mdo las ji snyed yod pa nyid ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la sogs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said in the sutra, “The diversity of phenomena refers to the five aggregates, etc., that are appropriated.

original: ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa ni de bzhin nyid bdun la sogs pa'o zhes gsungs pa yin no zhe'o //
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa ni de bzhin nyid bdun la sogs pa'o zhes gsungs pa yin no zhe'o //
translated: The real nature of phenomena refers to suchness, etc.”

original: tshig gnyis kyi bshad pa ni yi ge thad kar bab pa na bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: tshig gnyis kyi bshad pa ni yi ge thad kar bab pa na bshad par bya'o //
translated: The explanation of these two terms should be understood in the order in which they are presented in the sutra.

original: kun tu spyod pa gnyis mi mnga' ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnyis pa yon tan gyi khyad par bstan to //
analyzed: kun tu spyod pa gnyis mi mnga' ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnyis pa yon tan gyi khyad par bstan to //
translated: The phrase “he is free from the two kinds of error” indicates the second kind of excellence, that of the absence of error.

original: yon tan 'di dag rnam par bshad pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: yon tan 'di dag rnam par bshad pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: This excellence is also explained in two ways.

original: grangs kyi rnam pa mang nyung dang dpe gsar rnying mthun mi mthun bstan pa dang / bstan bcos rnams dang sbyar nas mdo sde'i tshig rnam par dgrol ba'o //
analyzed: grangs kyi rnam pa mang nyung dang dpe gsar rnying mthun mi mthun bstan pa dang / bstan bcos rnams dang sbyar nas mdo sde'i tshig rnam par dgrol ba'o //
translated: The explanation of the number of aspects, whether the examples are similar or not, and the interpretation of the sūtra statements in terms of the treatises.

original: de la mthun mi mthun zhes bya ba yang theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i dpe mi mthun pa gzhan kha cig las mdo sde'i tshig nyi shu las med do //
analyzed: de la mthun mi mthun zhes bya ba yang theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i dpe mi mthun pa gzhan kha cig las mdo sde'i tshig nyi shu las med do //
translated: As for the question of similarity, some other sources that summarize the Great Vehicle say that there are only twenty sūtra statements.

original: mdo tshig phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug pa zhes bya ba ma tshang ba dang bye brag med par yon tan nyi shu rtsa gcig gi ming tsam zhig smos pa kho nar zad do //
analyzed: mdo tshig phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug pa zhes bya ba ma tshang ba dang bye brag med par yon tan nyi shu rtsa gcig gi ming tsam zhig smos pa kho nar zad do //
translated: The phrase “the final end of the sūtra statements” refers to the mere names of the twenty-one good qualities without any omissions or repetitions.

original: de'i 'grel pa las kyang mgor ni rigs pa rnam pa nyi shu'i dbang gis de bzhin @69b gshegs pa'i blo shin tu rnam par dag par mngon par 'grub pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de'i 'grel pa las kyang mgor ni rigs pa rnam pa nyi shu'i dbang gis de bzhin @69b gshegs pa'i blo shin tu rnam par dag par mngon par 'grub pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: And the commentary to that says, “At the beginning, because of the twenty kinds of reasoning, the tathāgata’s mind is fully accomplished as being utterly pure.”

original: mjug tu ni tshig dang po ni mdor rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: mjug tu ni tshig dang po ni mdor rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: And at the end, the first phrase is the summary.

original: gzhan nyi shu rtsa gcig gis ni de sgrub par byed do zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gzhan nyi shu rtsa gcig gis ni de sgrub par byed do zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: The other twenty-one prove that.

original: dpe rnying 'gyur de la skyon rnam ba gnyis yod de /
analyzed: dpe rnying 'gyur de la skyon rnam ba gnyis yod de /
translated: There are two faults in that old translation:

original: mdo'i tshig phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug pa zhes bya ba ma tshang ba dang / 'grel pa las rigs pa rnam pa nyi shu zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: mdo'i tshig phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug pa zhes bya ba ma tshang ba dang / 'grel pa las rigs pa rnam pa nyi shu zhes 'byung ste /
translated: the words “at the end of the last” are incomplete, and the commentary says “twenty kinds of reasoning,”

original: 'og nas tshig nyi shu rtsa gcig ces 'byung ba dang mi mthun pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'og nas tshig nyi shu rtsa gcig ces 'byung ba dang mi mthun pa'i phyir /
translated: which is inconsistent with the twenty-one lines below.

original: slob dpon de dag gis bsgyur cing bshad pa la nor ba yod do //
analyzed: slob dpon de dag gis bsgyur cing bshad pa la nor ba yod do //
translated: There are errors in the translations and explanations by those masters.

original: slob dpon yang dag bden pas ni yon tan gyi khyad par bstan pa la tshig nyi shu yod de mjug bsdus pa'i tshig kyang der bsdu na nyi shu rtsa gcig tu 'gyur ro zhes bshad do //
analyzed: slob dpon yang dag bden pas ni yon tan gyi khyad par bstan pa la tshig nyi shu yod de mjug bsdus pa'i tshig kyang der bsdu na nyi shu rtsa gcig tu 'gyur ro zhes bshad do //
translated: Master Samghabhadra explains that there are twenty lines demonstrating the distinctions of qualities, and if the concluding line is included, there are twenty-one.

original: de la gnyis pa bstan bcos rnams dang sbyar nas mdo sde'i tshig rnam par dgrol ba yang yon tan gyi khyad par 'di rnam par bshad pa bstan bcos las mi mthun te /🔽slob dpon thogs med kyis mdzad pa bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa las sngar ni mdo sde las gsungs pa'i tshig nyi shu rtsa gcig bkod pa de'i 'og tu ni rigs pa dang sbyar nas mdo sde'i tshig gi go rims bzhin du yon tan gyi ming
analyzed: de la gnyis pa bstan bcos rnams dang sbyar nas mdo sde'i tshig rnam par dgrol ba yang yon tan gyi khyad par 'di rnam par bshad pa bstan bcos las mi mthun te / slob dpon thogs med kyis mdzad pa bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa las sngar ni mdo sde las gsungs pa'i tshig nyi shu rtsa gcig bkod pa de'i 'og tu ni rigs pa dang sbyar nas mdo sde'i tshig gi go rims bzhin du yon tan gyi ming
translated: The qualities are not explained in the treatises in the same way as they are in the sūtras.

original: rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: rnam par gzhag go //
translated: In the treatise Compendium of the Mahāyāna composed by the master Asaṅga, after the previous twenty-one statements from the sūtras are cited, the names of the qualities are presented in the order of the statements of the sūtras in accordance with reasoning.

original: de dag gi rnam par bshad pa ni med do //
analyzed: de dag gi rnam par bshad pa ni med do //
translated: But there is no explanation of them.

original: yon tan de dag gi ming yang theg pa chen po bsdus pa las ji skad du shes bya la shin tu sgrib pa med par 'jug pa'i yon tan dang / yod pa dang med pa'i de bzhin nyid mchog tu rnam par dag par 'jug par mdzad pa'i yon tan dang /
analyzed: yon tan de dag gi ming yang theg pa chen po bsdus pa las ji skad du shes bya la shin tu sgrib pa med par 'jug pa'i yon tan dang / yod pa dang med pa'i de bzhin nyid mchog tu rnam par dag par 'jug par mdzad pa'i yon tan dang /
translated: The names of those qualities are as they appear in the Compendium of the Mahāyāna: the quality of engaging objects of knowledge without the slightest obscuration, the quality of engaging the supreme purity of the suchness of existence and nonexistence,

original: sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa lhun gyis grub pa rgyun mi 'chad par gnas pa'i yon tan dang / chos kyi sku la gnas pa dang / dgongs pa dang / phrin las mdzad pa tha dad pa mi mnga' ba'i yon tan dang sgrib pa thams cad kyi gnyen po bsgoms pa'i yon tan dang mu stegs can thams cad btul ba'i yon tan dang /🔽'jig rten du skyes kyang 'jig rten gyi chos kyis mi 'phrogs pa'i yon tan dang / chos yang dag pa rnam par gzhag pa'i yon tan dang / lung ston pa'i yon tan dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du longs spyod rdzogs pa dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa lhun gyis grub pa rgyun mi 'chad par gnas pa'i yon tan dang / chos kyi sku la gnas pa dang / dgongs pa dang / phrin las mdzad pa tha dad pa mi mnga' ba'i yon tan dang sgrib pa thams cad kyi gnyen po bsgoms pa'i yon tan dang mu stegs can thams cad btul ba'i yon tan dang / 'jig rten du skyes kyang 'jig rten gyi chos kyis mi 'phrogs pa'i yon tan dang / chos yang dag pa rnam par gzhag pa'i yon tan dang / lung ston pa'i yon tan dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du longs spyod rdzogs pa dang /
translated: the quality of remaining in the spontaneous accomplishment of the deeds of the buddhas without interruption, the quality of abiding in the dharmakāya, the quality of not having a different intention or activity, the quality of meditating on the antidote to all obscurations, the quality of subduing all tīrthikas,🔽the quality of not being carried away by worldly phenomena even though born in the world, the quality of perfectly setting forth the Dharma, the quality of giving prophecies, the quality of displaying the saṃbhogakāya and nirmāṇakāya in all world systems,

original: sprul pa'i sku ston pa'i yon tan dang / @70a * //
analyzed: sprul pa'i sku ston pa'i yon tan dang / @70a * //
translated: and the quality of being unstained by worldly dharmas.

original: the tshom gcod pa'i yon tan dang spyod pa sna tshogs kyis 'jug par mdzad pa'i yon tan dang / phyi ma la chos 'byung ba rab tu mkhyen pa'i yon tan dang / mos pa ji lta ba bzhin ston pa'i yon tan dang / rten tshad med bas sems can 'dul bar sbyor ba'i yon tan dang ;
analyzed: the tshom gcod pa'i yon tan dang spyod pa sna tshogs kyis 'jug par mdzad pa'i yon tan dang / phyi ma la chos 'byung ba rab tu mkhyen pa'i yon tan dang / mos pa ji lta ba bzhin ston pa'i yon tan dang / rten tshad med bas sems can 'dul bar sbyor ba'i yon tan dang ;
translated: the quality of resolving doubts, the quality of engaging in various activities, the quality of fully knowing the source of the Dharma in the future, the quality of teaching in accordance with inclinations, the quality of applying to train sentient beings through immeasurable supports,

original: chos kyi sku mnyam pa la pha rol tu phyin pa rnams yongs su grub pa'i yon tan dang / mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi zhing tha dad pa ston pa'i yon tan dang / sangs rgyas kyi sku gsum gyi yul yongs su mchad pa'i yon tan dang /
analyzed: chos kyi sku mnyam pa la pha rol tu phyin pa rnams yongs su grub pa'i yon tan dang / mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi zhing tha dad pa ston pa'i yon tan dang / sangs rgyas kyi sku gsum gyi yul yongs su mchad pa'i yon tan dang /
translated: the quality of the perfections being fully accomplished in the equality of the Dharma body, the quality of displaying different buddha fields in accordance with inclinations, the quality of fully knowing the domain of the three buddha bodies,

original: 'khor ba'i mtha' ji snyam par sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde ba nye bar gnas pa'i yon tan dang / mi zad pa'i yon tan la sogs pa'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i mtha' ji snyam par sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde ba nye bar gnas pa'i yon tan dang / mi zad pa'i yon tan la sogs pa'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: the quality of abiding in the benefit and happiness of all sentient beings for as long as cyclic existence lasts, and the quality of inexhaustibility and so on.

original: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa las /
analyzed: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa las /
translated: The commentary composed by Master Vasubandhu

original: yon tan nyi shu rtsa gcig po 'di dag mdo tsam du rnam par 'grel to //
analyzed: yon tan nyi shu rtsa gcig po 'di dag mdo tsam du rnam par 'grel to //
translated: explains these twenty-one qualities in brief.

original: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las ni yon tan nyi shu rtsa gcig po 'di dag rgya cher 'chad de /
analyzed: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las ni yon tan nyi shu rtsa gcig po 'di dag rgya cher 'chad de /
translated: Master Bhāviveka’s commentary explains these twenty-one qualities extensively

original: yon tan rnams mtshams sbyor ba'i go rims kyang ston to //
analyzed: yon tan rnams mtshams sbyor ba'i go rims kyang ston to //
translated: and also teaches the order in which the qualities are connected.

original: slob dpon nye ba'i 'od kyis byas pa'i sangs rgyas kyi sa'i 'grel ba las ni rnam grangs gnyis kyis yon tan nyi shu rtsa gcig rnam par bshad de /
analyzed: slob dpon nye ba'i 'od kyis byas pa'i sangs rgyas kyi sa'i 'grel ba las ni rnam grangs gnyis kyis yon tan nyi shu rtsa gcig rnam par bshad de /
translated: In the commentary on the Buddha’s Stage composed by Master Upāśānta, the twenty-one qualities are explained by means of two enumerations.

original: de rnam grangs dang po las ni rang nyid kyi yon tan gyi ming rnam par gzhag nas mdo'i tshig rnam par 'chad do //
analyzed: de rnam grangs dang po las ni rang nyid kyi yon tan gyi ming rnam par gzhag nas mdo'i tshig rnam par 'chad do //
translated: In the first enumeration, having established the names of the qualities themselves, the words of the sūtra are explained.

original: rnam grangs gnyis pa las ni slob dpon thogs med kyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa las 'byung ba'i yon tan gyi ming rnam par gzhag pa la brten nas mdo'i tshig rnam par 'chad de /
analyzed: rnam grangs gnyis pa las ni slob dpon thogs med kyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa las 'byung ba'i yon tan gyi ming rnam par gzhag pa la brten nas mdo'i tshig rnam par 'chad de /
translated: The second system explains the words of the sutra in dependence on the presentation of the names of qualities that appear in the commentary composed by master Asaṅga.🔽

original: bstan bcos gzhan dang mthun no //
analyzed: bstan bcos gzhan dang mthun no //
translated: The second method of explanation is based on the names of the qualities that occur in the commentary composed by Master Asaṅga, and it explains the words of the sutra in accordance with other treatises.

original: tshig gi don rnam par bshad pa yang yon tan nyi shu rtsa gcig yod pa de nyid kyis rnam pa nyi shu rtsa gcig tu rnam par dbye ste /🔽rnam pa re re yang sngar ni smos pa bstan la /
analyzed: tshig gi don rnam par bshad pa yang yon tan nyi shu rtsa gcig yod pa de nyid kyis rnam pa nyi shu rtsa gcig tu rnam par dbye ste / rnam pa re re yang sngar ni smos pa bstan la /
translated: The meaning of the words is explained by means of the twenty-one qualities, which are divided into twenty-one aspects.

original: phyis ni yon tan dang sbyar bas bstan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: phyis ni yon tan dang sbyar bas bstan par rig par bya'o //
translated: Each aspect should be understood as taught previously by mentioning the name and later by mentioning the quality.

original: de la kun tu spyod pa gnyis mi mnga' ba zhes bya bas ni yon tan dang po bstan te /
analyzed: de la kun tu spyod pa gnyis mi mnga' ba zhes bya bas ni yon tan dang po bstan te /
translated: Here, the phrase “he does not have the two kinds of conduct” teaches the first quality.

original: 'di ni shes bya la shin tu sgrib pa med par 'jug pa'i yon tan zhes bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ni shes bya la shin tu sgrib pa med par 'jug pa'i yon tan zhes bya ba nyid do //
translated: This is the quality of engaging with the knowable without any obscurations.

original: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa las ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi shes pa ltar kha cig tu ni thogs pa dang @70b bcas la /
analyzed: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa las ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi shes pa ltar kha cig tu ni thogs pa dang @70b bcas la /
translated: Vasubandhu’s commentary explains:

original: kha cig tu ni thogs pa med pa lta bu ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad de /
analyzed: kha cig tu ni thogs pa med pa lta bu ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad de /
translated: Because it is not like the cognition of śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas, which sometimes has resistance and sometimes does not.

original: ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las kyang 'di dang mthun par bshad do //🔽'di ltar theg pa gnyis kyi ye shes kyis thag nye ba ni shes la /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las kyang 'di dang mthun par bshad do // 'di ltar theg pa gnyis kyi ye shes kyis thag nye ba ni shes la /
translated: And the commentary by Bhāviveka explains this in the same way.

original: thag ring po mi shes pa'i phyir thogs pa dang bcas pa'i kun tu spyod pa gnyis dang ldan no //
analyzed: thag ring po mi shes pa'i phyir thogs pa dang bcas pa'i kun tu spyod pa gnyis dang ldan no //
translated: Thus the Buddha has two kinds of activities that have resistance: he knows what is near by means of the wisdom of the two vehicles,🔽but he does not know what is far away.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni thag ring po dang nye ba kun mkhyen cing gcig tu thogs pa mi mnga' ba'i phyir kun tu spyod pa gnyis mi mnga'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni thag ring po dang nye ba kun mkhyen cing gcig tu thogs pa mi mnga' ba'i phyir kun tu spyod pa gnyis mi mnga'o //
translated: The Tathāgata does not have these two kinds of activities because he knows everything, both what is far away and what is near, and he is never obstructed.

original: gzhan yang ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las /
analyzed: gzhan yang ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las /
translated: Moreover, the commentary by Bhāviveka explains:

original: yang na gnas gnyis kyi kun tu spyod pa 'di la mi mnga' bas /
analyzed: yang na gnas gnyis kyi kun tu spyod pa 'di la mi mnga' bas /
translated: Or else, because he does not have these two kinds of activities in two abodes,

original: kun tu spyod pa gnyis mi mnga' ba zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: kun tu spyod pa gnyis mi mnga' ba zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ste /
translated: He is said to be without the two kinds of obstruction to action.

original: ji ltar mngon par shes pa ma thob pa'i gang zag ni thag nye ba dang thag ring ba gnas gnyis la thogs pa dang bcas pa'i kun tu spyod pa yod mod kyi /
analyzed: ji ltar mngon par shes pa ma thob pa'i gang zag ni thag nye ba dang thag ring ba gnas gnyis la thogs pa dang bcas pa'i kun tu spyod pa yod mod kyi /
translated: Just as a person who has not attained the higher perceptions has obstructed action in two places, near and far,

original: bcom ldan 'das ni thag nye ba dang ring ba thams cad la thogs pa mi mnga' bas kun tu spyod pa gnyis mi mnga' ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni thag nye ba dang ring ba thams cad la thogs pa mi mnga' bas kun tu spyod pa gnyis mi mnga' ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the Bhagavat is said to be without the two kinds of obstruction to action because he is not obstructed in all places, near and far.

original: slob dpon nye ba'i 'od kyis 'grel pa las /
analyzed: slob dpon nye ba'i 'od kyis 'grel pa las /
translated: Master Upasika says in his commentary:

original: 'di ltar nyan thos la sogs pa ni spyod yul rnams la shes pa thogs pa dang bcas pas shin tu thag ring ba'i dus dang phyogs dang rnam pa tshad med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams la shes pa 'jug pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar nyan thos la sogs pa ni spyod yul rnams la shes pa thogs pa dang bcas pas shin tu thag ring ba'i dus dang phyogs dang rnam pa tshad med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams la shes pa 'jug pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, sravakas and so on have obstructed knowledge in their fields of experience, because they do not engage in knowing the limitless Buddha qualities of time, place and aspect that are very distant.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: The Tathagata is not like that.

original: dus dang phyogs thams cad dang rnam pa tshad med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi yul rnams la rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyis thogs pa mi mnga' bar 'jug pas chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid la mkhyen pa dang mi mkhyen pa'i kun tu spyod pa gnyis mi
analyzed: dus dang phyogs thams cad dang rnam pa tshad med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi yul rnams la rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyis thogs pa mi mnga' bar 'jug pas chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid la mkhyen pa dang mi mkhyen pa'i kun tu spyod pa gnyis mi
translated: And because the gnosis of omniscience engages without impediment in the objects of the buddhas in all times, directions and aspects, the buddhas have no conduct whatsoever of knowing or not knowing the characteristics of phenomena.

original: mnga' ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mnga' ba'i phyir /
translated: Because the pristine wisdom of omniscience engages without impediment in all times, directions and the limitless aspects of the objects of buddhas, the Buddha does not have the two kinds of conduct of knowing and not knowing the characteristics of phenomena.

original: kun tu spyod pa gnyis mi mnga' ba zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: kun tu spyod pa gnyis mi mnga' ba zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Therefore it is said that he does not have two kinds of conduct.

original: gzhan yang de nyid las 'di ni bcom ldan 'das kyis shin tu sgrib pa mi mnga' pas khyad par du 'phags pa'i yon tan bstan te /
analyzed: gzhan yang de nyid las 'di ni bcom ldan 'das kyis shin tu sgrib pa mi mnga' pas khyad par du 'phags pa'i yon tan bstan te /
translated: Moreover, this sutra explains that the Buddha is superior because he is completely free of obscurations:

original: 'di ltar byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams ni 'khor ba las rab tu chags la /
analyzed: 'di ltar byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams ni 'khor ba las rab tu chags la /
translated: Thus ordinary beings are attached to samsara

original: theg pa gnyis kyis 'phags pa dag ni mya ngan las 'das pa la mngon par zhen te /
analyzed: theg pa gnyis kyis 'phags pa dag ni mya ngan las 'das pa la mngon par zhen te /
translated: and āryas of the two vehicles are attached to nirvana.

original: de lta bu'i sgrib pa gnyis bcom ldan 'das la mi mnga' ba'i phyir zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de lta bu'i sgrib pa gnyis bcom ldan 'das la mi mnga' ba'i phyir zhes bshad do //
translated: The Buddha does not have these two obscurations.

original: bstan bcos rnams las bshad pa yang mdor bsdu na rnam pa gsum du 'gyur te /🔽dang pos ni thogs pa dang bcas @71a * //
analyzed: bstan bcos rnams las bshad pa yang mdor bsdu na rnam pa gsum du 'gyur te / dang pos ni thogs pa dang bcas @71a * //
translated: The explanations in the treatises are also summarized in three aspects.

original: pa dang thogs pa med pas kun tu spyod pa gnyis bstan to //
analyzed: pa dang thogs pa med pas kun tu spyod pa gnyis bstan to //
translated: The first explains the two kinds of conduct, that is, with resistance and without resistance.

original: gnyis pas ni gnas gnyis la thogs pa spyod par kun tu spyod pa gnyis bstan to //
analyzed: gnyis pas ni gnas gnyis la thogs pa spyod par kun tu spyod pa gnyis bstan to //
translated: The second explains the two kinds of conduct, that is, conduct that is resistant in two situations.

original: gsum pas ni 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa la gnas pas kun tu spyod pa gnyis bstan te /
analyzed: gsum pas ni 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa la gnas pas kun tu spyod pa gnyis bstan te /
translated: The third explains the two kinds of conduct, that is, conduct that is resistant in samsara and nirvana.

original: bcom ldan 'das la 'di lta bu'i kun tu spyod pa rnam pa gsum mi mnga' ba'i phyir kun tu spyod pa gnyis mi mnga' ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la 'di lta bu'i kun tu spyod pa rnam pa gsum mi mnga' ba'i phyir kun tu spyod pa gnyis mi mnga' ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Because the Lord does not have these three kinds of conduct, he is said to be without the two kinds of conduct.

original: mtshan nyid med pa'i chos la mchog tu gzhol bar mdzad pa zhes bya bas ni yon tan gnyis bstan te /
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa'i chos la mchog tu gzhol bar mdzad pa zhes bya bas ni yon tan gnyis bstan te /
translated: The phrase “he is the one who has attained the supreme Dharma that is devoid of characteristics” indicates two qualities.

original: 'di ni yod pa dang med pa gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid de bzhin nyid mchog tu rnam par dag par 'jug par mdzad pa'i yon tan zhes bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ni yod pa dang med pa gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid de bzhin nyid mchog tu rnam par dag par 'jug par mdzad pa'i yon tan zhes bya ba nyid do //
translated: This is the characteristic of the non-duality of existence and non-existence, the supreme, perfectly purified suchness, which is called the quality of engagement.

original: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa las yongs su dag pa'i de bzhin nyid ni mtshan nyid med pa'i chos zhes bya'o //
analyzed: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa las yongs su dag pa'i de bzhin nyid ni mtshan nyid med pa'i chos zhes bya'o //
translated: In the commentary composed by Master Vasubandhu, it is said that perfectly pure suchness is called the dharma without characteristics.

original: gzhol ba ni 'jug par gzhol ba'o //
analyzed: gzhol ba ni 'jug par gzhol ba'o //
translated: Inclination means inclining towards engagement.

original: 'di ltar de bzhin nyid ni mtshan nyid yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar de bzhin nyid ni mtshan nyid yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Thus, suchness does not have the characteristic of existence,

original: chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid med pas mtshan nyid byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid med pas mtshan nyid byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it acts as the naturelessness of phenomena.

original: mtshan nyid med pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor does it have the characteristic of non-existence,

original: rang gi mtshan nyid byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
translated: because it acts as the intrinsic characteristic.

original: ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las ni 'di ltar de bzhin nyid de la ni yongs su grub pa kho na'i mtshan nyid kho na yod kyis /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las ni 'di ltar de bzhin nyid de la ni yongs su grub pa kho na'i mtshan nyid kho na yod kyis /
translated: In the commentary on the lack of intrinsic nature, it is said that suchness has only the characteristic of the fully accomplished,

original: kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid ni med de /
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid ni med de /
translated: but does not have the characteristic of the imagined,🔽because it is the object of the wisdom of the noble ones.

original: rigs pa des ni gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: rigs pa des ni gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya'o //
translated: By this reasoning, it is called the characteristic of non-duality.

original: mtshan nyid med pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not without characteristics,

original: yang dag par yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag par yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not really existent.

original: mtshan nyid yod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: mtshan nyid yod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not with characteristics,

original: brtags pa dag med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brtags pa dag med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the imagined are non-existent.

original: de bzhin nyid de ni mchog tu gyur par dag pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid de ni mchog tu gyur par dag pa zhes bya ste /
translated: That suchness is called supremely pure,

original: chos thams cad kyi nang na mchog tu gyur pa'i phyir dang / glo bur gyi dri ma thams cad yongs su spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi nang na mchog tu gyur pa'i phyir dang / glo bur gyi dri ma thams cad yongs su spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is supreme among all dharmas and because it is completely free of adventitious defilements.

original: de bzhin nyid de la nyid kyi 'jug pa mdzad pa de bzhin du gzhan dag kyang 'jug par mdzad pa'i phyir de bzhin nyid mchog tu rnam par dag par 'jug par mdzad pa'i yon tan zhes gsungs so zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid de la nyid kyi 'jug pa mdzad pa de bzhin du gzhan dag kyang 'jug par mdzad pa'i phyir de bzhin nyid mchog tu rnam par dag par 'jug par mdzad pa'i yon tan zhes gsungs so zhes 'byung ste /
translated: Because it causes others to enter into suchness just as it has entered itself, it is said to be the quality of entering into supremely pure suchness.

original: nye ba'i 'od kyis 'grel pa las kyang don 'di dang mthun par bshad do //
analyzed: nye ba'i 'od kyis 'grel pa las kyang don 'di dang mthun par bshad do //
translated: The commentary by Upadeśa explains this meaning in the same way.

original: gzhan yang de nyid las 'dis ni bcom ldan 'das kyis gdul ba'i thabs kyis yon tan khyad par du 'phags pa bstan te /
analyzed: gzhan yang de nyid las 'dis ni bcom ldan 'das kyis gdul ba'i thabs kyis yon tan khyad par du 'phags pa bstan te /
translated: Moreover, that same text says, “This shows the method of subduing the Blessed One’s disciples, and the excellence of his qualities.

original: mtshan nyid med pa'i chos ni mya @71b ngan las 'das pa yin par bzhed la /
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa'i chos ni mya @71b ngan las 'das pa yin par bzhed la /
translated: He accepts that the Dharma without characteristics is nirvana.

original: bcom ldan 'das thag pa gsum gyis gang zag gi skal pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'dul ba'i thabs yongs su mkhyen pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du bstan nas de dag mtshan nyid med pa'i chos la mchog tu 'gro bar mdzad pa'i phyir ro zhes
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das thag pa gsum gyis gang zag gi skal pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'dul ba'i thabs yongs su mkhyen pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du bstan nas de dag mtshan nyid med pa'i chos la mchog tu 'gro bar mdzad pa'i phyir ro zhes
translated: The Blessed One, knowing the method of subduing disciples according to their lot, teaches them the truth just as it is, and causes them to enter into the Dharma without characteristics.”

original: bshad de // de dag kyang mdor bsdu na bshad pa gnyis su 'gyur te /
analyzed: bshad de // de dag kyang mdor bsdu na bshad pa gnyis su 'gyur te /
translated: These are, in brief, two explanations.

original: dang pos ni de bzhin nyid la mtshan nyid med pa zhes bya ba bstan te /
analyzed: dang pos ni de bzhin nyid la mtshan nyid med pa zhes bya ba bstan te /
translated: The first shows that suchness is called “without characteristics”

original: yod pa dang med pa la sogs pa'i mtshan ma thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa la sogs pa'i mtshan ma thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is free from all signs of existence, nonexistence, and so on.

original: gnyis pas ni mya ngan las 'das pa la mtshan ma med pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gnyis pas ni mya ngan las 'das pa la mtshan ma med pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The second shows that nirvana is called “signless”🔽because it is free from all signs of existence, nonexistence, and so on.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan ma rnam pa bcu med pa'i phyir ro /🔽// / bam po bdun pa /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan ma rnam pa bcu med pa'i phyir ro / // / bam po bdun pa /
translated: Because the ten aspects of signs of form and so on do not exist.

original: sangs rgyas kyi gnas pas gnas pa zhes bya bas ni yon tan gsum pa bstan te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi gnas pas gnas pa zhes bya bas ni yon tan gsum pa bstan te /
translated: The line “abiding in the Buddha’s way of abiding” teaches the third quality.

original: 'dis ni sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa lhun gyis grub pa rgyun mi 'chad par gnas pa'i yon tan zhes bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'dis ni sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa lhun gyis grub pa rgyun mi 'chad par gnas pa'i yon tan zhes bya ba nyid do //
translated: This is the quality of the spontaneous and uninterrupted activity of the buddhas.

original: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa las /
analyzed: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa las /
translated: In the commentary composed by Master Vasubandhu,

original: sangs rgyas kyi gnas pa zhes bya ba ni gnas pa med pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi gnas pa zhes bya ba ni gnas pa med pa ste /
translated: it says, “The so-called ‘Buddha’s way of abiding’ is nonabiding.

original: 'di ltar gnas 'dir rtag par sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa rgyun ma chad pa'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: 'di ltar gnas 'dir rtag par sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa rgyun ma chad pa'o zhes bshad do //
translated: In this way, the activity of the buddhas is uninterrupted and continuous.”

original: de la gnas pa med pa zhes bya ba ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: de la gnas pa med pa zhes bya ba ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: In this passage, “nonabiding” refers to the nirvana that is not an extreme.

original: de'i phyir theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa las /
translated: Therefore, in the commentary on the Compendium of the Mahāyāna,

original: sangs rgyas kyi gnas pa med pa ni mya ngan las 'das par byon nas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi gnas pa med pa ni mya ngan las 'das par byon nas /
translated: it says, “The Buddha’s nonabiding is the arrival at nirvana.

original: gnas pa med par gnas pa'o zhes 'byung bas /
analyzed: gnas pa med par gnas pa'o zhes 'byung bas /
translated: It is to abide without abiding.🔽

original: de nyid mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la gnas pa'o //
translated: It is to abide in nonabiding nirvana.🔽 Spontaneous activities

original: mdzad pa lhun gyis grub pa'o zhes bya ba ni mngon par 'du mdzad pa la mi ltos par mdzad pa thams cad mdzad pa ste /
analyzed: mdzad pa lhun gyis grub pa'o zhes bya ba ni mngon par 'du mdzad pa la mi ltos par mdzad pa thams cad mdzad pa ste /
translated: Spontaneous activities are all activities performed without deliberation.

original: dper na 'jig rten pa'i yid bzhin gyi nor bu dang lha'i rnga lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na 'jig rten pa'i yid bzhin gyi nor bu dang lha'i rnga lta bu'o //
translated: They are like the wish-fulfilling gem and the celestial drum of the worldly beings.

original: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las /
analyzed: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las /
translated: Master Bhāviveka’s Essence of the Middle Way Autocommentary says,

original: 'di ltar sgrim mi dgos par sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa rnams dang / sems can gyi don la sogs pa la /
analyzed: 'di ltar sgrim mi dgos par sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa rnams dang / sems can gyi don la sogs pa la /
translated: “Thus, without needing to apply effort, the activities of the buddhas and the benefit of sentient beings and so on are performed.

original: 'phags pa dang lha dang tshangs pa'i gnas pa rnams kyis rgyun mi 'chad par ji ltar mthun mthun du gnas pas nyan thos ltar bsgrims te gnas pa ma yin pa dang / mu stegs can ltar gnas pa yod pas /
analyzed: 'phags pa dang lha dang tshangs pa'i gnas pa rnams kyis rgyun mi 'chad par ji ltar mthun mthun du gnas pas nyan thos ltar bsgrims te gnas pa ma yin pa dang / mu stegs can ltar gnas pa yod pas /
translated: Since the āryas, gods, and Brahmās abide continuously in whatever way is suitable, they are not like the hearers who apply effort to abide and are not like the tīrthikas who do not abide.

original: khyad par du 'phags pa ma yin pa ni ma yin no zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: khyad par du 'phags pa ma yin pa ni ma yin no zhes 'byung ste /
translated: Therefore they are not inferior.”

original: slob dpon nye ba'i 'od kyis @72a * //
analyzed: slob dpon nye ba'i 'od kyis @72a * //
translated: Master Upaśānta

original: 'grel pa las kyang 'di dang mthun par bshad do //
analyzed: 'grel pa las kyang 'di dang mthun par bshad do //
translated: also explains in his commentary in accordance with this.

original: gzhan yang slob dpon nye ba'i 'od kyis 'grel pa las /
analyzed: gzhan yang slob dpon nye ba'i 'od kyis 'grel pa las /
translated: Moreover, Master Upaśānta explains in his commentary:

original: 'dis ni bcom ldan 'das kyis gdul bya la so sor rtog pa khyad par du 'phags pa'i yon tan bstan te /
analyzed: 'dis ni bcom ldan 'das kyis gdul bya la so sor rtog pa khyad par du 'phags pa'i yon tan bstan te /
translated: This shows the Blessed One's superior qualities of discernment for disciples,

original: thugs rje chen pos nyin mtshan lan drug tu 'jig rten la gzigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
analyzed: thugs rje chen pos nyin mtshan lan drug tu 'jig rten la gzigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
translated: because with great compassion he looks at the world six times each day and night.

original: de dag kyang mdor bsdu na bshad pa rnam pa gsum du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag kyang mdor bsdu na bshad pa rnam pa gsum du 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, if summarized, they are threefold:

original: dang po ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa las gnas pas so //
analyzed: dang po ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa las gnas pas so //
translated: The first is from abiding in non-abiding nirvana.

original: gnyis pa ni 'phags pa dang lha dang tshangs pa'i gnas pas so //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni 'phags pa dang lha dang tshangs pa'i gnas pas so //
translated: The second is from abiding in the abodes of noble ones, gods, and Brahmā.

original: gsum pa ni thugs rje chen po la gnas pas so //
analyzed: gsum pa ni thugs rje chen po la gnas pas so //
translated: The third is from abiding in great compassion.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad dang mnyam pa nyid brnyes pa zhes bya bas ni yon tan bzhi pa bstan te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad dang mnyam pa nyid brnyes pa zhes bya bas ni yon tan bzhi pa bstan te /
translated: By attaining equality with all buddhas, the fourth quality is shown.

original: 'di ni chos kyi sku la gnas pa dang / dgongs pa dang / phrin las mdzad pa tha dad pa mi mnga' ba'i yon tan zhes bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ni chos kyi sku la gnas pa dang / dgongs pa dang / phrin las mdzad pa tha dad pa mi mnga' ba'i yon tan zhes bya ba nyid do //
translated: This is the quality of the Dharma Body, which is not different in terms of its basis, intention, and action.

original: theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa'i dpe mi mthun pa rnam pa gcig las de la gnas pa zhes bya ba ni chos kyi sku'o //
analyzed: theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa'i dpe mi mthun pa rnam pa gcig las de la gnas pa zhes bya ba ni chos kyi sku'o //
translated: In the commentary on the Compendium of the Great Vehicle, there is a variant reading: “The basis is the Dharma Body.

original: dgongs pa zhes bya ba ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: dgongs pa zhes bya ba ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'o //
translated: The intention is the Enjoyment Body.

original: phrin las mdzad pa zhes bya ba ni sprul pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: phrin las mdzad pa zhes bya ba ni sprul pa'i sku'o //
translated: The action is the Emanation Body.”

original: 'di ltar gsum po de dag ni phyogs bcu dus gsum gyi de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mtshungs shing tha dad pa med pas de dag brnyes par gyur pa'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: 'di ltar gsum po de dag ni phyogs bcu dus gsum gyi de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mtshungs shing tha dad pa med pas de dag brnyes par gyur pa'o zhes bshad do //
translated: Thus, these three are the same for all Tathāgatas of the three times and the ten directions, and they are not different.

original: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las gnas tha dad pa mi mnga' ba ni thams cad kyang ye shes rnam par dag pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las gnas tha dad pa mi mnga' ba ni thams cad kyang ye shes rnam par dag pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In the commentary by Master Niḥsvabhāva, it is explained: “The basis is not different because all of them have the nature of pure wisdom.”

original: dgongs pa tha dad pa mi mnga' ba thams cad kyang sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde ba mdzad par shin tu dgongs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgongs pa tha dad pa mi mnga' ba thams cad kyang sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde ba mdzad par shin tu dgongs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And they all have the same intention, because they all intend to benefit and gladden all sentient beings.

original: phrin las tha dad pa mi mnga' ba ni thams cad kyang longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa gnyis kyis gzhan gyi don sgrub pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: phrin las tha dad pa mi mnga' ba ni thams cad kyang longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa gnyis kyis gzhan gyi don sgrub pa'i phyir te /
translated: They all have the same activity, because they all accomplish the aims of others through both the beatific and the emanation bodies.

original: nyan thos la sogs pa ltar bsams pa tsam 'ba' zhig ni ma yin no zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa ltar bsams pa tsam 'ba' zhig ni ma yin no zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: They are not like the sravakas and so on, who only have the intention to benefit others.

original: slob dpon nye ba'i 'od kyis 'grel pa las kyang 'di dang mthun par bshad do //
analyzed: slob dpon nye ba'i 'od kyis 'grel pa las kyang 'di dang mthun par bshad do //
translated: Master Upasena explains this in his commentary in the same way.

original: gzhan yang nye ba'i 'od kyis 'grel pa las 'di ni bcom ldan 'das kyis sangs rgyas thams cad dang / phrin las mdzad pa 'dra ba khyad par du 'phags pa'i yon tan bstan te /
analyzed: gzhan yang nye ba'i 'od kyis 'grel pa las 'di ni bcom ldan 'das kyis sangs rgyas thams cad dang / phrin las mdzad pa 'dra ba khyad par du 'phags pa'i yon tan bstan te /
translated: Moreover, in his commentary, Upasena explains that this verse shows the superiority of the qualities of the buddhas and their activities.

original: @72b 'di ltar sangs rgyas thams cad dang phrin las 'dra bar mdzad pa'i mnyam pa nyid brnyes pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad de /
analyzed: @72b 'di ltar sangs rgyas thams cad dang phrin las 'dra bar mdzad pa'i mnyam pa nyid brnyes pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad de /
translated: Thus, it is said that he attains equality, because he acts in a way that is equal to all buddhas in his deeds.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi sprul pa'i sku'i phrin las 'dra ba'i phyir mnyam pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi sprul pa'i sku'i phrin las 'dra ba'i phyir mnyam pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: The equality of the buddhas is called equality because their emanation bodies perform similar deeds.

original: brnyes par gyur pa'i phyir brnyes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: brnyes par gyur pa'i phyir brnyes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The attainment of equality is called attainment.

original: de dag kyang mdor bsdu na bshad pa rnam pa gsum du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag kyang mdor bsdu na bshad pa rnam pa gsum du 'gyur te /
translated: In brief, these are threefold:

original: dang po ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi sku gsum mnyam pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: dang po ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi sku gsum mnyam pa nyid kyis so //
translated: The first is the equality of the buddhas’ three bodies.

original: gnyis pa ni sangs rgyas kyi rnam par dag pa'i ye shes dang / thugs rje chen po dang / longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / sprul pa'i sku gnyis mnyam pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni sangs rgyas kyi rnam par dag pa'i ye shes dang / thugs rje chen po dang / longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / sprul pa'i sku gnyis mnyam pa nyid kyis so //
translated: The second is the equality of the buddhas’ pure gnosis, great compassion, enjoyment body, and emanation body.

original: gsum pa ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi sprul pa'i sku'i phrin las 'dra ba mnyam pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: gsum pa ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi sprul pa'i sku'i phrin las 'dra ba mnyam pa nyid kyis so //
translated: The third is the equality of the buddhas’ similar deeds of their emanation bodies.

original: sgrib pa mi mnga' ba'i gnas su byon pa zhes bya ba ni yon tan lnga pa bstan te /
analyzed: sgrib pa mi mnga' ba'i gnas su byon pa zhes bya ba ni yon tan lnga pa bstan te /
translated: The phrase “he has arrived at the stage that is free of obscurations” reveals the fifth excellence.

original: 'di ni sgrib pa thams cad kyi gnyen po bsgoms pa'i yon tan zhes bya ba nyid do //🔽slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa las 'di ltar dus thams cad du shes rab yongs su sbyangs pas sgrib pa thams cad kyi gnyen por gyur pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
analyzed: 'di ni sgrib pa thams cad kyi gnyen po bsgoms pa'i yon tan zhes bya ba nyid do // slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa las 'di ltar dus thams cad du shes rab yongs su sbyangs pas sgrib pa thams cad kyi gnyen por gyur pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
translated: This is the excellence that is the antidote to all the mental afflictions and the obscurations to that which needs to be known.🔽The commentary composed by Master Vasubandhu states, “Because he has cultivated the antidote to all the obscurations by means of his complete training in wisdom at all times.”

original: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las 'di ltar nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa thams cad kyi gnyen po 'phags pa'i lam rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ting nge 'dzin la dbang ba'i bdag nyid goms par byas pas bag chags thams cad dang gtan du bral ba'i gnas su byon pa'o zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las 'di ltar nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa thams cad kyi gnyen po 'phags pa'i lam rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ting nge 'dzin la dbang ba'i bdag nyid goms par byas pas bag chags thams cad dang gtan du bral ba'i gnas su byon pa'o zhes 'byung ste /
translated: The commentary composed by Master Bhāviveka states, “Because he has cultivated the noble path, which is the antidote to all the mental afflictions and the obscurations to that which needs to be known, and which has the nature of the knowledge of all things and mastery of meditative absorption, he has arrived at the stage that is free of all propensities forever.”

original: slob dpon nye ba'i 'od kyis 'grel pa las kyang 'di dang mthun par bshad do //
analyzed: slob dpon nye ba'i 'od kyis 'grel pa las kyang 'di dang mthun par bshad do //
translated: Master Upasena's commentary also explains in accordance with this.

original: gzhan yang de nyid las 'di ni bcom ldan 'das kyis mi mthun pa'i phyogs yongs su spangs pa khyad par du 'phags pa'i yon tan bstan te /
analyzed: gzhan yang de nyid las 'di ni bcom ldan 'das kyis mi mthun pa'i phyogs yongs su spangs pa khyad par du 'phags pa'i yon tan bstan te /
translated: Moreover, that same text says, This is the teaching of the special qualities of the Blessed One's abandonment of the opposing factors.

original: nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa thams cad las rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mngon du mdzad pa'i phyir dang / sgrib pa thams cad ma lus par spangs pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa thams cad las rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mngon du mdzad pa'i phyir dang / sgrib pa thams cad ma lus par spangs pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Because he actualized the wisdom completely liberated from all afflictive and cognitive obstructions, and because he abandoned all obstructions without exception.

original: de dag kyang mdor bsdu na 'di skad du sgrib pa gnyis las dben pa'i ye shes bsgoms te /
analyzed: de dag kyang mdor bsdu na 'di skad du sgrib pa gnyis las dben pa'i ye shes bsgoms te /
translated: In brief, this means that he cultivated the wisdom isolated from the two obstructions,

original: sgrib pa thams cad spangs pas mya ngan las 'das pa sgrib pa med pa'i gnas su byon pa yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sgrib pa thams cad spangs pas mya ngan las 'das pa sgrib pa med pa'i gnas su byon pa yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: and by abandoning all obstructions, he arrived at the state of nirvana without obstruction.

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i chos dang ldan pa @73a * //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i chos dang ldan pa @73a * //
translated: Possessing the irreversible Dharma

original: zhes bya bas ni yon tan drug pa bstan te /
analyzed: zhes bya bas ni yon tan drug pa bstan te /
translated: This shows the sixth quality.

original: 'di ni mu stegs can thams cad btul ba'i yon tan zhes bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ni mu stegs can thams cad btul ba'i yon tan zhes bya ba nyid do //
translated: This is the quality of having subdued all the extremists.

original: theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa mi mthun pa rnam pa gcig las lha'i bu'i bdud dang mu stegs can gang gis kyang de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag par gsungs pa'i chos 'jig par nus pa med pa'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa mi mthun pa rnam pa gcig las lha'i bu'i bdud dang mu stegs can gang gis kyang de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag par gsungs pa'i chos 'jig par nus pa med pa'o zhes bshad do //
translated: The commentary on the Compendium of the Great Vehicle explains that this means that the teachings of the Tathāgata are not destroyed by any god or extremist.

original: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las /
analyzed: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las /
translated: Master Bhāviveka’s commentary says:

original: bstan pa dang thugs su chud pa'i chos gnyis gzhan gyis phyir bzlog mi nus pa ste /
analyzed: bstan pa dang thugs su chud pa'i chos gnyis gzhan gyis phyir bzlog mi nus pa ste /
translated: The two dharmas of teaching and realization cannot be reversed by others.

original: de la ches khyad par du 'phags pa'i chos gzhan med pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: de la ches khyad par du 'phags pa'i chos gzhan med pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ste /
translated: Because there is no other dharma that is superior to it.

original: slob dpon nye ba'i 'od kyis 'grel pa las kyang 'di dang mthun par bshad do //
analyzed: slob dpon nye ba'i 'od kyis 'grel pa las kyang 'di dang mthun par bshad do //
translated: Master Upāśānta’s commentary also explains in accordance with this.

original: gzhan yang slob dpon nye ba'i 'od kyis 'grel pa las 'dis ni bcom ldan 'das mu stegs can zil gyis gnon pa khyad par du 'phags pa'i yon tan te /
analyzed: gzhan yang slob dpon nye ba'i 'od kyis 'grel pa las 'dis ni bcom ldan 'das mu stegs can zil gyis gnon pa khyad par du 'phags pa'i yon tan te /
translated: This is the quality of the Bhagavat’s superiority in subduing the tirthikas.

original: 'di ltar sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa'i chos yang dag pa mu stegs thams cad kyis phyir bzlog mi nus te de dag zil gyis mnan nas yang dag pa'i lam rab tu ston pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa'i chos yang dag pa mu stegs thams cad kyis phyir bzlog mi nus te de dag zil gyis mnan nas yang dag pa'i lam rab tu ston pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ste /
translated: Thus, the Dharma taught by the Buddha is the truth that cannot be refuted by any tirthika, because it subdues them and teaches the true path.

original: de ni 'di skad du de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i yang dag pa'i chos rnams ni lha'i bu'i bdud dang / mu stegs can dag gis phyir mi bzlog go zhes 'byung ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i yang dag pa'i chos rnams ni lha'i bu'i bdud dang / mu stegs can dag gis phyir mi bzlog go zhes 'byung ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that the true Dharma taught by the Tathagata cannot be refuted by the devaputra Mara or the tirthikas.

original: spyod yul gyis mi 'phrogs pa zhes bya bas ni yon tan bdun pa bstan te /
analyzed: spyod yul gyis mi 'phrogs pa zhes bya bas ni yon tan bdun pa bstan te /
translated: The seventh quality is shown by “not being carried away by the domain.”

original: 'di ni 'jig rten du skyes kyang 'jig rten pa'i chos kyis mi 'phrogs pa'i yon tan zhes bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ni 'jig rten du skyes kyang 'jig rten pa'i chos kyis mi 'phrogs pa'i yon tan zhes bya ba nyid do //
translated: This is the quality of not being carried away by worldly dharmas, even though one is born in the world.

original: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las /
analyzed: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las /
translated: Master Svābhāvikabhūmi’s commentary states:

original: gang la su spyod pa de ni de'i spyod yul zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gang la su spyod pa de ni de'i spyod yul zhes bya ste /
translated: “The domain of someone is called their domain.

original: 'jig rten na rnam par rgyu yang 'dir rnyed pa dang ma rnyed pa la sogs pa la rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro ba'i 'jig rten pa'i chos kyis 'phrogs par nus pa ma yin te ji skad du /
analyzed: 'jig rten na rnam par rgyu yang 'dir rnyed pa dang ma rnyed pa la sogs pa la rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro ba'i 'jig rten pa'i chos kyis 'phrogs par nus pa ma yin te ji skad du /
translated: Even though they move in the world, they are not overcome by worldly phenomena such as attachment to gain and honor and anger. As it is said:

original: sangs rgyas rtag par 'jig rten rnam rgyu zhing //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rtag par 'jig rten rnam rgyu zhing //
translated: The buddhas always move in the world

original: sems can rnam pa thams cad phan 'dogs kyang //
analyzed: sems can rnam pa thams cad phan 'dogs kyang //
translated: and benefit all kinds of sentient beings.

original: chos brgyad rtsa rlung log par rtogs dag gis //
analyzed: chos brgyad rtsa rlung log par rtogs dag gis //
translated: But those with the eight worldly dharmas,

original: bskyod par mi nus 'grogs par nus ma yin //🔽zhes bshad pa lta bu'o zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: bskyod par mi nus 'grogs par nus ma yin // zhes bshad pa lta bu'o zhes 'byung ste /
translated: who are moved by the root winds, cannot accompany them.

original: slob dpon dbyig gnyen dang / nye ba'i 'od kyis 'grel pa las kyang don 'di dang mthun par bshad do //
analyzed: slob dpon dbyig gnyen dang / nye ba'i 'od kyis 'grel pa las kyang don 'di dang mthun par bshad do //
translated: This is explained in the commentary by master Vasubandhu and in the commentary by Uddyota.

original: gzhan @73b yang slob dpon nye ba'i 'od kyis 'grel pa las /
analyzed: gzhan @73b yang slob dpon nye ba'i 'od kyis 'grel pa las /
translated: Also, in master Uddyota’s commentary, it says:🔽“The buddhas always move in the world🔽and benefit all kinds of sentient beings.

original: 'dis ni bcom ldan 'das kyis bdud zil gyis gnon pa khyad par du 'phags pa'i yon tan bstan te /
analyzed: 'dis ni bcom ldan 'das kyis bdud zil gyis gnon pa khyad par du 'phags pa'i yon tan bstan te /
translated: This verse shows the special qualities of the Lord's subjugation of Mara.

original: de la spyod yul ni gzugs la sogs pa'i yul te /
analyzed: de la spyod yul ni gzugs la sogs pa'i yul te /
translated: The sphere is the object such as form, etc.

original: spyod yul de nyid sems 'khrul par byed pa'i phyir dang / dge ba'i bar chad byed pa nyid kyi phyir bdud ces bya'o //
analyzed: spyod yul de nyid sems 'khrul par byed pa'i phyir dang / dge ba'i bar chad byed pa nyid kyi phyir bdud ces bya'o //
translated: It is called Mara because it confuses the mind and creates obstacles to virtue.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni thugs legs par ting nge 'dzin la gzhag pas yul shin tu yid du 'ong bas kyang bar chad bya bar mi nus la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni thugs legs par ting nge 'dzin la gzhag pas yul shin tu yid du 'ong bas kyang bar chad bya bar mi nus la /
translated: The Lord Buddhas, with their well-established minds in samadhi, cannot be obstructed even by the most delightful objects.

original: yon tan ji snyed pa de dag legs par yongs su rdzogs pas spyod yul ngan pa thams cad kyis kyang 'phrog par mi nus te /🔽spyod yul thams cad zil gyis gnon pa dang / spyod yul thams cad kyis 'phrog par mi nus pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yon tan ji snyed pa de dag legs par yongs su rdzogs pas spyod yul ngan pa thams cad kyis kyang 'phrog par mi nus te / spyod yul thams cad zil gyis gnon pa dang / spyod yul thams cad kyis 'phrog par mi nus pa'i phyir /
translated: And since they have fully perfected all virtues, they cannot be robbed by any bad objects.

original: spyod yul gyis mi 'phrogs pa zhes bya'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: spyod yul gyis mi 'phrogs pa zhes bya'o zhes bshad do //
translated: They are called unrobbed by the sphere because they have conquered all spheres and because no sphere can rob them.

analyzed: bshad pa de dag kyang rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur te /
translated: These explanations are also twofold.🔽The first is because one is not moved by the winds of the eight worldly

analyzed: dang po ni chos brgyad kyi rlung gis mi bskyod pas so //
translated: dharmas.🔽The second is because one is not carried away by the domain of

analyzed: gnyis pa ni bdud kyi spyod yul gyis mi 'phrogs pas so //
translated: Māra.🔽The phrase “the inconceivable presentation” indicates the eighth

analyzed: rnam par gzhag pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa zhes bya bas ni yon tan brgyad pa bstan te /

analyzed: 'di ni chos yang dag par rnam par gzhag pa'i yon tan zhes bya ba nyid do //
translated: This is the quality of the correct presentation of the Dharma.

analyzed: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa las /
translated: In the commentary composed by Master Vasubandhu, it says:🔽“Because the immeasurable and inconceivable true Dharma, such as the

analyzed: 'di ltar mdo la sogs pa yang dag pa'i chos tshad med cing bsam gyis mi khyab pa de dag so so'i skye bo rnams kyis shes par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ste /
translated: sutras, is not to be known by ordinary beings.”🔽The Dharma of the teachings is called “presentation” because it depends

analyzed: bstan pa'i chos rnams sangs rgyas la ltos pas rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya la ;
translated: on the Buddha.

original: byis pa rnams kyis shes par bya ba ma yin pas na /
analyzed: byis pa rnams kyis shes par bya ba ma yin pas na /
translated: Since it is not to be known by childish beings,

analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called “inconceivable.”

original: theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa dpe mi mthun pa rnam pa gcig las gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis po bsam gyis mi khyab pas so so'i skye bo rnams kyis shes par bya ba ma yin la /
analyzed: theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa dpe mi mthun pa rnam pa gcig las gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis po bsam gyis mi khyab pas so so'i skye bo rnams kyis shes par bya ba ma yin la /
translated: The Commentary on the Compendium of the Mahāyāna says, “The twelve branches of scripture are inconceivable because they are a collection of the Mahāyāna. Therefore they are not to be understood by ordinary beings.

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa chos 'di rnam par gzhag pas /
translated: The tathāgatas, having set forth these topics,

analyzed: de bzhin du byis pa chung du la sogs pas kyang khong du chud par 'gyur ba'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: also cause the childish to understand them.”

analyzed: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las / mdo la sogs pa gsung rab yan lag bcu @74a * //
translated: Ācārya Niḥsvabhāva’s commentary says,🔽“The twelve branches of scripture, such as the sūtras,

analyzed: gnyis po dag ni rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ste /
translated: are called ‘set forth’

analyzed: de dang de dag gis rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they set forth their own and general characteristics.”

original: de ltar rnam par gzhag pa de yang byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyi blo'i spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phyir bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: de ltar rnam par gzhag pa de yang byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyi blo'i spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phyir bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o zhes 'byung ste /
translated: Since such a presentation is not the domain of experience of the minds of ordinary beings and is beyond the world, it is said to be inconceivable.

original: gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis po de 'di dag de bzhin gshegs pa la ltos pas rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis po de 'di dag de bzhin gshegs pa la ltos pas rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Since those twelve branches of scripture depend on the Tathāgata, they are called presentations.

original: gsung rab kyi chos de dag gis rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gsung rab kyi chos de dag gis rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: They are called presentations because those scriptures present their own and general characteristics.

original: slob dpon nye ba'i 'od kyis 'grel pa las /🔽'dis ni bcom ldan 'das kyis chos bstan pa rnam par gzhag pa khyad par du 'phags pa'i yon tan bstan te /
analyzed: slob dpon nye ba'i 'od kyis 'grel pa las / 'dis ni bcom ldan 'das kyis chos bstan pa rnam par gzhag pa khyad par du 'phags pa'i yon tan bstan te /
translated: Master Upasena’s Commentary says:🔽This teaches the special qualities of the presentation of the Bhagavat’s teaching of the Dharma.

original: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan pa'i chos thams cad rnam par gzhag pa de rtog ge'i spyod yul las shin tu 'das pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan pa'i chos thams cad rnam par gzhag pa de rtog ge'i spyod yul las shin tu 'das pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Thus all the Dharma taught by the Bhagavat is a presentation that is beyond the domain of sophistry.

original: de dag kyang mdor bsdu na bcom ldan 'das kyis gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis rnam par gzhag pa bsam gyis mi khyab pas so so'i skye bo rnams kyis shes pa ma yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag kyang mdor bsdu na bcom ldan 'das kyis gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis rnam par gzhag pa bsam gyis mi khyab pas so so'i skye bo rnams kyis shes pa ma yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: And these, in brief, are the inconceivable presentations of the twelve branches of the scriptures of the Transcendent Lord, which are not the province of ordinary beings.

original: dus gsum mnyam pa'i chos nyid la gshegs pa zhes bya bas ni yon tan dgu pa bstan te /
analyzed: dus gsum mnyam pa'i chos nyid la gshegs pa zhes bya bas ni yon tan dgu pa bstan te /
translated: The phrase “he has gone to the reality that is the equality of the three times” indicates the ninth good quality.

original: 'di ni lung ston pa'i yon tan zhes bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ni lung ston pa'i yon tan zhes bya ba nyid do //
translated: This is the good quality of prophecy.

original: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las /🔽'di ltar dus gsum mnyam pa'i chos nyid du kun du khyab par bgrod cing gshegs pa 'am /🔽dus gsum mnyam pa'i chos nyid ji lta ba bzhin du thugs su chud pas 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i don rnams 'byung ngo //
analyzed: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las / 'di ltar dus gsum mnyam pa'i chos nyid du kun du khyab par bgrod cing gshegs pa 'am / dus gsum mnyam pa'i chos nyid ji lta ba bzhin du thugs su chud pas 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i don rnams 'byung ngo //
translated: In the commentary by Master Bhāviveka, it says:🔽Thus he has gone to, or has reached, the reality that is the equality of the three times.

original: 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa da ltar gyi bzhin du lung ston pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa da ltar gyi bzhin du lung ston pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ste /
translated: Or, because he has realized the reality that is the equality of the three times just as it is, he can prophesy the past and the future, saying, “This will happen” or “This will occur,” and so on, just as if it were the present.

original: slob dpon nye ba'i 'od kyis 'grel pa las kyang 'di dang mthun par bshad do //
analyzed: slob dpon nye ba'i 'od kyis 'grel pa las kyang 'di dang mthun par bshad do //
translated: Master Udbhatasiddhasvamin's commentary explains this in the same way.

original: de la chos nyid ces bya ba ni de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: de la chos nyid ces bya ba ni de bzhin nyid do //
translated: Therein, reality is thusness.

original: de ltar dus gsum gyi chos rnams kyi mnyam pa de bzhin nyid thugs su chud pa'i phyir 'das pa la sogs pa yang da ltar gyi bzhin du thugs su chud par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar dus gsum gyi chos rnams kyi mnyam pa de bzhin nyid thugs su chud pa'i phyir 'das pa la sogs pa yang da ltar gyi bzhin du thugs su chud par gyur pa'o //
translated: Thus, because he has realized the thusness that is the sameness of phenomena in the three times, he has realized the past, etc., as he has the present.

original: yang na dus gsum gyi chos nyid ces bya ste /
analyzed: yang na dus gsum gyi chos nyid ces bya ste /
translated: Alternatively, the reality of phenomena in the three times means.

original: de dag gsal bar thugs @74b su chud cing dbyer med pa'i phyir mnyam pa nyid ces bya'o //🔽gzhan yang slob dpon nye ba'i 'od kyis 'grel pa las 'dis ni bcom ldan 'das kyis dus gsum lung ston pa khyad par du 'phags pa'i yon tan bstan te /
analyzed: de dag gsal bar thugs @74b su chud cing dbyer med pa'i phyir mnyam pa nyid ces bya'o // gzhan yang slob dpon nye ba'i 'od kyis 'grel pa las 'dis ni bcom ldan 'das kyis dus gsum lung ston pa khyad par du 'phags pa'i yon tan bstan te /
translated: Because he has realized them clearly and without differentiation, they are called sameness.🔽 Moreover, master Udbhatasiddhasvamin's commentary states:

original: da ltar byung ba'i dus bzhin du 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus lung ston pa thogs pa mi mnga' ba'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i dus bzhin du 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus lung ston pa thogs pa mi mnga' ba'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: This shows the superiority of the Lord's predictions concerning the three times, because he is unimpeded in predicting the past and future as he does the present.

original: de ni 'di skad du mkhyen pas dus gsum lung ston par yul gyi chos nyid gang yin pa de nyid mnyam pa'i de bzhin nyid yin pa 'am /
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du mkhyen pas dus gsum lung ston par yul gyi chos nyid gang yin pa de nyid mnyam pa'i de bzhin nyid yin pa 'am /
translated: That is to say, the reality of the object is the suchness of equality, which is the prediction of the three times by knowledge.

original: yang na dus gsum nyid chos nyid ces bya ste /
analyzed: yang na dus gsum nyid chos nyid ces bya ste /
translated: Or else, the three times themselves are called reality,

original: bye brag med par thugs su chud pa'i phyir mnyam pa nyid ces bya'o zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bye brag med par thugs su chud pa'i phyir mnyam pa nyid ces bya'o zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: because they are comprehended without distinction, they are called equality.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du zhugs pa'i sku dang ldan pa zhes bya bas ni yon tan bcu pa bstan te /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du zhugs pa'i sku dang ldan pa zhes bya bas ni yon tan bcu pa bstan te /
translated: The line, endowed with a body that has entered all world-realms, teaches the tenth quality.

original: 'di ni 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / sprul pa'i sku ston pa'i yon tan zhes bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ni 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / sprul pa'i sku ston pa'i yon tan zhes bya ba nyid do //
translated: This is the quality of displaying the beatific and emanation bodies in all world-realms.

original: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las 'di ltar gdul bya ji lta ba bzhin du 'jig rten gyi khams kun tu khyab par sku gnyis ston pas de dag la phan 'dogs pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las 'di ltar gdul bya ji lta ba bzhin du 'jig rten gyi khams kun tu khyab par sku gnyis ston pas de dag la phan 'dogs pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: In the commentary, the master Vasubandhu explains, “Because the two bodies are displayed in all world-realms in accordance with those to be trained, in order to benefit them.”

original: nye ba'i 'od kyis 'grel pa las kyang 'di dang mthun par bshad do //
analyzed: nye ba'i 'od kyis 'grel pa las kyang 'di dang mthun par bshad do //
translated: The Commentary of Upaśānta also explains in accordance with this.

original: gzhan yang de nyid las /
analyzed: gzhan yang de nyid las /
translated: Moreover, the same text says:

original: 'dis ni bcom ldan 'das dga' ldan gyi gnas nas gshegs pa kun tu ston pa khyad par du 'phags pa'i yon tan bstan te /
analyzed: 'dis ni bcom ldan 'das dga' ldan gyi gnas nas gshegs pa kun tu ston pa khyad par du 'phags pa'i yon tan bstan te /
translated: This shows the excellence of the qualities of the Lord's descent from the Tuṣita Palace.

original: 'di sprul pa'i sku gling bzhi pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du yum gyi lhums su 'jug pa kun tu cig car ston pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'di sprul pa'i sku gling bzhi pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du yum gyi lhums su 'jug pa kun tu cig car ston pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Because this is the manifestation of the enjoyment body, it is the simultaneous manifestation of entry into the mother's womb in all world-realms of the four continents.

original: de dag kyang mdor bsdu na bshad pa rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag kyang mdor bsdu na bshad pa rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, these are summarized as two kinds of explanations.

original: dang po ni sku gnyis kyi dbang du byas so //
analyzed: dang po ni sku gnyis kyi dbang du byas so //
translated: The first is from the point of view of the two bodies.

original: gnyis pa ni sprul pa'i sku'i dbang du byas nas 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du zhugs par bstan to //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni sprul pa'i sku'i dbang du byas nas 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du zhugs par bstan to //
translated: The second is from the point of view of the emanation body, which is taught as entering all world-realms.

original: chos thams cad la mkhyen pa the tshom mi mnga' ba zhes bya bas ni yon tan bcu gcig pa bstan te /
analyzed: chos thams cad la mkhyen pa the tshom mi mnga' ba zhes bya bas ni yon tan bcu gcig pa bstan te /
translated: The phrase he is the one who knows all phenomena without doubt teaches the eleventh quality.

original: 'di ni the tshom gcod pa'i yon tan zhes bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ni the tshom gcod pa'i yon tan zhes bya ba nyid do //
translated: This is the quality of resolving doubts.

original: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las yul thams cad la nges par legs par brnyes pa'i phyir dang / chos rnams la bdag nyid kyis gtan la phebs pa med pa gzhan gyi the tshom mchod @75a * //
analyzed: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las yul thams cad la nges par legs par brnyes pa'i phyir dang / chos rnams la bdag nyid kyis gtan la phebs pa med pa gzhan gyi the tshom mchod @75a * //
translated: In the commentary by Master Svābhāvikabhūmi, it says, “Because he has attained certainty in all objects, and because he has no doubts about the teachings himself, he does not rely on others.

original: par 'gyur ba yang ma yin pa nges pa dang bral bas the tshom gcod pa yang ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: par 'gyur ba yang ma yin pa nges pa dang bral bas the tshom gcod pa yang ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ste /
translated: Since he is free from certainty, he does not resolve doubts.”

original: nye ba'i 'od kyis 'grel pa las 'di dang don mthun par bshad do //
analyzed: nye ba'i 'od kyis 'grel pa las 'di dang don mthun par bshad do //
translated: In the commentary by Master Upāśānta, it explains in a similar way.

original: gzhan yang slob dpon nye ba'i 'od kyis 'grel pa las 'dis ni bcom ldan 'das the tshom gyi rnam pa thams cad gcod pa khyad par du 'phags pa'i yon tan bstan te /
analyzed: gzhan yang slob dpon nye ba'i 'od kyis 'grel pa las 'dis ni bcom ldan 'das the tshom gyi rnam pa thams cad gcod pa khyad par du 'phags pa'i yon tan bstan te /
translated: Moreover, in the commentary by Master Upāśānta, it explains, “This shows the special quality of the Blessed One’s resolution of all aspects of doubt.

original: chos thams cad la the tshom ma lus par bsal ba'i ye shes nges par brnyes pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
analyzed: chos thams cad la the tshom ma lus par bsal ba'i ye shes nges par brnyes pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
translated: Because he has attained the wisdom that completely eliminates all doubts about the teachings.”

original: de ni 'di skad du de bzhin gshegs pa chos thams cad la the tshom mi mnga' ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du de bzhin gshegs pa chos thams cad la the tshom mi mnga' ba'i phyir /
translated: That is to say, it shows that the Tathāgata, because he is free from doubt with regard to all things,

original: gzhan gyi the tshom gcod pa yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
