analyzed: gzhan gyi the tshom gcod pa yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: cuts off the doubts of others.🔽Moreover, because he has attained the four forms of intrepid confidence, he is himself free from doubt;

original: gzhan yang mi 'jigs pa bzhi brnyes pa'i phyir bdag nyid nges par the tshom mi mnga' ba dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi brnyes pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan yang mi 'jigs pa bzhi brnyes pa'i phyir bdag nyid nges par the tshom mi mnga' ba dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi brnyes pa'i phyir /
translated: and because he has attained the four forms of unhindered knowledge, he cuts off the doubts of others.

original: gzhan gyi the tshom gcod par byed pas de'i phyir yon tan zhes bya'o ;
analyzed: gzhan gyi the tshom gcod par byed pas de'i phyir yon tan zhes bya'o ;
translated: Therefore, they are called “virtues.”

original: ; spyod pa thams cad kyi blo chen po yongs su grub pa zhes bya bas ni yon tan bcu gnyis pa bstan te /
analyzed: ; spyod pa thams cad kyi blo chen po yongs su grub pa zhes bya bas ni yon tan bcu gnyis pa bstan te /
translated: The phrase “the great mind of all practices is perfected” indicates the twelfth virtue.

original: 'di ni spyod pa sna tshogs kyis 'jug par mdzad pa'i yon tan zhes bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ni spyod pa sna tshogs kyis 'jug par mdzad pa'i yon tan zhes bya ba nyid do //
translated: This is called “the virtue of engaging in the various practices.”

original: slob dpon nye ba'i 'od kyis 'grel pa las 'di ltar 'dul ba'i sems can gyi rjes su ji ltar 'os pa bzhin du skal pa mnyam pa'i lus bstan pas de dag 'jug par mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: slob dpon nye ba'i 'od kyis 'grel pa las 'di ltar 'dul ba'i sems can gyi rjes su ji ltar 'os pa bzhin du skal pa mnyam pa'i lus bstan pas de dag 'jug par mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to engage those to be trained in accordance with their suitability, he displays a body of the same fortune as theirs.

original: 'dis ni bcom ldan 'das theg pa thams cad kyis 'dul ba'i sems can dag la de dang 'dra ba'i sku kun tu ston pa khyad par du 'phags pa'i yon tan bstan te /
analyzed: 'dis ni bcom ldan 'das theg pa thams cad kyis 'dul ba'i sems can dag la de dang 'dra ba'i sku kun tu ston pa khyad par du 'phags pa'i yon tan bstan te /
translated: This shows the superiority of the Bhagavat's quality of displaying a body similar to that of sentient beings to be trained by all vehicles.

original: sems can thams cad kyi rang bzhin dang / spyod pa tha dad pa yongs su mkhyen pas ji lta ba bzhin du nyid kyi sku yang kun tu ston pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ste /🔽de ni 'di skad du bcom ldan 'das theg pa gsum mam /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi rang bzhin dang / spyod pa tha dad pa yongs su mkhyen pas ji lta ba bzhin du nyid kyi sku yang kun tu ston pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ste / de ni 'di skad du bcom ldan 'das theg pa gsum mam /
translated: By knowing the different natures and conduct of all sentient beings, he displays his body in accordance with them.

original: yang na theg pa lngas rang bzhin dang spyod pa tha dad pa rnams la de dang 'dra ba'i sku kun tu ston pas /
analyzed: yang na theg pa lngas rang bzhin dang spyod pa tha dad pa rnams la de dang 'dra ba'i sku kun tu ston pas /
translated: This means that the Bhagavat displays a body similar to that of those of different natures and conduct, by means of the three vehicles or the five vehicles.

original: blo bye ba mngon par bsgrub cing so so nas 'jug par mdzad pa theg pa gzhan gnyis po dag la khyad par du gyur pa'i phyir /
analyzed: blo bye ba mngon par bsgrub cing so so nas 'jug par mdzad pa theg pa gzhan gnyis po dag la khyad par du gyur pa'i phyir /
translated: It is superior to the other two vehicles because it is the means for accomplishing the ten powers and the other attributes of omniscience and it is the means for engaging in the different kinds of gnosis.

original: spyod pa thams cad kyi blo chen po yongs su grub pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: spyod pa thams cad kyi blo chen po yongs su grub pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called the “great mind of all practices” because it is superior to the other two vehicles, which establish and engage in many kinds of minds.

original: chos mkhyen pa la nem nur mi mnga' ba zhes bya bas ni yon tan bcu @75b gsum pa bstan te /
analyzed: chos mkhyen pa la nem nur mi mnga' ba zhes bya bas ni yon tan bcu @75b gsum pa bstan te /
translated: The phrase “the knowledge of phenomena is free of doubt” indicates the thirteenth quality.

original: 'di ni phyi ma la chos 'byung ba rab tu mkhyen pa zhes bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ni phyi ma la chos 'byung ba rab tu mkhyen pa zhes bya ba nyid do //
translated: This is the knowledge of the future arising of the Dharma.

original: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa las /
analyzed: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa las /
translated: In the commentary composed by Master Vasubandhu,

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dus na chos 'di lta bus de bzhin gshegs pa'i gya nom pa'i ye shes skye bar 'gyur ro zhes mkhyen pa'o zhes bshad do ;
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dus na chos 'di lta bus de bzhin gshegs pa'i gya nom pa'i ye shes skye bar 'gyur ro zhes mkhyen pa'o zhes bshad do ;
translated: it is explained as follows: “It is the knowledge that in the future, through this Dharma, the Tathāgata’s sublime wisdom will arise.”

original: / ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las /
analyzed: / ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las /
translated: In the commentary composed by Master Haribhadra,🔽it is explained as follows:

original: 'di ltar 'phags pa nyan thos rnams kyis gang la 'di ni gcig tu dge ba'i rtsa ba cung zad kyang med pa'o zhes spangs pa gang yin pa de la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis ma 'ongs pa'i dus na dge ba'i chos skye bar 'gyur ba yang rab🔽tu mkhyen la /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'phags pa nyan thos rnams kyis gang la 'di ni gcig tu dge ba'i rtsa ba cung zad kyang med pa'o zhes spangs pa gang yin pa de la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis ma 'ongs pa'i dus na dge ba'i chos skye bar 'gyur ba yang rab tu mkhyen la /
translated: This is not a root of virtue at all.

original: de'i tshe rabs gzhan dang 'brel pa'i sa bon dge ba'i rtsa ba shin tu phra mo yang mngon sum du mkhyen pa'i phyir zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe rabs gzhan dang 'brel pa'i sa bon dge ba'i rtsa ba shin tu phra mo yang mngon sum du mkhyen pa'i phyir zhes 'byung ste /
translated: Because he directly perceives even the most subtle roots of virtue that are seeds connected with other lives.

original: slob dpon nye ba'i 'od kyis 'grel pa las 'di dang don mthun par bshad do //🔽mdo las ji skad du bcom ldan 'das rgyal bu rgyal byed kyi tshal na bzhugs pa'i tshe /
analyzed: slob dpon nye ba'i 'od kyis 'grel pa las 'di dang don mthun par bshad do // mdo las ji skad du bcom ldan 'das rgyal bu rgyal byed kyi tshal na bzhugs pa'i tshe /
translated: This is explained in the commentary by Master Udayana as having the same meaning.🔽A sutra states:

original: sprang po zhig dge slong gi thad du phyin nas rab tu 'byung bar gsol ba btab pa dang / dge slong dag gis sngon gyi gnas dran pa'i shes pas brtags na /
analyzed: sprang po zhig dge slong gi thad du phyin nas rab tu 'byung bar gsol ba btab pa dang / dge slong dag gis sngon gyi gnas dran pa'i shes pas brtags na /
translated: When the Bhagavan was dwelling in the Jeta Grove, a beggar went to a bhikṣu and requested to go forth, but the bhikṣus examined him with knowledge of the recollection of past lives.

original: bskal pa brgyad khri tshun chad du dge ba'i rtsa ba la phyogs pa'i sems cung zad kyang med par mthong pa'i phyir gang gis kyang rab tu ma byung ngo //
analyzed: bskal pa brgyad khri tshun chad du dge ba'i rtsa ba la phyogs pa'i sems cung zad kyang med par mthong pa'i phyir gang gis kyang rab tu ma byung ngo //
translated: For eighty thousand eons, he did not have the slightest thought of virtue.🔽The Blessed One saw him crying and brought him back. He asked the monks, “Why did you not ordain him?”

original: mi de ngu zhing phyir byung ba bcom ldan 'das kyis gzigs nas slar khrid de dge slong rnams la ci'i phyir 'di rab tu ma phyung zhes bka' stsal pa dang / dge slong dag gis zhib tu gsol to //
analyzed: mi de ngu zhing phyir byung ba bcom ldan 'das kyis gzigs nas slar khrid de dge slong rnams la ci'i phyir 'di rab tu ma phyung zhes bka' stsal pa dang / dge slong dag gis zhib tu gsol to //
translated: The monks explained in detail.

original: de nas dus gzhan zhig na bcom ldan 'das kyis de rab tu phyung ste /
analyzed: de nas dus gzhan zhig na bcom ldan 'das kyis de rab tu phyung ste /
translated: Later, the Blessed One ordained him.

original: chos bstan pas rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob par gyur to //
analyzed: chos bstan pas rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob par gyur to //
translated: Through the teaching of the Dharma, he attained the fruit of stream entry.

original: dge slong rnams the tshom skyes nas bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: dge slong rnams the tshom skyes nas bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The monks were doubtful and asked the Blessed One, “Blessed One, why did he not go forth before?”

original: 'di sngon sangs rgyas mar me mdzad kyi tshe shing thun zhig tu gyur te /
analyzed: 'di sngon sangs rgyas mar me mdzad kyi tshe shing thun zhig tu gyur te /
translated: The Blessed One said, “Monks, in a past life, when the Buddha Dīpaṃkara was in the world, he was a wood gatherer.

original: grong khyer gyi sgor mi mang po rnams lam 'phyag cing sangs rgyas mar me mdzad la sdod pa shing thun des mthong nas mang po rnams la lam 'phyag pa 'di ci'i phyir zhes dris so //
analyzed: grong khyer gyi sgor mi mang po rnams lam 'phyag cing sangs rgyas mar me mdzad la sdod pa shing thun des mthong nas mang po rnams la lam 'phyag pa 'di ci'i phyir zhes dris so //
translated: The wood-gatherer saw the people sweeping the road and making a seat for the Buddha Dipankara. He asked the people, “Why are you sweeping the road?”

original: mi mang po rnams kyis deng sangs rgyas mar me mdzad grong khyer 'dir gshegs pa'i phyir lam 'phyag cing sdod pa yin @76a * //
analyzed: mi mang po rnams kyis deng sangs rgyas mar me mdzad grong khyer 'dir gshegs pa'i phyir lam 'phyag cing sdod pa yin @76a * //
translated: The people said, “Today the Buddha Dipankara is coming to this city. We are sweeping the road and making a seat for him.”

original: no zhes smras pa dang / de sangs rgyas zhes bya ba'i mtshan thos pas lus kyi spu zing zhes byed nas mchi ma blags te dus so //
analyzed: no zhes smras pa dang / de sangs rgyas zhes bya ba'i mtshan thos pas lus kyi spu zing zhes byed nas mchi ma blags te dus so //
translated: When he heard the word “Buddha,” his body hair quivered and he began to weep.

original: bcom ldan 'das gshegs pa las bsdad du yang gos zas dag gis phongs pas mthar gyis ri la song ba las /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gshegs pa las bsdad du yang gos zas dag gis phongs pas mthar gyis ri la song ba las /
translated: He stayed behind while the Blessed One went on his way. Because he was poor, he had no clothes or food. He went to the mountains.

original: lam du stag cig dang phrad nas des bzung ste khar bcug pa'i tshe sangs rgyas zhes bya ba'i mtshan brjod nas grong khyer gyi sgo'i mi zhes tshig tu brjod pa las stag gis bsad de zos so //
analyzed: lam du stag cig dang phrad nas des bzung ste khar bcug pa'i tshe sangs rgyas zhes bya ba'i mtshan brjod nas grong khyer gyi sgo'i mi zhes tshig tu brjod pa las stag gis bsad de zos so //
translated: When he met a tiger on the road, the tiger seized him and put him in its mouth. At that time, he uttered the name “Buddha” and the words “people of the city.” The tiger killed him and ate him.

original: mi 'di la sangs rgyas zhes brjod pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba 'di 'ba' zhig yod pas so zhes gsungs pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: mi 'di la sangs rgyas zhes brjod pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba 'di 'ba' zhig yod pas so zhes gsungs pa lta bu ste /
translated: The Buddha said, “This man had only this root of good, the utterance of the name ‘Buddha.’ ”

original: de bzhin gshegs pa mar me mdzad ni sangs rgyas 'di'i bskal pa grangs med pa gnyis pa na byung ste de'i tshe sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba 'di bskyed de /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa mar me mdzad ni sangs rgyas 'di'i bskal pa grangs med pa gnyis pa na byung ste de'i tshe sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba 'di bskyed de /
translated: The Tathāgata Dīpaṃkara appeared in the second incalculable eon of this Buddha. At that time, he produced the root of good of remembering the Buddha.

original: phyis bskal pa grangs med pa gsum pa yang rdzogs /
analyzed: phyis bskal pa grangs med pa gsum pa yang rdzogs /
translated: Later, he completed the third incalculable eon.

original: bskal pa bcu dgu yang 'das nas gdod dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su smin pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis dge ba'i rtsa ba 'di la brten nas rab tu phyung ste /
analyzed: bskal pa bcu dgu yang 'das nas gdod dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su smin pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis dge ba'i rtsa ba 'di la brten nas rab tu phyung ste /
translated: After nineteen eons had passed, the root of good matured. Therefore, the Bhagavān, relying on this root of good, went forth.

original: chos bshad pas rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob par gyur pa 'di lta bu'i sa bon shin tu phra ba theg pa 'og ma gnyis kyis mi shes kyi de bzhin gshegs pa nyag gcig gis thugs su chud pa'o //
analyzed: chos bshad pas rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob par gyur pa 'di lta bu'i sa bon shin tu phra ba theg pa 'og ma gnyis kyis mi shes kyi de bzhin gshegs pa nyag gcig gis thugs su chud pa'o //
translated: The seed of this sort of attainment of the fruit of stream enterer through teaching the Dharma is a very subtle one, not known by the two lower vehicles, but understood only by the Tathagata.

original: gzhan yang slob dpon nye ba'i 'od kyis 'grel pa las /
analyzed: gzhan yang slob dpon nye ba'i 'od kyis 'grel pa las /
translated: Moreover, Master Upa-Guptasrljnana's commentary says:

original: 'dis ni bcom ldan 'das chos thams cad shin tu mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyis ci rigs par gdams ngag yang dag par sbyin pa khyad par du 'phags pa'i yon tan bstan te /
analyzed: 'dis ni bcom ldan 'das chos thams cad shin tu mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyis ci rigs par gdams ngag yang dag par sbyin pa khyad par du 'phags pa'i yon tan bstan te /
translated: This shows the superiority of the quality of the Lord's giving of advice in accordance with the facts by means of the knowledge of all phenomena.

original: 'di ltar chos rnams la nem nur dang ldan pas ni ci rigs par gdams ngag sbyin par mi nus kyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar chos rnams la nem nur dang ldan pas ni ci rigs par gdams ngag sbyin par mi nus kyi /
translated: Thus, one who is doubtful about phenomena is not able to give advice in accordance with the facts.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'ba' zhig gis chos rnams thugs su chud cing mkhyen pas shin tu rnam par nges pas ci rigs su phyin ci ma log par gdams ngag sbyin pa la rgyun chad pa mi mnga'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'ba' zhig gis chos rnams thugs su chud cing mkhyen pas shin tu rnam par nges pas ci rigs su phyin ci ma log par gdams ngag sbyin pa la rgyun chad pa mi mnga'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: But the Lord Buddha, having understood and known all phenomena, is able to give unmistaken advice in accordance with the facts without interruption, because he is very certain.

original: bshad pa de dag kyang mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur te dang pos ni sems can rnams kyis yun ring por lon pa'i rgyu shin tu phra bas ma 'ongs pa'i dus na /🔽chos rnams thob par 'byung pa rab tu mkhyen pa'i nem nur mi mnga' bar bstan to //
analyzed: bshad pa de dag kyang mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur te dang pos ni sems can rnams kyis yun ring por lon pa'i rgyu shin tu phra bas ma 'ongs pa'i dus na / chos rnams thob par 'byung pa rab tu mkhyen pa'i nem nur mi mnga' bar bstan to //
translated: These explanations, in brief, are two-fold. The first shows that the Buddha is free from doubt in knowing the causes of sentient beings, which have been in existence for a long time, and are very subtle, and which will produce the dharmas in the future.

original: gnyis pas ni sems can rnams @76b kyi rgyu dang 'bras bu'i chos rab tu mkhyen pa'i phyir ci rigs su gdams ngag sbyin pas nem nur mi mnga' bar bstan to //
analyzed: gnyis pas ni sems can rnams @76b kyi rgyu dang 'bras bu'i chos rab tu mkhyen pa'i phyir ci rigs su gdams ngag sbyin pas nem nur mi mnga' bar bstan to //
translated: The second shows that the Buddha is free from doubt in giving advice to sentient beings, in accordance with their causes and effects, because he knows the dharmas of causes and effects of sentient beings.

original: rnam par ma brtags pa'i sku mnga' ba zhes bya bas ni yon tan bcu bzhi pa bstan to //
analyzed: rnam par ma brtags pa'i sku mnga' ba zhes bya bas ni yon tan bcu bzhi pa bstan to //
translated: The line, “He has a body that is not conceptualized,” teaches the fourteenth good quality.

original: 'di ni mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du ston pa'i yon tan zhes bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ni mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du ston pa'i yon tan zhes bya ba nyid do //
translated: This is the good quality of teaching in accordance with the inclinations of sentient beings.

original: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis mdzad pa'i 'grel ba las /
analyzed: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis mdzad pa'i 'grel ba las /
translated: This is the commentary by Master Niḥsvabhāva.

original: sems can gyi mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du gser la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du snang yang sku la rnam par rtog pa mi mnga' ste /
analyzed: sems can gyi mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du gser la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du snang yang sku la rnam par rtog pa mi mnga' ste /
translated: Although it appears in the nature of gold, etc., in accordance with the aspirations of sentient beings, it is not conceptualized in the body.

original: nor bu dang sil snyan la sogs pa lta bu'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: nor bu dang sil snyan la sogs pa lta bu'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: It is like a jewel, musical instruments, etc.

original: rnam par rtog pa mi mnga' yang sku ston par mdzad pa'i phyir rnam par ma brtags pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa mi mnga' yang sku ston par mdzad pa'i phyir rnam par ma brtags pa zhes bya'o //
translated: But it is called “non-conceptual” because it manifests the body.

original: yang na sku snang ba de yang rnam par mi rtog pa'i dbang las byung ba'i phyir gzhan dag gis rnam par ma brtags pa'o //
analyzed: yang na sku snang ba de yang rnam par mi rtog pa'i dbang las byung ba'i phyir gzhan dag gis rnam par ma brtags pa'o //
translated: Or, that appearance of the body is non-conceptual because it arises from the power of non-conceptual wisdom.

original: slob dpon nye ba'i 'od kyis 'grel pa las /
analyzed: slob dpon nye ba'i 'od kyis 'grel pa las /
translated: Master Upāśānta explains in the commentary:

original: yang na de dag dang 'dra ba nyid du ston pas rnam par brtag tu med pa'i zhes bshad do //
analyzed: yang na de dag dang 'dra ba nyid du ston pas rnam par brtag tu med pa'i zhes bshad do //
translated: Or, because it manifests as similar to them, it is called “non-conceptual.”

original: gzhan ni ngo bo nyid med kyis bshad pa dang mthun no //
analyzed: gzhan ni ngo bo nyid med kyis bshad pa dang mthun no //
translated: The other explanation is consistent with that of Asvabhāva.

original: de la de dag dang 'dra ba nyid du zhes bya ba ni gdul bar bya ba'i sems can gyi log par spyod pa dang yang dag par spyod pa dang / gnyi ga'i spyod pa mtshungs shing yongs su bstan pa'i mtshan ma de dag dbyer med pa'o //
analyzed: de la de dag dang 'dra ba nyid du zhes bya ba ni gdul bar bya ba'i sems can gyi log par spyod pa dang yang dag par spyod pa dang / gnyi ga'i spyod pa mtshungs shing yongs su bstan pa'i mtshan ma de dag dbyer med pa'o //
translated: The phrase in a manner similar to those means that the signs of the correct and incorrect conduct of the sentient beings to be trained, and the conduct of both, are indistinguishable.

original: yang na 'gro ba drug po'i rnam pa dang mtshungs pa nyid du 'gro ba drug po dag gi lus ston kyang 'di ni 'gro ba drug po dag gi nang na 'di yin no zhes dbyer med pa'o //
analyzed: yang na 'gro ba drug po'i rnam pa dang mtshungs pa nyid du 'gro ba drug po dag gi lus ston kyang 'di ni 'gro ba drug po dag gi nang na 'di yin no zhes dbyer med pa'o //
translated: Alternatively, in a manner similar to those means that even though he manifests bodies in the six destinies, he is indistinguishable in the six destinies, in the sense that one cannot say this is he.

original: theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa mi mthun pa rnam pa gcig las sprul pa'i sku bstan pa de'i grangs dang tshad dang / rnam pa dang dus dang dus tshigs dang gnas rnam par brtag tu med pa'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa mi mthun pa rnam pa gcig las sprul pa'i sku bstan pa de'i grangs dang tshad dang / rnam pa dang dus dang dus tshigs dang gnas rnam par brtag tu med pa'o zhes bshad do //
translated: The commentary to the Mahāyāna-sūtrālaṃkāra says, The emanation body is not to be analyzed in terms of number, size, type, time, season, or place.

original: gzhan yang slob dpon nye ba'i 'od kyis 'grel pa las 'dis ni bcom ldan 'das kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa mi mnga' ba'i sku yongs su 'dzin pa khyad par du 'phags pa'i yon tan bstan te /
analyzed: gzhan yang slob dpon nye ba'i 'od kyis 'grel pa las 'dis ni bcom ldan 'das kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa mi mnga' ba'i sku yongs su 'dzin pa khyad par du 'phags pa'i yon tan bstan te /
translated: This shows the special qualities of the transcendent state of the body of the Bhagavat, which is free of affliction.

original: 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku ni yang dag pa ma yin pa kun tu rtog pa las 'khrungs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku ni yang dag pa ma yin pa kun tu rtog pa las 'khrungs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Thus, the body of the Tathagata is not born from unreal imagination,

original: nyon mongs pa dang las dang skye ba'i nyon mongs pa mi mnga' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang las dang skye ba'i nyon mongs pa mi mnga' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is free of the afflictions of karma and birth.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku ni kun nas nyon mongs pa rnams kyis @77a * //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku ni kun nas nyon mongs pa rnams kyis @77a * //
translated: The body of the Tathagata is not imputed by the afflictions,

original: rnam par brtags pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par brtags pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not imputed by the afflictions.

original: rnam par ma brtags pa'o zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: rnam par ma brtags pa'o zhes 'byung ste /
translated: It is said to be not imputed.

original: ji tsam du sku ston pa de dag yang dag pa ma yin pa kun tu rtog pa las ma 'khrungs pa'i phyir rnam par ma brtags pa'o //
analyzed: ji tsam du sku ston pa de dag yang dag pa ma yin pa kun tu rtog pa las ma 'khrungs pa'i phyir rnam par ma brtags pa'o //
translated: To the extent that those bodies are shown, they are not imputed because they are not born from unreal imagination.

original: yang sku bstan pa de dag yang dag pa yin pa rnam par rtog pa las 'khrungs pa ma yin pa'i phyir gzhan dag gis rnam par brtag tu med pa'o //
analyzed: yang sku bstan pa de dag yang dag pa yin pa rnam par rtog pa las 'khrungs pa ma yin pa'i phyir gzhan dag gis rnam par brtag tu med pa'o //
translated: Moreover, those displays of body are real, because they are not born from conceptual thought, so they cannot be imagined by others.

original: de dag kyang mdor bsdu na bshad pa rnam pa bzhir 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag kyang mdor bsdu na bshad pa rnam pa bzhir 'gyur te /
translated: Those are also, in brief, of four kinds, as explained.

original: dang pos ni sku ston par mdzad kyang rnam par rtog pa mi mnga' ba'i phyir rnam par ma brtags pa nyid du ston to //
analyzed: dang pos ni sku ston par mdzad kyang rnam par rtog pa mi mnga' ba'i phyir rnam par ma brtags pa nyid du ston to //
translated: The first shows that, although he displays a body, it is not imagined, because he is free from conceptual thought.

original: gnyis pas ni de dang 'dra ba nyid du ston par mdzad pas shes par mi nus pa'i phyir rnam par ma brtags pa nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: gnyis pas ni de dang 'dra ba nyid du ston par mdzad pas shes par mi nus pa'i phyir rnam par ma brtags pa nyid du bstan to //
translated: The second shows that it is not imagined, because it cannot be known by being like that.

original: gsum pas ni sprul pa'i sku'i grangs dang / tshad la sogs pa shes par mi nus pa'i phyir rnam par ma brtags pa nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: gsum pas ni sprul pa'i sku'i grangs dang / tshad la sogs pa shes par mi nus pa'i phyir rnam par ma brtags pa nyid du bstan to //
translated: The third shows that it is not imagined, because the number, size, and so on of the emanation bodies cannot be known.🔽The fourth shows that it is not imagined, because the body of attributes is not an object of knowledge of the three realms.

original: bzhi pas ni ji tsam du sku ston pa dag yang dag pa ma yin pa rnam par rtog pa las 'khrungs pa ma yin pa'i phyir rnam par ma brtags pa nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: bzhi pas ni ji tsam du sku ston pa dag yang dag pa ma yin pa rnam par rtog pa las 'khrungs pa ma yin pa'i phyir rnam par ma brtags pa nyid du bstan to //
translated: The fourth shows that the body is not imagined, because it does not arise from unreal imagination.

original: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyis yang dag par gnyer ba mkhyen pa mnga' ba zhes bya bas ni yon tan bco lnga pa ston te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyis yang dag par gnyer ba mkhyen pa mnga' ba zhes bya bas ni yon tan bco lnga pa ston te /
translated: The fifteenth quality is shown by the verse, “Knowing the pursuit of all bodhisattvas.”

original: 'di ni rten tshad med pas sems can gdul bar sbyor ba'i yon tan zhes bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ni rten tshad med pas sems can gdul bar sbyor ba'i yon tan zhes bya ba nyid do //
translated: This is the quality of applying oneself to the conversion of sentient beings by means of an immeasurable support.

original: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa las /
analyzed: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa las /
translated: In the commentary composed by Master Vasubandhu,

original: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' tshad med pa'i rten du gyur pas sems can gdul ba'i bya ba mdzad pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' tshad med pa'i rten du gyur pas sems can gdul ba'i bya ba mdzad pa yin gyi /
translated: it says, “In this way, the bodhisattva becomes the immeasurable support for the performance of the activity of converting sentient beings.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams bdag dang gzhan mnyam pa nyid brnyes pas /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams bdag dang gzhan mnyam pa nyid brnyes pas /
translated: The tathāgatas, having attained the sameness of self and others,

original: yang ye shes 'di yongs su tshol ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: yang ye shes 'di yongs su tshol ba ni ma yin te /
translated: do not seek this knowledge.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas de lta bu'i gdul ba'i bya ba mchog sngar mdzad pas so zhes bshad de /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas de lta bu'i gdul ba'i bya ba mchog sngar mdzad pas so zhes bshad de /
translated: The Tathāgata previously performed such supreme deeds of training.

original: de ni 'di skad du de bzhin gshegs pa'i gdul ba'i mkhyen pa ni byang chub sems dpa' tshad med pa rnams kyi rten du gyur pas byang chub sems dpa' rnams sbyor pa'i rim gyis thob par bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du de bzhin gshegs pa'i gdul ba'i mkhyen pa ni byang chub sems dpa' tshad med pa rnams kyi rten du gyur pas byang chub sems dpa' rnams sbyor pa'i rim gyis thob par bya ba yin gyi /
translated: This is what is being said: The Tathāgata’s knowledge of training is the basis of immeasurable bodhisattvas, and it is to be attained by bodhisattvas through the stages of application.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa gnyer bar mdzad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa gnyer bar mdzad pa ma yin te /
translated: The Tathāgata does not strive for it,

original: sems can gdul ba'i mkhyen pa'i mchog brnyes par gyur pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can gdul ba'i mkhyen pa'i mchog brnyes par gyur pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: because he has attained the supreme knowledge of training sentient beings.

original: yang @77b na rten tshad med pa'i ye shes kyis sems can gdul ba'i thabs kyi bya ba mdzad pas de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams ye shes 'di yongs su gnyer ba'o //
analyzed: yang @77b na rten tshad med pa'i ye shes kyis sems can gdul ba'i thabs kyi bya ba mdzad pas de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams ye shes 'di yongs su gnyer ba'o //
translated: Or else, because he performs the deeds of the methods of training sentient beings with immeasurable knowledge as a basis, therefore bodhisattvas strive for this knowledge.

original: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las /
analyzed: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las /
translated: In the commentary by Master Niḥsvabhāva,

original: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa'i rten dpag tu med pas sems can gdul ba'i phyir sbyor ba bskyed pa de sangs rgyas kyi dbang gis chos mnyen pa sngon du btang bas ye shes gya nom pa 'thob ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa'i rten dpag tu med pas sems can gdul ba'i phyir sbyor ba bskyed pa de sangs rgyas kyi dbang gis chos mnyen pa sngon du btang bas ye shes gya nom pa 'thob ste /
translated: Thus, the bodhisattvas, through immeasurable bases, generate the application in order to train sentient beings. Through the power of the buddhas, they obtain the most sublime wisdom by first cultivating the Dharma.

original: rnam pa tha dad pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnam pa rjes su gzung zhing yongs su gtad pas gcig nas gcig tu rgyun mi 'chad par 'jug pa des byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyis mtshungs par gnyer ba'i ye shes thob par 'gyur ba'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rnam pa tha dad pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnam pa rjes su gzung zhing yongs su gtad pas gcig nas gcig tu rgyun mi 'chad par 'jug pa des byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyis mtshungs par gnyer ba'i ye shes thob par 'gyur ba'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Through the continuity of the lineage of bodhisattvas, who are to be guided by the different aspects of the bodhisattvas, they obtain the wisdom that is to be pursued equally by all bodhisattvas.

original: slob dpon nye ba'i 'od kyis kyang don 'di dang mthun par bshad do //
analyzed: slob dpon nye ba'i 'od kyis kyang don 'di dang mthun par bshad do //
translated: Master Upasena also explains this in accordance with this meaning.

original: 'grel pa 'di las sngar ni yon tan bshad la /
analyzed: 'grel pa 'di las sngar ni yon tan bshad la /
translated: In this commentary, the qualities are explained first,

original: de'i 'og tu ni mdo'i tshig rnam par bshad de /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu ni mdo'i tshig rnam par bshad de /
translated: and then the words of the sutra are explained.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i rten dpag tu med pa zhes bya bas ni gong ma'i rten tshad med pa zhes bya ba'i bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i rten dpag tu med pa zhes bya bas ni gong ma'i rten tshad med pa zhes bya ba'i bshad pa yin te /
translated: The bodhisattva's immeasurable support is the explanation of the above immeasurable support.

original: rten med pa ni sangs rgyas kyi 'bras bu rtog pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: rten med pa ni sangs rgyas kyi 'bras bu rtog pa'i ye shes so //
translated: The support of the result of Buddhahood is the wisdom of realization.

original: kha cig na re de ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes yin te /
analyzed: kha cig na re de ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes yin te /
translated: Some say that this is the nonconceptual wisdom of the bodhisattvas.

original: sems can rnams kyis yongs su 'dzin pa'i sems gdul ba'i phyir sbyor ba'i shes pa bskyed nas sangs rgyas kyi ye shes yongs su tshol ba'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyis yongs su 'dzin pa'i sems gdul ba'i phyir sbyor ba'i shes pa bskyed nas sangs rgyas kyi ye shes yongs su tshol ba'o //
translated: In order to tame the minds of beings that are to be guided, they generate the wisdom of application and then seek the wisdom of Buddhahood.

original: yang na byang chub sems dpa'i shes rab po zhes bshad do //
analyzed: yang na byang chub sems dpa'i shes rab po zhes bshad do //
translated: Or else, it is the wisdom of the bodhisattvas.

original: de ltar rnam pa gnyis su bshad pa yod kyang /
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa gnyis su bshad pa yod kyang /
translated: Although there are these two explanations,

original: sangs rgyas kyi ye shes yongs su tshol ba zhes bshad pa de bzang ngo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi ye shes yongs su tshol ba zhes bshad pa de bzang ngo //
translated: the explanation of seeking the wisdom of Buddhahood is better.

original: sems can gdul ba'i sbyor ba'i yon tan zhes bya ba man chad kyis mdo'i tshig rnam par bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: sems can gdul ba'i sbyor ba'i yon tan zhes bya ba man chad kyis mdo'i tshig rnam par bshad pa yin te /
translated: The explanation of the words of the sutra from the qualities of application in guiding beings onward is as follows.

original: sangs rgyas kyi dbang gi stobs kyis byang chub sems dpa' chos mnyan pa yod par gyur nas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi dbang gi stobs kyis byang chub sems dpa' chos mnyan pa yod par gyur nas /
translated: By the power of the Buddha's empowerment, the bodhisattva comes to listen to the Dharma,

original: sa dang po'i ye shes gya nom pa 'thob pa'o //
analyzed: sa dang po'i ye shes gya nom pa 'thob pa'o //
translated: and obtains the sublime wisdom of the first ground.

original: yang na sangs rgyas kyi ye shes gya nom pa 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang na sangs rgyas kyi ye shes gya nom pa 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Or else, he obtains the sublime wisdom of buddhahood.

original: dper na mar me gcig gis mar me brgya stong 'bar bar byed pa de bzhin du sa'i mdun rol gyi rnam pa tha dad pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dang / rigs ma nges pa'i nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas @78a * //
analyzed: dper na mar me gcig gis mar me brgya stong 'bar bar byed pa de bzhin du sa'i mdun rol gyi rnam pa tha dad pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dang / rigs ma nges pa'i nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas @78a * //
translated: Just as one lamp can light a hundred or a thousand other lamps, in the same way, the bodhisattvas on the grounds, the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas of unfixed potential,🔽are sustained by the Buddha's wisdom and,

original: rnams sangs rgyas nyid kyis rjes su gzung ba dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i tshe /
analyzed: rnams sangs rgyas nyid kyis rjes su gzung ba dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i tshe /
translated: at the time of their parinirvāṇa,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa gzhan dang byang chub sems dpa' chen po dag la yongs su gtad pas dge ba spyod pa'i gang zag thams cad kyis rim gyis thos pa dang / bsams pa dang / bsgoms pa'i shes rab thob par mdzad pas de'i dbang gis byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyis mtshungs par gnyer ba'i ye shes thob nas sangs rgyas kyi mkhyen pa'i ye shes yongs su tshol ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa gzhan dang byang chub sems dpa' chen po dag la yongs su gtad pas dge ba spyod pa'i gang zag thams cad kyis rim gyis thos pa dang / bsams pa dang / bsgoms pa'i shes rab thob par mdzad pas de'i dbang gis byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyis mtshungs par gnyer ba'i ye shes thob nas sangs rgyas kyi mkhyen pa'i ye shes yongs su tshol ba'o //
translated: By the power of that, all bodhisattvas will attain the wisdom that is equally pursued and seek the wisdom of the Buddha's omniscience.🔽Furthermore, in the commentary by Master Upālo,

original: gzhan yang slob dpon nye ba'i 'od kyis 'grel pa las /
analyzed: gzhan yang slob dpon nye ba'i 'od kyis 'grel pa las /
translated: it is said:

original: 'dis ni bcom ldan 'das kyi sangs rgyas kyi gdung rgyun mi 'chad par sbyor ba khyad par du 'phags pa'i yon tan bstan te /
analyzed: 'dis ni bcom ldan 'das kyi sangs rgyas kyi gdung rgyun mi 'chad par sbyor ba khyad par du 'phags pa'i yon tan bstan te /
translated: This shows the special quality of the Blessed One's connection to the unbroken lineage of the Buddha.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams sangs rgyas kyi rigs rgyun mi 'chad par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams sangs rgyas kyi rigs rgyun mi 'chad par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Bodhisattvas strive in the connection for the sake of the unbroken lineage of the Buddha's family,

original: sbyor ba la brtson par byed kyi nyan thos la sogs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba la brtson par byed kyi nyan thos la sogs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: but not the śrāvakas and so forth.

original: de'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi ye shes ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kho na yang dag par yongs su btsal bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi ye shes ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kho na yang dag par yongs su btsal bar bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, the wisdom of the buddhas is to be sought by the bodhisattvas alone.

original: bshad de sangs rgyas kyi ye shes 'di 'ba' zhig yongs su gnyer bar bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: bshad de sangs rgyas kyi ye shes 'di 'ba' zhig yongs su gnyer bar bya ba yin gyi /
translated: This is explained. Only this wisdom of the buddhas is to be sought.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi shes pa ni gnyer bar bya ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi shes pa ni gnyer bar bya ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of the bodhisattvas is not to be sought.

original: de dag kyang mdor bsdu na bshad pa rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag kyang mdor bsdu na bshad pa rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur te /
translated: And these, in brief, are twofold:

original: dang pos ni sangs rgyas rnams las tha dad par dgar ba ste /
analyzed: dang pos ni sangs rgyas rnams las tha dad par dgar ba ste /
translated: The first distinguishes the buddhas from the bodhisattvas.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kho nas gnyer bar byed kyi /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kho nas gnyer bar byed kyi /
translated: The bodhisattvas alone seek it,

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyis gnyer bar mdzad pa ni ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyis gnyer bar mdzad pa ni ma yin pa'o //
translated: but the buddhas do not seek it.

original: gnyis pas ni theg pa 'og ma gnyis las dgar ba ste ;
analyzed: gnyis pas ni theg pa 'og ma gnyis las dgar ba ste ;
translated: The second distinguishes the bodhisattvas from the two lower vehicles.

original: theg pa gnyis kyis gnyer bar bya ba'i ye shes ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: theg pa gnyis kyis gnyer bar bya ba'i ye shes ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is not the wisdom to be sought by the two lower vehicles.

original: sangs rgyas kyis gnas pa gnyis su med pa brnyes pas dam pa'i pha rol tu byon pa'o zhes bya bas ni yon tan bcu drug pa bsten te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis gnas pa gnyis su med pa brnyes pas dam pa'i pha rol tu byon pa'o zhes bya bas ni yon tan bcu drug pa bsten te /
translated: Since the Buddha has attained the nondual state, he has arrived at the ultimate perfection.

original: 'di ni chos kyi sku mnyam pa la pha rol tu phyin pa rnams yongs su grub pa'i yon tan zhes bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ni chos kyi sku mnyam pa la pha rol tu phyin pa rnams yongs su grub pa'i yon tan zhes bya ba nyid do //
translated: This is the sixteenth quality, and it is the quality of the perfection of the completely perfected Dharma body.

original: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa las /
analyzed: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa las /
translated: In the commentary composed by Master Vasubandhu, it says:

original: 'di ltar gnyis su med pa'i chos kyi sku ni mnyam pas mnyam pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar gnyis su med pa'i chos kyi sku ni mnyam pas mnyam pa zhes bya ste /
translated: “In this way, the nondual Dharma body is called ‘equalness’ because it is equal.

original: gnyis su med pa'i chos kyi sku 'di las shin tu rnam par dag pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams brnyes par gyur pa'o zhes @78b 'byung ste /
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i chos kyi sku 'di las shin tu rnam par dag pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams brnyes par gyur pa'o zhes @78b 'byung ste /
translated: From this nondual Dharma body, the completely pure perfections are attained.”

original: theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa mi mthun pa rnam pa gcig dang sbyar na yongs su grub pa'i chos dang / yon tan bzhi'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyi yon tan gyi ngo bo nyid byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
analyzed: theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa mi mthun pa rnam pa gcig dang sbyar na yongs su grub pa'i chos dang / yon tan bzhi'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyi yon tan gyi ngo bo nyid byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
translated: Because it is the nature of the qualities of the perfection of the four qualities of the perfected Dharma.🔽Therefore, that treatise explains:

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos de nyid las de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku ni gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos de nyid las de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku ni gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The dharmakāya of the Tathāgata is called “abiding.”

original: yon tan bzhi mthar phyin pa ni pha rol tu byon pa zhes bya'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: yon tan bzhi mthar phyin pa ni pha rol tu byon pa zhes bya'o zhes bshad do //
translated: The perfection of the four qualities is called “gone to the other side.”🔽In the commentary by Ācārya Niḥsvabhāva, it says:

original: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las chos kyi sku la gnyis su med pa'i phyir mnyam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las chos kyi sku la gnyis su med pa'i phyir mnyam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because the dharmakāya is non-dual, it is called “equal.”

original: chos kyi sku mnyam pa la brten nas /
analyzed: chos kyi sku mnyam pa la brten nas /
translated: Based on the equal dharmakāya,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'bras bu yon tan mngon par 'grub pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'bras bu yon tan mngon par 'grub pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ste /
translated: the result of the perfections is accomplished as qualities.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi sku gnyis su med pa'i phyir mnyam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi sku gnyis su med pa'i phyir mnyam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because the dharmakāya of the Buddha is non-dual, it is called “equal.”

original: yongs su mnyam pa'i chos kyi sku 'di la brten nas /
analyzed: yongs su mnyam pa'i chos kyi sku 'di la brten nas /
translated: On the basis of this equality of the Dharma Body,

original: rtag pa dang bde ba dang de dang yongs su btsal ba'i pha rol tu byon pa rnams sangs rgyas kyi gnas skabs kyi tshe gdod mngon par 'grub pa'o //
analyzed: rtag pa dang bde ba dang de dang yongs su btsal ba'i pha rol tu byon pa rnams sangs rgyas kyi gnas skabs kyi tshe gdod mngon par 'grub pa'o //
translated: the qualities of permanence, bliss, and the perfections of purity and self are first achieved at the time of Buddhahood.

original: yang na chos kyi sku mnyam pa la brten nas pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur la /
analyzed: yang na chos kyi sku mnyam pa la brten nas pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur la /
translated: Or else, on the basis of the equality of the Dharma Body, the six perfections are completed,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa ni sangs rgyas kyi gnas skabs kyi tshe gdod mngon par 'grub pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa ni sangs rgyas kyi gnas skabs kyi tshe gdod mngon par 'grub pa'o //
translated: and the perfections are first achieved at the time of Buddhahood.

original: slob dpon nye ba'i 'od kyis 'grel pa las /
analyzed: slob dpon nye ba'i 'od kyis 'grel pa las /
translated: In the commentary of Master Upâli,

original: 'di ltar sangs rgyas kyis gnyis su med pa chos kyi sku las sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad mnyam pa nyid du yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'di ltar sangs rgyas kyis gnyis su med pa chos kyi sku las sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad mnyam pa nyid du yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: it says, “Thus, from the nondual Dharma Body of the Buddha, all the perfections such as generosity are completed in their equality.”

original: gzhan yang de nyid las 'dis ni bcom ldan 'das kyi rang bzhin gyi sku'i phyogs khyad par du 'phags pa'i yon tan bstan te /
analyzed: gzhan yang de nyid las 'dis ni bcom ldan 'das kyi rang bzhin gyi sku'i phyogs khyad par du 'phags pa'i yon tan bstan te /
translated: Moreover, that same text says, This shows the special qualities of the excellence of the side of the Bhagavat’s essential body.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku la tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid mi mnga' ba'i phyir gnyis su med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku la tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid mi mnga' ba'i phyir gnyis su med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called “nondual” because the dharmakāya of the Tathāgata does not have the character of differentiation.

original: sangs rgyas kyi gnas pa gnyis su med pa ni chos kyi sku ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi gnas pa gnyis su med pa ni chos kyi sku ste /
translated: The nondual abiding of the Buddha is the dharmakāya,

original: de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo nyid byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo nyid byed do //
translated: which is the nature of suchness.

original: mtshan nyid tha dad pa med pas der gnyis su rnam par rtog pa thams cad mngon du mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: mtshan nyid tha dad pa med pas der gnyis su rnam par rtog pa thams cad mngon du mi 'byung ste /
translated: Since there is no differentiation of character, all dualistic conceptualization does not appear there.

original: de la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin khyad par can rtag tu gnas pa'i phyir gnas pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin khyad par can rtag tu gnas pa'i phyir gnas pa zhes bya ste /
translated: It is called “abiding” because the special samādhi that has it as its object always abides.

original: gnyis su med pa'i gnas pa de nyid ni dam pa'i pha rol tu byon pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i gnas pa de nyid ni dam pa'i pha rol tu byon pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That very nondual abiding is called “the supreme transcendence.”

original: de bzhin gshegs pas de'i phyi rol du byon pa'i phyir brnyes @79a * //🔽pa zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas de'i phyi rol du byon pa'i phyir brnyes @79a * //🔽pa zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Since the Tathāgata has gone beyond it, it is called “attained.”

original: slob dpon nye ba'i 'od kyis bshad pa 'di la mi mthun pa rnam pa gsum du bshad de //
analyzed: slob dpon nye ba'i 'od kyis bshad pa 'di la mi mthun pa rnam pa gsum du bshad de //
translated: Master Upasena explains three types of disagreement with this explanation.

original: kha cig ni ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa'i dbang du byas nas gnas par bya ba'i yul chos kyi sku mnyam pa bstan pa yin no zhe'o //
analyzed: kha cig ni ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa'i dbang du byas nas gnas par bya ba'i yul chos kyi sku mnyam pa bstan pa yin no zhe'o //
translated: Some say that it is taught as the equality of the dharmakāya, the object of abiding, from the perspective of abiding in samādhi.

original: kha cig ni de ltar gnas par bya ba'i yul smos kyang /
analyzed: kha cig ni de ltar gnas par bya ba'i yul smos kyang /
translated: Some say that although the object of abiding is mentioned in that way,

original: don gyis na ting nge 'dzin la gnas bzhes bzung ngo zhe'o //
analyzed: don gyis na ting nge 'dzin la gnas bzhes bzung ngo zhe'o //
translated: in fact, it is taken as abiding in samādhi.

original: kha cig ni gnas par bya ba dang gnas pa las yon tan gyi ming rnam par gzhag pa yin no zhe'o //
analyzed: kha cig ni gnas par bya ba dang gnas pa las yon tan gyi ming rnam par gzhag pa yin no zhe'o //
translated: Some say that it is the presentation of the names of qualities from abiding and the abode.

original: de dag kyang mdor bsdu na bshad pa rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag kyang mdor bsdu na bshad pa rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur te /
translated: Those are also summarized as two types of explanations.

original: dang po ni chos kyi sku gcig pa'i phyir gnyis su med pa zhes bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: dang po ni chos kyi sku gcig pa'i phyir gnyis su med pa zhes bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: First, it is taught that it is called non-dual because of the oneness of the dharmakāya.

original: gnyis pas ni chos kyi sku la rnam pa sna tshogs kyi gnyis med pa'i phyir gnyis su med pa'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: gnyis pas ni chos kyi sku la rnam pa sna tshogs kyi gnyis med pa'i phyir gnyis su med pa'o zhes bstan to //
translated: The second teaches that it is non-dual because of the non-duality of various aspects in the dharmakāya.

original: don gzhan ni brda phrad par zad do //
analyzed: don gzhan ni brda phrad par zad do //
translated: The other meaning is simply to communicate.

original: yongs su ma 'dres pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par thar pa'i ye shes dam pa mthar phyin pa zhes bya bas ni yon tan bcu bdun pa bstan te /
analyzed: yongs su ma 'dres pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par thar pa'i ye shes dam pa mthar phyin pa zhes bya bas ni yon tan bcu bdun pa bstan te /
translated: By the phrase “he has reached the culmination of the Tathāgata’s holy wisdom of liberation, which is unmixed,” the seventeenth perfection is taught.

original: 'di ni mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi zhing tha dad pa ston pa'i yon tan zhes bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ni mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi zhing tha dad pa ston pa'i yon tan zhes bya ba nyid do //
translated: This is the perfection of displaying different buddha-fields according to the inclinations of beings.

original: de la yongs su ma 'dres pa zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i mos pas sangs rgyas kyi zhing bstan pa rnams yongs su ma 'dres pa'o //
analyzed: de la yongs su ma 'dres pa zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i mos pas sangs rgyas kyi zhing bstan pa rnams yongs su ma 'dres pa'o //
translated: Therein, “unmixed” means that the Tathāgata’s display of buddha-fields according to the inclinations of beings is unmixed.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par thar pa zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pas sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su bstan pa'i mos pa nyid do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par thar pa zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pas sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su bstan pa'i mos pa nyid do //
translated: “Tathāgata’s liberation” means the Tathāgata’s very display of buddha-fields according to the inclinations of beings.

original: yongs su bstan par mdzad pa la mi mkhyen pa ci yang med pa'i phyir ye shes dam pa mthar phyin pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yongs su bstan par mdzad pa la mi mkhyen pa ci yang med pa'i phyir ye shes dam pa mthar phyin pa zhes bya ste /
translated: “Holy wisdom that has reached its culmination” means that there is nothing at all that is not known in the display.

original: 'di ni mdo'i tshig gi don rnam par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mdo'i tshig gi don rnam par bshad pa'o //
translated: This is the explanation of the words of the sutra.

original: 'di nyid dang sbyar te yon tan gyi ming bshad na de bzhin gshegs pa'i mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du sems can dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing tha dad par bstan pa rnams yongs su ma 'dres par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid dang sbyar te yon tan gyi ming bshad na de bzhin gshegs pa'i mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du sems can dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing tha dad par bstan pa rnams yongs su ma 'dres par gyur pa'o //
translated: If the name of the quality is explained in connection with this, the various buddha-fields of sentient beings are taught as distinct, but not mixed, according to the Tathagata's aspirations.

original: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa las /
analyzed: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa las /
translated: In the commentary composed by Master Vasubandhu,

original: yongs su ma 'dres pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes las mos pa mthar phyin pa ste /
analyzed: yongs su ma 'dres pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes las mos pa mthar phyin pa ste /
translated: it is said that the fulfillment of aspiration from the Tathagata's wisdom is the distinctness.

original: de la 'dir smos pa ni rnam par thar pa zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: de la 'dir smos pa ni rnam par thar pa zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ste /
translated: Here, what is mentioned is called liberation.

original: yongs su ma 'dres pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes las sems can @79b la phan 'dogs pa'i mos pa mthar phyin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yongs su ma 'dres pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes las sems can @79b la phan 'dogs pa'i mos pa mthar phyin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the fulfillment of aspiration to benefit sentient beings from the Tathagata's wisdom is distinct,

original: sems can gyi mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi zhing tha dad pa rnam pa sna tshogs bstan pa yang yongs su ma 'dres pa yin te /
analyzed: sems can gyi mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi zhing tha dad pa rnam pa sna tshogs bstan pa yang yongs su ma 'dres pa yin te /
translated: the various buddha-fields taught according to the aspirations of sentient beings are also distinct.

original: mkhyen pa la 'dres pa mi mnga' ba'i dbang gis sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su bstan pa rnams kyang yongs su ma 'dres par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: mkhyen pa la 'dres pa mi mnga' ba'i dbang gis sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su bstan pa rnams kyang yongs su ma 'dres par gyur pa'o //
translated: Due to the power of his unobstructed knowledge, the displays of the Buddha-land are also unmixed.

original: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las sems can rnams kyi mos pa tha dad pa la ltos nas /
analyzed: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las sems can rnams kyi mos pa tha dad pa la ltos nas /
translated: In the commentary by Master Niḥsvabhāva, it is said that in dependence on the different aspirations of sentient beings,

original: gser dang dngul la sogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnam pa sna tshogs yongs su ma 'dres par ston te /
analyzed: gser dang dngul la sogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnam pa sna tshogs yongs su ma 'dres par ston te /
translated: various Buddha-lands of gold, silver, and so forth are displayed without mixing.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis mos pa mngon du gyur pas na 'khor rnams kyi mos pa ji lta ba bzhin ston par mdzad de mi mkhyen pa mi mnga' bas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis mos pa mngon du gyur pas na 'khor rnams kyi mos pa ji lta ba bzhin ston par mdzad de mi mkhyen pa mi mnga' bas /
translated: Since the Bhagavān manifests in accordance with the aspirations of the assembly, he does not lack knowledge.

original: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par thar pa ye shes dam pa mthar phyin pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par thar pa ye shes dam pa mthar phyin pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said that the Tathāgata's liberation is the culmination of supreme wisdom.

original: de la 'dir mos pa la rnam par thar ba zhes bya bar bzhed do zhes bya bar bshad do //
analyzed: de la 'dir mos pa la rnam par thar ba zhes bya bar bzhed do zhes bya bar bshad do //
translated: Here, it is explained that aspiration is accepted as liberation.

original: slob dpon nye ba'i 'od kyis kyang don ming dang mthun par bshad do //
analyzed: slob dpon nye ba'i 'od kyis kyang don ming dang mthun par bshad do //
translated: Master Upasena also explains the meaning in accordance with the name.

original: gzhan yang slob dpon nye ba'i 'od kyis 'grel pa las /
analyzed: gzhan yang slob dpon nye ba'i 'od kyis 'grel pa las /
translated: Moreover, in his commentary, Master Upasena states:

original: 'dis ni bcom ldan 'das kyi longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku phyogs khyad par du 'phags pa'i yon tan bstan te /🔽'dir longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ni ma 'dres pa ste /
analyzed: 'dis ni bcom ldan 'das kyi longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku phyogs khyad par du 'phags pa'i yon tan bstan te / 'dir longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ni ma 'dres pa ste /
translated: This teaches the qualities of the exalted aspect of the Bhagavat's enjoyment body.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i ngo bo nyid so so tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i ngo bo nyid so so tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, the enjoyment body is unmixed because the essence of the enjoyment body of all tathāgatas is individually distinct.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes dam pas sems can thams cad rnam par thar par mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes dam pas sems can thams cad rnam par thar par mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is called the tathāgata's liberation, because it liberates all sentient beings through the tathāgata's sublime wisdom.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par thar pa ye shes dam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par thar pa ye shes dam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called the tathāgata's liberation, sublime wisdom.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas ye shes 'di'i mthar phyin pa brnyes pas 'di nyid de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes dam pa ma 'dres pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas ye shes 'di'i mthar phyin pa brnyes pas 'di nyid de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes dam pa ma 'dres pa yin no //
translated: Since the tathāgata has attained perfection in this wisdom, it is the tathāgata's unmixed sublime wisdom.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par longs spyod pa'i sku ston par mdzad kyang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par longs spyod pa'i sku ston par mdzad kyang /
translated: Although the enjoyment body displays the pure buddha realm,

original: phan tshun 'dres par mi 'gyur la //
analyzed: phan tshun 'dres par mi 'gyur la //
translated: it does not become mixed with each other.

original: 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor rnams su sku rnam pa sna tshogs bstan nas /
analyzed: 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor rnams su sku rnam pa sna tshogs bstan nas /
translated: Having displayed various bodies in the maṇḍala of the retinue,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang chos kyi dgyes pa bstar bar mdzad kyang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang chos kyi dgyes pa bstar bar mdzad kyang /
translated: it engages in the delight of Dharma with the bodhisattvas,

original: phan tshun 'dres par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: phan tshun 'dres par mi 'gyur te /
translated: but it does not become mixed with each other.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ye shes las snang ba'i sku 'di'i @80a * //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ye shes las snang ba'i sku 'di'i @80a * //
translated: This body of the Tathāgata, which is the appearance of wisdom,

original: mthar yang byon pa'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: mthar yang byon pa'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: has also come to the end of that.

original: 'dir bstan bcos de dag las bshad pa'i don yang mdor bsdu na bshad pa rnam pa lngar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dir bstan bcos de dag las bshad pa'i don yang mdor bsdu na bshad pa rnam pa lngar 'gyur te /
translated: Here, the meaning explained in those treatises can be summarized into five explanations.

original: dang pos ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes dam pa ma 'dres par bstan to //
analyzed: dang pos ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes dam pa ma 'dres par bstan to //
translated: The first teaches the unmixed supreme wisdom of the Tathāgata.

original: gnyis pas ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing bstan pa rnams kyis ma 'dres par bstan to //
analyzed: gnyis pas ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing bstan pa rnams kyis ma 'dres par bstan to //
translated: The second teaches the unmixed teachings of the buddha realm.

original: gsum pas ni nyid kyi longs spyod pa'i sku ma 'dres par bstan to //
analyzed: gsum pas ni nyid kyi longs spyod pa'i sku ma 'dres par bstan to //
translated: The third teaches the unmixed enjoyment body of oneself.

original: bzhi pas ni gzhan longs spyod pa'i sku ma 'dres par bstan to //
analyzed: bzhi pas ni gzhan longs spyod pa'i sku ma 'dres par bstan to //
translated: The fourth shows the enjoyment body for others as a distinct quality.

original: lnga pas ni chos kyi sku dgyes pa bstar ba ma 'dres par bstan to //
analyzed: lnga pas ni chos kyi sku dgyes pa bstar ba ma 'dres par bstan to //
translated: The fifth shows the Dharma body as a distinct quality.

original: dbus dang mtha' med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi sa mnyam pa nyid thugs su chud pa zhes bya bas ni yon tan bco brgyad pa bstan te /
analyzed: dbus dang mtha' med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi sa mnyam pa nyid thugs su chud pa zhes bya bas ni yon tan bco brgyad pa bstan te /
translated: The line “he has realized the equality of the buddha stage, which has no middle or extremes” shows the eighteenth quality.

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas kyi sku gsum gyi yul yongs su ma chad pa yon tan zhes bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas kyi sku gsum gyi yul yongs su ma chad pa yon tan zhes bya ba nyid do //
translated: This is the quality called “the uninterrupted object of the three bodies of the Buddha.”

original: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa las /🔽'di ltar sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi sku'i yul dang / phyogs kyi khyon ni 'di tsam mo zhes bya bar yongs su chad pa med la /
analyzed: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa las / 'di ltar sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi sku'i yul dang / phyogs kyi khyon ni 'di tsam mo zhes bya bar yongs su chad pa med la /
translated: In the commentary composed by Master Vasubandhu,🔽it says, “The object of the Dharma body of the Buddha is not something that can be said to have a finite extent, ‘It is this much.’

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / sprul pa'i sku'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyang 'di tsam mo zhes brjod par mi nus so zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / sprul pa'i sku'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyang 'di tsam mo zhes brjod par mi nus so zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: The world systems of the enjoyment body and the emanation body cannot be said to be ‘this much.’”

original: theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa rnam pa gcig las de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku rnam pa gsum las /
analyzed: theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa rnam pa gcig las de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku rnam pa gsum las /
translated: The Commentary on the Compendium of the Mahāyāna says, “From among the three bodies of the tathāgatas,

original: chos kyi sku yul la brten nas tshad dpag par yang mi nus so //
analyzed: chos kyi sku yul la brten nas tshad dpag par yang mi nus so //
translated: the dharmakāya cannot be measured in terms of its object.

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / sprul pa'i sku rnam pa gnyis kyang 'jig rten gyi khams 'di na ni yod la 'di ni med do zhes brjod par yang mi nus te /
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / sprul pa'i sku rnam pa gnyis kyang 'jig rten gyi khams 'di na ni yod la 'di ni med do zhes brjod par yang mi nus te /
translated: It is also not possible to say that the two bodies, the saṃbhogakāya and nirmāṇakāya, exist in this world system and do not exist in that one.

original: chos 'ga' yang chos kyi sku las gud na med la /
analyzed: chos 'ga' yang chos kyi sku las gud na med la /
translated: Because no phenomena exist apart from the dharmakāya,

original: sems can gang yang longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / sprul pa'i sku las gud na med do zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sems can gang yang longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / sprul pa'i sku las gud na med do zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: and no sentient beings exist apart from the saṃbhogakāya and nirmāṇakāya.”

original: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las ji ltar 'jig rten gyi khams la dbus dang mtha' med pa de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi sa'i yon tan yang de bzhin te /
analyzed: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las ji ltar 'jig rten gyi khams la dbus dang mtha' med pa de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi sa'i yon tan yang de bzhin te /
translated: Ācārya Svābhāvika’s commentary says, “Just as there is no center or end to the world systems, so too the qualities of the buddha ground are like that.

original: yul dang phyogs kyi tshad yongs su ma chad pa'o //
analyzed: yul dang phyogs kyi tshad yongs su ma chad pa'o //
translated: They are not limited in terms of location and direction.”

original: yang na 'jig rten gyi khams kyi phyogs mtha' med pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku rnam pa gsum der 'jig rten gyi tshad dang 'tsham pa mnyam par kun tu khyab cing @80b gang ba ste /
analyzed: yang na 'jig rten gyi khams kyi phyogs mtha' med pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku rnam pa gsum der 'jig rten gyi tshad dang 'tsham pa mnyam par kun tu khyab cing @80b gang ba ste /
translated: Or else, since the directions of the world are infinite, the three buddha bodies are equal in extent to the world and pervade it completely.

original: 'di ltar chos kyi sku la sogs pas 'jig rten gyi khams de lta bu dag tu zhugs kyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar chos kyi sku la sogs pas 'jig rten gyi khams de lta bu dag tu zhugs kyi /
translated: Thus, the dharmakaya and so forth pervade such worlds,

original: gzhan dag tu ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag tu ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: but not others.

original: yang na chos kyi sku la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi sar mnyam par kun tu khyab cing gang bas dbus dang mtha' med cing tshad yongs su chad pa med pa'o //
analyzed: yang na chos kyi sku la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi sar mnyam par kun tu khyab cing gang bas dbus dang mtha' med cing tshad yongs su chad pa med pa'o //
translated: Or else, since the dharmakaya and so forth are equal in extent to the buddha stage and pervade it completely, they are without middle or end and are not limited in measure.

original: chas kyi sku la sogs pa de dag thams cad kun tu khyab cing sems can gyi ched du phan 'dogs pa mngon sum du mdzad kyang rang gi ngo bo nyid la dbus dang mtha' med pa ni ma yin no zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: chas kyi sku la sogs pa de dag thams cad kun tu khyab cing sems can gyi ched du phan 'dogs pa mngon sum du mdzad kyang rang gi ngo bo nyid la dbus dang mtha' med pa ni ma yin no zhes 'byung ste /
translated: Although all those dharmakayas and so forth pervade and directly benefit sentient beings, their own nature is without middle or end.

original: slob dpon nye ba'i 'od kyis 'grel pa las kyang don 'di dang mthun par bshad do //
analyzed: slob dpon nye ba'i 'od kyis 'grel pa las kyang don 'di dang mthun par bshad do //
translated: Master Upasena's commentary also explains in accordance with this meaning.

original: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis dbus dang mtha' med par bshad pa de yang rnam pa bzhir 'gyur te /
analyzed: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis dbus dang mtha' med par bshad pa de yang rnam pa bzhir 'gyur te /
translated: Master Asvabhava's explanation of the absence of middle and end also has four parts.

original: dang po ni dpe'i chos can la brten nas dbus dang mtha' med par bstan to //
analyzed: dang po ni dpe'i chos can la brten nas dbus dang mtha' med par bstan to //
translated: The first is the absence of middle and end based on the example subject.

original: gnyis pa ni yang na 'jig rten gyi khams zhes bya ba man chad kyis brten par bya ba dang / rten pa'i dbang du byas nas dbus dang mtha' med pa bstan to //🔽gsum pa ni yang na chos kyi sku la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas sangs rgyas kyi sa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni yang na 'jig rten gyi khams zhes bya ba man chad kyis brten par bya ba dang / rten pa'i dbang du byas nas dbus dang mtha' med pa bstan to // gsum pa ni yang na chos kyi sku la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas sangs rgyas kyi sa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: The second is the absence of middle and end based on the supported and the support, from the line or the world systems onward.

original: dbus dang mtha' med pa bstan to //🔽bzhi pa ni chos kyi sku la sogs pa de dag ces bya ba man chad kyis sems can gyi ched du sku ston par mdzad pas /
analyzed: dbus dang mtha' med pa bstan to // bzhi pa ni chos kyi sku la sogs pa de dag ces bya ba man chad kyis sems can gyi ched du sku ston par mdzad pas /
translated: The third is the absence of middle and end based on the buddha level, from the line or the dharmakaya and so on.

original: dbus dang mtha' med pa bstan te /
analyzed: dbus dang mtha' med pa bstan te /
translated: The fourth is the absence of middle and end based on the display of the buddha's body for the sake of sentient beings, from the line or the dharmakaya and so on.

original: 'on kyang rang gi ngo bo nyid la dbus dang mtha'i sku med pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang rang gi ngo bo nyid la dbus dang mtha'i sku med pa ni ma yin te /
translated: But it is not that the essence of reality itself has no center or limit,

original: sems can la phan 'dogs pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can la phan 'dogs pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not benefit sentient beings.

original: gzhan yang slob dpon nye ba'i 'od kyis 'grel pa las /
analyzed: gzhan yang slob dpon nye ba'i 'od kyis 'grel pa las /
translated: Moreover, Master Upasena’s Commentary says:

original: 'dis ni bcom ldan 'das de bzhin nyid thugs su chud pa'i mtshan nyid khyad par du 'phags pa'i yon tan bstan te /
analyzed: 'dis ni bcom ldan 'das de bzhin nyid thugs su chud pa'i mtshan nyid khyad par du 'phags pa'i yon tan bstan te /
translated: This teaches the excellence of the special qualities of the Bhagavat’s realization of suchness.

original: 'di ltar de bzhin nyid mtshan nyid la mtha' dang dbus med de /
analyzed: 'di ltar de bzhin nyid mtshan nyid la mtha' dang dbus med de /
translated: Thus suchness has no center or limit,

original: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi dbus dang mtha'i mtshan nyid thams cad yongs su spangs pa'i phyir dang / yul gyi dbus dang mtha'i mtshan nyid yongs su spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi dbus dang mtha'i mtshan nyid thams cad yongs su spangs pa'i phyir dang / yul gyi dbus dang mtha'i mtshan nyid yongs su spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is completely free from all the characteristics of the center and limit of the conditioned and unconditioned, and because it is completely free from the characteristics of the center and limit of objects.

original: de bzhin nyid de ni sangs rgyas kyi sa'i mnyam pa'i chos nyid yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid de ni sangs rgyas kyi sa'i mnyam pa'i chos nyid yin te /
translated: That suchness is the equality of the dharmadhātu of the buddha ground.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sa'i mnyam pa'i ngo bo nyid 'di thugs su chud pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sa'i mnyam pa'i ngo bo nyid 'di thugs su chud pa'i phyir /
translated: Because he has realized the equality of the essence of the buddha ground,

analyzed: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas la sogs pa thams cad kun tu @81a * // khyab cing der yang mngon par zhen pa mi mnga' ba yin no zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: The middle and extremes of conditioned things are completely abandoned.🔽The middle and extremes of conditioned things are completely abandoned.🔽The middle and extremes of conditioned things are completely abandoned.🔽The middle and extremes of conditioned things are completely abandoned.🔽The middle and extremes of conditioned things are completely abandoned.

original: de la 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi dbus dang mtha'i mtshan nyid thams cad yongs su spangs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /🔽gang 'dus byas la nges par yod do zhes 'dzin pa ni rtag pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: de la 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi dbus dang mtha'i mtshan nyid thams cad yongs su spangs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni / gang 'dus byas la nges par yod do zhes 'dzin pa ni rtag pa'i mtha'o //
translated: The middle and extremes of conditioned things are completely abandoned.

analyzed: stong pa nyid med pa'o zhes 'dzin pa ni chad pa'i mtha'o // yod pa yang ma yin med pa yang ma yin pa ni dbu ma'i lam mo //
