original: dbus la ltos te dbus zhes bya //
analyzed: dbus la ltos te dbus zhes bya //
translated: The middle and extremes of conditioned things are completely abandoned.🔽The middle and extremes of conditioned things are completely abandoned

original: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa ni mnyam pa nyid thugs su chud pas dbus dang mtha' gnyi ga yang spangs pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa ni mnyam pa nyid thugs su chud pas dbus dang mtha' gnyi ga yang spangs pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, the Tathāgata, having realized sameness, has abandoned both middle and end.

original: 'dus byas ji lta ba bzhin du 'dus ma byas la yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: 'dus byas ji lta ba bzhin du 'dus ma byas la yang de bzhin no //
translated: Just as with the conditioned, so it is with the unconditioned.

original: kun rdzob kyi dbang du byas te brjod na yul dang phyogs la dbus dang mtha' yod de ji ltar dbus kyi yul la ni dbus zhes brjod la yul gzhan la ni mtha' zhes brjod pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi dbang du byas te brjod na yul dang phyogs la dbus dang mtha' yod de ji ltar dbus kyi yul la ni dbus zhes brjod la yul gzhan la ni mtha' zhes brjod pa lta bu ste /
translated: If we speak from the perspective of the conventional, then in terms of place and direction, there is a middle and an end. For example, in a certain place, the middle is called the middle, and other places are called the end.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mnyam pa nyid thugs su chud de /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mnyam pa nyid thugs su chud de /
translated: The Tathāgata has realized sameness,

original: yul dang phyogs mi mnga' ba'i phyir /
analyzed: yul dang phyogs mi mnga' ba'i phyir /
translated: because he does not possess place and direction.

original: yul dang phyogs kyi dbus dang mtha'i mtshan nyid yongs su spangs pa'o //
analyzed: yul dang phyogs kyi dbus dang mtha'i mtshan nyid yongs su spangs pa'o //
translated: He has abandoned the characteristics of the middle and end of place and direction.

original: yang na 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas ni mtha' gnyis yin la /
analyzed: yang na 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas ni mtha' gnyis yin la /
translated: Alternatively, the conditioned and the unconditioned are the two extremes.

original: yod pa yang ma yin med pa yang ma yin pa ni dbus yin te /
analyzed: yod pa yang ma yin med pa yang ma yin pa ni dbus yin te /
translated: That which is neither existent nor nonexistent is the middle.

original: mtha' yang yod pa ma yin /
analyzed: mtha' yang yod pa ma yin /
translated: The extremes do not exist.

original: dbus kyang ci la dbus zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dbus kyang ci la dbus zhes bya ste /
translated: What is the middle of the middle?

original: yul gyi dbus dang mtha' yang de kho na bzhin du bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: yul gyi dbus dang mtha' yang de kho na bzhin du bshad par bya'o //
translated: The center and periphery of the field should be explained in the same way.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyis klas pa zhes bya bas ni yon tan bcu dgu pa bstan te /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyis klas pa zhes bya bas ni yon tan bcu dgu pa bstan te /
translated: The phrase “extending as far as the realm of reality” indicates the nineteenth sublime attribute.

original: 'di ni 'khor ba'i mtha' ji tsam par sems can thams cad la phan pa dang / bde ba nye bar gnas pa zhes bya ba'i yon tan nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ni 'khor ba'i mtha' ji tsam par sems can thams cad la phan pa dang / bde ba nye bar gnas pa zhes bya ba'i yon tan nyid do //
translated: This is the very sublime attribute called “the presence of benefit and happiness for all sentient beings to the extent of saṃsāra.”

original: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa las /
analyzed: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa las /
translated: In the commentary composed by Master Vasubandhu,

original: 'di ltar rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyis klas pa ni chos kyi dbyings kyis klas pa'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyis klas pa ni chos kyi dbyings kyis klas pa'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: it says, “Extending as far as the realm of reality means extending as far as the realm of reality.”

original: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel ba las /
analyzed: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel ba las /
translated: In the commentary composed by Master *Asvabhāva,

original: 'di ltar chos kyi dbyings de shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ltar chos kyi dbyings de shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir /
translated: it says, “The realm of reality is extremely pure.

original: rgyu mthun par mdo la sogs pa'i chos rnams kyis chos dbyings de las klas pas /
analyzed: rgyu mthun par mdo la sogs pa'i chos rnams kyis chos dbyings de las klas pas /
translated: Since the sūtras and other teachings are concordant with it, they extend as far as the realm of reality.

original: @81b ma 'ongs pa na sems can thams cad la ji ltar 'os pa bzhin du rtag par phan pa dang bde ba nye bar gnas pa'o zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: @81b ma 'ongs pa na sems can thams cad la ji ltar 'os pa bzhin du rtag par phan pa dang bde ba nye bar gnas pa'o zhes 'byung ste /
translated: In the future, it is always present in the form of benefit and happiness for all sentient beings, in accordance with their needs.

original: slob dpon nye ba'i 'od kyis kyang 'di dang mthun par bshad do //
analyzed: slob dpon nye ba'i 'od kyis kyang 'di dang mthun par bshad do //
translated: Master Upasena explains in accordance with this.

original: chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa las ni yang dag par ye shes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa las ni yang dag par ye shes 'byung ngo //
translated: From the extremely pure dharmadhatu, perfect wisdom arises.

original: yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi dbang gis ni rjes la brnyes pa'i ye shes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi dbang gis ni rjes la brnyes pa'i ye shes 'byung ngo //
translated: By the power of perfect wisdom, subsequent wisdom arises.

original: rjes la brnyes pa'i ye shes kyi dbang gis ni thugs rje chen po skye'o //
analyzed: rjes la brnyes pa'i ye shes kyi dbang gis ni thugs rje chen po skye'o //
translated: By the power of subsequent wisdom, great compassion arises.

original: thugs rje chen po'i dbang gis ni mdo la sogs pa'i gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis gsung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thugs rje chen po'i dbang gis ni mdo la sogs pa'i gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis gsung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By the power of great compassion, the twelve branches of excellent speech such as sutras are spoken.

original: chos kyi dbyings 'di rtag par gnas pa'i dbang gis ni ma 'ongs pa na phan 'dogs pa nye bar gnas so //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings 'di rtag par gnas pa'i dbang gis ni ma 'ongs pa na phan 'dogs pa nye bar gnas so //
translated: By the power of this dharmadhatu always abiding, benefit in the future is present.

original: gzhan yang slob dpon nye ba'i 'od kyis 'grel ba las /
analyzed: gzhan yang slob dpon nye ba'i 'od kyis 'grel ba las /
translated: Moreover, in the commentary by master Upasena,

original: 'dis ni bcom ldan 'das 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid brnyes pa khyad par du 'phags pa'i yon tan bstan te /
analyzed: 'dis ni bcom ldan 'das 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid brnyes pa khyad par du 'phags pa'i yon tan bstan te /
translated: This shows the excellence of the special qualities of the Lord's attainment of the character of the fruit.

original: 'di ltar chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa brnyes pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa brnyes pa'o //
translated: Thus, he has attained the extremely pure Dharma-element.

original: chos kyi dbyings de ni lam bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu yin no zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings de ni lam bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu yin no zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: And it is said that this Dharma-element is the fruit of the cultivation of the Path.

original: nam mkha'i khams kyi mtha' gtugs pa zhes bya bas ni yon tan nyi shu pa bstan te /
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams kyi mtha' gtugs pa zhes bya bas ni yon tan nyi shu pa bstan te /
translated: The phrase up to the end of space shows the twentieth quality.

original: 'di ni mi zad pa'i yon tan zhes bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ni mi zad pa'i yon tan zhes bya ba nyid do //
translated: This is the quality of inexhaustibility.

original: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel ba las 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes ni zad pa med de /
analyzed: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel ba las 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes ni zad pa med de /
translated: In the commentary composed by Master Vasubandhu, it is said: Thus, the Tathagata's knowledge is inexhaustible.

original: nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Because it is like space.

original: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel ba las ni ji ltar nam mkha' de mtha' med pa /🔽mu med pa /🔽zad pa med pa /
analyzed: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel ba las ni ji ltar nam mkha' de mtha' med pa / mu med pa / zad pa med pa /
translated: In the commentary composed by Master Asvabhava, it is said: Just as space is without end,🔽without limit,🔽inexhaustible,

original: 'grib pa med pa /
analyzed: 'grib pa med pa /
translated: without decrease,

original: skye ba med pa /
analyzed: skye ba med pa /
translated: without origination,

original: 'gag pa med pa /
analyzed: 'gag pa med pa /
translated: without cessation,

original: 'gyur ba med pa /
analyzed: 'gyur ba med pa /
translated: It is immutable.

original: dus thams cad du gzugs can thams cad la skabs dbye ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: dus thams cad du gzugs can thams cad la skabs dbye ba de bzhin du /
translated: Just as space always makes room for all forms,

original: chos kyi sku yang rtag par sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde ba mdzad pa nye bar gnas pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: chos kyi sku yang rtag par sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde ba mdzad pa nye bar gnas pa'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: in the same way, the Dharma body is characterized by always remaining to bring benefit and happiness to all sentient beings.

original: sems can gyi khams ji srid par 'gro ba thams cad kyi don mdzad pa rgyun chad med do zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: sems can gyi khams ji srid par 'gro ba thams cad kyi don mdzad pa rgyun chad med do zhes 'byung ste /
translated: As long as the realm of sentient beings exists, it is uninterrupted in bringing about the welfare of all migrating beings.

original: zhib tu de nyid las bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: zhib tu de nyid las bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: This is explained in detail in that text.

original: phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug pa zhes bya bas ni yon tan nyi shu rtsa gcig pa bstan te /
analyzed: phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug pa zhes bya bas ni yon tan nyi shu rtsa gcig pa bstan te /
translated: The phrase “it reaches the furthest end of the future” indicates the twenty-first quality.

original: 'di ni mthar byon pa'i yon tan zhes bya ba nyid do //🔽slob dpon @82a * //
analyzed: 'di ni mthar byon pa'i yon tan zhes bya ba nyid do // slob dpon @82a * //
translated: This is called the quality of “reaching the end.”

original: dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa las /
analyzed: dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa las /
translated: In the commentary composed by Master Vasubandhu,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mkhyen pas phyi ma'i mtha' mu mthar byon pa la rgyun chad pa mi mnga' ba'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mkhyen pas phyi ma'i mtha' mu mthar byon pa la rgyun chad pa mi mnga' ba'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: it says, “The transcendent wisdom of the tathāgatas reaches the end of the future without interruption.”

original: ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las /
translated: In the commentary composed by Master Haribhadra,🔽it says, “The transcendent wisdom of the tathāgatas reaches the end of the future without interruption.”

original: yon tan 'di dag phyi ma'i mtha'i bar du rtag par rgyun mi 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: yon tan 'di dag phyi ma'i mtha'i bar du rtag par rgyun mi 'chad pa'o //
translated: These qualities are permanent and uninterrupted until the end of the future.

original: phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug pa zhes pas ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan mi zad par bstan te /
analyzed: phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug pa zhes pas ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan mi zad par bstan te /
translated: The phrase “until the end of the future” indicates the inexhaustible qualities of the Tathāgata.

original: gdul bar bya ba'i sems can gtan du mi zad pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gdul bar bya ba'i sems can gtan du mi zad pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Because the sentient beings to be trained are inexhaustible.

original: slob dpon nye ba'i 'od kyis 'grel ba las ni bshad pa phyi ma 'di gnyis gcig tu bsdus nas ston te /
analyzed: slob dpon nye ba'i 'od kyis 'grel ba las ni bshad pa phyi ma 'di gnyis gcig tu bsdus nas ston te /
translated: In the commentary by Master Upāyika, these last two explanations are combined into one.

original: de'i phyir 'grel ba de nyid las 'dis ni bcom ldan 'das kyi zad pa mi mnga' ba'i phyir byon pa khyad par du 'phags pa'i yon tan bstan te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'grel ba de nyid las 'dis ni bcom ldan 'das kyi zad pa mi mnga' ba'i phyir byon pa khyad par du 'phags pa'i yon tan bstan te /
translated: Therefore, in that commentary it says, “This shows the superiority of the coming of the Bhagavat because it is inexhaustible.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows.

original: ji ltar nam mkha' rtag par gtan du mi zad pa de bzhin du sangs rgyas rnams kyi dbyings las 'byung ba'i yon tan rnams kyang de bzhin te /
analyzed: ji ltar nam mkha' rtag par gtan du mi zad pa de bzhin du sangs rgyas rnams kyi dbyings las 'byung ba'i yon tan rnams kyang de bzhin te /
translated: Just as space is permanent and inexhaustible forever, in the same way the qualities that arise from the element of the buddhas are also like that.

original: gtan du mi zad pa nyid kyi phyir dang / ji ltar phyi ma'i mtha' zad pa'i dus med pa de bzhin du sems can thams cad la phan 'dogs pa'i sbyor ba yang rgyun chad pa mi mnga' ba'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gtan du mi zad pa nyid kyi phyir dang / ji ltar phyi ma'i mtha' zad pa'i dus med pa de bzhin du sems can thams cad la phan 'dogs pa'i sbyor ba yang rgyun chad pa mi mnga' ba'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: just as the end of space is not found, so too the application of benefitting all sentient beings is uninterrupted.

original: gzhan yang slob dpon nye ba'i 'od kyis 'grel pa las /
analyzed: gzhan yang slob dpon nye ba'i 'od kyis 'grel pa las /
translated: Moreover, Master Upasena’s Commentary states:

original: 'dis ni bcom ldan 'das bdag dang gzhan la phan 'dogs pa'i yon tan rnam pa gnyis zad pa mi mnga' ba khyad du 'phags pa'i yon tan bstan te /
analyzed: 'dis ni bcom ldan 'das bdag dang gzhan la phan 'dogs pa'i yon tan rnam pa gnyis zad pa mi mnga' ba khyad du 'phags pa'i yon tan bstan te /
translated: This teaches the Bhagavat’s excellence of inexhaustible benefit for self and other.

original: ji ltar nam mkha' bskal ba 'jig pa dang 'chags pa dag ni ngo bo nyid rtag par mi zad pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar nam mkha' bskal ba 'jig pa dang 'chags pa dag ni ngo bo nyid rtag par mi zad pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as space is permanent and inexhaustible in essence during the eons of destruction and formation,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i yang dag pa'i yon tan thams cad kyang de bzhin de rtag par zad pa mi mnga' ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i yang dag pa'i yon tan thams cad kyang de bzhin de rtag par zad pa mi mnga' ba'o //
translated: so too the Tathāgata’s excellent qualities are permanent and inexhaustible.

original: ji ltar phyi ma'i mtha' zad pa med pa de bzhin du gzhan la phan 'dogs pa'i yon tan rnams kyang de bzhin te /
analyzed: ji ltar phyi ma'i mtha' zad pa med pa de bzhin du gzhan la phan 'dogs pa'i yon tan rnams kyang de bzhin te /
translated: Just as the future is endless, so too are the qualities of benefiting others.

original: phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug pa'i bar du sems can thams cad la phan 'dogs pa'i phan pa dang / bde ba'i dngos po rtag par mdzad pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug pa'i bar du sems can thams cad la phan 'dogs pa'i phan pa dang / bde ba'i dngos po rtag par mdzad pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Because they always act to benefit and gladden all sentient beings until the end of the future.

original: theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel ba mi mthun pa rnam pa gsum las /
analyzed: theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel ba mi mthun pa rnam pa gsum las /
translated: The Commentary on the Compendium of the Mahāyāna explains three types of differences.

original: yon tan rnams bstan pa yang don phal cher mthun te /
analyzed: yon tan rnams bstan pa yang don phal cher mthun te /
translated: The presentation of the qualities is mostly similar in meaning.

original: gong du @82b bshad pa rnams ni slob dpon dbyig gnyen dang / ngo bo nyid med dang / sangs rgyas kyi sa'i 'grel ba dang sbyar nas bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: gong du @82b bshad pa rnams ni slob dpon dbyig gnyen dang / ngo bo nyid med dang / sangs rgyas kyi sa'i 'grel ba dang sbyar nas bstan pa yin te /
translated: The above explanations are presented in conjunction with the master Vasubandhu, the commentary on the Absence of Nature, and the commentary on the Buddha’s Sphere.

original: 'chad par 'dod pa rnams kyis 'phral la blang ba dang dor ba ci dgar byos shig //🔽/ bam po brgyad pa /
analyzed: 'chad par 'dod pa rnams kyis 'phral la blang ba dang dor ba ci dgar byos shig //🔽/ bam po brgyad pa /
translated: Those who wish to explain should immediately take up and discard as they see fit.

original: de nyan thos chen po'i dge 'dun tshad med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni lnga pa gsung rab nyan pa'i 'khor bstan pa zhes bya ba ston te /
analyzed: de nyan thos chen po'i dge 'dun tshad med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni lnga pa gsung rab nyan pa'i 'khor bstan pa zhes bya ba ston te /
translated: The phrase “an immeasurable saṅgha of great śrāvakas” and so on teaches the fifth topic, the assembly that listens to the teaching.

original: rnam pa drug las ni drug pa 'khor phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa drug las ni drug pa 'khor phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: The sixth topic is the excellence of the assembly, which is taught by the six aspects.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
translated: This topic is also divided into two parts:

original: nyan thos kyi 'khor bstan pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor bstan pa'o //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi 'khor bstan pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor bstan pa'o //
translated: the teaching of the śrāvaka assembly and the teaching of the bodhisattva assembly.

original: 'khor rnam pa 'di gnyis kyang sngar sgo rnam pa bzhis rnam par phye nas /
analyzed: 'khor rnam pa 'di gnyis kyang sngar sgo rnam pa bzhis rnam par phye nas /
translated: These two types of assemblies are first divided into four topics,

original: de'i 'og tu tshig gi don bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu tshig gi don bshad par bya'o //
translated: and then their meaning is explained.

original: de la sgo rnam pa bzhi ni yod pa dang med pa rnam par 'byed pa dang / snga phyi'i rnam par bshad pa dang / re zhig pa dang / gtan du ba bstan pa dang / 'khor gzhan yod pa dang / med pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de la sgo rnam pa bzhi ni yod pa dang med pa rnam par 'byed pa dang / snga phyi'i rnam par bshad pa dang / re zhig pa dang / gtan du ba bstan pa dang / 'khor gzhan yod pa dang / med pa bstan pa'o //
translated: The four topics are the analysis of existence and nonexistence, the explanation of the sequence, the temporary and the ultimate, and the teaching of the existence and nonexistence of other assemblies.

original: de la yod pa dang med pa rnam par 'byed pa ni mu rnam pa bzhi yod de /
analyzed: de la yod pa dang med pa rnam par 'byed pa ni mu rnam pa bzhi yod de /
translated: The analysis of existence and nonexistence has four alternatives.

original: dang po ni mdo sde la sogs pa las dman pa kho na smos la /
analyzed: dang po ni mdo sde la sogs pa las dman pa kho na smos la /
translated: The first is when only the inferior is mentioned in the sutra, etc.,

original: chen po smos pa ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: chen po smos pa ma yin pa ste /
translated: but the superior is not mentioned.

original: 'phags pa rdo rje gcod pa dang / lung ring po la sogs pa las bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa rdo rje gcod pa dang / lung ring po la sogs pa las bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: It is like the explanation in the noble Diamond Cutter Sutra, the Long Discourses, etc.

original: gnyis pa ni chen po kho na smos la dman pa mi smos pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni chen po kho na smos la dman pa mi smos pa ste /
translated: The second is when only the superior is mentioned, but not the inferior.

original: 'phags pa sangs rgyas phal po che dang / tshul brgya lnga bcu pa'i mdo la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa sangs rgyas phal po che dang / tshul brgya lnga bcu pa'i mdo la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: It is like the noble Flower Ornament Sutra and the Sutra of One Hundred and Fifty Modes.

original: gsum pa ni che chung gnyis ka smos pa ste /
analyzed: gsum pa ni che chung gnyis ka smos pa ste /
translated: The third is when both the superior and inferior are mentioned.

original: 'phags pa dam pa'i chos padma dkar po'i mdo dang / dri ma med par grags pas bstan pa'i mdo la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa dam pa'i chos padma dkar po'i mdo dang / dri ma med par grags pas bstan pa'i mdo la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: It is like the noble Lotus Sutra of the Holy Dharma and the Sutra Taught by Vimalakirti.

original: bzhi pa ni che chung gnyi ga mi smos pa ste /
analyzed: bzhi pa ni che chung gnyi ga mi smos pa ste /
translated: The fourth is when neither the superior nor the inferior is mentioned.

original: 'phags pa phreng ldan ma'i mdo la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa phreng ldan ma'i mdo la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: It is like the noble Sutra of the Garland Lady.

original: gal te mu rnam pa bzhi yod na /
analyzed: gal te mu rnam pa bzhi yod na /
translated: If there are four alternatives,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las byung ba ji ltar brda sprod cing bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las byung ba ji ltar brda sprod cing bshad par bya ste /
translated: The commentary on the perfection of wisdom says, “How should one explain and expound the terms?

original: de las nyan thos kyi sde snod las ni nyan thos kho na smos so //
analyzed: de las nyan thos kyi sde snod las ni nyan thos kho na smos so //
translated: In the sravaka canon, only sravakas are mentioned.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod las ni nyan thos dang byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor gnyi ga tshang bar smos pa yin no zhes 'byung ngo zhe na /🔽'di la bshad pa @83a * //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod las ni nyan thos dang byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor gnyi ga tshang bar smos pa yin no zhes 'byung ngo zhe na / 'di la bshad pa @83a * //
translated: In the Bodhisattva canon, both the retinue of sravakas and the retinue of bodhisattvas are mentioned.”

original: rnam pa gnyis yod de /
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis yod de /
translated: There are two explanations of this.

original: kha cig ni yang dag pa'i don du na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel ba las bshad pa kho na bzhin te /
analyzed: kha cig ni yang dag pa'i don du na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel ba las bshad pa kho na bzhin te /
translated: One is that, in terms of the correct meaning, it is just as explained in the commentary on the perfection of wisdom.

original: mu bzhi smos pa ni mdo sde sdud pa dag gi mos pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro zhe'o //
analyzed: mu bzhi smos pa ni mdo sde sdud pa dag gi mos pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro zhe'o //
translated: The four possibilities are mentioned because the compilers of the sutras had different inclinations.

original: kha cig ni yang dag pa'i don du na mu bzhi tshang bar smos pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: kha cig ni yang dag pa'i don du na mu bzhi tshang bar smos pa nyid yin te /
translated: The other is that, in terms of the correct meaning, the four possibilities are complete.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel ba las /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel ba las /
translated: The commentary on the perfection of wisdom says,

original: sde snod gnyis kyi mchog dang dman pa tha dad par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sde snod gnyis kyi mchog dang dman pa tha dad par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show that the two Piṭakas are different in being superior and inferior,

original: re zhig mu gnyis bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: re zhig mu gnyis bstan pa yin te /
translated: the two extremes are taught.

original: sngon brgyud pa'i bshad pa las /
analyzed: sngon brgyud pa'i bshad pa las /
translated: In the explanation of the lineage of the past,

original: yang dag par yod pa dang / med pa'i phyir dang / yang na rgyas pa dang bsdus pa'i phyir ro zhe'o //
analyzed: yang dag par yod pa dang / med pa'i phyir dang / yang na rgyas pa dang bsdus pa'i phyir ro zhe'o //
translated: it is said that it is because of the existence and non-existence of the perfect, or because of the extensive and condensed.

original: de la snga phyi'i rnam par bshad pa yang nges pa med de /
analyzed: de la snga phyi'i rnam par bshad pa yang nges pa med de /
translated: There is no certainty in the earlier and later explanations.

original: mdo sde kha cig las sngar chen po smos la /
analyzed: mdo sde kha cig las sngar chen po smos la /
translated: In some sūtras, the greater is mentioned first,

original: de'i 'og tu dman pa smos pa yod de 'phags pa snyigs ma lnga bstan pa'i mdo lta bu'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu dman pa smos pa yod de 'phags pa snyigs ma lnga bstan pa'i mdo lta bu'o //
translated: and after that the lesser, like the Sūtra Teaching the Five Corruptions.

original: kha cig las ni sngar dman pa smos la /
analyzed: kha cig las ni sngar dman pa smos la /
translated: In some, the lesser is mentioned first,

original: de'i 'og tu chen po smos pa yang yod de /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu chen po smos pa yang yod de /
translated: and after that the greater.

original: mdo sde 'di nyid la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: mdo sde 'di nyid la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: Like this very sūtra and so on.

original: gal te de lta na ci'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi sa'i 'grel pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las /
analyzed: gal te de lta na ci'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi sa'i 'grel pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las /
translated: If that is so, why is it explained in the Buddha Land Sūtra and the Perfection of Wisdom Sūtra

original: nyan thos sngar smos pa bshad ce na /
analyzed: nyan thos sngar smos pa bshad ce na /
translated: that the Hearer Vehicle is mentioned first?

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las 'di skad du /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las 'di skad du /
translated: The commentary to the perfection of wisdom says:

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The qualities of a buddha are of two kinds:

original: shin tu gsang ba dang / bstan par bya ba'o zhes bshad pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: shin tu gsang ba dang / bstan par bya ba'o zhes bshad pa lta bu ste /
translated: very secret and to be taught.

original: bstan par bya ba'i sgo nas sngar nyan thos smos pa yin te /
analyzed: bstan par bya ba'i sgo nas sngar nyan thos smos pa yin te /
translated: The listeners are mentioned first in terms of what is to be taught.

original: 'di ltar de dag nyon mongs pa spangs pas lus pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag nyon mongs pa spangs pas lus pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For they are without remainder because they have eliminated afflictions.

original: shin tu gsang ba'i sgo nas ni byang chub sems dpa' sngar smos pa yin te /
analyzed: shin tu gsang ba'i sgo nas ni byang chub sems dpa' sngar smos pa yin te /
translated: Bodhisattvas are mentioned first in terms of what is very secret.

original: mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob nas nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob nas nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For they have eliminated afflictions by attaining the acceptance that phenomena are not produced.

original: de nas mdo sde rnam pa gnyis so so nas don re re'i dbang du mdzad pas phan tshun 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: de nas mdo sde rnam pa gnyis so so nas don re re'i dbang du mdzad pas phan tshun 'gal ba med do //
translated: Then, since each of the two kinds of sutra is made in terms of a particular meaning, there is no contradiction between them.

original: nyan thos sngar smos pa de yang sangs rgyas kyi sa'i 'grel pa las /
analyzed: nyan thos sngar smos pa de yang sangs rgyas kyi sa'i 'grel pa las /
translated: The listeners are mentioned first in the commentary to the level of buddhahood, which explains:

original: don rnam pa brgyad kyi phyir ro zhes bshad de /
analyzed: don rnam pa brgyad kyi phyir ro zhes bshad de /
translated: It is because of eight topics.

original: theg pa chen po la the tshom za ba dag gi the tshom rab tu bsal ba'i phyir dang / rigs ma nges pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams nges pa'i dang ba rab tu bskyed par dran pa'i phyir dang / yongs su dag pa'i nyan thos chen po rnams @83b bdag cag gi lus ni btsun pa yin no snyam pa'i nga rgyal spang bar bya ba'i phyir dang /
analyzed: theg pa chen po la the tshom za ba dag gi the tshom rab tu bsal ba'i phyir dang / rigs ma nges pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams nges pa'i dang ba rab tu bskyed par dran pa'i phyir dang / yongs su dag pa'i nyan thos chen po rnams @83b bdag cag gi lus ni btsun pa yin no snyam pa'i nga rgyal spang bar bya ba'i phyir dang /
translated: In order to completely eliminate the doubts of those who doubt the Mahayana, in order to generate complete faith in bodhisattvas of unfixed potential, in order to eliminate the pride of pure sravakas who think, Our bodies are noble and in order to generate respect for the sravaka retinue in bodhisattvas,

original: gzhan yang nyan thos rnams rtag par de bzhin gshegs pa'i zham ring ba byed pa'i phyir dang / cha byad mtshungs pa'i phyir dang / nang gi 'khor yin pa'i phyir dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams nyan thos kyi 'khor la gus pa bskyed pa'i phyir dang /
analyzed: gzhan yang nyan thos rnams rtag par de bzhin gshegs pa'i zham ring ba byed pa'i phyir dang / cha byad mtshungs pa'i phyir dang / nang gi 'khor yin pa'i phyir dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams nyan thos kyi 'khor la gus pa bskyed pa'i phyir dang /
translated: in order for sravakas to always serve the Tathagata, in order for them to have the same appearance, in order for them to be the inner retinue and

original: gzhan dag kyang nyan thos kyi 'khor rnams la rab tu dang ba bskyed pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang nyan thos kyi 'khor rnams la rab tu dang ba bskyed pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: in order to generate faith in others in the sravaka retinue.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel ba las ni rnam grangs kyis ston te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel ba las ni rnam grangs kyis ston te /
translated: The commentary on the perfection of wisdom teaches them in numerical order.

original: de'i phyir de las gal te yas bgrang na ni sngar byang chub sems dpa' smos par rigs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de las gal te yas bgrang na ni sngar byang chub sems dpa' smos par rigs so //
translated: Therefore, if they are enumerated in ascending order, then it is correct that the bodhisattvas should be mentioned first.

original: gal te mas bgrang na ni sngar dge bsnyen ma smos pa'i rigs na /
analyzed: gal te mas bgrang na ni sngar dge bsnyen ma smos pa'i rigs na /
translated: If they are enumerated in descending order, then it is correct that the upasikas should be mentioned first.

original: ci'i phyir sngar nyan thos kyi 'khor rnam pa bzhi bstan pa'i 'og tu byang chub sems dpa' smos she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sngar nyan thos kyi 'khor rnam pa bzhi bstan pa'i 'og tu byang chub sems dpa' smos she na /
translated: Why are the bodhisattvas mentioned after the fourfold assembly of sravakas is taught?

original: smras pa byang chub sems dpa' shes pa che mod kyi /
analyzed: smras pa byang chub sems dpa' shes pa che mod kyi /
translated: It was said that the bodhisattvas have great knowledge,

original: sangs rgyas kyis de'i 'og tu gsungs te /🔽'di ltar nyon mongs pa da dung ma zad pas de'i phyir 'og tu smos so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis de'i 'og tu gsungs te / 'di ltar nyon mongs pa da dung ma zad pas de'i phyir 'og tu smos so //
translated: but the Buddha mentioned them last.🔽Since their afflictions have not yet been exhausted, they are mentioned last.

original: dgra bcom pa rnams shes pa chung yang nyon mongs pa zad pas de'i phyir gong du smos so //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa rnams shes pa chung yang nyon mongs pa zad pas de'i phyir gong du smos so //
translated: Although the arhats have little knowledge, their afflictions have been exhausted, so they are mentioned first.

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' ni thabs kyi stobs kyis 'gro ba lnga po dag tu 'dod pa lnga nyams su len cing sems can 'dren par byed la /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' ni thabs kyi stobs kyis 'gro ba lnga po dag tu 'dod pa lnga nyams su len cing sems can 'dren par byed la /
translated: Moreover, bodhisattvas, by the power of their skillful means, enjoy the five kinds of sense objects in the five destinies and lead sentient beings.

original: gal te dgra bcom pas de ltar byas na lha dang mi rnams the tshom skye zhing ya mtshan du 'dzin pas /
analyzed: gal te dgra bcom pas de ltar byas na lha dang mi rnams the tshom skye zhing ya mtshan du 'dzin pas /
translated: If arhats did that, gods and humans would doubt and be amazed.

original: de'i phyir 'og tu bstan pa yin no zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'og tu bstan pa yin no zhes 'byung ste /
translated: Therefore, it is taught below.

original: zhib tu de nyid las bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: zhib tu de nyid las bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: This is explained in detail in that text.

original: de la re zhig pa dang / gtan du ba bstan pa ni mdo sde 'di yang sngar gong du bshad pa bzhin du yang dag pa'i don du na gnas gnyis su gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: de la re zhig pa dang / gtan du ba bstan pa ni mdo sde 'di yang sngar gong du bshad pa bzhin du yang dag pa'i don du na gnas gnyis su gsungs pa yin te /
translated: As for the teaching of the temporary and the ultimate, this sutra, as explained above, is also said to have two abodes in the correct sense:

original: zhing yongs su dag pa dang / zhing yongs su ma dag pa'o //
analyzed: zhing yongs su dag pa dang / zhing yongs su ma dag pa'o //
translated: the completely pure realm and the impure realm.

original: mdo sde 'di gal te zhing yongs su dag par gsungs pa yin na ni /
analyzed: mdo sde 'di gal te zhing yongs su dag par gsungs pa yin na ni /
translated: If this sutra is said to be about the completely pure realm,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni gtan du ba yin la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni gtan du ba yin la /
translated: then the bodhisattvas are ultimate,

original: theg pa gnyis ni re zhig pa yin te /
analyzed: theg pa gnyis ni re zhig pa yin te /
translated: and the two vehicles are temporary.

original: de'i phyir rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las /
translated: Therefore Yogācārabhūmi says:

original: sems can ji lta bu dag zhing yongs su dag par skye bar mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: sems can ji lta bu dag zhing yongs su dag par skye bar mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: What kind of sentient beings will not be born in a pure realm?

original: so so'i skye bo dang theg pa gnyis dang / sa'i mdun rol gyi byang chub sems @84a * //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo dang theg pa gnyis dang / sa'i mdun rol gyi byang chub sems @84a * //
translated: Ordinary beings, those of the two vehicles, and bodhisattvas who are not on the advanced stages.

original: dpa' rnams so zhes bshad pas de'i phyir theg pa gnyis ni sprul pa yin pas /
analyzed: dpa' rnams so zhes bshad pas de'i phyir theg pa gnyis ni sprul pa yin pas /
translated: Therefore the two vehicles are emanations and

original: gtan du ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gtan du ba ma yin no //
translated: they are not permanent.

original: gal te zhing yongs su ma dag par gsungs pa yin na ni theg pa gnyis ni gtan du ba yin la /
analyzed: gal te zhing yongs su ma dag par gsungs pa yin na ni theg pa gnyis ni gtan du ba yin la /
translated: If it is said that the two vehicles are not born in a pure realm, then the two vehicles are permanent,

original: byang chub sems dpa' dag ni re zhig pa yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dag ni re zhig pa yin te /
translated: but bodhisattvas are not,

original: 'gyur ba'i lus len pas mthong bar mi nus pa'i phyir dang / sa bdun pa man chad dngos po can len pa'i phyir dang yang dag pa'i lus kyi don dang ldan pas nyes pa med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'gyur ba'i lus len pas mthong bar mi nus pa'i phyir dang / sa bdun pa man chad dngos po can len pa'i phyir dang yang dag pa'i lus kyi don dang ldan pas nyes pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: because they cannot be seen taking a changeable body, because they take bodies with substance up to the seventh ground, and because there is no fault in possessing a body that is the meaning of reality.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel ba las sa bdun pa man chad da dung srin bu dang bcas pa'i lus dang sha'i lus ma spangs pa yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel ba las sa bdun pa man chad da dung srin bu dang bcas pa'i lus dang sha'i lus ma spangs pa yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: “Up to the seventh level, one has not abandoned the body with worms, the body of flesh.”🔽The teaching that there is and is not another retinue is as follows:

original: de la 'khor gzhan yod pa dang / med pa bstan pa ni gal te zhing yongs su ma dag pa'i dbang du byas nas ni yang dag pa'i klu la sogs pa yang yod de /
analyzed: de la 'khor gzhan yod pa dang / med pa bstan pa ni gal te zhing yongs su ma dag pa'i dbang du byas nas ni yang dag pa'i klu la sogs pa yang yod de /
translated: If one considers the retinue from the perspective of the impure realm, then the retinue of the true doctrine and so on exists.

original: de'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi sa'i 'grel pa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi sa'i 'grel pa las /
translated: Therefore the commentary to the perfection of wisdom on the level of buddhahood says:

original: 'khor 'dus pa der 'khor gzhan yang yod mod kyi /
analyzed: 'khor 'dus pa der 'khor gzhan yang yod mod kyi /
translated: “Although there is another retinue assembled there,

original: sdud pa po rnams kyis mdor bsdus nas rnam pa gnyis bstan pa ni de dag mchog tu gyur pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: sdud pa po rnams kyis mdor bsdus nas rnam pa gnyis bstan pa ni de dag mchog tu gyur pa'i phyir te /
translated: the compilers taught it in two parts because they were the best.

original: 'og nas mdo la ji skad du lha dang mi dang lha ma yin la sogs pa'i 'jig rten yi rangs te /
analyzed: 'og nas mdo la ji skad du lha dang mi dang lha ma yin la sogs pa'i 'jig rten yi rangs te /
translated: As it says in the sutra, the world of gods, humans, demigods, and so on rejoiced

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa la mngon par bstod do zhes gsungs pa lta bu zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa la mngon par bstod do zhes gsungs pa lta bu zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: and praised what the Bhagavat had said.”

original: gal te zhing yongs su dag par bzhugs pa yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te zhing yongs su dag par bzhugs pa yin na ni /
translated: If he resides in a completely pure field,

original: sprul pa'i klu la sogs pa yod de /
analyzed: sprul pa'i klu la sogs pa yod de /
translated: then there are emanated nagas, etc.🔽Therefore, the commentary to the Bodhisattvabhumi declares:

original: de'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi sa'i 'grel ba las sprul pa yin na yang nyes pa med de /
analyzed: de'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi sa'i 'grel ba las sprul pa yin na yang nyes pa med de /
translated: “Even if they are emanations, there is no fault,

original: chos bshad pa'i dkyil 'khor rab tu brgyan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos bshad pa'i dkyil 'khor rab tu brgyan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the circle of the expounders of the Dharma is well adorned.

original: yang na sangs rgyas kyi sprul pa 'am /
analyzed: yang na sangs rgyas kyi sprul pa 'am /
translated: Or, they are emanations of the Buddha

original: byang chub sems dpa' dag gi sprul pa yin no zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dag gi sprul pa yin no zhes 'byung ste /
translated: or emanations of bodhisattvas.”

original: slob dpon dbyig gnyen dang ngo bo nyid med kyis mdzad pa theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel ba las kyang 'di dang mthun par bshad do //
analyzed: slob dpon dbyig gnyen dang ngo bo nyid med kyis mdzad pa theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel ba las kyang 'di dang mthun par bshad do //
translated: The commentary to the Mahayanasaṃgraha composed by the masters Vasubandhu and Nirvikalpa also explains in agreement with this.

original: de la tshig gi don rnam par bshad pa yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
analyzed: de la tshig gi don rnam par bshad pa yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
translated: The explanation of the meaning of the words is also divided into two parts:

original: nyan thos kyi 'khor bstan pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor bstan pa'o //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi 'khor bstan pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor bstan pa'o //
translated: the demonstration of the disciples of the sravakas and the demonstration of the disciples of the bodhisattvas.

original: nyan thos kyi 'khor bstan pa la yang rnam pa gsum du dbye ste /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi 'khor bstan pa la yang rnam pa gsum du dbye ste /
translated: The demonstration of the disciples of the sravakas is also divided into three parts:

original: dang po ni grangs smos shing @84b rnam pa rnam par 'byed pa'o //
analyzed: dang po ni grangs smos shing @84b rnam pa rnam par 'byed pa'o //
translated: The first is the enumeration and the analysis of the aspects.

original: gnyis pa ni thams cad kyang zhes bya ba man chad kyis yon tan rnams rgya cher rnam par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni thams cad kyang zhes bya ba man chad kyis yon tan rnams rgya cher rnam par bshad pa'o //
translated: The second is the extensive explanation of the qualities, beginning with “all of them.”

original: gsum pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i bka' zhes bya ba man chad kyis bka' bzhin byed pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: gsum pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i bka' zhes bya ba man chad kyis bka' bzhin byed pa bstan pa ste /
translated: The third is the teaching on acting according to the word, beginning with “the word of the Tathāgata.”

original: 'di ni grangs smos shing rnam par 'byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni grangs smos shing rnam par 'byed pa'o //
translated: This is the enumeration and the analysis.

original: 'di ltar 'khor rnam pa gnyis las /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'khor rnam pa gnyis las /
translated: Thus, from the two kinds of retinue,

original: byang chub sems dpa' las tha dad pa dbye ba'i phyir nyan thos zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' las tha dad pa dbye ba'i phyir nyan thos zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: the word “hearer” is stated in order to distinguish the bodhisattvas.

original: 'di yang rnam pa lngas bstan te /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa lngas bstan te /
translated: This is also taught in five ways:

original: thabs cig tu bzhugs pa rnam par 'byed pa dang / tshad med pa rnam par bshad pa dang / chen po rnam par bshad pa dang / nyan thos kyi don bstan pa dang / dge 'dun gyi don bstan pa'o //
analyzed: thabs cig tu bzhugs pa rnam par 'byed pa dang / tshad med pa rnam par bshad pa dang / chen po rnam par bshad pa dang / nyan thos kyi don bstan pa dang / dge 'dun gyi don bstan pa'o //
translated: the analysis of dwelling together, the explanation of the immeasurables, the explanation of the greatness, the teaching on the meaning of the hearers, and the teaching on the meaning of the Saṅgha.

original: de la thabs cig ces bya ba ni 'khor dang bdag nyid mngon sum du gyur ba'i phyir de dag dang lhan cig pa'i don to //
analyzed: de la thabs cig ces bya ba ni 'khor dang bdag nyid mngon sum du gyur ba'i phyir de dag dang lhan cig pa'i don to //
translated: Here, together means that the retinue and the self are present, and so it means together with them.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i le'u chen po las ni dge 'dun chen po dang lhan cig ces gsungs so //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i le'u chen po las ni dge 'dun chen po dang lhan cig ces gsungs so //
translated: In the great chapter on the perfection of wisdom, it says, together with the great assembly.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las /
translated: In the commentary on the perfection of wisdom,

original: gnas gcig pa dang / dus gcig pa dang / sems gcig tu gyur pa'am /
analyzed: gnas gcig pa dang / dus gcig pa dang / sems gcig tu gyur pa'am /
translated: it says, They are in the same place, at the same time, and have the same mind,

original: yang na lta ba gcig pa dang / lam gcig pa dang / rnam par grol ba gcig tu gyur ba ni lhan cig pa zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: yang na lta ba gcig pa dang / lam gcig pa dang / rnam par grol ba gcig tu gyur ba ni lhan cig pa zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ste /
translated: or they have the same view, the same path, and the same liberation. This is called 'together.'

original: mdo sde 'di las thabs cig ces gsungs pa dang don gcig go //
analyzed: mdo sde 'di las thabs cig ces gsungs pa dang don gcig go //
translated: Here, together has the same meaning as at the same time.

original: de la tshad med pa zhes bya ba ni slob dpon nye ba'i 'od kyis 'grel pa las /
analyzed: de la tshad med pa zhes bya ba ni slob dpon nye ba'i 'od kyis 'grel pa las /
translated: Here, incalculable means, as Master Udayabhadra's commentary says,

original: de'i grangs shin tu mang ste /
analyzed: de'i grangs shin tu mang ste /
translated: their number is extremely great.

original: bgrang bar dka' ba'i phyir tshad med pa zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: bgrang bar dka' ba'i phyir tshad med pa zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Because it is difficult to count, it is called incalculable.

original: de la chen po zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel ba las /
analyzed: de la chen po zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel ba las /
translated: The Great Commentary on the Perfection of Wisdom says:

original: don rnam pa gsum gyi phyir te /
analyzed: don rnam pa gsum gyi phyir te /
translated: It is so called for three reasons:

original: che ba dang mang ba dang mchog tu gyur ba'o //
analyzed: che ba dang mang ba dang mchog tu gyur ba'o //
translated: it is great, it is numerous, and it is supreme.

original: mang po'i nang na gtso bor gyur ba'i phyir dang / sgrib pa rnams spangs pa'i phyir dang / rgyal po la sogs pas shin tu bkur ba'i phyir che ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mang po'i nang na gtso bor gyur ba'i phyir dang / sgrib pa rnams spangs pa'i phyir dang / rgyal po la sogs pas shin tu bkur ba'i phyir che ba zhes bya'o //
translated: It is great because it is the chief among many, because it is free of obscurations, and because it is highly regarded by kings and others.

original: grangs shin tu mang ba'i phyir mang ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: grangs shin tu mang ba'i phyir mang ba zhes bya'o //
translated: It is numerous because it is extremely numerous.

original: mu stegs can dgu bcu rtsa drug gi smra ba rnams 'jig pa'i phyir mchog tu gyur ba'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: mu stegs can dgu bcu rtsa drug gi smra ba rnams 'jig pa'i phyir mchog tu gyur ba'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: It is supreme because it destroys the doctrines of the ninety-six non-Buddhist schools.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sa'i 'grel pa las ni rnam pa bzhir bstan te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sa'i 'grel pa las ni rnam pa bzhir bstan te /
translated: The commentary on the Buddha Level teaches that the assembly is of four kinds:

original: dbang po rno ba dang / mi slob pa dang / ma nges pa dang / 'khor mang po'o zhes bshad de /
analyzed: dbang po rno ba dang / mi slob pa dang / ma nges pa dang / 'khor mang po'o zhes bshad de /
translated: those of sharp faculties, those beyond training, those of indeterminate potential, and those with large retinues.

original: de'i phyir 'grel pa de nyid las @85a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'grel pa de nyid las @85a * //
translated: Therefore the same commentary says:

original: thams cad kyang dbang bo shin tu rno ba pha rol tu phyin pa'i rigs can gyi nyan thos yin pa'i phyir chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyang dbang bo shin tu rno ba pha rol tu phyin pa'i rigs can gyi nyan thos yin pa'i phyir chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: All of them are great because they are disciples of the perfection lineage who have sharp faculties.

original: gzhan yang mi slob pa'i 'bras bu'i gnas skabs la gnas pa'i phyir chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang mi slob pa'i 'bras bu'i gnas skabs la gnas pa'i phyir chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: Moreover, they are great because they abide in the state of the result of no-more-learning.

original: yang dag pa'i don du na thams cad kyang ma nges pa'i rigs can gyi nyan thos yin pas /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i don du na thams cad kyang ma nges pa'i rigs can gyi nyan thos yin pas /
translated: In reality, all of them are disciples of the lineage of the indefinite type, and so

original: 'bras bu chung du thob nas byang chub chen por gzhol ba'i phyir chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu chung du thob nas byang chub chen por gzhol ba'i phyir chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: they are called great because they attain the lesser result and then proceed to great enlightenment.

original: yang na 'khor grangs mang ba'i phyir chen po zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yang na 'khor grangs mang ba'i phyir chen po zhes bya ste /
translated: Or, they are called great because their retinue is large,

original: da ltar gyi 'khor mang po bzhin no zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: da ltar gyi 'khor mang po bzhin no zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: like the present great retinue.

original: slob dpon yang dag bden pas byas pa'i brjed byang las /
analyzed: slob dpon yang dag bden pas byas pa'i brjed byang las /
translated: In the notes composed by the master Bhāviveka,

original: chen po zhes bya ba ni don rnam pa gsum yod do //
analyzed: chen po zhes bya ba ni don rnam pa gsum yod do //
translated: it says, 'Great' has three meanings.

original: dang po ni grangs mang ba ste /
analyzed: dang po ni grangs mang ba ste /
translated: The first is a large number.

original: ji ltar dmag chen po zhes brjod pa lta bu grangs mang ba'i phyir chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar dmag chen po zhes brjod pa lta bu grangs mang ba'i phyir chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: It is great because of the greatness of its number, like a great army.

original: gnyis pa ni tshad che ba ste ji ltar rin po che zhes brjod pa ltar grangs mang ba'i phyir chen po zhes bya ba ma yin gyi dbyibs kyi tshad mtho zhing rgya che ba'i phyir chen po zhes brjod pa'o //🔽gsum pa ni mchog tu gyur bas che ba ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni tshad che ba ste ji ltar rin po che zhes brjod pa ltar grangs mang ba'i phyir chen po zhes bya ba ma yin gyi dbyibs kyi tshad mtho zhing rgya che ba'i phyir chen po zhes brjod pa'o // gsum pa ni mchog tu gyur bas che ba ste /
translated: It is great because of the greatness of its dimension, like a great jewel.🔽It is great because of the greatness of its excellence, like a great king.

original: rgyal po che po zhes brjod pa lta bu grangs mang ba dang / dbyibs kyi tshad mtho zhing rgya che ba la bya ba ma yin gyi /🔽yon tan mchog tu gyur ba'i phyir chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rgyal po che po zhes brjod pa lta bu grangs mang ba dang / dbyibs kyi tshad mtho zhing rgya che ba la bya ba ma yin gyi / yon tan mchog tu gyur ba'i phyir chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: The disciples are great because of the greatness of their number, not because of the greatness of their dimension or their excellence.🔽The bodhisattvas are great because of the greatness of their number and their excellence, not because of the greatness of their dimension.🔽The Buddhas are great because of the greatness of their number, their dimension, and their excellence.🔽The disciples are great because of the greatness of their number, not because of the greatness of their dimension or their excellence.🔽The bodhisattvas are great because of the greatness of their number and their excellence, not because of the greatness of their dimension.🔽The Buddhas are great because of the greatness of their number, their dimension, and their excellence.🔽The disciples are great because of the greatness of their number, not because of the greatness of their dimension or their excellence.🔽The bodhisattvas are great because of the greatness of their number and their excellence, not because of the greatness of their dimension.🔽The Buddhas are great because of the greatness of their number, their dimension, and their excellence.🔽The disciples are great because of the greatness of their number, not because of the greatness of their dimension or their excellence.🔽The bodhisattvas are great because of the greatness of their number and their excellence, not because of the greatness of their dimension.🔽The Buddhas are great because of the greatness of their number, their dimension, and their excellence.

original: nyan thos rnams kyang de bzhin te grangs gcig kho na ma yin pa'i phyir de ni grangs chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nyan thos rnams kyang de bzhin te grangs gcig kho na ma yin pa'i phyir de ni grangs chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: The disciples are great because of the greatness of their number, not because of the greatness of their dimension or their excellence.🔽The bodhisattvas are great because of the greatness of their number and their excellence, not because of the greatness of their dimension.

original: sangs rgyas kyi 'bras bu tshol bar sems gyur nas byung chub kyi lam bsgrub ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi 'bras bu tshol bar sems gyur nas byung chub kyi lam bsgrub ste /
translated: The Buddhas are great because of the greatness of their number, their dimension, and their excellence.🔽The disciples are great because of the greatness of their number, not because of the greatness of their dimension or their excellence.🔽The bodhisattvas are great because of the greatness of their number and their excellence, not because of the greatness of their dimension.🔽The Buddhas are great because of the greatness of their number, their dimension, and their excellence.🔽The disciples are great because of the greatness of their number, not because of the greatness

original: shin tu mtho zhing bla na med par gyur pa ni mchog tu che ba yin no //
analyzed: shin tu mtho zhing bla na med par gyur pa ni mchog tu che ba yin no //
translated: The highest, unsurpassed is the greatest.

original: rgya che zhing gting med de dpag par mi nus pa ni tshad med pa zhes bya'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: rgya che zhing gting med de dpag par mi nus pa ni tshad med pa zhes bya'o zhes bshad do //
translated: Vast and profound, immeasurable and unfathomable is called immeasurable.

original: de la nyan thos zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos de kho na nyid grub pa bstan pa las /
analyzed: de la nyan thos zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos de kho na nyid grub pa bstan pa las /
translated: In the treatise Establishing Reality, it states:

original: chos thos pas go bar gyur ba'i phyir nyan thos zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: chos thos pas go bar gyur ba'i phyir nyan thos zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Because they understand through hearing the Dharma, they are called śrāvakas.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sa'i 'grel pa las /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sa'i 'grel pa las /
translated: In the commentary on the Buddha Land Sutra,

original: sangs rgyas kyi gsung gi sgra thos pas 'phags pa'i lam la 'jug pa'i phyir nyan thos zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi gsung gi sgra thos pas 'phags pa'i lam la 'jug pa'i phyir nyan thos zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: it states: Because they enter the noble path by hearing the sound of the Buddha's speech, they are called śrāvakas.

original: gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las gzhan dag las yang dag pa'i chos kyi gsung gi sgra thos pa dang / gzhan dag yang dag pa'i chos kyi sgra thos par byed pa'i phyir nyan thos zhes bya'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las gzhan dag las yang dag pa'i chos kyi gsung gi sgra thos pa dang / gzhan dag yang dag pa'i chos kyi sgra thos par byed pa'i phyir nyan thos zhes bya'o zhes bshad do //
translated: Moreover, in the Levels of Yogic Practice and other texts, it explains: Because they hear the sound of the perfect Dharma and cause others to hear the sound of the perfect Dharma, they are called śrāvakas.

original: nyan thos @85b kyi sgra rgya cher bshad pa ni sangs rgyas kyi sa'i 'grel pa dang / gnas pa bcu'i bshad pa dang / mdo sde shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / 'dus pa chen po la sogs pa las 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: nyan thos @85b kyi sgra rgya cher bshad pa ni sangs rgyas kyi sa'i 'grel pa dang / gnas pa bcu'i bshad pa dang / mdo sde shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / 'dus pa chen po la sogs pa las 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The extensive explanation of the śrāvaka’s sound should be understood according to the Buddha Land Treatise, the Explanation of the Ten Stages, the perfection of wisdom sūtras, and the Great Collection and so on.

original: de la dge 'dun zhes bya ba ni sam gha'i sgra las drangs nas mthun pa'i 'khor zhes bya bar 'dren te /
analyzed: de la dge 'dun zhes bya ba ni sam gha'i sgra las drangs nas mthun pa'i 'khor zhes bya bar 'dren te /
translated: With regard to that, the term saṃgha is derived from the term saṃghata, which is translated as “harmonious assembly.”

original: don dang dngos po gnyis mthun par gyur pa'i phyir dge 'dun zhes bya'o //
analyzed: don dang dngos po gnyis mthun par gyur pa'i phyir dge 'dun zhes bya'o //
translated: Because the meaning and the thing are in harmony, it is called saṃgha.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sa'i 'grel pa las thams cad kyang rab tu byung ba'i dge 'dun yin pa'i phyir dge 'dun zhes bya'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sa'i 'grel pa las thams cad kyang rab tu byung ba'i dge 'dun yin pa'i phyir dge 'dun zhes bya'o zhes bshad do //
translated: The Buddha Land Treatise explains: “Because all are the saṃgha of renunciates, it is called saṃgha.”

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las ni /
translated: The Commentary on the Perfection of Wisdom says:

original: dge slong mang po gcig tu 'dus nas mthun par gyur pa ni dge 'dun zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: dge slong mang po gcig tu 'dus nas mthun par gyur pa ni dge 'dun zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ste /
translated: “When many bhikṣus gather together and become harmonious, it is called saṃgha.”

original: zhib tu de nyid las bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: zhib tu de nyid las bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: This is explained in detail in the same text.

original: thams cad kyang shin tu dul ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnyis pa yon tan rnams rgya cher bshad pa zhes bya ba bstan to //
analyzed: thams cad kyang shin tu dul ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnyis pa yon tan rnams rgya cher bshad pa zhes bya ba bstan to //
translated: All of them are very disciplined, and so on. This is the second chapter, called “The Extensive Explanation of the Qualities.”

original: 'di yang yon tan rnam pa bcu gsum yod pa nyid kyis sgo rnam pa bcu gsum du dbye ste /
analyzed: 'di yang yon tan rnam pa bcu gsum yod pa nyid kyis sgo rnam pa bcu gsum du dbye ste /
translated: This chapter is divided into thirteen sections, corresponding to the thirteen qualities that are discussed.

original: 'dis ni dang po shin tu dul ba'i yon tan bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni dang po shin tu dul ba'i yon tan bstan to //
translated: The first of these is the quality of being very disciplined.

original: 'di yang sangs rgyas kyi sa'i 'grel pa las /
analyzed: 'di yang sangs rgyas kyi sa'i 'grel pa las /
translated: This is explained in the Commentary on the Buddha’s Ground as follows.

original: bshad pa rnam pa gsum yod de /
analyzed: bshad pa rnam pa gsum yod de /
translated: There are three ways of explaining this.

original: de'i phyir de nyid las thams cad kyang shin tu dul ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid las thams cad kyang shin tu dul ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Therefore, the same text says, “All of them are very disciplined.”

original: kha cig na re slob pa dang bcas pa dag gis mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa'i gnas ngan len kun du brtags pa brgya rtsa bcu gnyis kyi rnam pa dang bral ba dmu rgod ma yin pa'i phyi rta cang zhes bzhin pas na shin tu
analyzed: kha cig na re slob pa dang bcas pa dag gis mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa'i gnas ngan len kun du brtags pa brgya rtsa bcu gnyis kyi rnam pa dang bral ba dmu rgod ma yin pa'i phyi rta cang zhes bzhin pas na shin tu
translated: Some say that because they are free of the one hundred and twelve aspects of the negative tendencies of the afflictions that are to be eliminated by the path of seeing, they are not wild, like a well-trained horse that is easy to ride.

original: dul bzhes bya'o zhe'o //
analyzed: dul bzhes bya'o zhe'o //
translated: Therefore, they are called “very disciplined.”

original: kha cig ni mi slob pa dag gis mthong ba dang / bsgoms pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa brgya nyi shu rtsa brgyad dang bral bsam dul ba ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: kha cig ni mi slob pa dag gis mthong ba dang / bsgoms pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa brgya nyi shu rtsa brgyad dang bral bsam dul ba ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Some are not disciplined because they are not free from the one hundred and twenty eight types of affliction that are to be eliminated by the path of insight and the path of cultivation.

original: gser btso ma bzhin pas na dul ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gser btso ma bzhin pas na dul ba zhes bya'o //
translated: They are called disciplined because they are like refined gold.

original: yang dag pa'i don du kun kyang byang chub chen por yongs su bsngos pa'i rigs can dag yin pas thams cad kyang 'bras bu chen po la gzhol ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs ji lta ba bzhin du 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i don du kun kyang byang chub chen por yongs su bsngos pa'i rigs can dag yin pas thams cad kyang 'bras bu chen po la gzhol ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs ji lta ba bzhin du 'gyur zhing /
translated: All of them are dedicated to the great enlightenment, and they are all destined for the great result, because they are all dedicated to the great enlightenment in the true sense.

original: glang po che cang shes bzhin pas na shin tu dul ba zhes bya ste /🔽shin tu dul ba rgya cher bshad pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin @86a * //
analyzed: glang po che cang shes bzhin pas na shin tu dul ba zhes bya ste / shin tu dul ba rgya cher bshad pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin @86a * //
translated: They are called well disciplined because they are like a well disciplined elephant.

original: pa'i 'grel pa las 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: pa'i 'grel pa las 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The detailed explanation of the well disciplined should be understood according to the commentary to the Perfection of Wisdom.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sras zhes bya bas ni gnyis pa sangs rgyas kyi gdung gsob pa'i yon tan bstan to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sras zhes bya bas ni gnyis pa sangs rgyas kyi gdung gsob pa'i yon tan bstan to //
translated: The phrase “the Buddha’s son” indicates the second quality, that of being the Buddha’s heir.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sras zhes bya ba 'di yang rnam pa gsum gyis bstan te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sras zhes bya ba 'di yang rnam pa gsum gyis bstan te /
translated: The phrase “the Buddha’s son” is also explained in three ways.

original: dang po ni nyan thos kyi dbang du mdzad nas sangs rgyas kyi sras zhes bshad de /
analyzed: dang po ni nyan thos kyi dbang du mdzad nas sangs rgyas kyi sras zhes bshad de /
translated: The first explanation is from the perspective of the disciples and is explained as “the Buddha’s son.”

original: mdo sde 'di nyid dang / sangs rgyas kyis la sogs pa las gsungs pa nyid do //
analyzed: mdo sde 'di nyid dang / sangs rgyas kyis la sogs pa las gsungs pa nyid do //
translated: This is stated in this very sūtra and in the Buddha’s Words and so on.

original: slob dpon nye ba'i 'od kyis 'grel pa las /
analyzed: slob dpon nye ba'i 'od kyis 'grel pa las /
translated: The master Upagupta’s Commentary states:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i lung gi stobs kyis 'phags pa'i lam las skyes pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i lung gi stobs kyis 'phags pa'i lam las skyes pa'i phyir /
translated: Because they are born from the path of the noble ones through the power of the Tathāgata’s prophecy,

original: sangs rgyas kyi sras zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sras zhes bya ste /
translated: they are called “the Buddha’s sons.”

original: ji skad du thams cad kyang bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung ngag las skyes pa ste /
analyzed: ji skad du thams cad kyang bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung ngag las skyes pa ste /
translated: As it is said, “All of them are born from the Bhagavān’s speech,

original: yang dag pa'i chos las skyes pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i chos las skyes pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: because they are born from the true Dharma.”

original: kha cig ni thams cad kyang theg pa chen po la gzhol ba'i nyan thos yin pas /
analyzed: kha cig ni thams cad kyang theg pa chen po la gzhol ba'i nyan thos yin pas /
translated: Some say that all of them are disciples who are oriented toward the Great Vehicle.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gdung 'tshob cing rgyun mi gcod pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi sras zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gdung 'tshob cing rgyun mi gcod pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi sras zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: and because they perpetuate the lineage of the Tathagata, they are called sons of the Buddha.

original: gnyis pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: The second is from the perspective of bodhisattvas.

original: sangs rgyas kyis sras zhes bshad de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis sras zhes bshad de /
translated: They are called sons of the Buddha.

original: theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa mi mthun pa rnam pa gcig las /
analyzed: theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa mi mthun pa rnam pa gcig las /
translated: The commentary on the Compendium of the Great Vehicle says:

original: ji skad du sangs rgyas kyi sras zhes bya ba yang don rnam pa lnga yod de /
analyzed: ji skad du sangs rgyas kyi sras zhes bya ba yang don rnam pa lnga yod de /
translated: The term son of the Buddha has five meanings.

original: bla na med pa'i theg pa la shin tu mos pas ni sa bon byed do //
analyzed: bla na med pa'i theg pa la shin tu mos pas ni sa bon byed do //
translated: They are the seed because they have great interest in the unsurpassed vehicle.

original: shes rab kyis ni mi byed do //
analyzed: shes rab kyis ni mi byed do //
translated: They are the mother because they have the perfection of wisdom.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyis ni mngal byed do //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyis ni mngal byed do //
translated: They are the womb because they have concentration.

original: snying rje chen pos ni ma ma byed do //
analyzed: snying rje chen pos ni ma ma byed do //
translated: They are the nurse because they have great compassion.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyis ni yab mdzad do zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyis ni yab mdzad do zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: The buddhas are the father.

original: slob dpon yang dag bden pa'i 'grel pa las /
analyzed: slob dpon yang dag bden pa'i 'grel pa las /
translated: And Master Bhāviveka’s commentary on the Essence of the Middle Way says:

original: sems can gyi lus mngon par grub pa las gdon mi za bar dngos po lnga phun sum tshogs par bya dgos te /
analyzed: sems can gyi lus mngon par grub pa las gdon mi za bar dngos po lnga phun sum tshogs par bya dgos te /
translated: The body of sentient beings is definitely produced from the five perfections.

original: pha dang / sa bon dang / ma dang / mngal gyi gnas dang / ma ma 'o //
analyzed: pha dang / sa bon dang / ma dang / mngal gyi gnas dang / ma ma 'o //
translated: father, seed, mother, womb, and nurse.

original: pha ni bu skyed pa'i gzhi yin pas sngar bstan pa'o //
analyzed: pha ni bu skyed pa'i gzhi yin pas sngar bstan pa'o //
translated: The father is taught first because he is the basis for the production of the son.

original: pha'i khu chu las lus kyi sa bon du 'gyur ba'i phyir gnyis pa sa bon bstan to //
analyzed: pha'i khu chu las lus kyi sa bon du 'gyur ba'i phyir gnyis pa sa bon bstan to //
translated: The second, seed, is taught because the body’s seed arises from the father’s semen.

original: ma med na 'dzin par mi nus pas lus mi 'grub pa'i phyir gsum pa ma bstan to //
analyzed: ma med na 'dzin par mi nus pas lus mi 'grub pa'i phyir gsum pa ma bstan to //
translated: The third, mother, is taught because the body is not produced if there is no mother who can carry it.

original: mas yongs su bzung yang gal te mngal gyis ma bkris na lus mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: mas yongs su bzung yang gal te mngal gyis ma bkris na lus mi 'grub ste /
translated: Even if the mother is present, if the womb is not fertile, the body is not produced.

original: mngal @86b ni lus gnas pa'i rten yin pas bzhi pa mngal gyi gnas bstan to //
analyzed: mngal @86b ni lus gnas pa'i rten yin pas bzhi pa mngal gyi gnas bstan to //
translated: The fourth, womb, is taught because the womb is the basis for the body’s existence.

original: btsas nas ma mas ma gsos na lus mi 'grub pa'i phyir lnga pa ma ma bstan to //
analyzed: btsas nas ma mas ma gsos na lus mi 'grub pa'i phyir lnga pa ma ma bstan to //
translated: The fifth, nurse, is taught because the body is not produced if the mother does not nurture it after birth.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sras zhes bya ba yang de bzhin du rkyen khyad par can rnam par lnga dgos te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sras zhes bya ba yang de bzhin du rkyen khyad par can rnam par lnga dgos te /
translated: The so-called son of the Buddha also definitely requires five special conditions.

original: dang po ni yab mchog tu gyur pa ste /
analyzed: dang po ni yab mchog tu gyur pa ste /
translated: The first is the supreme father,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams yab mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams yab mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, act as fathers.

original: gnyis pa ni sa bon mchog tu gyur pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni sa bon mchog tu gyur pa ste /
translated: The second is the supreme seed,

original: 'di ltar byang chub kyi sems kyis sa bon byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub kyi sems kyis sa bon byed pa'o //
translated: because the thought of the spirit of enlightenment is the seed.

original: gsum pa ni skyed pa'i yum mchog tu gyur pa ste /
analyzed: gsum pa ni skyed pa'i yum mchog tu gyur pa ste /
translated: The third is the supreme mother who gives birth,

original: shes rab kyis bskyed pa'i ma byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab kyis bskyed pa'i ma byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because wisdom acts as the mother who gives birth.

original: bzhi pa ni mngal gyi snying po mchog tu gyur pa ste /
analyzed: bzhi pa ni mngal gyi snying po mchog tu gyur pa ste /
translated: The fourth is the supreme embryo in the womb,

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyis yongs su bzung nas mngal gyi snying po byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyis yongs su bzung nas mngal gyi snying po byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the embryo in the womb, being held in the womb of merit and wisdom.

original: lnga pa ni ma ma mchog tu gyur pa ste /
analyzed: lnga pa ni ma ma mchog tu gyur pa ste /
translated: The fifth is the supreme nurse,

original: snying rje chen po rnams kyis gso zhing ma ma byed pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ngo //🔽gsum pa ni byang chub sems dpa' dang / nyan thos gnyi ga'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: snying rje chen po rnams kyis gso zhing ma ma byed pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ngo // gsum pa ni byang chub sems dpa' dang / nyan thos gnyi ga'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: because the great compassion nurses it like a nurse.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sras zhes bshad de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sras zhes bshad de /
translated: The third, “the Buddha’s son,” is explained from the point of view of both the bodhisattva and the disciple.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las /
translated: The Commentary on the Perfection of Wisdom says:

original: ji skad du sangs rgyas kyi sras ni rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: ji skad du sangs rgyas kyi sras ni rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: “The buddhas’ children are of five kinds.

original: thams cad kyang gsung las skyes pa /
analyzed: thams cad kyang gsung las skyes pa /
translated: All are born from the Buddha’s speech.

original: chos las skyes pa /
analyzed: chos las skyes pa /
translated: They are born from the Dharma.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: rgyun tu zhugs pa nas dgra bcom pa'i bar dang / yang dag pa'i gnas skabs su zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa'o //
analyzed: rgyun tu zhugs pa nas dgra bcom pa'i bar dang / yang dag pa'i gnas skabs su zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa'o //
translated: stream enterers, up to arhats, and bodhisattvas who have entered the authentic states.

original: rang sangs rgyas ni sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi nang du rgyu rkyen btab pa yin mod kyi /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas ni sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi nang du rgyu rkyen btab pa yin mod kyi /
translated: Although pratyekabuddhas are influenced by the Buddha’s Dharma,

original: sangs rgyas mi 'byung ba'i tshe rang nyid kyis lam rtogs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sangs rgyas mi 'byung ba'i tshe rang nyid kyis lam rtogs pa'i phyir /
translated: since they realize the path on their own when there is no Buddha,

original: gsung las skyes pa zhes mi brjod de /
analyzed: gsung las skyes pa zhes mi brjod de /
translated: they are not called “born from the Buddha’s speech.”

original: rgyu'i rkyen ring du gyur pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: rgyu'i rkyen ring du gyur pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ste /
translated: This is because the causal condition is distant.”

original: sangs rgyas kyi sras kyi don rgya cher bshad pa ni bstan bcos mdo sde rgyan dang / sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin bstan pa dang theg pa chen po bsdus pa dang / gnas pa bcu bshad pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sras kyi don rgya cher bshad pa ni bstan bcos mdo sde rgyan dang / sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin bstan pa dang theg pa chen po bsdus pa dang / gnas pa bcu bshad pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa dang /
translated: The extensive explanation of the meaning of Buddha's son is found in the treatises Ornament of Mahayana Sutras, Teaching on the Nature of the Buddha, Compendium of the Mahayana, Explanation of the Ten Dharmas, Commentary on the Perfection of Wisdom,

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las 'byung ste /
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las 'byung ste /
translated: and Levels of Yogic Deeds.

original: mngas kyis dogs nas 'dir ma bstan to //🔽sems shin tu rnam par grol ba shes rab shin tu rnam par grol ba zhes bya bas ni gsum pa sems dang shes rab rnam par @87a * //
analyzed: mngas kyis dogs nas 'dir ma bstan to // sems shin tu rnam par grol ba shes rab shin tu rnam par grol ba zhes bya bas ni gsum pa sems dang shes rab rnam par @87a * //
translated: Fearing too many quotations, I will not cite them here.

original: grol ba'i yon tan bstan te /
analyzed: grol ba'i yon tan bstan te /
translated: The phrase “his mind is extremely liberated, his wisdom is extremely liberated” indicates the third quality, the qualities of the mind and wisdom being extremely liberated.🔽As a sutra states:

original: mdo las ji skad du 'di ltar 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir sems rnam par grol ba thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mdo las ji skad du 'di ltar 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir sems rnam par grol ba thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, because of being free from attachment, he attains a mind that is liberated.
